Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: am10
Reviews.Content: Like the earlier reviewer we had to change rooms 3 times due to unbelievable loud drilling noises and items dropping on our ceiling.You will share filthy common parts with all the builders, expect non stop noise and mess.The renovated rooms are cheap and shoddy-ours had a chaise longue on which the back collapsed.We told the hotel it was the worst hotel stay we have had anywhere on the planet and they have been trained to say "we urge you to visit us again".Surely a sign of no clue from the management as to what is going on or more likely not caring an inch.We will never stay in a Radisson or a Carlsson ever again and this new set up will be called Revere something so avoid it.Changing brands does not make up for cheap rooms, 70s fittings, cheap and nasty 20 threadcount sheets, filthy "balconies" and indifferent staff.There are plenty of better and less greedy places to stay in Boston -oh and watch your bags in this area come dusk.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about the new renos”
Reviews.Author: jadelovessun
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, both times for business purposes. The current construction did make for more noise, dusty areas & the occasional change in exit/entrances, but nothing bad enough to make for a bad stay. But I'm not sure if I like the new decor. I missed the sleep number beds and I found having the full length mirror right beside the bed just a little weird. Don't know if this part is temporary due to construction or not, but the plumbing was very loud, at least on the 12th floor....one could clearly hear the flushes of the rooms around, above & below you...especially at night when trying to fall asleep. I don't remember that being the case when I stayed here a year ago. But the hotel is well located. Lots of places to eat nearby and it is right by Boston Common for an end of the day stroll. Found the staff to be both friendly and helpful. Overall it was comfortable for a three night business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thornton377
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel in downtown Boston, Convienient for shops and transport and just a walk away from the harbour. Courtious staff and very good rooms. Would go back again if visiting this city. Archie Thornton.

Reviews.Title: “Cancel your visit here”
Reviews.Author: martin w
Reviews.Content: In my 45 years of travel i have never had a worse experience at a hotel. Currently the hotel is under construction. On they're web site there is no indication of contruction or is it mentioned when you call the hotel . We have been awakened at 7am with hammer drills and the workers dropping "anvils" on the floor above us. In short almost knocking us out of bed. That was on a Saturday morning. When we checked in it took 3 tries to get us in a room. The first time we were met by a very nice Chinese lady that was already checked into into the room. 2 more attempts were met with further disappointment. The staff is doing their best to makeup for the shortfalls but to no avail. It is completely irresponsible for the management to continue to book guests into this facility. I want you to understand my personal experience, I travel on a weekly basis, all around the world from Europe to South Africa, Australia to China and everywhere in between, I have never had an experience like this. CANCEL YOUR RESERVATIONS HERE UNTIL THEY ARE FINISHED WiTH THE CONSTRUCTION IN MID APRIL

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & clean but impractical room layout.”
Reviews.Author: Gdr1312
Reviews.Content: I'm writing mostly about the room (15 th floor)itself. Brand new, clean & sleek mid-20th-century retro decor. BUT simple things missing. No full length mirror. No mirror in the main part of the room. If I was sharing the room, I'd have to share bathroom mirror or use the one behind the coffEe pot. No towel bars to hang up stuff, shelves & a hook only. No shelves for toiletries in shower. The bathroom counter doesn't meet the walls which is chic, but means your toiletris will fall on the floor if your not careful. Odd & insufficent lighting. Comfy beds. Very quiet room. Excellent drenching shower. Very curteous staff. Great view. Prompt room service. Good price. Construction made check in inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Cary L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson on Stuart street in Boston,Ma and it was great! The rooms are so clean and very modern. We had a balcony and a view of the city on the 12th floor. Love the view during the day and awesome at night. There are bars that are close withing walking distance from the hotel. The hotel is under construction but you do not here any noise at all. I love this hotel and would recommend anyone to it. If minor construction in the lobby doesn't bother you, than this hotel is for you. I love it and I will be back with my son next time to see all that Boston has to offer for kids. This hotel is great for couples, mature couples, and families. The gym and pool are great. Why would you pay anymore? Parking is 34.00 a day, so park and leave your car in the garage and walk around or grab the T subway or hail a cab. It is not expensive and bringing your car anywhere and finding a parking garage will cost you much more. Coffee, tea in the room with an ice bucket and glasses. Bathroom equipped with robes, haidryer and iron and ironing board. the room has a safe and huge closet. Love it! Thanks Radisson! The staff is extremely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “fun date night”
Reviews.Author: karen l
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison Hotel on Stuart st boston....Although under a major reconstruction project..We were supprised by a wonderful very clean and NEW room with great veiws of the city at an extremely reasonable price. The cable was not working and we were given a free breakfast ..even though it was not their fault. Great night. However the breakfast (if we had to pay i would not have paid) we left our plates full the breakfast was not edible under cooked and bland and cold. Service coudl not have been better on all asspects. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: rebiffer
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Radisson were all so pleasant! From the doorman, to the concierge, to the staff at the front door, to the excellent service at breakfast. As Australians, sometimes it's annoying to tip when the service is not good (not to start an argument about tipping - because I know it's a cultural thing) but the service was really very good at the Radisson. For all the comments about the awkward set-up due to the renovations, it is true, but I don't agree that you should not stay here until after the renovations are finished. It was still a very positive experience! The large rooms were such a refreshing change from NY accommodation, but I think they are large even by Boston standards. Would definitely stay again if I was ever in Boston - it was a shame that we only had one night there!

Reviews.Title: “Boston is NOT for me!”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: I think of no real fault of Radisson I just do not get along with "Boston". It is very much like being in London in many ways with a lot of Irish influence and a very strange accent. None of these things bother me but the "theatre" district is also sort of a red-light area, or so it seemed if you took a wrong turn. The hotel itself is not all that bad and I would not say NO to it for someone who thinks Boston to be interesting but personally I found Boston a frigid, in every way, version of London and more limousine/champagne liberals than at an Obama rally! The hotel room I got was quite ok and more than adequate but Boston is an expensive city, relatively. Staff were courteous and though I had to try to understand their accents, they still were quite nice and able to joke about PAHKIN THAYA KAZ!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ellert I
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction, but was no bother at all, in the middle of the theater district, short walk to parks and shop-browsing the room was on the 9th floor great and very comfortable with balcony. We simply loved the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Super_Scotty
Reviews.Content: It's located within walking distance of many good attractions. I had a large room with a good view. There were some reservations that got a bit noisy a few morning and the lobby was a mess. Other then that it was good. There are some great restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Heavy Renovations Going on Here”
Reviews.Author: YankeeTraveller08
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned that this hotel is going through heavy renovations. The front desk is in a coat closet, the concierge desk is in a corner (and was not manned once during our two days there), and there is no lobby. Signage is constantly being revised. Just getting from the parking garage to the front desk, or from the room to the street can be an ordeal, as we often waited 5 minutes for an elevator. Noise in our room was not terrible, but we could hear distant hammering and such. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms, and while it was adequate, note that they have decided to do away with boxsprings for the mattress, so they are stiff. Oddly, the television is new but the input system is of the ancient loginet variety, meaning it is not user friendly and with limited channels. The "fitness center" is a joke; one can only hope that will be taken care of in the renovation. One positive note is that the staff was friendly and was trying hard in difficult circumstances (though this did not include any compensation for the issues, which means it is unlikely I will stay here again). Parking is very expensive ($39/night) though this is not uncommon in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of chaos under construction”
Reviews.Author: olive03-11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under construction, which was not noted on the website. The check in was a mess...physically (in a parking lot entrance!) and organizationally. The man at the front desk was lovely but even after he confirmed I reserved a room with two beds, he checked me into a room with one bed. I called the front desk and they put me on hold for a long time. I hung up and went 14 floors back down to the parking lot to speak with the front desk. I was then told the room would not be ready for an hour, but the lovely man allowed us to put our luggage in the room he had already booked us in. We went for lunch and then, after some delay in securing the new room, we moved to the proper room. The rooms are a great size, nice decor, very clean and the cleaning lady on the floor greeted us warmly! All makes for a promising experience. BIG problem...the elevator security cards were not needed to access a floor! I reported this to the front desk. A guest told me she has seen non-guests accessing guest floors with no problem. BIG problem for the hotel. This must corrected immediately. The construction has made for a real messy entrance experience. The gym, albeit small, nicely equipped. The pool was nice and warm as reported by someone in my party. Nice lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction and Other Problems”
Reviews.Author: RabbitSam
Reviews.Content: Don't go to the lobby to check in because it's all blocked off. They've got a temporary lobby set up across the driveway to the parking garage. I could handle that. But then I got to my room and bed was a little weird. I checked the hotel amenities book and it mentioned that some rooms had sleep number beds. So I called the front desk and checked, but was told that there were no sleep number beds on my floor. So, after a bad nights sleep, I stripped the bed and found out that indeed, I did have one, with no control to be seen. I was there for a short meeting and tried to work in the room during the day, but construction noises could be heard, even on the 12th floor. The room was nice, but not sure it was worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Amy124
Reviews.Content: Visited the Radisson Boston over the summer and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The rooms were spacious for a city hotel and the bathrooms were very clean (not that I would expect less from a Radisson brand hotel). One of the best features about this hotel is the rooftop pool, whilst we were in Boston the weather was very hot and sticky so the breeze and comfy loungers and hammocks were much appreciated! The pool is actually enclosed in with an attaching gym with a lounging area outside, I must admit it was initially very strange to sunbathe to the sound of horns and sirens but we soon were so relaxed we drowned them out! The pool was quite busy at times with children but in the mornings and evenings if was much quieter if you wanted to tip a quick dip without splashing and loud children. On most floors there were vending machines and ice machines for your convenience which was great if you fancied a little treat at night. One thing I must advise you to remember is that the elevators are controlled by your room key card so if you are travelling with older children and teenagers and they may be separated from you at times it is advisable to request a couple of room keys at the start of your stay otherwise they will forever trapped in the lobby unless some other guests joins them in the lift! We didn't have breakfast or any other meals in the hotel as there was so many good places to eat nearby. For breakfast we sometimes just wanted to grab something quick and across the road a block down there is a 7/11 for things like little cereal boxes with a small bottle of milk and pastries/muffins. At the local subway station there was also dunkin donuts and starbucks for a quick bite. For dinner we mainly went into the market but nearby the hotel there is a couple of great restaurants and some chains too like California pizza kitchen. A few blocks down to the left there was a great little Irish pub which did a beautiful steak and mashed potato combo with really friendly service (plus it was very reassuring to hear an accent from home!) For getting around the city we typically just walked, with the odd taxi and also used the hop-on hop-off trolley which stopped literally at the door of the Radisson which was very handy. Finally I must praise the efforts of the concierge he was very attentive and helpful, even striving to secure us last minute Red Sox tickets and we found ourselves chatting away to him about Boston for ages! Definitely hope to be back to Boston in the future and would definitely recommend the Radisson to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Work in Progress”
Reviews.Author: chuck05408
Reviews.Content: Nice room, but access to hotel, construction noise, and overall disarray was a big negative. It was a construction zone and there were no amenities that one would expect and were advertised. No pool, no gym, no nice hotel lobby. I would have stayed elsewhere if I was aware of the current situation. Avoid staying here at least until renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Goodguydoug
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend package stay at the hotel and it was great. Yes there was work going on to re-do the lobby so it was closed at the time and check-in was in a different area, right in front of you when you pull into the parking area and it was fine for checking in. Our room was on the 23rd floor and was very nice, with a westerly view. The Sleep number bed was comfortable and adjustable and the bed pillows were great too. The room was very clean and comfortable, the only thing missing was a refrigerator, which it should have to make it complete. I know they are working on the hotel renovating it and they are working from the bottom on up, and they havenâ€™t gotten to the very top yet, but the elevator stopped at some of the renovated floors and it does look nice, very modern. Our stay included the breakfast buffet at the restaurant adjoining the hotel and the spread they put out was very good with a wide selection of breakfast food, we also checked out the restaurant too, and it looks great, it was packed both nights we were there. In closing, the Radisson is our place to stay when visiting Boston, itâ€™s in a great downtown location, has nice rooms with a view, and parking too so when you arrive you park the car and only need it again when you are ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wait til after construction is completed”
Reviews.Author: Lea05408
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Radisson in Boston is hit and miss, so negotiate a discount and wish for the best, or stay away. Our room was temperature comfortable and clean, but noise from construction in rooms below (or above?) started early and made it hard to concentrate on some reading I needed to do before an afternoon conference. Friends rooms were too hot, heaters noisy, beds hard, and toilets flushed with sound like a train wreck waking roommates up. Pool and gym were closed, with offer to use Wang Y down the street. Location of Radisson is great, but other hotels nearby have comparable room rates, so why take chances (unless you negotiate a deep discount). Restaurant in the hotel (Rustic Restaurant) is overpriced with lousy food, so avoid that. Hot Pot in Chinatown is a comfortable walk away, where you can cook a wide assortment of raw meats, seafood and vegetables the way you like it right at your table, in a pot of broth (four flavor choices: spicy, herbal, plain and house).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more irate!”
Reviews.Author: Leyna_24
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Raddisson locations and have always had a very good opinion of them however this was just a series of unforgivable blunders on the managements part. We booked in and according to all paperwork (including a confirmation email from the hotel themselves) we were there for 4 days and had paid for 4 days but we had to go through a number of phone calls over seas and emails with Australia in order to convince them that this was the case. A bond of $650 was taken from us as is usual upon arrival, it was a bit pricey but that was fine and they said it would be 5 working days after leaving that we would get our money back, after a week my husband rang and said that we hadn't gotten our money back, they said that delays can happen give it another few days. About 4 days later he calls again and now they haven record that we ever stayed with them and will not have a conversation about returning our money as we were never there, again we call Australia etc etc. Now we have convinced them that we were there we want our money back... They said that they will fix it. My husban calls back a week later... Still no money, they will contact our bank in order to release the money... We stayed there over 5 weeks ago and still our money has not been returned. I can accept that mistakes are made but there is no excuse for incompetence and a complete lack of professionalism. What if we had desperately required that money to be returned? I expect good service, clean rooms and better from a Raddisson.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Be_Switzerland
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for 6 nights. The location is sensational - right in the middle of it all, everything including the airport is a maximum of 15-20mins cab ride away. The rooms are big, clean and well-kept. Hallways and elevators are a bit worn, but personally I don't mind that at all. Staff is friendly. Had room service from the Rustic Kitchen next door - the food was awesome. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One Nighter”
Reviews.Author: V O
Reviews.Content: This will probably be a long review because I am very finicky when it comes to my hotels. Upon arriving to the hotel, I was thrown offguard by the rennovations, this wasn't a big deal to me, because it only means that they are trying to improve themselves. I have stayed at Raidsson's beforehand and know their potentials and critierias so this wasn't a big deal, except in the morning when I had to go outside without a jacket to speak to the front desk, at 17degree weather? Yeah that sucked :( I spoke to Steven upon arriving to the hotel, and he was great! I'm a New Yorker, so everyone knows of that unspoken rivallary between Boston and New York, especially because me and my boyfriend are hardcore Yankee and Giants fans, and one thing I could appreciate is being treated like a person as opposed to a guest. That saying, I appreciated his sense of humor and not taking offense to my boyfriend's NY attitude (cause we all know how rude New Yorkers are) That being said GO GIANTS nananana! Going up to the room, it was nothing special, again, staying in hotels often, I'm not easily impressed. I did love the view, except there is nothing as breath taking as a NYC view, but again, that's just the bias NYer in me. I called down the FD a few times, and I appreciated the rapid responses I got. The only thing I found annoying was when the agent answered the phone, she actually used my name. I found it annoying only because me and my boyfriend don't have the same last name, and we both found it rude for him to be called Mr. (ME). And again, I'm not used to the politeness. That's my only PERSONAL pet peeve. Richard and John, awesome guys. Again! Hardcore Boston fans with the understanding of NY humor. We did this everywhere, we're proud New Yorkers fuggetabutit ;) They both told us where the poor excuse with a 2am last call "nightlife" was. And we did some touring around the following morning as well. When we were forced to call it a night at 2:30, we tried to wind down the night by watching some movies, but we weren't able to watch the movies. It kept telling us to call the FD, I found this odd because I put down $100 for incidentals, why should I have to call down the FD? We called, and we were comped breakfast. I guess this was ok. Again, if you haven't figured it out, I'm a NYer! I never wake up early enough for breakfast, but for free breakfast, hell yeah I woke up! Oh before I forget! The sleep number beds, scared the crap outta me. I didn't really know how to use it, but when I figured it out, I didnt know how to adjust it again, me and my boyfriend ended up sleeping on the same side of the bed, just because it was pretty difficult. Overall, I enjoyed my stay! I just wish I could get to the FD without going outside. And it was after I already had breakfast that someone told me I could stay inside to go to the restaurant! 1) This is not the weather to be outside without a jacket 2) no one wants to take their coat downstairs just to speak to FD.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall, but perhaps a little bit past it...”
Reviews.Author: KevHurst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for over a week on business in September and overall enjoyed the experience. The double twin room I had was absolutely huge - big enough for about 4 people - with ample space for clothes, suitcases, etc. Got to admit, the hotel itself looks a little bit past it. It's clean enough, but the dÃ©cor is a bit old-fashioned and even a bit shabby. There was also a slight musty smell in my room when I first arrived which wasn't awful but meant I had to air it straightaway (and also when I returned each day). This wasn't a massive problem, but it added to my impression that the place could do with a bit of freshen up. Location-wise it's fantastic. Feels right in the heart of things. And easy enough to walk to most places in the city. The staff are friendly, room service was quick and the concierge was super-helpful, more than happy enough to draw me a walking route to different places and recommended some great places to eat in the evening. Overall, not the best hotel I've stayed at in Boston, but I'd definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: jfulginiti
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in Boston. The rooms are big and the balconies offer incredible views of the city. You cannot beat the location. Almost everything is in walking distance, and for what isn't, the T is right around the corner. You can score some great last minute "day of" deals on the Hotel Tonight iPhone app!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: boltur
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in great staff great location and the Breakfast how wonderful The Rooms are big and the beds are very good

Reviews.Title: “Jackhammer Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Ben L
Reviews.Content: "A W like Boutique Hotelâ€¦.." touts the staff at the Radisson Boston. Other than clean rooms the hotel offers nothing but noise and dust. One wonders why they didn't close the place altogether rather then alienate any repeat customers. The guests look like busy-street, out of town traffic which is the only reason anyone checks in. The bathrooms on the top floor are exceedingly small and impractical with weak showers, no dedicated heat and a scrawny vent. The new decor is a shameless attempt a recreating a 30 year old boutique mantra. (Without the interior designer) The results are more like an experienced project manager vision without the interior designer credentials or a reputation to tarnish. Other than that the staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Stay away unless compâ€™d till April 2012

Reviews.Title: “Your Typical Radisson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRogersDublin
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel Boston is located in the Theater District and is close to a number of bars and eateries which was good for us. The hotel is currently under renovation whih means that there is no lobby area and check in is in a small area away from the main entrance, i am sure when it is completed it will be better than it was on our stay. Our room was well appointed with 2 queen sized beds, balcony and large tv. The beds are the very odd beds that have a dial to set the firmness, something that i personally cant get used to and end up not sleeping as well as i would in a normal bed. All in all not a bad hotel if you can live with the rennovations

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, big room and clean”
Reviews.Author: Luna S
Reviews.Content: The Radisson location is great, close to everything within walking distance (4 blocks to Copley place mall, 2 blocks to state house...). Despite the hotel is under renovation, but it's clean. The room is big and the bed is very comfort. Just the pillows were too soft for me. Staffs were very friendly. Would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: jeae
Reviews.Content: We stayed just 1 night in a room located near the top of the hotel. The first room they showed us smelled strongly of smoke even though it was a non smoking room. A quick call to reception and we were almost immediately given another room that was fine. It was a large room with an extremely comfortable bed - great fun to play with the remote controls that each person has to set their side of the bed to the required softness! The bathroom was bright, large and had lovely fluffy towels as you would expect. Our room had a small balcony and the view was great if you have a head for heights! Breakfast was self service, but a good selection of both hot and cold. A great location and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but didn't live up to what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: SimonAdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located which is its major advantage. It took us about 40 minutes to get from the airport to the hotel on the T train at $2.00 per adult for the ride. The nearest T station to the hotel is Chinatown or Bolyston which are both about a 10 to 15 minute steady walk from the hotel. The hotel is very close to the main theatres and some great restaurants. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to Newbury Street (great shopping street with some good cafes) and a Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts and a 7 Eleven are all a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is under major refurbishment and looks like a building site. Reception/front desk is similar to a car rental pick up place and is in a parking lot area. We had a room on the 18th floor which was obviously not a renovated one; plenty of space and big beds but a tired interior. Unfortunately there was a lot of drilling and background work at odd hours but we slept quite well. Free wifi is available in the rooms. The hotel offers complimentary tea and coffee on the 24th floor but on two occasions during the day we found the room to be locked. There is meant to be tea and coffee facilities in the room but a coffee percolator Is for coffee only; and coffee tasting tea/hot water. No minibar but a safe in the wardrobe along with a hair dryer, an iron and ironing board. Plenty of towels and toiletries provided but be aware of the aircraft style suction toilets. Room service is obviously available but low quality and high priced food with automatic 18% gratuity extra charge and $4 admin fee!! A margherita pizza on room service would cost you about $30 with the charges........ The Rustic Kitchen restaurant attached to the hotel offers a good choice of wines, drinks and food and the staff were very friendly. Otherwise try one of the many local seafood restaurants. All in all we wouldn't say the hotel is 4 star but the location is its main asset. Maybe once the renovation work is done, it will look less tired and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stacy_S13
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! When you first arrive it looks like a parking garage, but it is nice inside. The room was an average size with a balcony, which had a beautiful view of the city. It was also very clean. The bed did not work at first but I fixed it by unpluging it and plugging it back in. Once it was working it was wonderful. My husband and I were able to have our own settings! The bathroom was small but functional with modern touches that I loved! The location was great. We were able to walk to just about everywhere in the city. What we didn't walk to we took the "T" which was also nearby. Also the Legal Seafood across the street was a great place for dinner. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. All the suggestions they gave were spot on! Extra tip: Don't rent a car - get the week pass for the "T" and take advantage of the public trans. We got off the plane took one bus to the "T" straight into the city. It took maybe a half hour and was cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Considering the renovations...still a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: lusanti
Reviews.Content: I was there for a training on Dec 11th -16th. Though I may say it was a bit confusing to find the "makeshift" lobby, once I got to the room I found it to be very modern looking, the balcony offered a great view of the city (I was on the 20th Floor) and the bed (once I masters the sleep control thingie) was very comfortable. The location as has been said before is quite impressive, i would walk a mere 12-15 minutes to the Financial District for the actual training, passing through Chinatown on the way. Hotel Staff were very accommodating. One negative was that I had requested a new Iron, since the one in my room had a retractable power cord that was damaged and the lid where you pour water into the Iron had been missing. When I inquired I was told that "they would see what they could do"...I never got a replacement so I improvised with what I had. Checkout was smooth and I was offered complimentary parking for my 5 night stay...which is a huge plus in Boston! I am sure that this hotel will shine once the renovations are complete!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat at a great location”
Reviews.Author: RedKen10
Reviews.Content: We flew over to Boston from UK for my (significant!) birthday and the the hotel did not disappoint. It is well located in the Theater District of Boston, close to Boston Common and Chinatown and about 10 mins walk from the nearest T Station (Boylston). Most of the main parts of the city were within 20-30 mins walk of the hotel and, on the 23rd floor, we had a great view over the city with Boston Common and the Massachusetts State House in the distance. When we stayed the hotel was in the course of renovation and was being severely knocked about so this caused a small amount of noise and inconvenience, but only at the lower levels of the hotel. Also the lift, operated only with an often malfunctioning room key card, sometimes had a mind of its own. It seemed like some of the passengers had been in them for hours! On a more positive note, the room itself was spacious, well-equipped, comfortable (especially the king-sized bed) and well maintained. In a warmer part the year the balcony would have been a real bonus. The business centre was useful for catching up with emails and plane on-line check-ins (at no charge) Overall a very pleasant and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “fair enough”
Reviews.Author: ppiittyy
Reviews.Content: Let me start by the good parts... although the hotel seems to be an old one, my room had been renovated and was so clean. it was very large and contained a balcony with a great view... this hotel has a pool which it is fairly good and a fitness center that you could not find any machines there.. only some weights and trade mills... Be aware that the hotel is under construction but it did not bother me because I was at the 23 floor... I have found it something above an average for the price you pay...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Going_Home_Today
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel because my company gets a corporate rate but I like the place. The recent stay was all good; helpful Bellmen, clean and comfortable room, good location. The best feature for me is the free super fast internet. Not that slow intermittent connection you get at some hotels but a very reliable and FAST connection. Yea! You can't beat the location either. It's very close to everything you need. I will be glad when the construction is over. It seems as if it's been going on forever.

Reviews.Title: “As many have said, major reconstruction going on...”
Reviews.Author: WendyWal
Reviews.Content: Our room was just fine, spacious and clean. Nice bathroom. There are many construction sites on the first floor, so there's no lobby right now. You sort of feel like debris could fall on you at any time. We did get a good AAA rate of $143 though, much cheaper than other Boston hotels. Staff was nice, as others have said. They are trying, but the hotel really should be closed until the renovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: talkshowsonmute
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week of December and couldn't have been happier with this hotel. The room was very large and extremely comfortable. The balcony gave a great view of Boston! Loction is great its close to everything. Boston Common is around the corner. The staff were friendly. Yes they were making some adjustments to the hotel but not once was I disturbed by noise. So don't understand how anyone could complain this hotel is fantastic. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location but hotel was nothing special”
Reviews.Author: vicozzie
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston to take our son to Children's Hospital and only booked this hotel because the others we wanted were booked. Upon arrival we noticed the parking garage under construction so we had to drive a ways to find a spot. Once off the elevator from the garage we were in the hotel but then discovered we had to go back out to the garge to check in at their make shift front desk. Our room was okay, nothing special but nice size tv. We stayed on the 17th floor with a nice view of the city but honestly I'm amazed that they have balconies open to walk out on that high..I didn't like it and all you heard were helicopters and sirens. We checked out the surroundings and found 7 Eleven, California Pizza Kitchen & Starbucks down the block. There is also a small food court adjacent to CPK. Down several more blocks was McDonalds where I happen to like my coffee from. The hotel is really in a good location for getting around by foot. Boston Common and Public Gardens is just a block away! We felt very safe walking around even at night. There were a few homeless hanging around 7 Eleven but the police kept them moving along. We used the pool with our son one evening and we were the only ones in it. It was VERY hot in the room and the water was cold. Otherwise nice pool and city view. We stopped in at the concierge room one day and met with John. Very friendly man and helped us out with restaurant suggestions and directions. The doormen were extremely friendly as well and enjoyed teasing the lil one. All in all, we had a pleasant stay and the location was great but I have certainly been to nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Airprox
Reviews.Content: As previously stated by other reviewers, this hotel is still currently undergoing refurbishment. Right now, there is no lobby, just a desk in a room off the car park. I don't know if I was in a refurbished room or not, but for price it was average at best. The Sleep Number beds are not my kind of thing, but were reasonably comfortable. Room service was very quick, and of satisfactory quality. I did not use the pool or any of the other facilities. Only one person maning the desk in the "Fishtank" lobby in the morning, and with a queue of 4 people it took 20 minutes to check out, unacceptable. Staff all very friendly. Location is excellent. WiFi is free and quite quick. I would only stay here again if the price was much much lower.

Reviews.Title: “Normally, hotels close for refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Simon J
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this hotel, I thought the Big Dig was back in Boston - because the place is being turned upside-down in a major refurbishment. From the car park to the non-existent lobby, staying at this hotel requires patience and ear-plugs. There was no warning on the website that refurb works were under-way, nor any discounted rates. But right now, this hotel doesn't have a reception, a concierge, a front desk, or even a properly-functioning car park. It's most definitely one to avoid at all costs - and was far and away my worst Radisson stay ever. Normally, hotels close to refurbishment. Unfortunately the room hadn't been updated and the decor was tired and shabby - think 80s beige with fixtures and fittings that by and large have been phased out in business class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Boston on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: jenn7t4
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip in July 2011 on Expedia and got a great deal on flights and hotel for 5 days. This hotel is in the middle of everything, within a half hour we were able to walk downtown, the waterfront, Back Bay, and the public gardens. Stayed in a beautiful room high up with an amazing view. Pool was clean and outdoor patio was wonderful, at the end of a long day we laid on the loungers and had a drink...could not have asked for a better place to be. Absolutely no complaints about this hotel, would go back again in heartbeat. *** Make sure when you go, get yourself a goboston card - it includes entry to a number of tourist attractions and discounts off of food and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Just above average”
Reviews.Author: Icelanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson in november 2011. Stayed in room 20xx. Some refurbishmetns are ongoing with the lobby relocated. Service was professional, Rustic Kitchen restaurant a bit pricey. Will recommend. Location is very good a short walk in every direction. Hotel is Recommended. Dont pay over the top though!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: FreezerQueen
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Radisson in Boston in April of this year, and we found it to be quite wonderful. Having never stayed at a Boston hotel since childhood, I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect. I was travelling with my husband and two daughters, aged 16 and 11, so I wanted something that was safe, close to the subway system and restaurants, central to the city, and wouldnâ€™t break the bank too terribly bad. We got off the T (local for Boston Subway system), walked a couple of blocks and found our hotel. It was right in the heart of the city and had a plethora of wonderful restaurants nearby. Upon arrival, I found the staff to be very friendlyâ€¦not at all stuffy and everything looked modern and clean. However, I was not impressed with the $100 per night fee they tacked on to my nightly rate (which was already $218 per night) for security. The money is put back on your card once you check outâ€¦pending that everything in the room is OKâ€¦but it made our budget during our stay a little tighter than we would have liked. The room was nice (21st floor), about average size, but the bathroom seemed a bit dated. A button that switched the water from the shower to the tub didnâ€™t work very well and was often stuck on shower. Also, more detail could have been paid to cleaning the bathroom. Upon arrival I had to wipe cleaner off of the toilet, floors, and sink. The hotel restaurant was a bit too expensive and high end for a family, but the California Pizza grill was right across the road and offered everything we wanted and needed at a very reasonable price. There was also a 7-11 and a Dunkin Donuts nearby for all of our breakfast and beverage needs. There was also a pool on sight, but it was extremely cold and not at all pleasant to swim in. Other than these few issues, everything was wonderful and I would definitely stay at this Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for Boston...but....”
Reviews.Author: RdSxfn
Reviews.Content: Boston hotels can be quite pricey, but this hotel offers decent value for money. It has a very central location for sightseeing for leisure travelers and is also well located for the Back Bay and financial district. The rooms are fine, nothing too special but clean and well appointed, They feature those dial-a-number beds so you can adjust the firmness of the mattress. Two things bother me about the hotel, however; one is that you can enter the hotel from the garage without going past the front desk, which is not good for an urban hotel. The second is that I got terribly ill from the room service and there was no follow up when I alerted the hotel to that in a post-stay survey.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: Vansmith
Reviews.Content: Just had our fifth stay at The Radisson and again excellent service especially from John and Richard the Concierges. The hotel is strating a big refurb - understand it has been sold and will not be The Radisson next year but a boutique hotel - whatever that means! So some disruption to the lobby area. Did find the Rustic Kitchen a bit pricey for breakfast so if you don't mind a 10 /15 minute walk first thing suggest you head to Thorntons for a really good breakfast at half the price. Turn left on leaving the hotel head down Stuart St. towards Huntingdon Thorntons is located opposite the Huntingdon Ave. exit of the Prudential Centre and the Christian Science HQ. Recommendations for dinner walk through the Transportation Building Plaza up the alley -sharp turn right and there is Remingtons, very good reasonably priced food. Hope the refurb. doesn't put this hotel out of reach as the location is so central to all the local shopping and the 'T'. Whatever you do - do go to the Kennedy Presidential Library on the 'T' red line and do not miss Harvard Yard on the way. Thank-you again Boston a lovely, lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gimalleo
Reviews.Content: Good position in theatre district. Walking distance (20-25 min) to Copley Square/Back Bay area and to downtown. My room was very big and clean, huge bed. Furniture a bit old-style. Bathroom OK although quite small. Nice view over John Hancock and Prudential towers. Free wi-fi. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cjp255100”
Reviews.Author: cjp255100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in early October 2011. The location was excellent for us. It is across the street from the Transportation Building from which the tours we had booked departed. Our hotel room was very comfortable, clean and with all the amenities that are expected. The balcony and view of the city was a very nice bonus. The staff were helpful. A great stay but the room rate together with taxes makes it fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business stay”
Reviews.Author: Helen C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Radisson and overall thought it was really good. I've travelled a few times to Boston on business but this was the first time I had stayed here. The staff were really helpful from check-in to check-out and were very accommodating in our request for rooms with a view (they put us on the top floor!) and also in storing our luggage bewteen check-out and heading for the airport. It's a fairly standard hotel in terms of decor etc. but a great business stay and having a balcony in the room is definitely a nice feature. Overall, it's very comfortable, the room size was perfect for me and the huge, adjustable beds amazing - (You can adjust the firmness of the mattress, so it's very taylored to your preferences and for me was a great night sleep!) Couple this with its Back Bay location, in close proximity to great shops, restaurants, 'the T' and Boston Common and I'd say it's great value for money. Would definitely make a return visit. And next time, I'll get round to trying the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jodamo
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, pretty standard Radisson hotel. Location is good for exploring the city. Friendly, attentive staff. No negatives to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: JaneCWebsterNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Sept 2011. The hotel was located in the theatre district. It was close to everything and transportation was very closeby as we did not rent a vehicle this trip. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The balcony was a nice touch as the skyline was beautiful day or night. The only recommendation I have is that the hotel did not advertise any events in or near it and we felt this would've been helpful as the film festival was going on at this time. At times, entrances were blocked, without notice, and to be honest, if they would've even mentioned this prior to our visit, we would've bought tickets! Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay there and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pennv
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the theatre district near Boston Commons and the Public Garden. Walk to historic downtown sites and the North End's Italian eateries. Plenty to do and see. Our room was spacious, well appointed and clean. Our rate included on site parking and breakfast buffet. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fall stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: NigelR
Reviews.Content: We looked for a reasonably priced hotel in Boston, rarer than hen's teeth, for two nights on our way to Albany to visit my son who's on an exchange for 12 months. The Radisson was what you'd expect from such a large chain. Rooms large and clean with two good size double beds. But at over Â£200 per night with no breakfast extortionate. We caved in and had breakfast in the hotel one morning as it was raining and it costed $16 for a full buffet. Boston on the otherhand was lovely. Went on a trolleybus trip around the city including Cambridge to see Harvard. The hotel was on the route which meant we got dropped right outside at the end of the trip. I guess to stay in a modern city you should expect to pay these kind of prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: AHub67
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Boston and I was thrilled with this hotel, its location and staff. I had initially booked at another hotel online in Brookline because it was the best price I could find, then looked online through tripadvisor.com three days before departure and found the Radisson priced exactly the same as the first hotel I booked. Am I glad I found the Radisson! Our room was great, the location was fantastic, and the staff was very attentive. We especially appreciated the concierge Richard and his thorough knowledge of the area. We were very pleased with his recommendations of the Upper Deck Trolley Tour (could get off and on all day long with access for three days; also included a harbor tour) and the nearby Jacob Wirth restaurant, and his clear directions to wherever we wanted to go were superb. This hotel is within walking distance of all the areas we wished to see (Boston Commons, the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market, the North End, a variety of restaurants, even a nearby movie theater) and also a five minute walk to the Arlington 'T' Station on the Green Line. This hotel is located in the Theatre District and if I had had more time I would have caught a show. It was easy to find an inexpensive breakfast at Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks just around the corner (also a Starbucks right by the Arlington T station) to get our day started. The fitness center was clean and adequately equipped. The fitness center and pool were surrounded with windows all around, providing a gorgeous view of the city. The pool looked nice but we did not swim. I will definitely stay here if I get to Boston again!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: mmpel
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the Radisson hotel. Easy walking distance to the Commons and Public Garden, and other sites...also easy access to "T" stations made my first visit to Boston a great experience. I would stay at this hotel again. Upon reading previous reviews, took the advise of requesting a room on a higher floor - was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for disabled”
Reviews.Author: Cookster_11
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were faultless. Always helpful. However the hotel room was tired and run down. The electrics only worked sometimes, the knot of electrical cables beside the bed, appalling. There is no access to reception if you are in a wheelchair or unable to use stairs, as with my friend. You are also unable to go to the pool without going up stairs. This is not acceptable. Every morning at 10 am jackhammers started up. It was awful, not what you want to hear while on holiday. I could have coped with the scruffyness of the room if it had not been expensive. Poor value for money

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Boston Commons”
Reviews.Author: meddlingmom
Reviews.Content: During a fall foliage trip this fall (we flew into Boston and took an airport transfer to hotel), our first night in Boston was at the Radisson Hotel. I wasn't sure what to think of the hotel at first as the front of the hotel had tarp all over it due to renovation, I assume. But walking into the lobby, we found it very clean and charming. We were tired from our flight from California, and our check in was quick and easy. We were given a map of the area along with our room key. This was very helpful, although we seemed to navigate the streets with ease by the next day. They offer parking, but since we were not picking up a car (rental agency was just across the street), until the day we departed on our driving trip, I couldn't tell you the cost. The concierge quickly made our restaurant reservations for both that evening and the next. We left our bags with the bellboy, thinking that our luggage would make it to our room in a somewhat timely manner, but after half and hour, my husband decided to retrieve them from the lobby as they were still sitting on the cart, and we were anxious to explore this lovely town. The first thing I noticed was how large the room was. There is a seperate sitting area with sofa and coffee table, along with a television set. (there is also a flat screen t.v. in the bedroom area). I noticed that the room had two thermostats for heating and a/c. One in the sitting area, and one near the bed. The room was supplied with a coffemaker (was that handy in the morning), The bathroom was large with plenty of vanity counter space. Bathrooms come with a hair dryer, and magnifiying mirror which I was thankful for. (I hate lugging those things along). The first night , we were so exhausted that we did not realize that the bed had a gizmo attached to the mattress that would inflate the mattress due to your comfort preferences, so we grumbled to ourselves the next morning about the hardness of the bed until we discovered this delighful controller. The next night was much more comfortable, but I do wish they just supply comfortable beds to begin with. The drawbacks to this hotel was that our room was located behind the elevator, and we could hear it all night long as people utilized it, as well as the frequent sirens on the street, although we were 22 stories up. The restaurant located just across the covered entry from the main lobby served breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Our experience was with breakfast and though at an extra cost, was delightful. The food was offered buffet syle or you could choose off the menu. Service, though a little slow, was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was really good. The best reason for staying at this hotel, was the location. We walked to the Boston Commons and Public Gardens, and caught the hop-on, hop-off, trolley just a few blocks away. Restaurants are within walking distance and there are several stores (they are big on CVS's) nearby. You can walk to the theatre district, and it seemed very safe to walk around this area. Due to the hotel's wonderful location, I found the room rate very reasonable compared to other hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Martudona
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our trip to Washington DC - Philadelphia - Boston- NYork. Very good trip. We didn't have car so we chose the Amtrak from DC to Philly and from Philly to Boston. Then by plane to NY. It was a great choice as the service is wonderful and on time. No problems with it and the price is good for the service. At Boston we stayed al Radisson Hotel for 4 nights. good Hotel and good location. You can walk to Common Park, Public Garden, Copley Square and Prudential Mall Staff really kind, Very good concierge . He always adviced us the best not only in restaurants but also the tour he recomended ( the only one that goes into Harvard) The rooms are comfortable and breakfast was included in the price You can choose how hard or soft you like your bed.. I ate the best lobster I've eaten .A good place to have dinner is Union Oyster House al Union St. just on the Freedom Trail. It's an old place from 16... they are very kind and the salmon is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Always friendly staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: pvdzavel
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and always friendly staff. Luxury bedding, rooms have a lot of space and are well equiped. No noice at night. Valet parking. Good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Central, everything is within walking distance. I certainly recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth A Repeat Visit”
Reviews.Author: snowdog13
Reviews.Content: This is my third or fourth time at this hotel in about 4 years. The family and I take trips to Boston often and the Radisson always satisfies us. The hotel is in a very good location with the green subway line one block up and two streets over. There is a Legal Seafood right across the street from the Radisson, which the wife and I love. Also, as part of the hotel there is "Rustic Kitchen" which is used for you breakfast buffets. It offers you usual fruits, cereals, eggs, french toast, hot oatmeal, sausage, bacon and pastries. During the daytime and evenings it's also a nice place to hang out and have drinks as the decor is modern but cozy. Nice thin crust pizza and they even make their own pasta. Unfortunately, please note that the Radisson garage is under construction and it looks like it wont finish until the spring of 2012. I stayed during the weekend so there was no noise or construction during my stay but parking, while it is offered as a free option when booking the hotel, it is a big annoying with the first 3 levels being roped off. You need to park on the 4th level and above. This is only temporary but just know it will be an issue if you are driving to the hotel. As for the rooms. They are you standard rooms. Clean, neat and updated. The only little pet peeve is that they installed "power-flush" toilets in their bathrooms. They are so powerful that you can hear the person 2 floors above you and below you flushing their toilets. (Our room was on the 14th floor) A bit weird when it's 1am and the person above you needs the bathroom and you hear a Whosh! Its more than I need to know. Otherwise, there is no external noise or sound from the street and the rooms are quiet enough for me to sleep. Beds were also comfortable and firm.

Reviews.Title: “Best Shower Ever”
Reviews.Author: CamperVan74
Reviews.Content: My sister was recently in town on buisness, so of course I crashed her hotel. Stuart Street is a very easy drive from Logan, close to everything and anything you would want to see in Boston. The Radisson staff we very helpful and friendly. It is also worth pointing out this hotelroom had the best shower I have ever used hotel or otherwise. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: Twobair
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last week during a business trip to Boston. A co-worker wasn't able to get into the hotel I was originally booked in so I reluctantly switched to the Radisson so we could stay at the same hotel. I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is sparse but is freshly updated and modern. The staff was over the top friendly and helpful. They have valet service and an on-site restaurant. The fitness facility is average. There were a few treadmills and eliptical machines and stack of free weights - that's it. I couldn't wait to try the Sleep Number beds and am glad I did. I wasn't impressed and have decided that I don't need one in my future. Just my personal opinion. Other people love them! Note - apparently the hotel has been sold to a boutique and will be changing over in the future. Special tip to shoppers: I inadvertently passed a Marshalls on the way to dinner and was able to stop in on my way back to the hotel. OMG! The most amazing Marshall's - EVER! It was like shopping at Saks - but with huge discounts. I walked away with a designer evening gown that was originally $1,000 for $179. Boot selection was over the top, as well. I may just go back to Boston to hit this Marshall's - it was the one in the "Back Bay" area.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel with comfortable rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EagleFlyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson during a short business trip to Boston. Decided to try a new hotel in a new area for this trip and was quite satisfied with the result. The hotel offers easy access to most key areas of Boston Obviously, the Theater District is easily accessible as the hotel is basically in that area, but it is also easy to get to Beacon Hill, Downtown, Chinatown, North End and Back Bay, even by foot. There are plenty of restaurants in the area. The rooms are large and comfortable and the beds were really nice. Everything was clean and worked well in the room. The service of the staff was fine, but nothing out of the ordinary. The lobby and elevators could use an update to match the nice rooms better. The elevators were slow, causing long waits at times. The lobby is not a comfortable place to wait or chat with colleagues and it is rather unusual to have to bring your bags down a few steps to reach the check-in desk. But these are small things and the key part - the hotel room itself - is nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Canada420
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September prior to joining a cruise ship. We had stayed at the Lenox on a previous trip but decided to shop round for this. We got a great deal on Travel Republic. The hotel is pretty central. Just a 10 minute walk to The Prudential Centre and Boyleston Street. But just a couple of minutes walk to Boston Common. Check-in was very pleasant with the staff member happy to help in any way. The room was better than expected and the beds absolutely fine, no problem with the "number" beds as previous guests have mentioned. We didn't mess on with the remote as the bed was very comfortable as it was. Pillows were perfect for us too. Staff rushed to help us as we were walking out of the hotel, offering brollies and advice.(it was raining). If we stay in Boston again we will definitely be staying at this hotel. We also used the restaurant next to the hotel for our breakfast. It was expensive but the food was just perfect. Probably the best cooked breakfast we have had in years.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Boston. I booked the Radisson based on other reviews and the price (15% discount for booking for 4 nights). I was meeting a girlfriend from another city and sharing the room with her. When I booked online, it wasn't clear what kind of beds we'd get, so I called to request two queen beds and they had no trouble accommodating me. The location was perfect - the subway stations were all minutes away. I also walked to the aquarium, Faneuil Hall and Omni (home of the Boston cream pie). There's a Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts and 7-11 conveniently located a block away. The concierge was always friendly and extremely helpful in pointing me in the right direction on my daily sightseeing treks. The front desk also sold stamps, which was convenient for mailing postcards. The front of the building was undergoing renos while I was there. Unfortunately, this meant construction noise on weekday mornings after 9 a.m. (It didn't bother me personally since I was out the door by then, but my roomie didn't appreciate it.) One day, the City was doing some work on the watermain, so there was no running water to the hotel from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Beyond the hotel's control, but still worth mentioning. The hotel did let guests know with a note under the door and extra bottles of water in all rooms. I would definitely stay there again. I would just be sure to check the coffee supplies in the room before going to bed - they weren't replenished one day, but the front desk took care of that with a phone call. The beds were the sleep number beds and full of plush pillows. I couldn't have asked for a more comfortable sleep in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A good solid performer”
Reviews.Author: dingotraveller
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than this place is good value for money. It is in a convienent location not far from the Boston Botanical Gardens and Boston Common. Subway is accessible only a few blocks away as is the transport centre for those who want to pick up a tour. The rooms are a good size and have everything you would expect from a Radisson. Service was good not great and the breakfast downstairs was vaule for money and handy. Basically for the price you cant fault what the hotel provides. Not stellar but solid and efficient. My only criticism is perhaps the place needs a bit of a make over or freshen up. This would certainly not stop me from recommending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KAYJAYDEE
Reviews.Content: Chose it after comparing prices of similar hotels and wasn't disappointed - what you'd expect of a Radisson. Stayed 3 nights at end Sept. Room was big, bed very comfortable with adjustable controls. Was on top floor and moved from original room without any fuss due to it being too noisy as too close to lifts. Also normal city noise from street and aircon on roofs of neighbouring buildings but not too intrusive. Good view of Boston Common and surrounding area from balcony although you couldn't really sit out on it - just stand and stare. Pool is good and large enough for us. Big outside area but didn't get round to using it. Ate in Vapiano opposite and Jack Wirth pub on Stuart Street. Both good experiences. Had breakfast in L'Aroma cafe on Newbury Street which is a very relaxing way to start the day. Hotel didn't seem to advertise the fact that you can access internet via free computers in Business Centre off lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Holmfridur J
Reviews.Content: We 4 ladies stayed at Radisson in Boston for 2 nights and this hotel was perfect for us, great location, nice rooms and good service at the hotel. The staff was very friendly and ready to assist us in so many ways, getting us a taxi and helping with the luggage. Four ladies and the bathroom was big enough for us. Overall, a great hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: randy s
Reviews.Content: The staff and management went above all expectations for our stay. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Boston”
Reviews.Author: LynneC001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. It is a perfect location for someone new to Boston....within close walking distance to the sights, restaurants and bars. There is no need to rent a car when staying here (which is good considering the traffic is crazy!). The hotel itself was nice and the service very good. The bathroom was really small with only a shower. They only had tiny pillows on the king-sized bed which we found uncomfortable. Overall, a great place to stay for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “May as well been renting an apartment!”
Reviews.Author: TrudyCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 11 nights at the end of September. Due to previous reviews regarding noise I was concerned, however I have to stay that we had a quite room and did not have any complaints regarding noise. The room was spacious and had the usual facilities in terms of iron, ironing board, tea/coffee making facilities etc. The location was very central, with Boylston street and the financial district/wharf all within a 10/15 minute walk. My main issue with this hotel is that we paid a lot of money to stay there 11 nights and not once were we asked at any stage during our stay if everything was alright or if we were enjoying our stay. We passed the reception/concierge desk conservatively 4 times a day and were never once acknowledged. Something simple like a note under the door from the hotel saying they hoped we were having a nice stay, but if we needed anything to contact 'whoever' would have made all the difference. In reality we most likely wouldn't have contacted anyone, but the gesture would have been nice. Instead we felt like essentially we were boarding in one of their rooms, and were not acknowledged until we checked out. Incidentally they were able to put a bill under our door on the day of checkout requesting payment of $1.25 for a phone call, pity they could not have put as much effort into their hospitality. Sorry to have to give this review put unfortunately we did not come across the friendly people other reviewers referred to. We don't expect people to fall over us, put when you pay over Eur2,500 to stay somewhere, you would hope that someone would at least ask you if you are enjoying your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for its location”
Reviews.Author: lakechiro
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms. Sleep number bed. Best price I found for this quality of a hotel in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: GracemcCarter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for nearly a week with work as was only hotel in budget. Very pleasantly surprised. Big rooms (bigger than other hotels in Back Bay area) and my room had two full size king beds in it. Also, a balcony which was a really nice surprise. Great views out over Boston. The bathroom was OK, not that special, and the TV is a bit ancient, but apart from that no complaints of the room. I really enjoyed using the pool - another nice touch and a definite advantage over other hotels in the area. Great location and some fantastic restaurants nearby (really enjoyed Flemings). Would recommend and would stay here again. Get a room on the upper floors if you can, to get the view.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and good location ruined by renovations”
Reviews.Author: dandd_au
Reviews.Content: We are about to finish our stay at the Radisson for the last 5 nights and have enjoyed the visit to Boston immensely. The hotel is clean and in a good location with quick access to the back bay and north areas. Unfortunately, since we came to Boston for a relaxing holiday, the very noisy renovations happening made a sleep in impossible and also became quite irritating. I guess renovations need to happen, but it's a shame we weren't told they were planned before we booked our stay as it may have changed our decision. Over-all, good hotel - but for the next few months, I recommend asking if they have any jack-hammering planned before agreeing to the fairly high priced rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jenzell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for its proximity to the Hertz car rental office but it was a great location for visiting all over Boston. It was next to the Theatre district, close to the Common only a short walk from the start of the Freedom Trail and most importantly pretty close to the shops. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable and we had a great view over the city with the bonus of a small balcony. The pool is rather small and there is a lack of changing facilities at the pool area so felt a bit conspicuous going up the lift dripping on the carpet. However, overall the hotel was great for a couple of days. Clean, comfortable and with friendly staff. Also, if you do need to rent a car the Hertz Rental office is situated only 2 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper1616
Reviews.Content: I'll just qualify this review by saying the very good rating comes from the service and location itself not the hotel or room. By that let me say there was nothing really wrong with the room or hotel but they were not exceptional. The room had a sleep number bed which might have been nice except mine didn't really work, though it was comfortable enough for me. On the upside the room was very clean and had a balcony with a downtown view. The staff was so friendly, especially the man at the concierge desk. He was EXTREMELY HELPFULL and told us a ton of great things to do. The hotel was in a great location, close to the subway and public transportation. They have a restaurant on site that looked fabulous, though I didn't eat there. Over all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: Well located close to Boston Common. The hotel is well appointed with excellent concierge service (Richard). There is an excellent business centre to book local attractions and an excellent indoor pool and fitness centre. Only a short walk to Boston Common and Walking distance to shopping and restaurants in Newbury St. The subway station is nearby at the common and it is very easy to use with a "Charlie card". Highly recommend Emersons Cafe just a block away opposite Boston Common for breakfast - we fed a family of 4 a healthy breakfast for under $25 with lots a variety available. Highly recommend doing the Fenway Park tour,visiting Harvard and the JFK Presidential Musuem. Plimoth Plantation is out of town towards Cape Cod but worth a visit if you have the time. Loved Boston and the great location of this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average. A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: andysarahhunt
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights using my Club Carlson points this is a category 6 (highest) hotel as far as the points go, so I was expecting something special. I thought the decor was tired. The AC was too noisy to have on. The pool is described as full size but is small and has no shower or changing facilities so you have to go there in the elevator with your costume on. I changed room because the first room had wallpaper peeling off. I stay in a cat 6 Radisson in London every week and would say this is way under par in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-nice city”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy918
Reviews.Content: Three night stay at the Radisson in Boston, very good experience. First impressions were good before we even arrived with advice from the head commissionaire on how to get there and parking. Reception a bit dull and impersonal but very efficient. Rooms very clean and spacious. All the staff we met were cheery and helpful but if you didn't approach them or have need of the staff you probably would never hear from them - maybe overly discreet?? Used the separate diner for breakfast one morning and enjoyed the freshly made foods and the attentive staff. Being centrally located there were other diners/restaurants available on your way out and wanted out to explore rather than sit in hotel - this was the only reason for not using hotel dining areas.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean, comfortable, all you need”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights for a conference. The room was clean although the carpet (as in most hotels) could need a steam clean) and the beds were very comfortable (sleep number beds where you can adjust the firmness). We felt safe too as the elevators require your room key to activate. The size of the room, number of drawers and closet space, in room safe, free bottled water, and bathroom were excellent (we had 2 queen beds). The toilets in Boston are really loud and go WHOOSH! The bathroom was immaculate although the water pressure wasn't great. It's a nice (3.5 our of 4) star hotel by hotel ratings cuz there's no minibar but I never use them anyway. There is a very nice pool (no hot tub) but the water was too cool for me. The location is great - walking distance to the 2 big shopping/restaurant streets of Newbury and Boylston, and if you continue left out the door on Stuart, you can also reach the luxury shopping mall Copley Place and the Prudential Shopping Centre. The Park is also 1 block away. Everything, including (25 mins) is walking distance. Conference amenities were very good - food for breaks, lunch, although the heating/cooling system in the conference room and the hotel room is loud when it comes on. The front desk was extremely accommodating and efficient. They even provided something special for my mom's birthday which was really appreciated and sets this hotel apart! The door man and all other staff were really nice and genuinely interested in helping. The hotel restaurant Rustic Kitchen is nicely decorated in one section (ask to sit there!) but the buffet wasn't anything special for $16. We went across the street to try the Four Seasons for afternoon tea/dessert and also for buffet breakfast ($39) and those were luxurious splurges. I'd stay here again for its convenience and amenities. They also have a business centre where you can use the computer/printer. We had a conference rate of $239. The taxi to/from airport was $18.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Janie M
Reviews.Content: We had exactly the same room as last year, nice spacious room (although 100 dollars more and no breakfast included this time), and the balconies have been finished and the surface is now smooth concrete. Itâ€™s great to have a lot of space when youâ€™ve just got off a plane and so can leave your bags in the corner, fall on the sofa, turn on one of the roomâ€™s 2 big TVs, and order room service (which arrived very promptly). And the bed and pillows are the most comfortable on the planet. The hotel was NOT overrun with groups of students this year, and the staff were very friendly and helpful - unlike reception last year. We loved going to the pool, and we were early enough to have it to ourselves. We were too tired to explore the location on the night we arrived, but it was nice to have a walk along the park and of course was so close to the hertz rental garage that it made the start of the onward journey so simple.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed again, just as good as it was last year.”
Reviews.Author: BMLNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights last year, and were happy to be able to stay again this year, but only for one night. The rate was excellent, the room was very clean and spacious, two televisions, comfy bed, nice bathroom with shower (no bath), staff were very helpful as we needed to quickly drop off our bags and return our rental car. We had to check out very early the next morning for our flight, the wake-up call was as requested. Very happy with the Radisson, love it's central location too - and it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: tpulleyn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week fly drive of New England, the first two nights were spent at the Radisson Hotel in Boston. The hotel is extrememly easy to get to from Logan Intl airport either by paying the $2 subway fare or by paying for a slightly higher but quicker shuttle service at approx $25. The hotel is modern, well kept and most of all clean though some furniture is slightly dated and is within a two minute walk of Boston Common and Boston Public Garden. Also nearby is Downtown Crossing and Chinatown and just opposite is Legal Seafoods which is a great place for dinner. The rooms themselves are what you would expect from a large hotel chain like Radisson. Our room came with a desk, chair, coffee maker and large bathtub/shower. The bed was extremely comfortable with adjustable mattress softness and a choice of pillows. The only negative point is that breakfast is very expensive. The buffet breakfast works out at $18 a head but does include both hot and cold food and unlimited tea/coffee. Having been to a different Radisson hotel at the end of our trip it transpired that this is more expensive than most and whilst the quality was good I wouldnt pay it again! Overall a good hotel in an excellent location in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but aging furniture”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_maple_leaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located to walk downtown and is close to restaurants and the theater district. Overall, the hotel was correct and offered good city views fron high floors. However furniture and carpet in the room looked aging. The bathroom with small white tiles looked aging too.

Reviews.Title: “70s decor made good by staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel with no joy - all other Boston hotels were full of conference folk. Arriving at 11.30pm without my luggage (thanks, Delta!), the 1970s tired look didn't exactly lift my heart. However, the night checkin person (Stephen I think) was utterly excellent. A bag full of toiletry essentials appeared, several bar vouchers ('have a drink to recover'), and some breakfast vouchers were a considerate, friendly touch. Stephen asked if I'd mind switching to a twin-double room so that he could give me a room on a higher level and so with a view. I didn't and gained a great view for my 4 days there.
