The room was simple, clean and functional: again, 1970 came to mind. However, the beds were supremely comfortable and the free (yes!!) wifi was really very good indeed. Friendliness extended to all staff: the cleaners were helpful and chatty, all of the reception, baggage and business centre staff were helpful in an unforced way. There also seemed to be a lot of managerial staff in evidence generally checking on guests, pitching in etc. Air con units in the rooms were a bit old and noisy, but easy to turn off and adjust. There's a swimming pool on the mezzanine (on top of the car park) leading onto a roof bar area (unstaffed, you need to phone for service and then it's charged at Room Service rates). Pool's not tiny, but a bit over-chlorinated. There're no showers on the floor, but it's great to sit and read on the roof. The location was excellent too: spitting distance of Boston Common, walking distance to Beacon Hill and Back Bay, taxiable everywhere and metro close too. Normally I wouldn't have picked a Radisson after some dodgy experiences in the past, but this has changed my view. While it could do with a room refresh at some point, the basics of cleanliness, comfort and location are here and the staff were a real plus. I'd certainly be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but do not go there with children”
Reviews.Author: mz05
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of what was written by all the others. Large Rooms, great location etc. Astonishing for me is the poor service we got during our stay and the lack of amenities (no fridge, no water heater) that I consider to be standard in a four star hotel. As we had our 9 month old infant with us I asked for an water heater to make tea etc. No chance. The other day I tried to find a way to get babyfood heated up in a microwave. After talking to 3 people i finally gave up and did that at the 7 eleven around the corner. Exceptionally poor service in my eyes...I tried to bring our complaint to the manager as they ask on their "commitment sheets" and was put on hold for several minutes...dead end here as well. On top of that came the noisiness in the room. We were on 19th floor and you had the impression the policecars and firefighter trucks were running right through our room. Sleeping without earplugs impossible for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: peter194940
Reviews.Content: Let me say that this was my wife's first time in Boston and I'm glad we picked the Rasdisson. Room was large, clean, sleep number beds were great and really did not hear any contruction noise, perhaps because we were on the 17th floor. Location was great. 10 minute walk to Prudential Center, 5 minutes to Boston Commons, 10 minutes to Cheers, and yes a 45 minute walk to Fenway. BTW we went to a Boston/Tampa Bay game and Boston lost 4 to 3. Close to many restaurants and sites. Steve at the front desk was great. He suggested the Intermission Tavern and the IT'S ALWAYS SUNNY IN BOSTON BURGER. Boy what a burger. 10oz. angus burger plus bacon, cheese and a sunny side up egg served with siracha mayo. Boy was it good. If you go there you have to try it. Only a 5 minute walk. Also ate at Legal Seafood. Great place, just across the street. Never ate or ordered room service from the hotel, much too pricey and many restaurants within a short walk. We also purchased a two day pass on the Old Time Trolley. We booked with them because when in San Diego a few months ago used them. They are by far the best plus the hop on spot was only a 2 minute walk from the Radisson. When we go back to Boston, we'll defintely go back to the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jambo43
Reviews.Content: Visited in September .. this is a typical radisson and as such comes with a known quality. The hotel did not disappoint and is situated in a good location for all attractions and is easliy reached by Metro if arriving by plane (cost $2). One major advantage the hotel offers in free wi-fi and a very small issue is that there is some work going on to the rendering and our window was locked down and hadnt been cleaned in a while - however there was no noise or disruption and staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: TheMysteryCustomer
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, facilities are excellent. Room was clean and spacious and perfectly equipped close to all attractions located in the Theatre District. There are numerous restaurants located in the area and it is only a short walk from Boston tourist attractions or the train network if looking to travel further afield. The reception staff were helpful with all requests. We did not include breakfast due to cost but did have room service from the hotel one evening which was of impressive quality and reasonably priced. We also used the swimming pool which was clean and well sized and offered good views across the city as an added bonus! If we return to Boston, we would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - but noisy”
Reviews.Author: willowtree155019
Reviews.Content: On the good side: The location is fantastic in the theatre district, Back Bay, a few minutes to China Town and a 10 minute walk to Copely Place. The staff is great and the rooms are large and clean, clean, clean. Read on Trip Advisor to ask for a high floor and as requested we were on 21 on the west side. Unfortunately this side of the hotel is over the air conditioning generators for the hotel. Even with the balcony door shut tight you could hear this all night. Also the in-room air/heating units must be 50 years old, they are terribly noisy. Really surprising given how nice the room is. Noise is definitely a factor here, but overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller49
Reviews.Content: The quality of the rooms was very good with all the facilities. Room size was surprisingly large and the view exciting. The service from the front door to check out was excellent and everyone very helpful. The location was a big factor in choosing the Radisson and we were not disappointed. We walked almost everywhere. Our only problem was the noise from the air conditioner however we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Always ask - you never know what you can get :)”
Reviews.Author: happynuts
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed at this hotel back in the August long weekend and we were very happy with the service received from the staff. Upon checking in at the reception desk, we met a staff that used to live in the same city as we are. It's always nice to meet someone who knows your own city! Makes a great way to start your vacation. The staff was able to set us up in a higher floor but it needed to be clean by the cleaner staff. We were perfectly happy to leave our luggages with the bell boy, grab lunch and then do the check-in afterwards. To our surprise, the staff came over and told us the room was ready as we started to drop off our luggage for storage. We were placed in a suite on the second highest floor with a beautiful view of the city (and partial view of the sea). The washroom was long and narrow. It was recently renovated with a walk-in shower, white 'subway style' tiles, and large mirror. The only complain I had was that there were no hooks (not even 1) to hang clothes, just a narrow countertop which sits very closely to the toilet. Some previous reviews also mentioned the sleep number bed wasn't working properly, ours had a similar issue but we dismissed it in the grand scheme of things especially when you are exhausted after a full day of walking around in the city! We also met the conceiage person who was very professional and keep tabs on every guest. He would often ask how the guest enjoyed the city as he sees them coming back to the hotel. From what I observed, he seems very genuine in making sure everyone was having a good time. He also did something extra special for us. We had inquired about Boston famous Cannoli and the best way to 'store' them. According to him, it's best to eat it right away but storing them in the fridge would be okay as well. Well we told them there was no mini-fridge available in the room as generally most city hotel offers that in their room. To our surprise, he offered to have room service bring up a fridge for us so we can store our cannolis! We were skeptical but none-the-less happy that he offered. So you can imagine the surprise look when we saw a mini-fridge installed in our room the very next day. Overall, we were very happy with the location of the hotel, free Wi-Fi access, the close proximity to various location attractions and most importantly the great friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harald035
Reviews.Content: I only stayed the one night but I was very impressed with this hotel. The standard room I got was very spacious and clean, with a big TV and a adjustable bed. The hotel was fully booked, but I could not hear any noise from my room and I had a good nights sleep. The breakfast-room was in another building. The breakfast buffet was perhaps a bit small, but definately tasty. I would reccommend this to anyone travelling to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Stay cut short...”
Reviews.Author: emmaxoxo
Reviews.Content: Our stay got cut short at this hotel, where suppose to stay 3 nights, but only stayed 1 due to Hurricane Irene. But our 1 night stay was enjoyable, didnâ€™t see the need for balcony though, the screen door was filthy as well. Hotel isnâ€™t in a very pretty area, but close to other Boston Neighbourhoods. Had Sleep Number beds, but didnâ€™t really understand how to use them. Free wifi, would have liked to stay longer

Reviews.Title: “Boston 2011”
Reviews.Author: Sarah230
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel Boston was a great hotel. Everything was lovely. Huge room, bright and spacious - om the top floor (24th). Free internet and TV games if desired. Staff were excellent and location of this hotel was one block from Boston Common, one block from Wang Theatre and just around the corner from the Blue Man Group theatre. Just a couple of blocks to walk to the Prudential Bldg for top floor restaurant and viewing area as well as the main shopping area for upscale shops. Attached restaurant quite expensive for a snack however across the corner was City Centre which had Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts and other food court options for light breakfast or lunch. The Gray Line tours were also located in the City Centre which was where we caught the trolley each day. Also the subway was just out the back door and down the street a bit. Excellent location in the city of Boston. We stayed all five days here and enjoyed it thoroughly. Nice pool and pool deck with tables, chairs. lounges and even a two-person hammock. You could also order room service to the pool deck if desired. Booked in through Priceline.com and definitely saved $$$. Would go and stay again at the Radisson for sure. They have said they are going to totally renovate and that it will be nicer (hopefully it is all done by the time I return). Sleep by Number beds in all rooms and they are great (have one at home).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but only affordable with special deal.”
Reviews.Author: EA_South_Dakota
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, though I wouldn't have been able to stay if I hadn't gotten a good deal through Hotwire. Rack rate would be prohibitive. Great pool and workout room. Stayed for three nights, if I remember correctly. One day when it was raining they had umbrellas to lend to anybody who needed them. That was very classy.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION! Everything is walkable!”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: When I came to Boston I booked 2 nights at the Waterfron Renaissance and my last night here becasue I had an early flight and a free night through Radisson Rewards. I should of stayed all three nights here. The location is very central and scenic. All the main sights are walkable and the subway is only a few steps away which can take you everywhere. I like staying at Radisson because of the sleep number beds which are always comfortable for me. The rroms were great. They gave us a room on the top floor and the view was killer. We also had a very small balcoiny which was pretty neat to look over the whole city from. The one ie I had with my stay was that the coffeemaker had a used coffee grounds in it and the pot had old coffee. This was a little disturbing. I notified the hotel and recieved an apology email. If you are looking for a central location for sightseeing this is the place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: gribbsfam
Reviews.Content: My travel friend and I stayed at the Radisson in Boston just a couple of days ago. Though the weather was rainy and windy, we had an enjoyable stay in Boston. (We had our own umbrellas, but the Hotel did offer us a loan of their umbrellas - very thoughtful!) This Hotel has 24 floors and is located in the Back Bay area of Boston. The City Place Mall is conveniently situated diagonally across Stuart Street. (Try D'Angelos clam chowder - I had the best soups in the 3 cities I visited this time.) Ice cream seems to be extra delish in the States, too.... Quincy Market has a huge hall of food offerings. Food is a big part of their daily routine (and mine, come to think of it!) - there's someone eating somewhere at all hours of the day and night! You can choose foods according to your whims and your finances. We stayed in room #1905 which was to the side of the hotel but there were no obstructions to our views of that part of the building skylines and streets in our area. There was a small balcony but the sliding doors did not open onto it - for safety, I would guess. There was the usual shower/bath/toilet combination. The hotel's position was quite central to the Boston Common and the T at Boylston subway station both of which were about a 5-10 minute walk away. The Subway system is quite easy to navigate (as are most of the underground train setups in the States) and this is from someone who doesn't take trains in Australia!! In Charles Street South (just across the road the down the street) is the location for the Boston Hop On/Hoop Off Trolley bus. The 'free' harbour cruise which lasted about an hour was a nice relaxing way to see the Boston Bay area. The history of Boston and its' part in the America's versus the Brits is a big selling point - but we Australians can be a bit overpowered with the whole fighting tale that seemed to take place just about everywhere in this city .... though I did enjoy the historic details we were told. I guess we all know about the Boston Tea Party. Tourism is the 4th largest industry in Boston, we were informed. Too bad it was inclement weather on the day we chose to visit Harvard University. We just wandered around - even saw the Drain Doctor (a van from a city plumbing company) at one of the Faculties!!! Ha, Ha! This was my second visit to Boston and the hotel is very clean and all the staff were friendly to us travellers. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Construction still going on”
Reviews.Author: wundys
Reviews.Content: Despite the other reviews saying they couldn't hear any of the constructions this noise couldn't be missed. It seems like they are working on the building girders and it resonated through the entire building. The drilling would start about 9am, a little later on Saturday but continued for a good part of the day (or at least the parts where we were in and out). The accommodations are what you would expect for a 3+ star hotel so other than the noise of the construction this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Free wifi in the room”
Reviews.Author: adamagi
Reviews.Content: We hade a two bad room + rollaway bed for 5 of us, and it was enough but not big. Free wifi is working in the room, perfect. We lived on the 16th floor, but could here the noise of the coolers from top of other buildings even with closed windows. We hade only one bad experience: when arriving from the airport we left our digital camera in the taxi and they could not find out which company took us there, and even the lost and found service of the city was not available. They were helpful but no success. There is a camera at the entrance that coluld have recorded our arrival but they did not try it. Otherwise every thing was fine.

Reviews.Title: “We always go to the Radisson in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Virginia O
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Radisson hotel in Boston for 4 years now. This summer we were there for 9 days while settling our daughter into college. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and the hotel staff always helpful. For a very good hotel at a reasonable price for Boston I recommend the Radisson. It also has the advantage of being close to Chinatown (good food), the Boston Commons, Downtown Crossing and Newbury Street (good shopping), the theater district, and the T's Green Line...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TFamily1998
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance of all sorts of attractions plus underground stations. Car park a bit expensive, but the going rate. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice property, attentive and professional personnel”
Reviews.Author: alinnna
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our 5 days staying. A one day overbooking problem has been solved in a most smooth, delicate and professional way â€“ many thanks to Crystal Sullivan and to her team. Views from the 24the level were fantastic, location is great in the mist of the theatre district, just a short walk to the Public Garden. Overall it was a pleasant experience. On the downside, we can mention the parking fee of USD 40/ day which we found a bit excessive (we only inquired about it, we did not use the option), but the area has plenty of alternative parking buildings at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel room and will return soon!”
Reviews.Author: JMT06
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room at this hotel. They have thought out where to put outlets and mirrors so more than 1 person can get ready in the morning. The sound proofing seemed better than at other hotels. The staff were friendly and efficient too. This hotel is located between Copley and the waterfront so if your a walker, enjoy the walks. You can also walk to the Commons.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: WiscDoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Hotel Boston with a friend for 4 nights and have almost all good things to say about this hotel. It was conveniently located to everything we wanted to see in Boston and our stay was excellent. Check-in staff were probably the friendliest and most pleasant I've ever encountered at a hotel. We were able to check in around noon and had a great view of the city from our room on the 20th floor. The balcony was awesome! The room itself had plenty of space for a large-city hotel room (I was expecting smaller, based on stays in cities like Chicago), and although it took a few minutes to figure out the Sleep Number beds, they were comfortable and we looked forward to falling into them after a long day exploring the city. Bathroom was very nice and updated. Plenty of counterspace to unpack our toiletries. Housekeeping did an excellent job with cleaning our room promptly each day. We didn't check out the pool or rooftop or the Rustic Kitchen. We did go to Legal Seafood across the street and had a so-so experience. The one negative was that a bellman at the Radisson hailed a cab for us (very nice) and was confused about where an attraction we wanted to visit within Boston was located...so therefore gave the cab driver incorrect information. It took a few minutes to sort out with the cab driver, and with the help of our phones, we got to our destination. I assumed bellman were knowledgeable about all aspects of a city, but not so in this situation. (Our destination was only 2 miles from the Radisson, but it was pouring, which is why we called a cab.) No biggie, but just frustrating for a few minutes. There was some construction happening during our stay, but it was only bothersome on the day we checked out. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Radisson Hotel Boston. I'll recommend it to those I know heading to the city in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: STFC69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days while visiting Boston. It was excellent value, a good size room at a decent price. Staff were very helpful and efficient. I would certainly recommend this hotel. The 'Rustic Kitchen' restaurant next door is reasonably priced and serves decent food and I would also recommend the P.F. Chang's chinese across the road. Otherwise steer clear of the overpriced steak and seafood places nearer to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: alexk77
Reviews.Content: We checked in the day that Hurricane Irene came ashore. Very nice location, one block from Boston Common. Building was older but fairly well taken care of, free Wi-Fi unlike the Marriot Copley which charges. Ask for a room on one of the top floors, great views of Boston from the balcony. Be warned, the balcony railing is low so people with kids or clumbsy adults take caution. Oh yeah, and sleep number beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and quality service!”
Reviews.Author: maire5
Reviews.Content: After much research, we decided on the Radisson as our base for exploring Boston with our two grandchildren! Terrific decision. The Staff was superb-courteous, warm, and helpful! The concierge advised us on unique eating spots! Pool was a highlight. Our early departure due to Hurricane Irene was smooth and seamless thanks to an acommodating staff!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: YorkCastiger
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and 7yr old stayed here mid August for 6 nights.The hotel was clean with friendly staff. The hotel location was very good, walking distance to most of the Boston sites, with a 7-eleven opposite hotel for picking up breakfast. There was construction noise coming up through the elevator shaft from 8am each morning but this couldn't be heard in the bedroom. The upper deck trolley tour picks up from in front of the hotel, valid for 2 days, this was a good way of getting to the places which were a little further out. My only real fault with the hotel was the pool. On a weekend the pool was full of 20+ children who treated the pool like a public park pool and not a hotel SWIMMING pool, I know this isn't the hotel's fault but it did sour the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and we were very pleased. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. We got in town quiet early and was not expecting our room to be ready, but thought we would check as we dropped off the car. To our surprise the room was ready! We found the room to be very clean! We will be back again and we will be sure to stay at the Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and not clean”
Reviews.Author: Huguesstephane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is realy noisy, we were on the 15th flor and we can hear the noise of the works in the parking. The bathroom is very little and not very clean. No interest in this place, so expansive for this kind of service. So Tripadvisor need 300 letters to be happy, what can i say nothing more, this hotel is nothing and find 300 letters to say it is much.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: Wiced
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable and the staff were very nice but the pool was a real disappointment generally poor no changing rooms and cold

Reviews.Title: “The General Manager went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: jaidevg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a convention in Boston back in May of 2011. My check in experience was not that pleasant as the Manager on Duty took a while to check me in. When I checked into my room, it was not up to par with the level of service that is expected at this type of hotel. I complained about it and was informed that the Manager on Duty would call me back. I never received any acknowledgement. The next day I complained to the General Manager, Mr. Simon Mais and he immediately addressed my complaints. As someone in the industry, I was impressed with the service recovery that he executed. When I returned back to New York, I received a hand written note from Simon, which blew me away!!! Thanks to Simon Mais, I would make this hotel my choice in Boston for future stays. Thank you JaidevG, Brooklyn,NY

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but lifts are annoying”
Reviews.Author: bagobones33
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good locations with restaurants very near to it, and, the trolly tour pick up just around the corner. I found the staff lovely and friendly and the breakfast in the morning was very good. The only bad thing I have to say is that on the weekends its very hard to get down to the lobby as you cant take the stairs and have to wait for the elevator. One morning we were left on our floor for 30 minutes as every elevator that went by was packed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JackF
Reviews.Content: Had a great 7 night stay at the Radisson in Boston. Ideal location to walk everywhere. Friendly staff who were very helpful. Don't be put off by very ugly exterior of the building!! Rooms spacious, all with balcony. Nice sun deck to enjoy and adequate indoor pool. I can understand review I read that said room by elevators very noisey. We had room at end corrider and no issue, but you could tell they would disturb you if room next to one.

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: andavo
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, big and clean. A lot of private parkings nearby. Close enough to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Willwil60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights the 1st week of August, 2011. Just as I had researched, it has a great location for tourists & theater goers. It's only a few blocks to the Boston Commons, where the Freedom Trail starts. There you can also catch the subway, which I found to be convenient, clean & reasonably priced. But still be prepared to do a lot of walking, walking & walking to do the entire trail(it was a letdown). Enjoyed the costly Duck tour better. Several theaters are only a block away. We didn't care for the Radisson's restaurant(Rustic Kitchen) for breakfast(did their poor buffet), so we didn't choose it for other meals. But there's Dunkin Donuts in just about every block it seems! But, for all other meals THERE ARE MANY, MANY RESTAURANTS WITHIN A BLOCK OF THE RADISSON BOSTON. That includes: Legal Seafood, Maggianos Little Italy, Flemmings Steakhouse; McCormick & Schmick's, Rock Bottom Brewery; California Pizza; Smith & Wollensky(very pricey); P.F.Chang; Vapiano Italian; + in the Massachusets Transportation Dept. Office Building is a large food court +++. The Hotel itself is really nice including the indoor pool with a skylight that partially opens + the adjoining sundeck. The room was OK. Liked the balcony with a nice view of the city from our 19th floor balcony. Only downside was a noisy air conditioner, which kept waking up my wife. But comfortable bed. In the lobby you will find an excellent concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: BirdFamily22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good value (for central major city) and was comfortable and clean. We were on the 20th floor, as I requested a high floor, so only heard the jack hammers once or twice in the lift on the way down. Easy walk to T but you can walk to the major sites and harbour in 20-30 mins through town and the city always felt safe (even in the evening). Best for breakfast is the South Street Diner (turn right out of the hotel and keep walking nearly all the way to the South Station area and you'll find it on the right). Great Hash! Taxis always available. Pool clean and roof top 'garden' a nice place to relax. Would recommend the hotel for a city break or part of a tour of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Nellie_traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay with the family. The staff was very helpful. Asked for an extra luggage stand and got it immediately. We did receive a notice about the construction, but thankfully we only heard the jack hammering one morning in the elevator. Our room was on the 16th floor so maybe that helped. Our sleep number beds worked fine but I would have preferred a pillow top bed. The balconey was not much to brag about. Not even room for a chair, but it did allow us to get fresh air in the mornings. The kids used the pool and work out room which were small but fine. The hotel does have a good sized deck outside on the roof by the pool that was nice to excape to. Location was close to Boston Commons and the T-stop. Just wish the halls didn't smell like stale smoke. Maybe that will improve when they finish their renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: ReesLondon
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, well located. Reception staff very pleasant and friendly. Our room and bathroom was spacious and comfortable. would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Radisson, Boston. The service was among the best we have had, with everyone from the concierge to the housekeeping doing everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. The front desk was very polite and helpful and always asked what they could do for us. The room we stayed in was exceptionally clean and roomy. We also enjoyed the workout room. I would recommend this to everyone going to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveandBeverley
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Raddison in Boston this past July. The valet parking on arrival was great although I have to say that I'm never comfortable when a valet leaves my bags unattended on the trolly while they park my car. This was not unique to this hotel, so as I usually do, I stick around to keep an eye on it while they park my car and bring my things up to my room. The check in was smooth and went without a hitch. The room was as expected and was nice and clean; so was the washroom. Beds were comfortable and the pool was great. The location was also very convenient. I would recommend this hotel to my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsJol
Reviews.Content: Very close to the centre of the city in the theatre district - with all the historic sights within easy walking distance to the north and east. We didn't walk to the west till the last day and so did miss out on the more modern part of Boston - which looked like it had several nice restaurants. DIdn't make it into the Legal Sea Food restaurant opposite, but wish we'd had and extra night to do so. Boston is pretty small, so walking to the historic sights is easily an option from this hotel - you may not need to get on the subway except for the trip to Harvard. We didn't have breakfast or dinner included so can't comment. There seems to be a very interesting restaurant associated with the hotel - one that has a cooking show broadcast live on local tv, see for yourself...

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: Betsie49
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, nice mattress, linens and bathroom. The service desk (Concierge) was most helpful in picking out restaurants and places to visit. Although you have to pay to park your car ($39/night), they did allow us to keep our car there after check-out and we took advantage of continuing our sight-seeing in the afternoon before retrieving our car on the way to Maine.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: The_Rev007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week with my family. The room was large, the air-conditioning worked well, and the balcony was a bonus. Everything was clean, the staff was helpful and breakfast (part of our package) provided plenty of options. The hotel is situated 200 yards from Boston Common and was central to all the main shopping and tourist sites. All in all it was a good stay. I've nothing against the hotel, but it simply didn't excite me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: payingitforward1
Reviews.Content: If you are up to it, you can walk to nearly every attraction in Boston. The hotel is large. There is a small pool and fitness center. Steven at the front desk was very welcoming. The beds are sleep number. We couldn't get the hang of them and were consequently uncomfortable. The balcony was a nice touch. There is a laptop-size inroom safe which is free. You have to use your room key to go up the elevator. Get a room high up to get above the street noise. The a/c was very effective during a brutal heat wave. Toiletries were not replaced. The room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MNlove2travel
Reviews.Content: My 21 yo daughter and I spent 4 nights here July 28 - August 1. We got a great deal through Last Minute Travel of $119/night. I thought it might be too good to be true. When I checked in, the staff was very friendly. Our room was on the 18th floor. I liked the extra security where you need your card to punch a floor number in the elevator. My daughter arrived shortly after I did and the staff was very helpful in connecting us. I was waiting at one door and she came in another. The rooms were quite large, very clean and comfortable. The sleep number bed didn't seem to really work, but it was comfortable. Wifi worked perfect and it was great to be able to use my laptop right in the room. We didn't have any noise issues. The location was great. A 5 minute walk to Boston Common and the T there as well as a 5 minute walk to get on the orange line by Tufts Medical Center. There is a 7-11 across the street for sodas, snacks and a Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks and a few fast food type places. We had one of our best meals just on the opposite side of the mini-mall area. There is a small alleyway just outside the mini-mall door with a restaurant called Sweetwater Tavern. The location was quiet, you can eat outside and they have a great menu. We had a late flight the day we left and the staff was very helpful in letting us store our luggage while we did some additional touring during the day before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: SallyBrownTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in Boston in July, 2011. We got a great deal using our AAA card. Cost-wise, t was significantly less ($100+) than most other hotels in the city that were not as nice or as highly rated. The room was clean and big. The bed, a SleepNumber bed, was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We checked in late at night, around 11:30 pm, and the front desk clerk was very friendly, helpful, and quickly checked us in. He even gave us menus for local restaurants since we hadn't eaten dinner yet. The shower and bathroom were clean and large. The best part about this hotel is the location. Very close to Boston Common, and within walking distance to all major attractions, including the Freedom Trail, North End, Quincy Market, etc. Fenway could be walked to, but it was only two stops on the T. There are plenty of place to eat nearby. Right across the street is a food court, with a Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts, and a few other places to grab a quick bite, but there are also nicer restaurants within walking distance. It's in the theatre district, so there's lots to do and see nearby. My only complaint was that the plumbing was a little noisy. I could hear the pipes in the walls and the toilet flushing in the room next door. It was not that big of a deal, though, as the pros of this hotel far outweighed that minor annoyance. I highly recommend this Radisson if you're looking for a wallet-friendly, nice place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, solid customer service.”
Reviews.Author: LagunaGrrl
Reviews.Content: It's strange to see the mixed bag of reviews that make it appear as though one either has a great time or a really bad time at this hotel. Count us as folks who had a solidly good experience. Arrival: I got to the hotel at 9am after a red-eye flight. Upon entering the hotel the manager greeted me practically at the door and suggested that they may have a room ready for me. I was floored considering that check-in doesn't start until the afternoon. The desk staff let me know that housekeeping would beginning at 9 and I might have a room by 10am. I settled in for coffee at the diner next door and got a call 45 minutes later to let me know the room was ready. I was in my room and relaxing by 10am. This to me was excellent customer service. Room: The room was clean, comfortable and the A/C had been turned on so it was already nice and cool during our hot summer's day visit. The balcony and views were a treat for my mom who had never been to Boston. The sleep number beds were comfy, but they don't seem to really work that well. Bathroom: Very clean with all the usual amenities. My only complaint here would be the water pressure being a bit light and the water temp being a bit difficult to gauge, differing in temp each morning. Property: The hotel is situated in convenient walking distance to two subway stops. The neighborhood was safe and near the theater district so there was nightlife if that's your thing. The pool is indoors and affords a good workout swim due to its length. There's a deck at the pool level where you can layout in the sun or hang out and read. Breakfast: We opted to eat in the city rather than at the hotel, but the buffet looked fine when I was having my coffee the first morning. If you do venture out I can recommend the Parish Cafe right up the street and Paramount on Beacon Hill. Other: Solid wifi signal, couldn't hear a thing through the walls and key card access to all room floors had us feeling safe and secure. Pros: Centrally located, great staff. Cons: Water pressure/temp - but that's a really tiny complaint. The sleep number beds didn't seem to work that well - might be in need of a refresh. Still comfy though. Booked: Through the hotel website. Got a pre-pay early bird special that I felt was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherFeather27
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved this hotel! It was a good-sized room and was very clean. The beds were comfortable. We had a balcony with a great view. We could walk from the hotel to many attractions/activities. It's very close to a trolley stop, too, if you choose to ride a trolley to see the city. The pool and fitness room were nice. There was a rooftop deck to relax on. The only thing that I wished it had was a complimentary breakfast and cheaper parking in the garage (almost $40/day). Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor bed”
Reviews.Author: Isra-Caltraveler
Reviews.Content: Family and i stayed 7/24/11 for two nights. Hotel is centrally located, in walking distance, for Freedom Trail and other tourist destinations. Staff was very friendly. Good internet service. Breakfast was excellent. The room cost was competitive.....however, this was my first stay at the Radisson and my first experience with their "sleep number" beds. I enjoy the high end beds at other good hotels and was looking forward to trying out this type of bed. Well, the bed was terrible. It felt like sleeping on a deflated pool mattress. I played with the setting for quite some time, over the two days and could not find a good setting. It did not help that the "readout" on the hand held controller did not work. i also am not sure the air pump worked properly. Perhaps this bed was not meant for commercial use. You cannot beat a pillow top or just a normal mattress. Our friends who stayed on a different floor also gave the bed a "thumbs down." I did not complain nor ask for another room as the hotel was booked. I would give the bed zero out of five stars and the rest of the experience five out of five stars. Since i consider the quality of sleep in a hotel to be one of the key measures, i am not sure i would return to this hotel. That's too bad (or should i say, too bed). The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Clarala2003
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at a Radisson following my recent experience in Boston. The following are some of the reasons why: (1) Horrible Air Conditioning. Our a/c was turned off when we arrived. Considering we were on the top floor and in Boston during extreme heat - this doesn't make sense. Our a/c ran continuously (with our drapes closed the entire time) from Friday am to Sunday am and it NEVER got below 78. We had to sleep on top of the sheets the entire time. Miserable. (2) Horrible Beds. Perhaps some people like the Sleep Number beds, but we found them to be deplorable. We were first put in a room where the bed didn't work. The remote didn't display a number at all. One side was hard as a rock and the other was a sunken mess. So if you wanted to move from one side to another it was like climbing a mountain. We had to change rooms because this bed was such a mess. The hotel did comp our room the first night, but because we were in town for a wedding and there were no rooms available for the 2nd night we were stuck there - still left paying a rate way more than what this hotel is worth. This hotel is really nothing more than a glorified motel. Note, when we got in the 2nd room - the TV didn't work. Stupid thing wasn't plugged in. Unbelievable. Even in the new room, where I guess the bed worked, it was horribly uncomfortable. Who wants to get in a hotel bed at night and have to adjust to a stupid sleep number. (3) Horrible Pool. The hairs on the white floor were everywhere. We tried to ignore it and take a swim to escape the heat of our room, but after about 3 minutes we had to get out because hairs floating in the pool were wrapping around our arms and legs. Nasty. (4) Horrible Alarm System. Of course, just as we were about to escape the mess of this hotel and check out, the alarm system went off. The alarm was hardly audible - it would never wake a mid-hard sleeper. Also, the alarm told us to wait until further instruction before we left. We were so thrilled to leave anyways, so we hiked down the 24 floors with our bags. The alarm, however, never actually told people to leave - even though fire trucks were out front when we got downstairs. (5) Noisy. The connecting doors in the room allow all of the noise to go through. On the final night and morning of our imprisonment there it sounded like a sorority meeting was taking place next door. Later saw about 5 teenage girls leaving the room. You could hear absolutely ever conversation they had - and I don't think they were even talking that loudly. (6) Other downfalls. - no mini fridges in hotel - balconies are sub par - no furniture or way to enjoy if you sit down - dingy, dark lobby - never any bellmen outside to help get taxi - had to get our own each time While the hotel did try to fix the situation with the bed by moving us to a new room - we were still stuck staying there for a wedding and paying a price well above what I would pay for a comparable motel. Paying $300 a night for no a/c, dirty, loud, uncomfortable, and unsafe conditions is ridiculous. I don't believe I have ever stayed at a Radisson before, but I will NEVER do it again. There are way too many other nice places in Boston to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: alrededordelmundo11
Reviews.Content: Great location, big and clean rooms. Really comfortable bed!!! Spending machine for water and snacks on every floor. Fast check in and check out. If back to Boston, I will definitively go to the Boston Radisson!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: gjanie
Reviews.Content: Just a block and a half from the Boston Public Garden this hotel was close to subway , surrounded by good restaurants , quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: SusieSavannah
Reviews.Content: We spent an extended weekend in Boston with our adult kids in late June and chose this hotel based on location and ratings. We booked two rooms, but as one was a king and the other had two queens, we were on different floors. The hotel location and the view were great for our needs. The staff were pleasant and accommodating. Here is my one criticism, but it is one that can inform our decision on whether to book again at a hotel: The first room with the two queen beds had multiple ugly-looking stains on the carpet, a bathroom sink that was in bad need of a snaking, and a broken toilet paper holder that caused the roll to go flying. We requested and immediately received another room that was perfectly fine. But you cannot tell us that these issues were unknown to the staff BEFORE assigning the room. How many others were first steered to it and then asked for a more suitable room for the price? My point is that the room should NEVER have been assigned in the first place. First impressions are everything. As we waited for a cab on the day we checked out, a senior staff person asked us about our stay. We were informed that the hotel has changed ownership in the somewhat recent past and plans are underway for a large revitalization. Perhaps we'll see what the Trip Advisor ratings are at that point.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: qualireq
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was most welcome after the heat wave came along while we were in Boston! Nice, clean hotel, great location, only 2 blocks from subway system; very polite and helpful staff, gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--garage construction noisey”
Reviews.Author: annpharm
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for the Fourth and stayed 2 nights. The room was nice, sleepnumber bed didn't work but was really comfortable. Jackhammering started at 8am on both days, complained to conceriege the first day, who said he knew nothing about it but would get back to us, he never did. On checking out another couple was also complaining, manager offered them some sort of refund but we were told that because we booked through an online third party site they couldn't adjust our rate. They did give us comp for breakfast buffet ($15pp value), you absolutely want to AVOID that place, it is a restaurant associated with the hotel but across the street. I have had nicer buffets in the lobby of a cheap hotel. Definitely not worth $15. The location was great, especially if you like to walk. The areas all around are safe and clean. We walked to Fenway and Harvard and the Freedom Trail. Never felt like we were in shady neighborhood. Would I stay here again? Probably not, there was a card on the desk stating they have a 100% refund policy if you are not satisfied and they fail to meet your needs....apparently that only applies to some people... Oh and we didn't rent a car....but be warned self parking at the hotel is about 40 bucks (you don't want to know what valet cost!), there is a garage literally less than a block away for $15.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service, Excellent Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cost-Conscious
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms here in July for our group of 12, for 6 days and everything was fabulous!! We traveled with 6 children, and 6 adults for a indepth tour of historical Boston, what we found made us fall in love with Boston, and the Radisson Hotel! The service from every staff member was outstanding, but we all agreed that John Hallett the concierge wins our award for Excellent Customer Service! He was amazing and made our trip perfect everyday! He has the ability to match Boston locations to what the customer wants/needs for every activity, restaurant, or travel plan. His knowledge of local Boston locations was amazing! The Radisson was perfectly located for all our sightseeing activities, everything is in easy walking distance even for 70+ year old Grandma and Grandpa! Way to go Radisson! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard hotel rooms at a great price but those sleep number beds have to go!”
Reviews.Author: 3littlepigsgotroppo
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, pretty standard rooms, clean and efficient maid service, free internet, convenient location. Pleasant door men and concierge happy to help with directions. Those sleepnumber beds are a disaster. We had 2 queen/queen rooms so a total of 4 beds...only one of them worked. In our room, my side of the bed was fine but my husband's was so soft it was ridiculous while daughters bed was nicknamed "Ayers Rock" (we are Aussies) and she preferred to sleep on the floor because it was softer! On the last night my husband gave up on his side and took on Ayers Rock! Other kids room wasn't much better son managed to adjust his but daughters was fixed on hard. If I wanted to sleep on an airmattress (which is basically what they are) I would go camping! We overheard similar whinges in the hotel lobby from other guests. I'm stunned that a hotel would be providing such a strange choice of beds. We got a great deal on Lastminutetravel at $108 per room at a busy time so overall we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but not so great beds.”
Reviews.Author: zenmusic
Reviews.Content: This is a first-rate hotel in many ways. My only complaint (aside from having to pay $39 a night to park) was the beds. They have "sleep-number" beds, each of which comes with a hand-held unit that selects the level of firmness. It's essentially an air bed that you can fill or deflate as you wish. Unfortunately, the controls on our beds were not working properly, and even when we got them working, I didn't find the beds all that comfortable. As I say, it's a very nice hotel, well-located to walk around Boston. But for the cost I really would like a nice bed.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: lilmissgiggles1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights while taking in the sites and sounds of Boston. Hotel is in a great location, surrounded by alot of good restaurants and very close to all of the shopping. The only problem we had was with the bed, it had an air mattress and we found it quite difficult to find our comfort level. Also the aircon was extremely noisy but after the first night we got used to it. We got a good deal on this hotel and if the price was right again, we would definitely stay.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good stay at radisson”
Reviews.Author: radforce
Reviews.Content: arrived at 1 and check in was smooth sleeping area, desk, bathroom are decent sized-not huge and not tiny either beds were comfortable hotel concierge and staff milled around lobby and were helpful hotel couple blocks from boston commons, T stop one block from food court with bunch of restaurants 7/11 and dunkin donuts one block away for quick breakfast before heading out for day 20 min walk to pru mall parking $teep overall pretty good and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CorkBuzz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the raddisson hotel for business. I had to stay longer than first anticipated... I stayed almost 4 months! I can honestly say that I felt 'at home' in my room. The rooms are very large and having a balcony gives an extra feeling of space and great light and of course spectacular views of the city. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the bed is amazingly comfortable... an adjustable mattress-what more could you ask for! The hotel staff were like my family... John the concierge was extremely helpful in advising me on where to go and what to do. The location of the hotel is perfect for city site seeing and of course shopping! The resturant has the most amazing food- recommend the steak with truffel fries! The roof top area is the perfect place to unwind and chill out after a busy day site seeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson, just okay”
Reviews.Author: big_D123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Boston 2011 marathon. It's close to the finish line and overall very conveninently located for sightseeing. Prices during the marathon are ridiculous. Every hotel in town totally overcharges that's just something you have to accept. However, given the price paid and the room received, the 'gap' was rather large. Stayed at the Back Bay Hotel (former Jury's) last year and it's not even a comparsion. Radisson is very non-despript, they did some updates in the rooms but nothing special. Old lay-out and rooms with some updating. Nothing bad, just disappointing and not even worth 1/3 of what I paid (>$400).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: oscart77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Boston for two nights at the end of June and were very comfortable and well attended. An upper floor room with very comfortable queen beds allowed for peaceful and quiet sleep for us both. I must commend the staff for their prompt reaction to any request. Our room safe, for example, did not work and was repaired in 10 minutes. The room was very clean and well maintained during our stay. Parking was a little pricey as in all large cities, but our car was easily accessed when needed. The location was within a few blocks of the Copley Square and Commons areas and not a long walk to the north end. We really enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, modern. No charm but very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: binmadrid
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 with kids of 13 and 11) stayed in a double queen room for 2 nights. It was just what we needed - large room, good views, walking distance from the Common and the Beacon Hill district. On checking in, although I had booked through Booking.com, the reception staff offered us a better deal. Had a couple of niggles - the first room they gave us, the air conditioning unit was so loud it would have been impossible to sleep. It took a while, including a visit from the technician and my husband going down to talk to the front desk in person, to change the room. The best feature though was the helpfulness of the staff, which really stood out as unfailingly cheerful and friendly. The concierge booked us into a great Italian restaurant on the North side. A special mention for Ben, a huge help throughout our stay. If the hotel has an employee reward scheme, he should be on it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Bad Construction Noise Inside”
Reviews.Author: FYItraveler1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice (e.g., adjustable firmness beds), and the pool/fitness/deck area is very nice, but there is bad construction noise inside. Workers are using pneumatic drills or hammers on the concrete structure of the building to do some repairs or renovations, and the noise from the power hammers penetrates every room and the interior hallways. It starts as early as 7am (as it did today) and ends as late as 7pm (as it did yesterday). I don't know what date the construction is scheduled to stop, but you may want to ask before reserving if you think you'll be inside your room during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: vbarse86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay for my business conference being held at the nearby Park Plaza Hotel. The private balcony was great for catching a few stray fireworks being shot off over the river. The sleep number beds are awesome once you figure out where you want it set. The bathtub in the bathroom was extra deep. I absolutely loved it. I never did make it down to the pool, although I've heard it was really nice. The staff were very courteous and answered any questions I had about directions in the city. If you're going to Boston on vacation for the major attractions, like the Harbor, Aquarium, Shopping, sports, etc....this hotel is a little far of a walk. It's do-able, but it will take some time. There is a great subway system in Boston, however, and there are stations nearby. The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfy. I would have no problem staying again! And, if you're into Theatre...it is located in the Theatre District!!!

Reviews.Title: “Construction work going on”
Reviews.Author: traveldel
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Radisson was a pretty good hotel. What I enjoyed most about the hotel was the location, it was walking distance to everything, a couple of blocks from Newbury street, close to all restaurants, close to Chinatown & Fanneuil Hall. If you wanted to go outside of Boston, the T station was also close by. The rooms were clean & the bathroom was nice. (small warning: the air condition in the room was quite noisy) The staff was also great. They were really helpful when I needed help in planning for day trips outside of Boston. My only complaint was the ongoing construction on the garage. When I booked the hotel, I thoroughly went through their website and there was no mention of any construction. When I arrived - I was handed a notice saying that there will be noise during the day but it won't affect me since I will be gone site seeing. I was a bit annoyed but thought it could still work out. However the very next morning at 7:30 AM - the jack hammers were going crazy which made me really grumpy since I was exhausted from the 3 hour time change and the flight from the West Coast. Had I known there was construction going on - I would have booked elsewhere. Radisson Hotels did however reimburse me for one night, so they did make an effort to apologize for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: DerbyPie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a One Nighter, arriving from Logan and going onto the DownEaster the next morning to Maine. Excellent reception, very spacious bedroom and immaculately clean and fresh. Just right after the Atlantic flight. The Rustic Kitchen gave us excellent food and drink, a "Cheers Bar" atmosphere for my wife and sports screens for me. And the IPA was just right. Very attentive concierge got us a cab straight away on checkout. For what we wanted, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Can be great value for groups”
Reviews.Author: Kingky
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps the cheapest hotel in downtown Boston that would accommodate our needs. It's a stone's-throw away from Boston common and a short T ride away from the Back Bay area or Cambridge (the nearest station is Boylston, green line). If you're driving, be careful of the one-way system in the area. Check in was swift and friendly (despite the late hour) and the extra bed was delivered promptly. We paid the advance rate, which implied the payment was taken at the time of booking, but in our case, it wasn't taken until check in. The rooms are huge with two queen-sized double beds. Each bed is a "sleep number" bed, which is essentially an air bed that allows you to easily change the hardness. Some of our group struggled to find these comfortable, to the extent that they were fighting over who got the roll-away bed! However, the rest of us found them to be fine. We made use of the parking for one night, but considered $39 a bit extortionate for 24 hours. However, there seems to be nowhere else to park in the immediate vicinity. We didn't use the pool or eat at the hotel so can't comment on that, but the free wireless was high-speed with a reliable connection. There is also a complimentary business centre in the lobby, which is convenient for printing our boarding passes etc. (just be aware that not all of the PCs there have a PDF reader installed). Sadly, the little gift shop that used to be on the ground floor is no more, but reception can sell postage stamps if you need them. The concierge was polite and efficient at storing our cases (although the room can get quite full) and hailing us a taxi. This is a decent, standard hotel, although it doesn't really have much character. If you want to be in the centre of Boston then this is certainly a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: JDavis21
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not have that â€œBoston Charmâ€�, but I selected it because I was traveling with my two adult children. The room was perfect for us. It was large, clean, and had two queen sized beds. We were on the 20th floor and had a great view of the city. You could sometimes hear some noise from the street (cars honking, ambulances, etc.), but if you put the air conditioner on, the room was very peaceful. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived at 11 A.M. and they were able to find a room for us without a wait. Richard, the concierge, was very pleasant and helpful. He helped set up a New England Coast tour for us. It was a great way to see Maine and New Hampshire. It was a relaxing day. It gave us a break from several days of walking city tours. The best thing I purchased in Boston was the 7 day unlimited use T pass for 15 dollars. Although the hotel is in a good location, after walking around sightseeing for several hours, it was nice to hop on the T to return back to the hotel. We also used this pass to go to Harvard, Fenway Park, TD Garden, the waterfront, and the North End. We were even able to use it to take their ferry to go to Charlestown. I read that it was possible to take the T from the airport to the hotel. Feeling adventurous, we tried it. You take a shuttle from the airport to the Blue line and get off at the Government Center stop. You switch to the Green line. You get off at the Arlington stop which is close to the hotel. We made it!! Since we do not have subways, trains, etc. where we live, there was one thing I didnâ€™t factor inâ€¦..THE LUGGAGE!. It is not easy riding the T with luggage. For this reason, we took a cab (21 dollars + tip) on our return trip to the airport We had a great time and I would recommend the Radisson to anyone

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with the Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: agtiesqx2
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 15 year old son and I stayed at the Radisson 7/9 - 7/13. Compared to the rooms in other hotels in which we've stayed that had two queen beds, this room was really spacious (our son is 6 feet tall and built like a football player, so often, when we travel, three of us moving around a hotel room can prove daunting, particularly when trying to get ready to go out for the day or for dinner). The room had a comfortable floor plan including a large closet and a safe, plenty of drawer space in the dresser, and a balcony. The bathroom had a nice-sized counter for all our toiletries; there was always plenty of hot water; the hotel was very clean and well-kept. House keeping staff were most accomodating. There was free-wifi that never failed; a business center for printing off our boarding passes; very, very helpful hotel concierge (thank you, Justin and Richard) available from early in the morning until late at night, very professional and accomodating desk staff. The hotel amenities listed on the website were accurately described and all available; after a long day of sightseeing, our son enjoyed the well-tended pool which, while not Olympic-sized ( and who would expect that in a downtown hotel anywhere-lol), was more than adequate with plenty of fresh towels available at all times.The hotel's location was perfect - within walking distance of the Public Garden, Boston Common, the beginning of the Freedom Trail, shopping on Newbury Street, numerous "T" (subway) stations, the Rustic Kitchen right next store where we had a very nice meal our first night after a long day of traveling and walking around the city, Legal Seafood restaurant across the street, a 7-11 and Dunkin' Donuts less than a block away for coffee,light breakfast foods, and snacks. We found the hotel very family-friendly. When we return to Boston, we will head right to the Radisson and encourage anyone considering it to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great first visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Travelhappypair
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Radisson for our first visit to Boston and it has proved to be a great choice. The location of the hotel has been perfect and we have walked most places from the hotel, or used the T with stations being a short walk away. We had a king room on the 22 floor which gave us a beautiful view of the city, it was large, clean and very comfortable. After a long day exploring the city it was great to spend a couple of hours relaxing on the sun deck, this outside space was a real bonus. The only downside to our visit was that on arrival after a long day travelling from Scotland we couldn't check in as the hotel's systems had crashed. However, we have to compliment the management who dealt as effectively as they could with this situation and ushered us to the bar so we could have a drink whilst it was sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back at the SAME hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pnayangel
Reviews.Content: I decided to go see beautiful Boston with my family for our first time towards the end of our MA trip. Initialy, I was booked for the Hampton Inn and Suites, but after reading its not so rave reviews, I searched for a better hotel, and I'm glad I made the right decision to switch with Radisson - what was odd to me was that my total price to book the Radisson hotel was still CHEAPER than the Hampton Inn and Suites! I booked two hotel rooms, and requested that they be connecting rooms - Radisson was able to fulfill the request upon check-in. The hotel was beautiful, concierge was very helpful, and the bellhop was able to keep our luggage since we came to the hotel hours before the check-in. We did the Old Trolley Tour, then came back to the hotel for check-in. We were on the 20th floor, and those views were AMAZING! And we all flipped for the Sleep Number Bed. We had such a comfortable sleep that we were actually relaxed even though we had to check-out early that next morning (and the bellhop still kept ou baggage while we were finishing our Boston tour). The only setback is the parking garage charge of $75 for two cars - for one night. I may choose a different parking garage next time. I did not have a chance to see the pool but we have plans to come back and hopefully maybe Radisson can give me a free night (or maybe a good sicount)? I know I'm asking too much. But I highly recommend this hotel. Yay Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: a12548
Reviews.Content: We picked the Radisson because it was one of the few hotels with 2 queen beds with larger rooms. It is only a few minutes to the marketplace , the Duck tour and to the Arlington subway station. The rooms were very clean with great interent connection. The concierge was fantastic in answering all our questions. The reason for no fifth star is for 2 reasons 1) the $39 per day parking. I think with a paid room, $20 would be acceptable. 2) When we checked out, they locked out our garage card too quickly so we couldnt get out of the garage, having to call the front desk and wait a good ten minutes for someone to let us out. I would book again unless other hotels in the area offer better parking deals.

Reviews.Title: “Most Likely to Return...”
Reviews.Author: GCaymanbound
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were in Boston for a concert back in March, and we chose the Radisson for its parking garage, convenience to/from the Mass Pike, and the T. The hotel lobby was very nice and stylish. The young woman at the front desk was very warm and polite and always smiling. The process was quick and painless. After checking out our room, we asked the concierge for some ideas for bar/pub food within walking distance. He happily gave us some options, complete with easy directions. We ended up at M.J. O'Connor's on Columbus Ave...great food and atmosphere! I should also note that the Radisson is a very short walking distance to Boston Common and the Public Garden. Our room was great, with a pretty decent view. It was roomy enough, very comfortable, and very clean. We weren't really crazy about the sleep number beds, but for one night, they were tolerable. The parking garage is a big winner, since parking in Boston is never easy, and I fully appreciated the safety of indoor parking. Breakfast the next morning was at the Rustic Kitchen, which is just outside the hotel. One word - FABULOUS! We both had the buffet and were not disappointed...highly recommend. A bit pricey, but the food was delicious, AND, after all, it IS Boston! All in all, we were both very pleased with our hotel and restaurant experiences. I'm trying to get my husband to go to Boston this Fall, so I will absolutely stay there again without giving it a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family vacation trip”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl105
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the July 4th weekend and had a great stay. The rooms are good sized for a city hotel. Unfortunately our sleep number beds weren't working properly, but the beds were comfortable anyway. The hotel was quiet, we never heard any hallway noises at night. The hotel's location is good for seeing the attractions in Boston. Just a couple of blocks south of the Boston Common and Gardens, and an easy walk to the start of the Freedom Trail. Near 2 T stops as well (Boylston and Arlington). Can't comment on the pool or restaurant as we didn't have time to use them, but for a quick cheap breakfast, you're just across the street from Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts. Parking (especially on the weekends) can be found MUCH cheaper at the Boston Common Garage, entrance is just 2 blocks up toward the common on Charles Street. Only $11 per day on the weekend, was about $40 at the hotel. Highly recommend the parking, as you don't need your car in the city anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefamilyhunt Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights early June and I would most definitely recommend this hotel to others. It was only a few minutes walk to Boston Common and well within easy reach of plenty of bars and retarurants. The hotel staff were very obliging and most friendly and the rooms were really clean and quite spacious. They have the beds which you can adjust to your own liking (can't remember what they're called!) and that was most appealing as you can adjust the mattress for your own comfort. Although we didn't use it, there was a nice pool and also a gym for the customers' use. There was no breakfast but just opposite was an arcade with a few eateries which well sufficed our needs. (although only Dinky Donuts and Starbucks were open on the weekend!) Overall a really pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: chele67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days in June with my husband and 2 children (ages 10 and 11). We truly enjoyed our stay! We arrived late on Monday and we ordered room service from the Rustic Kitchen since we were too tired to go anywhere. The food was pricey but DELICIOUS! The hotel is close to everything, and we basically walked or took a taxi to everywhere we wanted to go. The staff were welcoming, friendly and always helpful. Our view (24th floor) was incredible. My husband and the kids visited the pool twice and they had great fun. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay while in Boston. My kids wanted me to add that they loved the sleep by numbers bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel... would consider for future visit”
Reviews.Author: clairemc10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of different hotels in Boston over the past few years and this I consider to be one of the better ones. The hotel is very smart, clean and quiet. We were never disturbed by any noise typical of a city, no noise from planes and despite being next to the lifts were not disturbed by this at all. On our arrival to our room, we promptly found there had been a mix up with our rooms, which was very quickly rectified and we were moved to another room. Our room was very spacious especially consider city hotels tend to be a little small. The hotel is in a good location, a very short walk to Boston Common as well as either Boylston or Arlington T station. This makes it very easy for people like ourselves to visit Fenway Park for any Red Sox games. We checked out the gym and swimming pool facilities which looked good, however we never managed to actually fit in time to use of them. I have no complaints about this hotel whatsoever. If the price is right, I'm sure we will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great view”
Reviews.Author: john fegan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days in the Radison and found it a very enjoyable experience. The room was on the 23rd floor and had a fantastic view over the city. This was especially enjoyable at night with the city lights at their best. The room was spacious as was the bathroom and more importantly they were spotless. We ate in the restaraunt on one occasion and found the food to be very good at a reasonable price. Boston was as usual a great place to visit and as we intend visiting again we will probably return to the Radison.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Joannajmiller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights on the final leg of our east coast fly drive. Booked via hotels.com for a reasonable price in relation to the excellent reviews we had read on here and compared to other Boston hotels. We were so delighted to be upgraded to a junior suite and welcomed with champagne and strawberries to celebrate our honeymoon! Really fantastic touch. Our room was fabulous and the bed was huge and very comfortable and we were on a high floor with great views of Boston. Free internet access in the business lounge downstairs. There is a swimming pool/leisure club but we didn't visit it. We didn't have breakfast included in our stay so cannot comment but the doorman was so helpful and recommended the Paramount, a 5-10 min walk away with fantastic breakfasts! Be warned, always busy and PACKED on the weekends but worth the wait for their waffles or pancakes! Hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance of all major sites of Boston and plenty of restaurants. We liked P F Changs chinese nearby where we had an excellent meal, and Rock Bottom where we had amazing steaks! Overall a really lovely stay at the Radisson in Boston and I would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced with good rooms but poor quality dining and other facilities.”
Reviews.Author: ZukeLondon
Reviews.Content: PLUS: Rooms good and clean Beds excellent Most staff helpful and friendly Location excellent MINUS: Lifts erratic and annoying. Pool small and grubby. Restaurant poor, too crowded at breakfast Restaurant nothing like it's description. Lobby dark and utilitarian.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird2905
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of downtown one block from the Public Garden and the Boston Common. You can walk to everything or take the train which is only a few blocks away. Leave your car behind because unless you can find street parking (good luck with that), it will cost $15. - $35. a shot. Everyone at the hotel was pleasant and very helpful. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Jr. suite w/ 2 balconies at no charge (very nice views of the city). Our room was on the 21st floor right next to the elevator. We NEVER waited more than 45 seconds for one to arrive and we NEVER had a noise issue, contrary to what some guests have said. The breakfast & parking package is absolutely the BEST deal in Boston! I would recommend Skipjack's Seafood restaurant for a nice dinner. The Aquarium is great as is the Whale Watch. If you've never been to Fenway go to a game, if you like the Boston Pops go to a concert and if you would like a romantic adventure schedule a Gondola ride on the Charles River around sunset. They only operate Friday-Sunday so call ahead to make a reservation -" Boston Gondola Tours" I would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning a trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Service Recovery”
Reviews.Author: NathanC
Reviews.Content: After chasing the tornado lightening cloud into Logan airport, I was relieved to finally get into my room at the Radisson. I kicked off my shoes and immediately stepped on a wet patch of carpet and then something hard - which turned out to be a toenail! Being tired and Britsh, I didn't complain and went straight to sleep. The following morning, I bumped into the chambermaid on the way out of my room and mentioned what had happenned. Returning to the hotel that evening, the front desk informed me that they were changing my room and upgrading me. This turned a negative experience into a positive one for me. Thank you Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: LL_Bklyn
Reviews.Content: Good size room with terrace. Ask for the room far from the elevators because it is noisy. High level floor, you get a better view.S Swimming pool crowded and with too much chlorine!

Reviews.Title: “Great view from te balcony.”
Reviews.Author: hounds20
Reviews.Content: Room was on the 19th floor. Each room has a balcony which gives you an awesome view of the city. Plus you get to have a cool breeze. Still can hear a lot of traffic noise though. Good location to Freedom Trail, subway, restaurants and there is a Starbucks and 7-Eleven across the street. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly. My 2 daughters and I stayed and there was plenty of room. Desk, table with 2 chairs, dresser, coffee maker. Every hotel in Boston seemed to be way overpriced to this Texas family. We stayed 3 nights and did get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: dewey25
Reviews.Content: High quality hotel in a great part of Boston. All the key attractions easily accessible by foot from this location. Just a couple of blocks from Boston Common and a number of good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Fenway Park is a 15-20 min walk away. The hotel itself is great. Comfortable beds. Great cleaning staff... the front desk and concierge (John is the man) do everything they can to make sure your stay is enjoyable. Nothing but praise for the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, with great access to Boston Commons and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler
Reviews.Content: While the exterior was very plain and unassuming, the interior was modern yet comfortable. Our 20th floor room was very quiet, even when we opened the door to the balcony to enjoy the view. It is everything that you expect from Radisson--comfortable sleep number beds, great staff, spacious bathrooms, and free internet to boot. While not as convenient to all the actions as some of the hotels that are closer to downtown or the Back Bay, it was a very short walk to two T-stations, Boston Commons, downtown, and even Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: lgelkins
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel is in a fantastic location for exploring all parts of the city.
