We ventured to Newbury Street for shopping, wandered the commons, and went over to the financial district. The hotel also gives you a helpful map so getting around was easy. The only place we drove was to the Museum of Fine Arts to see the amazing Chihuly exhibit. Rooms: The rooms here are very comfortable. The sleep number bed was ok - I wasn't in love with it, but it was fine for a couple of nights. Rooms are very spacious for being in the city, and we had a nice view with a balcony on a high floor, which I requested. The hotel also gave us adjoining rooms, which I also requested. The rooms were very quiet, so we slept well. The staff was helpful and attentive. The lobby was nothing spectacular, and we did not eat at the restaurants or use room service. We ate at a fun pub across the way and also at Piattini's Wine bar on Newbury - excellent meal for such a reasonable price, and delicious wine. We also went to Finale for dessert and got the sampler plate. YUM!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: frauchang
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the hotel, I really loved it! The staff was very kind and welcoming. The location is good, near a metro and major shopping areas. The room was spacious and the bed quite comfortable. Good value for the money, I stayed here as an alternative to a conference hotel and it was much cheaper. The restaurant isn't so good, however, and I would eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, attractive location”
Reviews.Author: hansgeluk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the Radissin Hotel and loved it. A very busy hotel but you hardly notice it. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring city.”
Reviews.Author: sjanes
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Boston are generally expensive and whilst there was nothing amazing about this one I didn't have any complaints either. It's well situated for exploring either on foot or using the T subway system. The sleep-number bed was very comfortable as generally hotel beds are far too soft for me and it was great to have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “A little overpriced but decent hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: sunnysandiegan
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and responsive but the hotel seemed a little overpriced. No or minimal decor in the lobby. Good distance from train station and 2 subway stations and walking distance to Boston Common and public gardens

Reviews.Title: “NIce features don't mask a tired facility”
Reviews.Author: NCHKCA
Reviews.Content: Room has "sleep number" beds which is unique and cool, large in-room safe for your laptop, free wifi that worked well, etc. Bathroom remodeled with marble tile floor, subway tiles around all 4 walls - but still old-style small footprint. Rest of room - tattered drapes, stained carpet, multiple visible patches in wallpaper. Limited hours for room service. Location is central and walkable to many areas, but nothing open late nearby - and room service has limited hours. Rates jacked up high due to low supply at time I went to Boston - way overpriced for what the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: atoth
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Boston is in a great location about two blocks from the Boston Common with many nice restaurants and sites within walking distance. At check-in I was upgraded to a suite on one of the upper floors and the view was fabulous but more importantly, the room was clean and very quiet so I slept well. Everyone I came in contact with at the hotel was friendly and helpful and since this was my first time to Boston, it made my stay that much nicer. If future travels take me to Boston, I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , well positioned for walking Boston”
Reviews.Author: REYNOLNH Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned close to Boston Common and the back bay area for shopping and restaurants the trolley bus tourist route passes by the hotel and was very good. The staff were helpful, the room was OK and the bed comfortable. The decor could do with an update and TV reception was poor. I understand from the concierge the hotel will be refurbish in a boutique style soon. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but unfriendly staff and in hindsight I'd prefer a location nearer the water in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Rob7005b
Reviews.Content: My first experience of the hotel was disappointing. We arrived mid morning and went straight to the hotel to check in and drop our bags. We never expected a room to be available but the reaction at the front desk was almost as if we were insulting them by asking. Dripping with sarcasm we were sent away and told to come back at 14:00. At least our bags were stored. We returned at 14:30 and rooms were still not ready. The Radisson is in theatre district in Boston. Close to Back Bay, which is upmarket and pretty, it is a good walk from the waterfront where there is more life and things to see and do. It was my first visit to Boston and if I were to return I would look for a location nearer the waterfront. When we eventually got our room it was actually a very nice room. Large size, nicely designed with a comfy bed, good air conditioning, a small balcony and a pleasant view. it was a very comfortable stay but it was coloured by my first dealing with the hotel and it's location and on reflection I wouldn't recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: igiveyoubeauty
Reviews.Content: The beds are the best, best, best! Parking in Boston. I have no complaints. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Below average Radisson”
Reviews.Author: montrealer1110
Reviews.Content: Good location and very good service. Room are big and clean with a balcony. There are three reasons why I did not give this hotel a 4 rating. 1. The bathroom in our room was tiny. 2. The bar on a Friday night that was packed closes at 11. 3. Our room was next to the elevators and it was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: P2APD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on a short break. We had an executive room, it was large, clean, modern and comfortable. The pool and leisure facilities were limited. Good location, close to theatres and restaurants. Tour bus stops right outside the hotel. Found a good local restaurant (Silvertone bar & grill) not expensive, limited menu, really good food and very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic area!”
Reviews.Author: WestieJane
Reviews.Content: Loved the Radisson. Very easy parking, very easy to find, very friendly staff. Rosa at the front check-in was wonderful and very helpful. Very clean, great balcony with nice view of Boston. Room was nice and the sleep number bed was confy. Pool was wonderful and very clean. Patio looked extremely inviting, but was rainy and cold so we did not use it. We had the breakfast and parking package which was a great deal. The Rustic Kitchen Restaurant- this was very disappointing. Quite unorganized. Waited 15 minutes at the podium before we were acknowledge, then waited anothr ten for a table. Got to the table and another 15 minutes passed.. We went up to the buffett before the server even made it to the table. The cold foods ( fruit) were warm and the hot foods (eggs, bacon, ham, pancakes) were cold. Tried to toast a bagel because I wanted something hot (it was cold & rainy that day)- the toasted started to smoke with something that was jammed and on fire in the toaster. Someone came and took the bagel and toasted it for me in the kitchen. When the coffee did finally arrive, it was hot and delicious. I would stay at the Radisson, but would not dine here again. There are many choices in the area. Our favorite was Magiano's right around the corner. Excellent Italian! Will be back during the summer and try to get the same room. I had read the elevators were slow, but we encountered no problems. Great friendly staff, well kept hotel! Wish we could bring our Westie- we would be back more often!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel With Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkandSuzanne
Reviews.Content: Very good location, as seemed central to all attractions in Boston, was also 5 minute walk from Back Bay station and 15 min drive to airport (depending on traffic). Rooms were very large, with a balcony, they also included tea and coffee making facilities. Our room had two large beds and a shower over a bath tub. Staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was of a good size. Across the road from the hotel was a Starbucks, 7/11, pizza place.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for making our stay in Boston great...”
Reviews.Author: kenko
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here the weekend of May 12. The hotel is great and the staff professional, helpful, and patient. I would llike to thank you for the early check- in, which, we were EXTREMELY grateful for. The Radisson is in a great location to many restaurants, bars and tourist sites. We needed to catch two different "T's" and were within walking distance to both. Boston Commons, Chinatown and Fanuiel Hall were all walkable. Our hotel room was very clean, our housekeeper attentive and did a great job. The room was large enough for the three of us and our request for two beds was honored. An added plus was the balcony. The bathroom small but not an inconvenience. It was nice to be able to have coffee in your room upon waking, walking to a Starbuks, DD's or to the restaurant on the premises for breakfast. Although we didn't have time for swimming the pool area was was very nice, water felt warm. The staff was starting to put greenery and flowers on the outside deck area which overlooked the city...pretty neat. The conveniences and the price of the hotel are awesome. We visited the North End of Boston and walked the Freedom Trail and Fauniel Hall- all within walking distance of front lobby door. I would recommend the Trolley to take the tour of the city...then on to points of your interest. Off the subject, sorry - purpose is to recommend this hotel for all it has to offer. Another feature was to be able to print your boarding passes prior to arriving to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the theater district.”
Reviews.Author: AwnyTawny
Reviews.Content: A 2 minute walk to the theater district. Safe and secure hotel with uber customer service. From valet to check out every person we came into contact with were soooo nice. Lots of restaurants right outside the hotel doors, never needed our car. I plan on staying here in the future. Oh and sleep number beds...fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor slumber with the Sleep number”
Reviews.Author: islndtrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Radisson continues to fill an excellent niche in Boston hotels. It is affordable, yet has great location and comfortable rooms. My main grip is the "sleep number " bed. We had to have ours repaired upon check in as it was deflated to its minimum and would not inflate. The guy arrived quickly and fixed it, but for the next two days we were unable to keep the finicky thing pumped up. It's disconcerting to feel your bed deflate for no reason while you sleep. Fix the beds and this place is great. The pool is great and has fun views. PS, it needs a better place to eat than the Rustic Kitchen which is creepy feeling though serves a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Good Value in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: Maizie3213
Reviews.Content: The hotel was relatively easy to find and quickly accessed off of Route 90. Check in was quick and painless although parking is quite expensive and is NOT included. Quick tip- if you park at the hotel's parking garage, you don't have to bring the ticket into the hotel if you're not planning on moving your car. If you pay with the ticket when you leave, it's 5 dollars cheaper than the daily rate the hotel quotes. We had requested a king bed, but they didn't have one available. However, they did move us to a 18th story room, which had a decent view and a nice balcony- although no chairs on the balcony. The room was essentially clean, although showed some signs of aging and wear. The sleep number bed was very comfortable, but we could sleep on anything after a long drive. A few things to note- the toilet did flush very, very loudly- and you could hear other rooms' toilets flushing. The hotel is also very close to a major medical center, and we frequently heard sirens. These were minor nuisances and did not distract from our trip. The hotel cafe was a reasonable value with good food, service was a little slow. The hotel has a bar, but there was almost never anyone there. The cafe was much busier and had a very active bar scene. We didn't try room service or the in room coffee maker, but both were available. Overall, we felt that the hotel was a good value and a safe location, we would probably stay here again if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamonaholic
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and great service. They truly aim to please. They also offered the best rate for my business trip. I had to stay overnight in Philadelphia as my connecting flght to Boston was cancelled and get up early and take a 6:15 am flight for a 9:00 meeting. I arrived at the hotel around 7:45 am and truly expected to be told that it was too early to check in and I would have to change into my suit in the bathroom. To my surprise, they gave me an upgrade to a Jr. Suite so I could check in that early in the morning. The room was beautiful and comfortable. There is a Legal Seafood right across the street. The staff is very professional and when I return to Boston, I would defintely stay here again and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three mornings with cold water in the shower, uh?”
Reviews.Author: Explorist
Reviews.Content: Nice view, nice location, not pricey. But three mornings (and even afternoons) wity cold water only in the shower is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Terrible Elevators”
Reviews.Author: TChristy
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel with a great staff and excellent rooms but I would recommend a low floor because we were on the 24th floor and the elevators took forever and were super slow. If they ever upgrade the elevators this place will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lphelan
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Boston and was very happy with my choice of hotel. The hotel was walking distance from "everything". When i checked in, the manager (Roger Crosby) was helpful and very friendly. The concierge (Richard) was outstanding. During our stay, we must have asked him a million questions, which he answered always with a smile and most importantly with the truth. I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but noisy plumbing!”
Reviews.Author: byrdie50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early May 11. The hotel is pretty ugly from the outside but the lobby area is nice and the staff were friendly. There is a business centre for guests to use with free printers if you need to check in for a flight, also free wifi everywhere. The rooms were large and spacious, the bathroom was fairly small though and the shower was a rain shower which I didn't really like. The room seemed a bit dated in terms of furniture and I felt the price for the room was high. The main issue we had was the really noisy plumbing - we were next to the elevator which I didn't really hear but you could hear people going to the toilet above, below, side to side, and then because they have the powerful pressure flush (kohler toilets) the noise of the flush was quite incredible - with ear plugs in I often still jumped in bed when I heard a flush and it seemed to be happening every 5 mins so we must have been able to hear quite a few rooms! The hotel is fairly central in the theatre district although next time I visit Boston I will probably stay closer towards Newbury and Boylston St. One other thing - we used the ultimate livery shuttle recommended on the hotel's website to go to and from logan airport - I definately would not recommend this - the bus was old and basically (and this happened both ways) if the bus was not on the move it was blowing out boiling hot air from the side of the bus - I asked twice on the way in for the driver to do something as I thought I was going to pass out but he didn't really respond and said there wasn't much he could do - quite what happens to passengers in the summer I don't know! Anyway the hotel was generally fine, it wouldn't be my choice next time but the rooms were a good size and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, most dissapointed hotel experience in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AllThreeOfUs
Reviews.Content: Check in was a nightmare. Got there at 3:45pm, 45 minutes AFTER normal check-in and the room was not ready! Waited 15 minutes and then they said they had no idea how long it was going to take, so we went to eat a late lunch at Rustic Kitchen (another mistake, see review about that). Finally was able to check in around 5pm. We were told by the check-in clerk that our upgrade (to the 24th floor, top) would be given at no charge. Unfortunately, she apparently didn't put that in the notes as I was charged it upon check out. When I discussed this with them they didn't even know who checked me in, so they couldn't confirm this. After they called me back they finally agreed to remove the charge. They have a 100% satisfaction guarantee at the hotel, but you seem to have to argue with them over any issues. The room was very clean - the house keeping staff did an awesome job everyday (only thing that made the stay bearable). The rooms are big but the bathroom is tiny, can barely get more than one person in there at a time. Definitely had more room to make the bathroom bigger ... I have traveled all over the world and have never needed a keycard to get me to my floor (unless special floor), but you couldn't even go form the pool floor back to your room without the keycard. Most of the time it did not work well, and apparently one of the four elevators it did not work at all (was not required), so what was the purpose? The pool was MISERABLE! It is indoors on the top of garage but is not heated, which means that it is only heated by the air, which was 82-84 degrees. The water was 82, which is NOT conducive to enjoyment. I have NEVER been an indoor pool that was so COLD. There are no steps to get in, other than some old junky ladders, so if you need any help getting in/out, forget it. We had two room service meals (the restaurant associated with this hotel had miserable service, so we figured we would try room service). The breakfast we ordered had hard and cold scrambled eggs and soggy toast. Three of us for breakfast for $60 for that quality food was ridiculous. We tried an evening snack one night (cheese platter, fruit and yogurt platter, shrimp cocktail) and that was no better. The cheese was just big chunks of cheese (probably from the local grocery store). The menu said 5 shrimp, but only 4 arrived, but that brought what seemed like a gallon of sauce, so if you were really hungry you could drink the sauce. Luckily there are enough restaurants nearby so you don't have to suffer through on their restaurant, but normally we like to start out having breakfast in the hotel before we venture out. They advertise sleep number beds, but they should just have them removed and bring in normal beds. Two double beds had four controls but half the time we couldn't get the controls to work. The beds deflated somewhat over time so you had to keep adjusting them. If you wanted anything more than really soft, it basically was a round tube inflated under you, so you constantly rolled all night. There is no mini-bar or refrigerator in the room, and when asked about getting some things that we forgot to pack, they said, 'There is a 7-Eleven across the street.' Hotel doesn't even have a small gift/sundry shop. If you want a soda, you get it from the vending machine on the floor, but they use the same vending machine for candy/etc as they do for soda cans, so when you select a soda, it bangs on the front glass then onto a small ledge and shakes up so much that when you attempt to open it, it just sprays for a bit. Have never seen soda cans vended from a machine in this fashion. We have stayed at Radissons before, but none has ever come close to this level of dissatisfaction. We were tempted to leave early, but figured we would stick it our for the 4 nights and hope things would get better. They didn't and the problems at check out were just the icing on the cake. I rarely have ever needed to write a bad review but I really feel that this is warranted.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: ap3646
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and thought the hotel maintained a very high quality, especially for the price. The sleep number beds were very comfortable, the location is great, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: GwenMagini
Reviews.Content: Been here around Christmas. The room was big (2 queen size beds), the bathroom very clean (nice shower system!), the service was excellent. The concierge was really really helpful. The spot is perfect to go around the city, very central, near almost everything, with 2 subway lines near the hotel. Will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GME1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night and had breakfast included well worth it if you get one of their package deals. The staff in general were polite and helpful. The room was average but personally the number beds were more of a pain to use especially with having children who like pressing all the buttons. It was quite difficult to find a comfortable setting and the controls on one of the beds seemed to be the wrong way round. Give me a normal bed any day. In response to a recent review I really liked the almond soap but I do understand that it could be a real problem if you or a member of your family have an allergy to nuts. We did the trolley tour for 2 days just up the road from here which was a good way to see Boston but you could easily walk to most of the sites from this hotel. The Duck tour was a little disappointing as you don't really get to see Boston when you go into the water. It is more of a novelty tour. The one thing we didn't like about this hotel was the pool. It was so cold it was almost impossible to stay in for more than a few minute. The children manage to stay in longer but were shivering when they got out.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot if you're there to 'run Boston', still great if you're not!”
Reviews.Author: tobysimmonds
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston to run the marathon. i guessed from the map that this would be a good location but was leary as maps sometimes arent' to scale etc... it turned out to be a perfect location... not too far to walk to any of the important Boston Marathon locations, and same for just being a tourist. you have to cab/underground to the waterfront but everything else is walking distance. i had never been to Boston before and staying here was a bonus. the staff was fabulous, the food was great and the room was clean. the minor annoyance of having to drag your luggage from one elevator shaft from the parking lot,to a different one for the hotel, was overshadowed by positives as soon as you got into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not at all good but appreciate manager's response”
Reviews.Author: Compensated
Reviews.Content: I booked our Spring Break for my 2 sons and husband at the Radisson based on excellent location and indoor pool facilities. When we checked into our room, the carpet had not been vacuumed and the TV was broken. The maintenance man repaired the TV right away before we even unpacked. The pool was dirty with a lot of hair floating in it. The room was very dated and not maintainedâ€” wall paper was peeling off, stains on carpet and chips on furniture. The heater/a.c. was noisy and not consistent with the thermostat, and there was no cold water at all from the sink. But the worst part was that the sleep number beds leaked air so that my husband and I had backaches in the morning because they completely deflated. We requested a change of room the very next morning and the management kindly accommodated us rapidly. Our next room was much better--on the top floor and had been thoroughly cleaned, and the beds worked. They also gave us a nightly discount as well as a surprise tray of chocolate covered strawberries with a handwritten note of apology which were very much appreciated. The room size was good and the staff was friendly. The business center and free Wi Fi helpful, and the buffet breakfast was good for my busy family.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, great value, good sized rooms, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: rga777
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is located perfectly whether you plan to visit Newbury Street, Beacon Hill, the South End, walk the Freedon Trail or simply take the T around the Boston area. The cost was also much lower than many of the nearby hotels. The rooms were good sized though the bathrooms were a little small. The hotel is one of the few (maybe the only one) in Boston with balconies on every room. I'm not sure they are practical but our teenage son liked standing 20 floors up on the balcony and looking over Boston. The rooms (especially the carpets) could use some updating and we had to leave a note for the maid service to replenish the coffee. It also has Sleep Number beds in every room. All in all, convenience and price will keep the Radisson on our radar for future Boston trips.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Hotels in Boston”
Reviews.Author: NealWallen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Radisson based solely on reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel is in the theater area and chinese section of the city. For those people that are touring the city I would recommend staying near Quincy Market. The hotel has no gift shop and only has bare basics. The hotel does have a restaurant but we did not eat at it. On our second night at the hotel, my wife was laying on the floor doing her stretching and she noticed ants all over the place. On closer examination we noticed them in the bathroom, in the beds and basically all over the room. You should of heard my wife scream. Well we got a new room and the hotel gave us breakfast the next morning. Our kids who are ages 12 and 7, would not go to sleep that night as they were scared that ants were crawling all over them. Our vacation was basically ruined because of this. As it is not fun touring with 2 Very cranky kids. When we checked out of the hotel, my wife again complained at the front desk and the lady told us there was a note saying if guest complain you can take $150 off of our bill. This upset me, so they were only going to credit us if we complained. This should of been given to us up front. The hotel has signs all over the hotel saying 100% satisfied. Well we are not satisfied. I do not recommend anyone staying here. The pool is small, the sleep number bed is nothing special, the hotel is off the beaten path for tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and good value for the area”
Reviews.Author: tcancienne
Reviews.Content: We booked the Radisson in Boston based on Tripadvisor review. We were quite pleased with the location and ease of getting around the city from it. It is directly across the street from City Place where you can book a two day trolley tour to get you to all parts of the city. Our room package included a great breakfast buffet and free self parking. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Sleep number beds were okay for me, but Im not a fan. Hotel is a bit noisy at night, but no different from any other hotel in a big city. All staff that we encountered were friendly, and very helpful. Nice indoor heated pool area, but on the small side. Was very crowded in the evening. I was disappointed that there was no hot tub/sauna area after a long day of walking and touring the city. Overall, I would recommend this place, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travellingfuntimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had a great time. The location is superb and within walking distance to everything - shops, restaurants and the city centre itself. The hotel staff were friendly, the room was nice and clean and the hotel amenities were also excellent. If I ever visit Boston again, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: so3003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Boston for a week in March 2011 while attending a course elsewhere in the city. I got a good rate on priceline for the week, albeit booked a few months in advance. I arrived quite late at night and check-in was uneventful. My room was on the 20th floor (I'd asked for a high floor) and was clean, spacious and comfortable. There were two large double beds, a large TV, desk, chairs etc and the usual hotel bathroom. See my photos for a better idea. I particularly liked the coffee maker which has normal mugs and takeaway cups provided, meaning I could take coffee with me as I went out every morning. There's free wifi and wired internet throughout the hotel which suited my laptop and my smartphone, and I was impressed at how easily it worked - usually you need to go through 101 very slow confirmation screens to get onto a hotel network, but this one just worked without any hassle. As my luggage was delayed (airline didn't load my bag) I had to speak to the front desk and concierge quite a few times about having my bag delivered from the airport, where to buy new clothes etc etc, and they were always helpful and courteous. My TV remote was replaced within a few minutes when I called the front desk (the original didn't have any batteries?!). I used the express laundry service which was very efficient, and they returned my items well within the 3 hour timescale they advertise. My one bugbear was that it took almost the whole week for my in-room safe to be fixed (the previous guest had left it locked open), but they did eventually get round to doing it. The hotel is in a good location close to Copley Plaza (my course was around here and I walked there and back most days); it's also close to a "T" subway station which you can easily and cheaply commute around when in Boston. There are two attached restaurants (not sure if owned by hotel or not) which seem ok, and lots of smaller eateries within 2 minutes walk eg Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts etc. I didn't have much free time in Boston but I did manage to see Blue Man Group, whose theatre is around 5 minutes walk from the hotel, and there are also a few cinemas within easy walking distance. Overall I had a comfortable stay at the Radisson Boston, and it is more than adequate for a business or leisure trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “central”
Reviews.Author: theclansman
Reviews.Content: we flew in to logan int airport took a tram to boylston station and walked round the corner to the hotel in no time for $5 we was quickly checked in to a quite large room with two beds a balcony looking over the city it was clean, warm in march, the resturant was good for a meal and there is a duncan donuts across the road ok for breakfast the hotel is right in the centre of most places you would want to walk to good eating places , boston common park ,lovely large malls at copley+prudential tower and sky walk looking right over the city we took a open top bus from outside our hotel door which goes right over the bridge to harvard college

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boston”
Reviews.Author: Diti
Reviews.Content: Had five days in Boston and we really enjoyed it. The Radison Hotel on Stuart Street is very central for all sight seing and the sightseing trolley stops outside the door. We went to see Harvard, MIT and downtown Boston with the lovely Quincy Market, We enjoyed The BLue Man group in the theatre just around the corner from the Hotel.. The Radison is well run, beds are adjustable and most comfortable, there is a lovely swimming pool. We had a few problems with lack of hot water and noise -from an ice machine - Room 2024. Diti from Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Dazzled by Radisson”
Reviews.Author: absolucitr79
Reviews.Content: Here was my letter to the management team at the Radisson! I wanted to share this most pleasant experience that I have had recently with your Hotel on Stuart St. in Boston. It is service like this that creates customer loyalty. This was a very special weekend stay for my partner and I as we were in Birthday Celebration mode and the Radisson certainly made it very special! I certainly know where to stay when on future travel plains. I had the absolute pleasure of being assisted by Helena Desir in the main lobby. Her outgoing, funny, accommodating, flexibility and professionalism personality was outstanding. She real dazzled us with the outstanding services provided. This experience definitely stood out as World Class Service. Coming from a Sales environment in the largest Health Insurer Company in Massachusetts we set our standards at World Class Service and have been recognized nation wide for it. I know that when I go to do my next presentation on one of the best experiences Iâ€™ve had in Customer Service Iâ€™ll be sure to tell them this one. What was even more amazing was as we left everyone gave us a warm send off and even asked how the birthday celebration went. With so many people going in and out of this very large hotel we were so shocked that everyone still recognized us and not just Helena oh and Alex at the front desk too, I mean everyone! Talk about Excellence in Personalized Service! The room was gorgeous and was so impressed with the breath taking views of the John Hancock and Prudential Towers. What was even more spectacular was that there was a balcony! A HUGE PLUS that also makes the Radisson stand out over the competition as so many other hotels donâ€™t have them. Iâ€™m really looking forward to my return. The staff there is amazing and all really deserve recognitions. Iâ€™m also looking forward to sharing my wonderful experience with as many friends as possible. Officially a Loyal Customer & Best Regards!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, contemporary, spacious rooms, excellent value, and a great location with own parking garage.”
Reviews.Author: smk12
Reviews.Content: Have traveled to Boston 4 times (2 Leisure and 2 Buisness). I have stayed at this Radisson half of the time. By far it was the better deal all around. This Radisson is now my first choice when staying in Boston especially since it easy on/off I90 for someone who does not like to drive in Boston. Have already recommended it to numerous colleagues/friends who also agree. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Just the kind of place you want to arrive after midnight”
Reviews.Author: csquared1160
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son on a quick college (Emerson) visit. Drove up from New York through the snow and arrived after midnight. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful even at that hour. The room, thank goodness, was well-appointed, quiet and clean. The "Sleep Number" beds were a treat. In the morning I ordered coffee from room service and, as it turns out, we ended up eating in the hotel's restaurant, Rustic Kitchen, before we left to drive home the next day. It, too, was quite good. The hotel is in a great central location for Boston's many sights and it is very close to Emerson. We will be back as it looks like that is where he will be for the next 4 years.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price, and service”
Reviews.Author: lori0914
Reviews.Content: The staff here was awesome, especially the people at the doors. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The location is close to many sights. We got a great rate using the coupon from TripAdvisor for 20% off.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helmari Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We came to Boston for 2 nights with son while we were visiting him in New York. Hotel was walkable from South Station and location was excellent for sightseeing and Symphony Hall concert (by T). Beds were very comfortable and room of good size with good view (9th floor). For our purposes hotel was just right. Only small downside was that tea and coffee making facilities were not worth using.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Hot Spot!”
Reviews.Author: BrittyBearBoston2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend with two girlfriends this past December and we had an absolutely fabulous experience! The staff from the front desk, to the maids and valet, to the concierge who helped us with trolley tickets were very accomidating! The hotel was trendy and stylish, but comfortable. The rooms were exceptionally roomy which I was surprised by, pleasantly of course. We had a standard room with 2 queen beds, flat screen television, desk, table, chairs, and your other basic hotel features; unfortunately no refridgerator, but there was a safe! This hotel offers complimentary wifi which worked very nicely! We also had a balcony with breathtaking views of Boston! The beds were sleep number and sort of tricky, but not too bad; however not the most comfortable either. The bathroom was standard, but nice and we had no complaints about it. Also Valet was about $40 per day with unlimited in/out priviledges which is really standard for anywhere in Boston. We were also told the hotel had an indoor pool and fitness center which we didn't get to use during our stay. We ate dinner one night at the restaurant adjacent to the hotel called the Rustic Kitchen which was great and also another night we ate at Legal Seafoods across the street which was okay. I highly reccomend the "Old Town Trolley Tour" which the concierge can help you with. It was about $35 per person, but the pass is good for two straight days and runs from 9am-5pm and will take you anywhere you want in Boston with a narrated, comedic tour that we really enjoyed! The tour also includes perks such as free admission to certain museums and exhibits as well as the Harbor Cruise which was also fabulous! Great deal for your money for sure! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service a NO 1”
Reviews.Author: maryhillmagyar
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault any member of staff at this hotel, and that is unusual.From the doorman to the maids everyone is very personable to you. The rooms are very spacious , spotless and great service from the maids. I ate each night in the Rustic Kitchen restaurant in the hotel and the food is fantastic. Only downpoint and it is minor is that the bar is the hotel is quiet and I prefer to have a drink in the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “powerful toilets”
Reviews.Author: miffyninja
Reviews.Content: as others have already said, the location is pretty ideal. you're about 15 a minute walk to the north end, to fan pier, newbury st, beacon hill, etc. we even walked to the mfa, which was a bit much, but not impossible. the employees are all very eager to help. the hotel is clean, the room clean, free internet connection, balcony with a view, those weird inflating beds... the hotel is very quiet, but their toilets have serious industrial-strength flushing power, so you can hear the upstairs toilet quite clearly. i sleep with earplugs, so i didn't bother me that much, but it's a pretty distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Best Location !”
Reviews.Author: mackie14
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned from the Raddison Boston, we stayed for 5 Nights, bed only, no breakfast. After a very long journey from the UK, we checked in around 4pm, without any hassle, all very smooth and the porter brought the bags to our room - All very nice and a really warm welcome, Our room was on the 19th floor and looked out on the city over the Back Bay area and John Hancock Tower - We never grew tired of the view ! The room was very clean, spacious and we even had a balcony - very rare for a City Hotel. We did not book breakfast and I can honestly say we are glad we didnt - The food around Boston is all fantastic and we were never hungry for breakfast as we ate big lunch's and dinners and snacks through the day ! We had breakfast at the Hotel on the first day as we were up early and did not know our way around the City, it is a good breakfast, plenty of choice but if you can live without it, go and explore all the food outlets around the City. The Raddison is in the best location for Tourists, it is in the Theatre District, its about a 10 min walk to the Prudential Centre, 15 min walk to Fanueil Market and Harbour area and only a couple of min's from Boston Common, the Hotel also has plenty of restaurants and pubs all nearby. Apparently there is a T stop (Underground) not far from the Hotel, but we walked everywhere. Everything we done around Boston was fantastic - From the Duck Tours to the Trolly Tour, Fenway Park Stadium Tour, Cheers bar for Lunch, Fanueil / Quincy Market and we also went for lunch at the Top of the Hub - 52nd Floor of the Prudential Building - The view is amazing !! I could write pages on our time in Boston so please, if you would like any advice from a Tourist point of view then please drop me an E Mail - All I will add is as mentioned earlier the food around Boston is amazing - Everything is so tasty, but I will say, if you like your seafood, you must go to Legal Seafoods - There are a few around the City, we went to the one opp the Raddison, we enjoyed it so much we went there twice and the first time we went there I tried the Lobster - Its amazing and half the price we would pay !! Overall the Raddison was a great place to stay, if we ever returned to Boston, we would stop back there without a shaddow of a doubt !! Enjoy :o)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing booking options, amazing location and amazing service thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Rodchabot
Reviews.Content: It was easy getting to the hotel when i booked i took the parking and breakfast option and had 0 hassle for the rest of my stay great food and welcome! The rooms are very clean and comfortable highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay at the Radisson Hotel Boston, It is our favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Becky6Moran
Reviews.Content: Richard (Concierge) always helps us to choose a restaurant and set up our reservation for a great dinner at an area restaurant for three years in a row now. We can't wait for our next trip. We eat the breakfast buffett at the Rustic Kitchen and after dinner we return to the Rustic Kitchen Bistro Bar for an after dinner Cocktail. We recommend the Carmel Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value,location,room & super-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJaneEdinburgh Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel for the price - upgraded to business class suite so room was lovely & big with great view. Only slight down-side was no late opening residents bar & no mini bar in room but perhaps that was a good thing as were in Boston for Paddy's day & had our share of a drinkie or two !

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJPS
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel overall and convenietly located in the back bay area. The room did lack a refrigerator and luggage rack which I really missed. Breakfast was only included for the higher prices rooms whereas you can stay at a less expensive hotel and get free breakfast. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers or for a couple wanting a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: joeeinri
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Minutes from North end, Copley place (mall) within walking distance. A lot of very good restaurants around. STAFF=EXCELLENT!! Check-in took 3 minutes! Voice mail check out, the room was very comfortable with a great sleep by number king bed. Very clean hotel. ONLY complaint is parking, what a rip off!!!--$46.. But, it is Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive staff & great deal for Boston!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMRowe
Reviews.Content: I don't travel to Boston often but when I do it is for business. This location was picked by our company but I am always pleased to go here. Legal Seafood, Flemings, great little Irish pub are all in walking distance. The hotel staff is very helpful. We asked for a location to play pool one night and they looked it up on the internet and came back with a few suggestions very quickly for us. All they had do was overhear us talking in the lobby and they would offer to help. I had one request that they add lighted & magnified mirrors to the bathrooms & I received an email from the manager that this was being done. What amazing service for such a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable in a good location”
Reviews.Author: plightfo
Reviews.Content: We were happy with the hotel. The room was comfortable and clean. The hotel was in good shape. The exercise room was OK, but I was disappointed that there were no exercise bicycles. Can't comment on the price, as we got a good deal through Hotwire. Do be advised that the parking is not inexpensive - around $35 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: nhJenny
Reviews.Content: Just needed a room for one night for a quick trip down to Boston. The Radisson had a good price, and the location is exactly where we wanted to be so we booked a room. It is super easy to get to from the Pike, the parking is easy, and we were checking in within minutes of arriving. The room was very large and comfortable, with a balcony. We could walk to the show we were going to, and didn't have to take any cabs. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area to check out, and a short walk over to the Common or Quincy Market. I'd absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I would absolutely recommend this hotel ! It is fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: MRB22
Reviews.Content: Not having a clue about Boston I had read the reviews on trip advisor before booking my trip - which I must say I found to be very useful in helping me select a hotel. I am glad that I opted for Radisson. I am happy to say that I spent 2 very enjoyable nights in the Radisson Boston. It is very central both to Boston Common, South Station and within walking distance to Quincy Market etc. The rooms were amazing - clean, comfortable and roomy and the view from the balcony was an added bonus. They were also very quiet - we were on the 18th floor. The staff were so helpful, polite, and very friendly. The buffet breakfast in the rustic kitchen has really good choice and variety of food in both hot and cold breakfasts. I would also recommend PF Changs restaurant in Charles St for dinner which is just around the corner from the hotel. I am coming back to Boston in October and I will definately stay in the Radisson. They also have a complimentary business centre where you can log on and check your emails etc which is very convenient if you dont have your lap top with you. A few months ago I was looking at the reviews and I needed them to help me make up my mind so I hope that I can be of some help to someone now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sarah05
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience during my recent stay at the Radisson Hotel. First of all, we arrived early and were very excited that they were able to check us in. It was nice to be able to freshen up in the room before we went out to explore. I was pleasantly suprised to see our room had a nice view of the Boston skyline. Even though we were located right in the city center, the room was quiet and I never heard any street noise or noise from other guests. After walking around the entire city of Boston over 3 days, I came to the conclusion that this is one of the best located hotels in Boston in terms of ease of visiting various neighborhoods and tourist sites. We easily walked the entire Freedom Trail, and in the other direction we walked to Back Bay and the South End. It's also located near a couple subway stops which was convenient. Chinatown is very close by for some good inexpensive restaurants. I have two minor complaints with the hotel. The biggest one was that we never had very hot water in the shower, it was lukewarm every time we showered, no matter the time of day. Also we found the heated swimming pool to be pretty cold. But neither of these were a major problem, and overall we enjoyed our stay. The business center was awesome and allowed us to print out our boarding passes for free. Also they had free wireless internet in the room which was another bonus (although it was really slow at times, I assume because a lot of other people were taking advantage of it as well). I would happily stay here again and recommend to anyone looking for a nice, convenient hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort in the heart of Boston's theater district”
Reviews.Author: perkie1
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel Boston is a fabulous location in the center of all theater district activities. One of the few Boston hotels I know of that offer balconies with wonderful views of the city. The friendly front desk staff made our checkin quick and easy. Our room was on the 22nd floor, very clean and quiet.. and did I mention the balcony views! We were able to enjoy a show at one of the nearby theaters ... all of which are within walking distance from this hotel. There is a lot of night life activity in the immediate area. The adjoining Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar offers fabulous dinners and a full breakfast buffet which includes your choice of omlet! I would highly recommend this hotel. We we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly place, best service anywhere”
Reviews.Author: GrnMtntraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times now at this Radisson and each time I am amazed at how happy the staff are, and consequently, how friendly and helpful they are to me. I have done alot of business travel for 12 years and really get tired of staying in yet another hotel. There is a warmth here that you just don't get at most hotels that has emanated from each person and the service is great. I had forgotten my smartphone in my car and the valet ran several blocks trying to get my attention as I was rushing off to a full day of work, I would have been lost without that phone. The proximity to many office buildings and restaurants in the Back Bay is also perfect. The beds are luxurious and the view of Boston from the upper rooms is spectacular. Stay here and feel good about another night in another anonymous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: markusinmiami
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is a great choice among many others in the Theatre District - excellent service (they let me check in early), spacious rooms (with tubs and coffee maker and complimentary wireless) with balconies and great views. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because I'd like to have a fridge or minibar in the room. But otherwise an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, awesome location, great hotel! A++++”
Reviews.Author: hardtosay
Reviews.Content: I'm currently sitting in the lobby of the Radisson Hotel Boston, having checked out earlier today and waiting to catch my plane later this afternoon. Using their free wifi to rave about this place. I can't recommend this hotel more highly! I was looking for a hotel in Boston convenient to the T and hopefully within walking distance of something interesting, without costing an arm and a leg. I got a great deal on DHR.com ($160 per night, inclusive of taxes and fees) for the Radisson, and saw it got great reviews so I decided to go for it. I'm so glad I did. The staff here is ridiculously nice and accommodating, from the doorman to the bellman to the front desk clerks. They got me a super early check-in when I arrived Thursday morning after a redeye, getting me into my room with no problem at 8am. When the internet went out at 1am, I called the front desk and the clerk was really apologetic and, since they didn't know when it was going to be fixed, immediately offered to remove our parking charge for the night to compensate me for the inconvenience, which I really appreciated. They actually got the external IT guy to talk to me to try to troubleshoot the problem (and he was also super-nice), and got it fixed within half an hour, but my parking was still comped. That's service! The woman who checked me out was extremely sweet and helpful and has been extremely accommodating as I take up space in their lobby. As is typical for downtown Boston hotels, parking is extra - $39/day self-park in a garage attached to the hotel (valet is also available for more) with in and out privileges. The location is awesome. It's only a block away from Boston Common (though admittedly, it's winter and the Common isn't that attractive right now), like three blocks from Chinatown, less than a mile's walk from Downtown Crossing and Faneuil Hall. In the other direction, I think it's also within a mile of Back Bay, but I haven't actually gone that way yet. There are a bunch of subway stops within a few blocks of the hotel - the Arlington stop on the green line is the closest at 2 blocks away, but the Tufts Medical Center stop on the orange line is only maybe 3 blocks away, Chinatown stop is maybe 5 blocks away, I walked to South Station easily, the Boylston and Park St stops are also all really close. There are a ton of restaurants close by - around the Boston Park Plaza Hotel across the street are Legal Seafood's, McCormick and Schmicks, Maggiano's Little Italy, the Melting Pot, Au Bon Pain (around the back, on the Boston Common side), Finale, Pairings, etc etc... Diagonally across the street is a food court with a Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, and a bunch of other food court food. As for the room itself, it was great. Big, clean, comfortable. A reasonable number of accessible outlets (which is important to me b/c I always have a half dozen things to charge and so many hotels seem to not have outlets), both wired internet and free wifi, a safe in the closet, shower with good water pressure, a balcony, etc. The beds are sleep number beds, which I've never tried before but were kind of fun to play with and comfortable to sleep on. Either no one was in the rooms around us or the room was quite well soundproofed. I could occasionally hear honking or loud honks from the street below (we were on the 10th floor) and last night, I could distantly hear a drunk man bellowing (Friday night in downtown Boston - big surprise), but for the most part it was very quiet. I heard voices once or twice when they were talking right outside my door, but there wasn't the usual array of annoying noises from adjoining rooms that I often get at hotels. Since I'm a light sleeper, this was priceless to me. Overall I am extremely happy with this hotel and would recommend it highly to anyone looking for a place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel!! The entire staff went out of their way to meet all of our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix082
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Boston. Our stay at the Radisson was absolutely perfect! I had called ahead and asked for a refrigerator. When we checked in they already had it in our room and ready to go. We truly never waited for anything! The bell hop showed us to our room and explained where everything was in the hotel The concierges were amazing! So helpful in giving us directions and making dinner reservations for us. They even walked us out of the hotel -- to the street that we were to turn on. I have stayed at many hotels this is the first time anyone took so much time with us to make sure we got to our destination. Very impressive!! The location was great! Only 10 minute walk to the subway, 5 minute walk to a great shopping area. Lots of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. I can't wait to come back to this great hotel and also see more of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, incredible service...Look no further”
Reviews.Author: Chance071
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I took a week long vacation to Boston. It was a surprise vacation and it was our first as well. I only chose this hotel because of it's location in the Theater District, little did I know at the time what a gem I had found. The service from the moment we checked in was nothing less than incredible. And remained to our checkout 6 nights later. We are from a small town and value friendly people, and the staff here was Great! Everyday my daughter and I were greeted by everyone in the lobby, and when we returned from our daily events, the staff was always waiting to hear from my daughter what exactly we had done. They truly made us feel at home. The front desk staff and the concierge were very knowledgeable, they knew everywhere in Boston I wanted to go. they even busted out the maps to show me where they were in relation to the hotel. The only problem we had at the hotel was a hair dryer that stopped working. I called the front office and within 5 minutes there was a housekeeper at our door with a brand new, still in the box, hair dryer. Our vacation in Boston was great, but thanks to the staff at the Radisson, it will be a vacation that will never be forgotten by my daughter or I. She is already trying to figure out the next trip to the Radisson Boston. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone...unless they aren't interested in a hotel that was very clean, comfortable, and loaded with very personable staff. ps. the "hotel restaurant" The Rustic Kitchen was awesome! great food, really good staff. We had dinner there on Monday night when we checked in and on Friday night when we returned, our waiter from the first night stopped to ask us how the vacation was going! Im not usually in too much of a rush to hit the hotel restaurant, but this place was a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Spacious Rooms, But Just Really Noisy @ Night”
Reviews.Author: chauncey4u
Reviews.Content: I purchased my hotel stay for $69 plus taxes on priceline. We live right outside of Boston 45 minutes away, and just went into Boston for a 1-night getaway with our 15-month old daughter. We checked in on a Saturday afternoon. The hotel has a valet car service for $39 per night which allows car service in and out of the hotel unlimited times. The valet attendant was very nice. We then checked in and the hotel staff was very pleasant, and check in took no longer than 5 minutes. Our room was on the 22nd floor - great view! We entered our room and it was really spacious and open - our daughter had a GREAT time playing in the room and running around - she was happy... we were happy. The beds are the "Sleep Number" beds - and I'm embarrased to say that we just didn't find them comfortable as we expected it to be. The pillows on the bed weren't as cozy either. We went down to the pool and though they advertise a "heated pool", the water wasn't warm, so we were dissapointed. We still lounged at the pool and played with our daughter. By the way, we needed a fridge in our room to keep our daughter's milk, and they put one in our room free of charge for the baby (otherwise it's $20). That was really nice of the attendant to do that when I called to request it. At night, there was a real issue of the noise outside the hotel. We could here the police and fire sirens ALL NIGHT - not much sound proofing going on. That was a bit of disturbance, so we didn't sleep sound. I will have to mention that the rooms are impeccable in terms of cleanliness. I didn't find anything that was out of place or un-clean. Overall the hotel is great - but I would have just sound proofed the rooms and wanted a heated pool. The location is wonderful, in the heart of the Theater Arts district - accessible to everything, lots of restaurants, shops and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but marginal customer service”
Reviews.Author: lnapmaine
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very clean hotel and most staff were friendly. Stayed two nights and housekeeping never came. When I called, they brought more towels and 2 clean mugs but never offered to tidy room or take trash. Upon check out, the front desk clerk asked how stay was and I reported the problems with housekeeoing. He just brushed it off. Also, room service was inaccurate on two of our three orders. Delivery staff was great but room service operator was not friendly and barely offered to fix the problems with order. Kids breakfast meals were sent without the toast and juice listed on the menu. I ordered a muffin which was forgotton. No butter sent with order. Tea ordered for two came with one mug. We have stayed at many Radissons and have always had great service. Probably would not stay at this one again. I wished I hadn't used up most of my Radisson rewards for this visit. I am used to great service at other Boston accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Umm...ok, but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: MPearlS
Reviews.Content: Location is good if you want to walk out of the lobby and right into action, as we are in the theater district. Although, I'd prefer to stay in a neighborhood and visit the action. Room is nice, comfortable size for "city" hotel, clean bathroom with pretty white subway tiles. But no refrigerator in room? and when I asked if I can have one for my bottles of water (because you always want to stay hydrated while traveling), they replied, for 20$ a day! I said no thank you, you already got 40$ for parking!! I am not cheap, but come on, a charge for the mini fridge? I'm already paying $160/night and $40 for parking...now another $20 for a mini fridge?? Hope they don't charge me for walking the wrong way on the way out!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better service”
Reviews.Author: Shotzies_girl
Reviews.Content: We recenty stayed at the Radisson Hotel in Boston and were very pleased with the location, cleanliness and especially the service provided by the staff. Roger at the front desk was kind enough to switch our room to a higher floor upon our request. The concierges John & Habib were friendly faces upon our return to the hotel each evening. What was even more impressive was the surprise gift of champagne and berries given to us by the staff in honour of our anniversary celebration. The only complaint I have, which is not the hotel's fault whatsoever, was the noise from the bar across the street at closing time when the drunken patrons took to the streets. Otherwise... it's a great place to stay and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: DeniDen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (late 20's) and another couple stayed at the Radisson for a weekend getaway, at a Travelzoo steal of $99 a night. We took a mini-van taxi from the airport, which was around $30 for all of us. We had let the hotel know that we would be checking in late. Upon checkin, the other couple was upgrade to a junior suite. The main difference between their room and our room was a small sitting area. We were in Room 2212. The room was very clean and we had a nice view of the city from our balcony. Maid service each day was great, always done when we got back for afternoon naps before dinner. The concierge staff is extremely helpful. They assisted us with booking the Trolley Tour, and several meals (Joe's American Bar & Grill, Strega on the Waterfront, and Hillstone). We also went to Mike's City Diner for breakfast on a Sunday morning - take a taxi and head over, best breakfast ever. Don't bother with the breakfast at the Rustic Kitchen, not worth the price. The hotel is in a great location, close to one of the trolley stops and close to several restaurants and taverns. Taxis are plentiful in the area, also. Overall, we loved this hotel and loved Boston. Definitely looking forward to returning to both.

Reviews.Title: “great stay.great staff”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: the staff is so nice. the rooms are very clean and roomy.due to the location it can get noisy but would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for dollar!”
Reviews.Author: lsmith55518
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip to Boston, made even better by the awesome staff at the Radisson. Concierge "Richard" made us feel like we were the only guests he had to take care of. He arranged tickets for us to 3 popular sporting events, gave us directions to everywhere we went, recommended some awesome restaurants, and just generally made us feel welcome. We wished we could take Richard home with us to take care of our every need:) Special mention also goes to smiling Ben and the other fellows at the front door, as well as the excellent staff at the front desk. The beds were good, the rooms spacious, and the proximity of the hotel to so many attractions was excellent. We found Bostonites (?) in general to be very friendly and we look forward to coming back to this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson makes good”
Reviews.Author: 6naygrl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on a radisson gift cert. Issued to us from a previously bad radisson experience in another city. The boston radisson was absolutely great. They were extremely helpful and their service was excellent..they treated us the way we are accostomed to being treated at a much more expensive hotel..the inside was elegant and modern..the bathroom was spotless and had kohl faucets..the shower and bathtub were new and very nice for relaxing after a day of boston winter. What a treat. Valet parking is good, staff helpful and courtious and very efficient. Thanks radisson! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - spacious rooms, friendly staff, amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: AElphinstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and had a fantastic time - pool and gym great to relax in, restaurant delicious (ideal for breakfasts), rooms higher up have fantastic views and are spacious and comfortable. A lovely stay - highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, super staff”
Reviews.Author: RuralMA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our 2 year old so that we could go to a Dr. appointment at MGH the next morning. We got a great rate through Tripadvisor and the hotel staff was super helpful - they even brought up a refrigerator to the room for my daughter's medication. The rooms were very clean, roomy, hotel itself was well taken care of also. Room service was tasty and on-time. My only knock was that they wouldn't let me take my own baggage cart up to my room - I noted this on my online survey sent by Radisson after my stay and got a nice, very thoughtful email from the hotel manager a few days later explaining why this was the policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: IHeartEurope0331
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston this weekend for girlfriend get away from NYC. The Radisson worked out perfectly! The location is ideal - 4 blocks from Newbery and in the heart of the Theater district. The Sleep number beds were fun. We didnt know there was a pool- next time we will totally bring out bathing suits and take advantage as there arent many pools in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed to find so many positive reviews for such a mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliesmum
Reviews.Content: Checked in and out of the Radisson in one day, having moved from the Marriott Long Wharf when stuck in Boston for extended stay due to volcanic ash. The staff were welcoming and the location was OK, but the room was musty, dark and depressing with grimey curtains an ugly concrete balcony on the side. We moved to the Marriott Residence Tudor Wharf and got a lovely light suite for the same price. I appear to be going against the grain here, but I would seriously look at other options before booking here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: WRead
Reviews.Content: We stay for 4 days. The welcoming smile from Ben our bell boy was a good inditia that we were going to have a good time. Rooms are clean and very spacious. All the staff is very helpful, and the best is the location, you can walk everywhere. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Great location”
Reviews.Author: LaTechFanatic
Reviews.Content: Our stay started off on the wrong foot with Expedia not reserving our rooms with the Radisson as promised. Arriving at 11 pm with the hotel booked, we thought we were going to be left high and dry. The front desk staff was excellent and tried everything within their power to accomodate us. Finally after 2 hours on the phone with Expedia, the staff made an excellent decision to declare one of the 5 rooms yet to be check-in as a no show. We stayed 2 days and enjoyed every bit of it. Rooms were comfortable and spacious. The restaurant provided a great breakfast at a modest additional cost. Visiting the "walking city", we found this property to be located quite nicely near the Freedom Trail and subway stations. We look forward to making our way back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Pillows & Showers, Good Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: natter1327
Reviews.Content: PROS Good location in theater district Nice staff (upgraded us to a suite) Comfortable Bed Great view Great price ($150/night) CONS The most uncomfortable pillows I've ever slept on HORRIBLE SHOWER -- no water pressure, no hot water!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, super comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: MandarineBlossom
Reviews.Content: There's nothing very particular about this hotel except for the beds which you can regulate (the firmness of the mattress). Good location, decent sized beds, clean bathroom, tea and coffee in the room - really good choice for the money I happened to pay. Loved the view from the 18th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: jcolesw2
Reviews.Content: Good choice for Boston. A great location and easy walking to the city centre. Rooms a good size with great beds and I was very touched to return to my room on the first day of the stay to discover a birthday card, a bottle of wine and a cheese/fruit plate! The receptionist had noted it was my birthday from my passport on check in and the hotel organised this gift. A really nice touch. Great staff and recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but below average service”
Reviews.Author: trvl_lite
Reviews.Content: Wanted to spend New Year's Eve in Boston and found a great deal on the hotel's website so we booked a 3-nights stay arriving on December 31st. Location is ok only because the city itself is so small. Surroundings are mainly a business center/financial district. Didn't appreciate the doormen. Although we must have gone through the lobby at least 10 times during our stay neither one of them acknowledged our presence. Staff talked amongst themselves, almost ignoring the guests. Only highlights : A young black man with a big white smile who was the exception. (Sorry I forgot his name) and all the cleaning ladies we ran into were nice and smilling. Friends staying in another room found it noisy because of outside noises (sirens, alarms, ...). Pillows were TERRIBLE, so small and soft I had to ask for 4 more even though there were already 8 in the bed, we ended up with 12 soft pillows! for 2 adults. You shouldn't pay more than 135 USD for a double room... Better yet, book elsewhere, Boston has better to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight for a show”
Reviews.Author: amlunchlady
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with an overnight trip to Boston to go to a show and an italian restaurant as a Christmas gift. He booked the hotel from a special package that the Radisson had which included Champagne & Choc. covered stawberries that arrived in our room about an hour after check-in. We had a king room and breakfast and parking were also included in the special room price. The room was on the 23rd floor and looked out onto the Prudential building. The room was great, though I am not so sure about the sleep # beds. It was our first time trying one out, and I think it would take a little more knowledge and practical research to know just what # would suit us... we slept ok. The shower was great, and the deep tub wonderful! My only thought was that the lighting could have been a bit brighter in the bathroom for applying makeup, but that was a minor for me. The hotel is VERY convenient for seeing a show, which is why he chose this hotel, and though it was $240 plus taxes, we feel we got our $$ worth in comfort, location, convenience of parking, and the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Always friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: JeffG006
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson Boston several times. The staff is very nice and it is one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at. The location is great. Close to the theaters, restaurants, subway, and major attractions. Well priced for a downtown hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamar829
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The service was excellent. Everyone I encountered put a smile on my face, especially the gentleman at the Front Desk. Room was perfect with an amazing view from the balconies! We stayed there for my boyfriend's birthday and he too loved everything about the hotel. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations were remarkable”
Reviews.Author: KatieK329
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with walking distance to many places and different T's. Would definitely stay here again when visiting Boston. The room and the bed were comfortable and clean at all times. The staff at the front desk was polite, efficent, and just made me feel very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: zuidpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, just minutes away from Boston Common, movie theatre, China Town, shopping and lots of great restaurants in walking distance. Hotel itself is a bit outdated, so are the rooms. Good beds though, parking is expensive but that's just the way it is in Boston. Staff in bar act like they can't wait to get their pension and is just plain rude. Restaurant is nothing special, get better food for beter prices in restaurants surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Fantastic Staff, Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: TMc13465
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this hotel I was a bit worried by some of the comments but I had booked my trip and had pre-paid. However, I can honestly say that on arrival I was most surprised with the hotel. The doorman, Kam, who opened our taxi door had the biggest smile in a cold evening that made us feel so welcome. The reception staff were fantastic and all staff were so helpful. John and all on the desk could not have been more helpful and everthing I asked for in the booking was looked after and more besides. The rooms were very spacious, clean and warm. The beds (two doubles) were so really comfortable. Every staff member I met were not only of the highest professional standard but also extremely friendly and really helpful. The hotel was centrally located and really convenient with lots of fantastic restaurents within a very short walk. I would highly recommend the Radisson Boston to anyone planning a trip to this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: emmaline
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 days in November. The location is ideal. The area is clean and quiet and there are plenty of restaurants just outside of the hotel door. The hotel has free wifi in all of the rooms which was a real plus. They also had a free business centre with computers, internet, printers and a photocopier. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room on the 21st floor had a balcony and a fantastic view of Boston Common. The room was spacious. The bed was very uncomfortable though and the tv did not get very good reception. It was fuzzy all the time. The location of this hotel is one of its best points and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jlpress
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Boston Radisson. Great location, large clean rooms with a very friendly and helpful staff. We would definitely stay at the Radisson again and would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: Vansmith
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Radisson and again we thoroughly recommend it. We wnated to arrange a trip to Wrentham Shopping Village for the day after we arrived, we told reception and within a few minutes of reaching our room the 'phone rang and Richard the concierge was organising it for us. All the staff are so helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Food at the Rustic Kitchen was good as was the service, the dinner on Thanksgiving evening was gorgeous. The only thing we would say for travellers from the UK is don't expect too much activity on Thanksgiving which is a big holiday in the US. Everything was shut although the 'T' was working a Sunday service, so unless you have family or friends to go to this holiday is perhaps best avoided. If you want Christmas Shopping probably the first week in December is the best time as the decorations are fabulous and Boston Common lights up! However, the Radisson delivers everytime, a very nice hotel in a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with very friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mickmc55
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, particularly John the Concierge. Great location with a good selection of restaurants locally. Lovely bedrooms and a comfortable bed but the pillows were too soft.. Very close to Boston Common, Theatre District and shopping at Downtown Crossing. Free WiFi in the hotel and access to the internet in the small business centre. Highly recommended. I would definitely book the Radisson again. Parking in Boston is expensive but the Radisson have a deal whereby you get 24 hour parking with in and out access for $34.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lagunanina
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Radisson in Boston. Great location and very friendly and helpful staff, especially the concierge, Rich. We were within walking distance of most of the sites, and there are plenty of restaurants very close to the hotel. The hotel is just a couple of blocks from the Boston Common, the Public Garden, and the Freedom Trail. The Rustic Kitchen at the hotel was also very good and convenient for breakfast. There is also an indoor swimming pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and service minded staff”
Reviews.Author: palsone
Reviews.Content: Justin and his colleagues at the concierge made our day when they arranged for front court tickets to the Boston Celtics game at the garden. Overall the staff is service minded to say the least, very helpful with anything you need. The gym at the hotel is very basic to say the least but the pool is very spacious. The breakfast area has improved a lot from our last visit. The location is very central to all areas of the town. Rooms are spacious. A nice Italian restaurant just across the street VaPiano with a interesting german concept.

Reviews.Title: “Otherwise great experience marred by a poor breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: jjhalpin
