Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend here to celebrate an anniversary. We had a great room, very spacious and clean. Loved the indoor pool for relaxing. The location is great for visiting Boston, on the edge of the Theater District, one block to Boston Common, and an easy walk to Boylston/Newbury St. shopping areas. Our only negative experience was the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant. We booked a Bed & Breakfast package for the weekend. The breakfast buffet food was luke-warm to outright cold and the toast and biscuits were hard. The server asked if I wanted juice, and then charged our room for the drink when I thought it was covered (my mistake, too trusting). Nice hotel, but pass on the breakfast package,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- so impressed with the rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller238510
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with this hotel, we booked it with a deal on hotels.com and got so lucky! The room on the 19th floor was huge was big comfortable beds and a fantastic view of Boston. We didn't hear a peep out of anyone the whole time that we were there and the service was impeccable. Really impressed with this hotel- will definitely stay again even without a deal.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DeDee-10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the theater district, short walk to train stations and to the start of the freedom trail. It was a beautiful hotel with very friendly, helpful staff. I would recommend and already have recommended this hotel to several friends. We play on going to Boston and will be staying there every trip.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: mika017
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit in Boston, and we found Radisson hotel very convenient, clean and well located. We got good value for money. We enjoyed very much our stay there, and we'll recomment choosing this hotel while visitng Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great location near Boston Common”
Reviews.Author: SFBorderCollie
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Boston Radisson on a business trip in late October 2010. I booked the room online a couple of months before the trip and chose the hotel for its proximity to the college where I had meetings. I was very pleasantly surprised by the spaciousness and comfort of my room -- as large as some studio apartments in San Francisco! The sleep number beds were extremely comfortable, the hotel's restaurant has a good buffet breakfast, and the location is conveniently close to the Green T line. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. There was even a Legal Seafoods across the street. Lovely hotel and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Every time I go to Boston, I stay here. Consistently great!”
Reviews.Author: annagriswold56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Lots of helpful staff from valet, bell men, room service, etc. Nice restaurant too. Sleep number beds are fantastic. View of Boston from the balcony is outstanding. You can walk to many places easily from this location. Close to green line and Boston Commons. This hotel is one of the tourist trolley stops if you want to get a nice overview of Boston. Walking distance to many theaters. You just can't go wrong staying here. And when I stayed there for my 40th bday weekend, I was surprised with chocolate covered strawberries, sparkling water and a birthday card from the staff. Im hooked. No other hotel in Boston could compare.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jessica1250
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location. The room was nice size, beds were extremely comfortable. What i liked most were the "little things". etc. housekeeping noticed i was running out of toothpaste and left a new one on the sink etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Radisson I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: EAKTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Radisson for one night while in Boston on a business trip. This is the third Radisson I've been to in the past six months, and was by far the best of them. The location is perfect for being in the business district; the hotel itself is very clean and in great condition; the staff was prompt, courteous, and helpful; and the room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. No complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - needs new pillows!”
Reviews.Author: tennisbummer
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. The hotel's a little dated (pictures, paint, etc) but rooms clean and well-equipped. Love the select comfort mattress, views, and speedy elevators. More than adequate Business office to check email and print documents. Location good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: gfh1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew into Boston the day before we embarked on a cruise. We had never been to Boston so I had to select a hotel by reviews, location and amenities. We had the most pleasant surprise when we arrived. The staff was genuinely friendly, helpful and a delight to converse with. When we entered our room we were surprised by all the room! It had a comfortable "sleep number" bed. No problem there! The living area was nicely arranged for viewing the large, flat screen TV. The office area was perfect for using my laptop and internet connection. The bathroom was privately located off the entry hallway. The room and bathroom was sparkling clean! We had two balconies, one off the bedroom area and one off the living area. The Boston city lights were magnificient at night! The next morning we went downstairs for breakfast. We could order off the menu or have the breakfast buffet. We selected the buffet because had a full selection menu. The food was delicious and the service was great! When it was time to leave we went down to the lobby. I walked up to one of the concierge desks and asked what we needed to do to get a taxi to the pier. This wonderful man helped with our bags and hailed a taxi. We were on our way to the pier within minutes. It was just a wonderful experience to begin our vacation. By the way, the cruise was wonderful, too! We'll always remember our vacation to Boston and Canada and the friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: CSN
Reviews.Content: General: - didn't use concierge or the hotel breakfast/dinner or swimming pool so can't comment. if I came back I would take a robe and flipflops to wear down to the pool as there is no changing facility - across the road from the start of tours - fall foliage, new england seacoast, autumn on the cape on Charles Street South - I used my points to pay for the 7 nights so I can't comment on value for money Pros: - big room with two televisions - bed is comfy with lovely pillows - excellent location - near a 7/11, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts - really good Tea, near tours, common, etc - free wifi is really useful - powerful shower - stand for suitcase is good - generally clean Cons: - need bigger towels - need to vaccum - they didn't do it in a 7 night stay - I was on the 23 of 24 floor but it was VERY noisy you could hear every siren - of which there were many, you could also hear the lifts from my room - ask for one not near the lifts Recommendations: - breakfast from au bon pain - oatmel = porridge - after dinner ice cream from ben and jerrys around the corner - sushi near back bay station - dinner a few blocks behind the hotel is excellent - Mike and Pattys

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travlinhokie
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was perfect. When we checked in, we received a two bedded room and was told there were no king rooms available. So we proceeded up to the room, sat our luggage down and went back down to go have dinner. I went by the front desk again, met Rose, and asked her that if a king room became available, we please be notified since we were there on our honeymoon. When she heard that we were there on our honeymoon, she said that newlyweds shouldn't have to be in a double bedded room and gave us a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite! Rose was one of the best front desk agents I've ever met. She gave us restaurant recommendations that turned out to be excellent and was full of knowledge of the local area.The junior suite was great and I couldn't have asked for a better experience! Thanks Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: kkfrench
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right in the heart of Boston. Nice rooms with Amazing matresses, great view. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was deliscious. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: Rameman
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with friendly staff, immaculate room. In the Theatre district with expensive breakfast, we could not find a cheaper option within walking distance apart from Dunkin Donuts! Very central and convenient for everything

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to downtown Boston Freedom Trail, local restaurants and subway system”
Reviews.Author: maugustynski
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel on Stuart in Boston, was an ideal location for someone like ourselves who were visiting Boston for the first time. Just about everything was in walking distance like the Freedom Trail, Boston Commons, subway system, Copley Square, Cheers Bar and local restaurants. The double decker tour bus had a stop right at the door of the Radisson. It was nice to just wait outside the hotel door knowing that the tour bus would pick you up right there. The conceirge in the hotel was very helpful in making dinner reservations and made us feel as if we were long time friends. Our room had a splendid view, was very clean and well supplied with towels. The bed sheets were of a high thread count that made you feel cozy when sleeping. The hotel restaurant staff was also very pleasant and we were greeted as if we were regular customers. Definitely, we will come back next year to see a Boston Red Sox Game at Fenway Park and would "love" to come back to stay in your hotel, The Radisson in Boston, MA.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: Loumund
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by very helpful staff who carried our bags to our upgraded room. The porter told us all about the location and answered any questions that we had. He was excellent! The room was amazing. It had two balconies and a fantastic view. The room was very clean and spacious. The location was very good. We were close to the main sites and used the subway (nearby) to get to Fenway Park. The staff were excellent and very approachable. We stayed here for three nights and were very impressed with the hotel. We would have no hestitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ejm3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct. 2010 for a night. I picked this hotel because it was close to the theater and the reviews here on TA. I think I paid $240/night including taxes but I took the deal where you paid up-front a couple months in advance and couldn't cancel. It was at least $125 more per night to book 'normally' through the hotel's website. So if you don't need the ability to cancel then itâ€™s a decent deal to pay in advance. The hotel is pretty easy to find right off I-90 (Mass Pike). The parking is a painful $34/day self park or $39 for valet. As near as I could tell that was pretty much the going rate for the area. The lobby is small if that's important to you. Check-in was painless. The rooms were very clean (including bathrooms) and decent sized. Not fancy but certainly adequate. Flushing the toilet was louder than launching a missile however. As with other Radissons I've stayed at, this one has the ridiculous Sleep-Number beds. I can't ever seem to get these things to work and they seem to have two settings; cement and granite. That said I still managed to sleep ok. The real benefit of staying at this hotel is its location. Itâ€™s in the Back Bay close to the theaters, the common and other tourist sites. Even Quincy Market is only maybe a 20-25 minute walk. As someone else noted the hotel is plenty nice but lacks any personality. I didn't really care about that so it was perfect for me. I wouldn't stay here on my honeymoon but if you're looking for a decent place to stay at a [relatively] reasonable price in a good location this place is perfect. They have a pool and a business center but I didn't use either one so I can't comment on them. I also think they have free wi-fi though I didn't use it on this trip. I think other hotels in the area charge for it so its another reason to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, centrally located, even if not a whole lot of personality.”
Reviews.Author: aguadora
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was a good choice for us. It offered us a better rate than many others of comparable quality and it was close to two subway lines and the Commons. It also happened to be just a few blocks from the school my son was about to move into: Emerson College. The room and bathroom both were a good size for the two of us and my sister who accompanied us part of the time. From the balcony we had a nice view over the city (from the 17th floor). We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, from housekeeping to the concierge to the front desk. A few negative points. No towel racks in the bathroom. If you are trying to keep 3 people's towels clean or dry, this is an issue. I also found the air conditioner noisy (we were there when it was pretty hot). The "high speed" Internet wasn't always speedy and went completely out for a few hours. The Business Center consisted of 2-3 older computers and 1 printer in a very small room off the lobby. They were free of charge, though often busy. These features should be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Location, views and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Electron
Reviews.Content: I researched a lot before booking at this hotel and the reviewers are so right. It is centrally located to everything. Tons of eating choices. Many restaurants nearby. A food court right across the street, T is 2 blocks away. Most Boston trolleys stop right in front of the hotel. I mean they stop right at the entrance. That was a pleasant surprise. View from our room (higher floor West facing) was nice. Room/Bathroom/bed/TV etc. was exactly as I would expect from a luxurious hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: oakhesd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the first time in Oct, dispite some of the negative reviews we took a chance, and we are so glad we did . This hotel was for us the best in Boston, the room was large, the ajustable beds were heaven, the bathroom spotless, The staff were very friendly and helpful.There was nothing negative about this hotel at all. If your going to Boston stay here you will not regret it THE BEST HOTEL IN BOSTON THANKYOU TO ALL THE STAFF

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: letramp
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for only 2 nights on our way to NH to see the foliage. The Radisson Boston was a great location for getting to Boston Common (2 blocks) where everything starts or leaves from. The hotel was very nice, service was good..no complaints and would stay here again. We chose it because the price was better($259 per nite) as opposed to the $300 plus of most other places. Had dinner at Toscano in Beacon Hill..very nice, great food. The highlight of our trip was a limo tour of the Freedom Trial with Antique Limousine. It was in a 1939 restored Cadillac limo driven by Mark (owner) who picked us up at our hotel. He was dressed like Al Capone and stayed in character for alot of the trip. He knew the history of Boston very well and gave us a wonderful tour along with being very entertaining. Would highly suggest any first time visitor splurge and do this. We saw all the points of interest and at the end of the tour he let us off at our choice and we knew just which venues we wanted to go back and see. Tried to get into the Cheers Bar at Beacon Hill, which the tv show was modeled after(not the other location)..It was about 4:30 and VERY crowded...go early. Other than seeing Beacon Hill, we enjoyed walking around the North End (Little Italy) and smelling the wonderful aromas coming from the hundreds of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: Carrie M
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this hotel, we decided it was the best choice for us and our budget. It is a good hotel, close to all the tourist attractions, and we road the subway from the airport to the hotel. The only thing negative thing we can say is the bathroom is very small and narrow but it was very clean and modern. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loving it!”
Reviews.Author: carissa76
Reviews.Content: I am currently in Boston and having such a wonderful experience that i wanted to review it now while all the positves are fresh in my mind. Traveled here with husband for a weekend get-away. This hotel has courteous, friendly, and willing-to-help staff. Great little restaurant bar called Rustic Kitchen, with cozy ambiance and good food. Also TV's for sports watchers. The rooms are the perfect size, with a king bed and sitting area with armchairs for using our laptop. And I almost forgot that every room has Sleep Number beds, so you can adjust to your own comfort levels! The best part... all the rooms have balconies! Such a nice addition to the experience, especially on a warm and sunny fall day. Also a positive is the free, easily accessable WiFi, which we've found much easier (and free) compared to other hotels we've recently stayed at. Probably the best part of this hotel is the wonderful location - centrally located, its so close to the "T", Boston Common and Freedom Trail, Back Bay, Newbury Street, Prudential Center, Theater district, top restaurants, and its all a quick stroll away. There are also easy night time eats and drinks and a movie theater nearby. Love the Radisson. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, relaxing, enjoyable, close to many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Eatonstream
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at another local hotel that was more expensive. This hotel out shines the other by far. Our room was very clean. Room was quiet. Beds were very comfortable. Had a small balcony to go out on. Near the T so can see alot of Boston, as well as, walking to attractions such as theater district, China Town, Boston Central Park, Prudential Center & Cropley shopping malls, and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatEagle
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable and amenities were good. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The location was perfect. Could hear some footsteps and running water early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Milton High School Class of 55 Had a Great 55 Year Reunion at the Radisson.”
Reviews.Author: racmem
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel provided an ideal place for our reunion. Hotel personnel, the service and the food were all wonderful. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: LimerickJay
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a breakaway and really enjoyed the hotel. The hotel is really central just 1 block from Boston Common and 2 blocks from the shopping on Newbury street. We got a good deal relative to other hotels in Boston. I arrived early and they were able to help me with an early check in. The staff were very helpful. Car parking is a bit of a problem but I think its the same everywhere in downtown Boston, it was $34 a night $39 if you wanted valet parking. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are loads of good places to eat within a block or 2 of the hotel. The rooms were very clean, nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: homerandsue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Radisson starting September 18th. After reading lots of reviews I decided on the Radisson and I'm very happy I did. It was great - great location, very clean, very friendly and helpful staff. The location is great - just a couple of blocks away from Boston Commons, the Freedom Trail, and Cheers. Across the street is the City Plaza (I think that's the name) which is a mini-mall with a 7-11, Dunkin Donuts, several restaurants and the office for the Old Town Trolleys/Tours. I highly recommend the Radisson for anyone making a visit to Boston. Its a Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a central location. Great...”
Reviews.Author: AymanN
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a central location. Great selection of pillows. Friendly staff. Valet parking is around $28. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kaisuva
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Radisson in the Boston Commons which is close to everything you are looking for. From the Freedom Trail to Faneuil hall to Harvard Square, you are very close to everything. It is located in more lighted areas of Boston compared to the four star Sheraton and others. Naturally I felt safer. The reception desk were very courteous and once they figured out that it was our honeymoon, they upgraded us and sent chocolate covered strawberries as a compliment. Rose, our front desk person was so incredibly sweet and kind. She made sure we had the best stay. I would rather stay here next year when I am in Boston than any other 4 star or 5 star hotel. It pretty much has all the amenities of 4 or 5 star hotel, it has better location and a very attentive staff. Their food from the restaurant and room service, although expensive, was simply delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: j1234travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights at the Boston Radisson on Stuart St. Sep 14-21, 2010. The hotel accomodated my wife's need for a room with a walk-in shower. Our room on the 15th floor was large, bright, well furnished, comfortable and very clean. We had no problems with noise or disturbances of any kind. All personnel were very helpful and promptly took care of questions or requests. The hotel is located in the theater district and there are many nice restaurants within easy walking distance. Chinatown is but 2 blocks away as is Boston Common. Even closer is the terminal for tour busses of all sorts. There are both a Star Bucks and a Dunkin Donuts about a block away with ample seating(!) for a relaxing breakfast. I definitely recommend this Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: pmingo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for two nights as part of a girls' weekend to Boston. We picked the place based on how close it was to some of the activities we had planned. This hotel is superb. The rooms are nice and have two queen size sleep-number beds which is far better than any other reasonably priced hotel we looked at. Even more outstanding was the view from the balcony which overlooked the city. It was breathtaking. As we aren't from Boston, we relied heavily on the concierge for restaurant recommendations. He was fantastic as far as recommending what he thought we'd like and with getting us reservations. This hotel is very reasonably priced (about 280/night not including parking) and is located in the theater district which has a lot to do. I'd absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fabulous room”
Reviews.Author: gerryhof
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due its location and it turned out be a winner in other areas as well. The staff were courteous, friendly and helpful, the room was wonderful and we had no complaints whatsoever. The location was really a bonus, being very close to to a Hertz depot, across the road from Legal Seafoods and right on the hop-on-hop-off bus route. It was great having breakfast included and there was plenty of variety in that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic All-around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynorris
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Boston, and we have such great memories. We selected the hotel based on its location, but we got a bonus in the excellent service we encountered. The people at the registration desk were very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast in the restaurant both mornings and encountered excellent service with smiles!! John, the concierge, left a great impression on us. He assisted us with our plans to tour the city and with dinner reservations. He is a true asset to the hotel. The location was perfect...everything was easily accessible. Being from the opposite side of the country, we did not know what to expect and feel very fortunate that we selected this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mss0ccerbunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, with everything you need to see within a decent walking distance. Upon walking up to the hotel, it looks a little daunting (cement communist-looking), but inside is clean, bright and up to date!! We had a room on the 18th floor with 2 queen beds. The beds are good once you figure out what sleep number you want. Very spacious room, spotless bathroom and the balcony was awesome. The pool had a fantastic patio overlooking the Back Bay. We didn't visit the restaurants in the hotel, but they looked nice. I only gave it a rating of 4 because it had a 4 star price for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Trip to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: OC_BH
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel on Sunday afternoon, no wait at the Front Desk. We were up in the room within 5 minutes since all was already paid for. Room was on the 22nd floor, great veiew of the surrounding city, looking out to the west, noise was never a problem. Air Conditioner worked well and was not noisey. Nice, big flat screen tv with good selection of channels, including HBO. Furniture was clean and in good order. Bathroom was very white and very clean, never saw any instances of prior visitors! When I had called a few days before, I had mentioned that we were celebrating a wedding anniversary, and we had a snack tray delivered to our room while we were out walking the town! It was a great surprise and my wife thanked me for it, but I really had no idea of it myself! A great touch by the Service Staff to take note of something like that. Location is ideal to two subway stations running different directions. Legal Seafood directly across the street was a great first meal. Almost a two mile walk to Fenway Park, which we did the evening we arrived, and we had no concern about shady or sketchy neighborhoods at all. Subway trains are clean and ontime. Stations are also clean and safe In all, I thought this was a great hotel for staying in the city, close to great food, the subways, Freedom Trail, MANY PUBS and shopping. Did not experience room service, hotel bar or restaurant, but it looked pricey. Nor did we try the pool or gym. Try eating at Flash's about 2 blocks away, good food and drinks! We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - central, clean and so spacious!”
Reviews.Author: amidub
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - fairly modern, great big beds, huge rooms and very light and airy because of big balcony doors. Very warm friendly greeting upon arrival but other than that we had no need to deal with hotel staff. We ordered room service one night, it was fine, nothing special but filled a gap which is all we needed. We walked everywhere and nothing was too far - there are a load of restaurants nearby as well as chinatown so plenty of choice. Public parks and shopping are all very close by as well. Great hotel, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Janie M
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its central location and werenâ€™t surprised to find it very busy, although didnâ€™t expect what appeared to be groups of students everywhere, carrying bags of beer back to their room. Pleasant person at check-in, but it would have been helpful if sheâ€™d mentioned (to first time guests) the policy of no luggage trolleys in the lift and precisely how to operate the lifts - over half the people who used the lifts with us couldnâ€™t get the required 2 lights to illuminate and allow them to choose their floorâ€¦ We were on the 18th floor, room 1802, I think. It was very spacious, lovely big comfortable bed and super pillows at one end of the room (with a large TV) and a sofa, arm chair, desk and another TV at the other end of the room. The pleasant dark wood furniture and striped wallpaper were slightly at odds with the whitewashed cement ceiling. The corporate feel to the room was also in contrast to the balcony which was raw grey concrete â€“ the floor sides and underside of the room aboveâ€™s balcony all left unfinished, resulting in gritty feet when I stepped outside to soak up the view! We ordered from room service as we were too tired to go out, and an enormous tuna sandwich (more like a tuna salad with some bread, excellent !) and a good fish and chips arrived very quickly. We enjoyed using the pool which was fine for 4 of us to do laps (the fitness room as a glass room to the side of the pool, and seemed well equipped). There was a good selection at the breakfast buffet, with cheerful, helpful staff on hand. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PARS1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Radisson as part of an American Tour. Without doubt one of the best Hotels we have encountered in the USA. Rooms and bathrooms first class. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts in Theatre Cafe good value for money and Rustic Kitchen first class for meal and bar facillities. The position of the Hotel is very central for the tourist. Adjacent to Boston Common with the Prudential Centre and Quincy Market easily walkable. Tube Stations nearby if you wish to travel further. Within 200 yards of Hotel is an Irish Pub/Restaurant (O'Connors) which serves good meals and has a good atmosphere. Also nearby is an indoor food court and 7/11 shop for holiday needs. The only disappointment in Boston was the Downtown Crossing Shopping Area which apart from Macy's is looking pretty run down but apart from that a very beautiful City and well worth a visit. Recommend harbour cruises and trolley tours. Will most certainly visit this City sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson Hotel makes your Boston experience the most pleasurable.”
Reviews.Author: neecy1957
Reviews.Content: Starting at the front desk, the hotel personnel make you feel welcome and actually seem happy to see you checking in. Great help from the concierge with tips on sightseeing, directions etc. The location is perfect for walking to the Boston Common, theaters and awesome shopping. Also T stations very nearby to get to points further away i.e. Fenway! Wonderful indoor pool and outdoor patio. Last but not least the best breakfast buffet I've enjoyed in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “can be better for the price”
Reviews.Author: oluap
Reviews.Content: Front Desk, Concierge and Cleaner Staff very good Only 4 elevadors, but one always broken, sometimes your personal card not work Elevadors used by employes too, with dirty laundry , leftover food, etc.. Ice machine 20th and 19th floor broken Staff at the breakfast very confuse, despite a buffet service (hot or Cold) Valet , even call 15 minutes before, takes at least more 10 minutes wait Number Bed !!! What is this??? Stone or Water....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WITraveler75
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston several times a year for work, and stay at the Radisson Hotel Boston every time. Everyone on staff is very helpful and friendly. Checking in is a very easy process. I normally arrive earlier than the check-in time, but never had an issue with getting into my room earlier. I also also eaten in their restaurant several times, and love the food. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a little tired.....”
Reviews.Author: Ningail
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights and I would have to stay it is not up to the quality of the Radisson's I have stayed at in the UK. I understand from looking at recent reviews that the lobby area has been updated but they could really do with paying some attention to the rooms some time soon. Air con very noisy in the room (we complained and it was attended to promptly but still noisy). There is nothing specifically wrong with the rooms that a general update would not put right - although they were very clean. We paid a reduced rate being Goldpoints members and the rating would have been lower had we paid a higher price. The staff were helpful enough during our stay (the concierge in particular was good). Overall an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location with lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: Zack_in_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to catching a flight home and were generally pleased. We arrived around 11:00 hoping to just drop our luggage and head out, but Crystal at the front desk was very helpful and got us checked into our room right then! An equally helpful bellman named Habib brought our bags up to the room, which was large and clean with a sleep number bed and views of the Charles River. The Radisson is in a great location for exploring the city, and our daughter enjoyed playing in the Frog Pond and the carousel before falling asleep while we ate at Jacob Wirth. Back at the hotel we enjoyed the pool and the rooftop view. We were able to print boarding passes in the business center (only 2 computers available in there). All of the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming, and our visit was only marred by one thing â€“ night time noise! In all fairness, there was a UFC fight in town that night so things were probably much rowdier than normal, but even on the 22nd floor with all of the windows shut the yelling and shouting and constant sirens blaring sounded like they were out on our balcony. It was impossible to sleep until things quieted down at 2:30 in the morning. Having to be up at 5:30 to catch our flight didnâ€™t help. Honestly, I donâ€™t know what Radisson could do about this other than install double paned glass, but not being able to sleep was a huge inconvenience that put a black mark on an otherwise perfect stay. I would stay here again if I knew there was not a huge event taking place.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility - great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelchief07
Reviews.Content: Chose the Radisson for price, location and Trip Advisor rating. Was not disappointed. Hotel is within a block of great restaurants, Boston Commons and the trolly stop; only three blocks to the subway. Arrived on an early flight (10:30) yet within thirty minutes we were in our room. Great balcony view of the city, a roooftop pool, clean rooms and very comfortable accomodations. Staff was friendly and bent over backwards to meet our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson after other places we stayed”
Reviews.Author: oakprk
Reviews.Content: Typical inner-city hotel location with all the amenities. Exceptionally clean. Loved the Select Comfort bed!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel Boston - The Perfect Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: hubtowner
Reviews.Content: This past summer my wife, my cousin, his wife and I all decided to head to Boston for a short vacation. Having been there last summer for the first time in 20 years for a couple of Sox games I had the pleasure of staying at the Radisson with my cousin. In planning a trip this summer with our wives, I knew the quality and value we would be getting by staying at the Radisson Hotel Boston again this year. As we were driving from Nova Scotia, we planned to be in Boston sometime early Thursday morning on August 19th knowing that we would probably have to leave our bags and explore the city until our rooms were ready sometime in the early afternoon. Well we arrived at exactly 10am, went to the front desk to see if perhaps our rooms may be ready and to our pleasant surprise they were! The very kind lady working the front desk was even trying to get adjoining rooms for my wife and I and my cousin and his wife! This was my wife's first trip to Boston and after me bragging it up I wanted everything to be perfect. Well we got to our room on the 19th floor and she was blown away! The room was clean, fresh, big and had incredible views of the city! TV was great, beds were heavenly and the bathroom was clean and just the right size. We used the pool and workout room several times and even enjoyed to roof top deck for a few drinks in the evening. The price we paid for 2 nights, well let's say, was more than a bargain! We were walking distance to EVERYTHING we wanted to do in Boston - shopping on Boyleston and Newbury Streets, Prudential Centre, Boston Common, Quincy Market and even to Fenway Park! I can say that our stay and exprience at the Radisson Hotel Boston was a perfect 10 out of 10 and we will DEFINITELY be back next year and recommending this to any of our friends or anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in Boston. - Greg Nova Scotia

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to Stay when you see the sights”
Reviews.Author: victoryblossom
Reviews.Content: We just went to Boston for 3 days and stayed at the Radisson. The staff was extremely helpful and available to us, especially the porters. The room was spotless and we even had a view of the city (could see Boston Commons) Was one to two blocks from the commons and near the historic sights. I was very impressed with how quiet it was. When somebody in our room used the restroom, you couldn't hear it in the main part of the room which was helpful late at night with 4 people staying in the room. I wish the room had had a mini fridge just because we did try to eat bagels in the room one morning and had leftover orange juice but the city offered such delectable food that it wasn't a big deal. The elevators were fast and not too crowded. All in all a good place at a very good price -- only a bit more to stay in central Boston than the hotels in the suburbs! Nicest hotel by far of the places we stayed on our New England trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city location and extremely clean room.”
Reviews.Author: roro1976
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown Boston. Exceptionally clean room with a fabulous view. Lots of sightseeing possibilities and superb restaurants within steps of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - but no complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PeeVee67
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in a double queen room with our teenage daughter. One side of one of the sleepnumber beds was not working properly and the display of the bed seemed to be a little out of order, so we avoided that side of the bed, which was not so much of a problem when you are 3 people. The sleepnumber beds are nice to play with, but no absolute necessity. The room itself and the bathroom were very spacious and clean, but there was a strange smell when you had the air conditioner turned off, possibly from the rugs. The choice of bathroom amenities was very good. The people at the reception do a very good and quick job. Check-in and check-out were a matter of seconds. Otherwise, we did not really have any experience with the personnel. The elevators can be a problem because the hotel is so big. On the day of our departure we had to wait for about 15 minutes and let 3 elevators depart without us because they were packed already. The biggest downside is that you don't get a complimentary breakfast. With the coffeemaker in your room and Seven Eleven and Dunkin' Donuts across the street, however, you can get by without having to have breakfast for $ 20 at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Londinium
Reviews.Content: We got a big room on the 24th floor with a great city view. The beds have this Radisson system that allows you to adapt the mattress to your comfort. The room has a safe, coffee/tea facilities, we received free bottles of water during the 2 first days and suddenly nothing on the 3rd day, a big flat screen TV, airco, free wired and wifi internet (with a very good speed) and a balcony. As other reviewers said, it would have been a good idea to put a table and 2 chairs on the balcony but on the other side you do not spend your days in your room â€¦ We found the balcony a bit unsafe, if you have children watch out. The bathroom was of a good size, no problem with the shower but indeed, again as other already said, water everywhere when using the sink, but we did not see this as a â€˜problemâ€™. They also put loads of towels which is quite convenient. We had breakfast included in our rate and I must say that this breakfast is really good. Having spent 3 weeks in the US and visited something like 8 cities and 8 hotels already, finally I had a really good breakfast: real orange juice, good coffee, more than enough choice of hot food (and â€˜reallyâ€™ hot, not just average). The only negative aspect of this hotel is the noise from the street: I still donâ€™t understand how the noise could be so loud as we were on the last floor, especially at night. The hotel is near the Arlington stop on the Green line (try to get a Charlie Card from employees in the stations â€“ itâ€™s free, you can recharge it and itâ€™s less expensive than the Charlie Tickets)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: Miles4BG
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive of what to expect going to this hotel, especially given how cheap it was, but we were very happy with what we got. The rooms are quite tired, but they're large and comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean and looked newly renovated. The beds are a little uncomfortable, but it looks like you either get two queens or a king which is nice, and they can be adjusted. The TV is terrible, but you do get free internet. Our balcony didn't close properly but we were so high up we could barely hear the traffic so it was fine. Not sure what it'd be like in other rooms. The location is fantastic and the staff were very helpful, so if you're looking for somewhere cheap to stay in Boston this place is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Starviagera
Reviews.Content: We were received by the bell boy (they are never boys, this term should be changed) Ben and his great smile. He was so nice and very helpful better than the stiff concierge. By they way donâ€™t buy the hop on off he sells, there is a better double decker. The hotel is in the Back Bay and a great location to see Boston. It is located in the theatre district, but there was nothing good to go see. Chinatown is terrible donâ€™t waist your time going. The rooms are a good size. The bathroom is a little small and the sink squirts water every where when you turn it on and everything gets wet. There were also no safety bars to get in and out of the shower. They really need to do something about this. Some hooks would be nice. The room was big, had a coffee maker and decent coffee, a safe, a nice TV. Everything looked clean and fairly new. The balcony is a good size but is just cement and there are no chairs in it. We had a fantastic view but the balcony wall is too high to sit there as it blocks the view. I hated the beds they were uncomfortable in every number and the pillows were awful. We had terrible weather the 4 days we were there. We were allowed to have a late check out, which was great as it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Walking Location and Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: SusieEK
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed the room and its location. It is a good walk to all the sights and the harbor. Might be a bit long for younger children, but for my boys, 10 and 13, it was fine. The room was huge for a city and it was great to have a balcony for some fresh air. We skipped breakfast at the hotel and saved a ton of money by eating at the Dunkin Donuts across the street.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Night in Beantown”
Reviews.Author: prbartlett
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a few minutes out of my busy schedule to write this review. The accomodations were first rate and certainly par with some of the finer hotels in NYC. The staff were knowlegable and friendly and always available for advice and service. The rooms were spacious, clean and the perfect size. The Radisson is located in the heart of the Financial District making it easy to travel to meetings, restuarants and local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room but hate the beds!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in July/August. The hotel is in a nice location in the Back Bay and a great base to tour Boston. It is located in the theatre district. When checking into this hotel we didn't get much help from the guy who checked us in. He asked my name, took my credit card number and gave me my room keys. He didn't give me any info about hotel services or even directions to the elevator...it was way too abrupt. The rooms are a good size. Bathroom is a little small and the sink, because of it's design, squirts water every where when you turn it on...a real pain. And each room has a balcony which was nice, we went out on it a couple of times...would have been nice to have some chairs or something out there. The room was clean. The first night/day we didn't receive towels for the day from housekeeping...had to call and request them which I found odd. But my biggest issue with this hotel was the beds. Oh the sleep number bed. I hated it. It didn't really matter what number I put the sleep number on, it was always uncomfortable. And the walls are thin. Could hear people talking and the toilet flushing in the next room and could also hear people running on the floor in the room above. There isn't anything that stands out about this place, especially for the cost. It is also a very large hotel and always seemed crowded. Another annoyance was the elevators. In order to use the elevators, you had to use your room key...which worked only some of the time. Very annoying. On a positive note, we did go to the restaurant located in the hotel, Theatre Cafe, and the food was delicious. Beware, huge portions though. Overall, this hotel provided us with clean accomodations and a good location to tour Boston but would not return to it again because of the beds...just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Radisson”
Reviews.Author: jennie1107
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. My husband and I will definitely return in the future. The guest services were very accommodating. Rose, the woman at the front desk, advised us of many different activities and tours around Boston. She was very helpful and it is very refreshing to see kindness from the front desk. The room was impeccable along with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Hitchintraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 19 month year old son while we explored Boston. Great location and helpful staff. The fact the Hertz car hire drop off was over the road even better. As we have a cot in the room they gave us a junior suite which was fantastic. Swimming pool was great, if a bit cold. Ideally located for both Pru, Fenway park and exploring downtown. Supermarket and bars opposite the hotel. Make sure you get a package that includes breakfast as it was very good but would work our expensive if you paid when you got there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the last night of a long vacation”
Reviews.Author: MissingVermont
Reviews.Content: After a two week family vacation in New England, we decided to spend our final night close to Boston's Logan Airport. This was a very wise choice as the commute to the airport was less than twenty minutes which allowed us a little extra time to get our rental car returned and get situated before our flight home. The customer service at the Radisson was superior and the room was very clean. The view from our room was spectacular and the location of the hotel was convenient to Boston Commons among other attractions. Parking garage was very nice as well. Would stay there again upon return to Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned_traveler68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel many times because of the great location and service, however it appears to be under new management. The room looked tired and the bed (a sleep number unit) was broken. For the money there are better choices in the area. no longer recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: hs_prd
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mixed bag. On the plus side - nice rooms, helpful staff (with the exception of the cleaners who are fantastically pushy and not averse to letting themselves in half a second after knocking), good free wifi. Bad points - air conditioning is really noisy so hard to sleep at night, sleep number beds are a gimmick and more trouble than they're worth, swimming pool is freezing cold. Location is good for downtown, Common & theatres, less good for Back Bay. I wouldn't not stay here again but the place lacks that special factor that says I Must Come back.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly hotel in a family friendly area of town”
Reviews.Author: Chitownbigcityfan
Reviews.Content: Great views from our balcony. Nice hotel pool. Great location near many family friendly places to eat. One block to the Commons and the start of the Freedom Trail. Parked in the Commons parking to save on parking

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel - not cheap though”
Reviews.Author: Joske
Reviews.Content: Booked "family breakfast and parking" for 2 nights. Reception area was being renovated but totally clean. Check-inn was superfast and easy. Valet parking and bellboy were relly nice. Room large with balcony. Pool on 4th floor (no changing rooms present) and sun terrace. Vending machines on each floor (a can of Coke for only 1$). Breakfast buffet ok Hotel located near old part of town and nxt to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Value”
Reviews.Author: a_coastal_traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in downtown Boston, which we selected on the basis of Tripadvisor ratings and reviews and the great reservations experience I had with the local Radisson representative. This is clearly one of the best values in its class in the city, even more so if you are able to book one of their pre-paid rates. The rooms are large and well-furnished, and the beds are in fact very comfortable. We requested and received a quiet room location, and had a great nights sleep after an enjoyable walk and dinner in the historic area. Although the lobby was undergoing renovations the night we checked in, it was complete the next morning and is certainly attractive and well-appointed. Although the hotel could not accommodate our request for a late check-out because it was fully booked, our bags were efficiently tagged and stored until our departure.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in the center of Boston.”
Reviews.Author: traaveler9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Boston so you can easily walk to everything. The parking garage is on the lower levels of the hotel so you don't need to use valet parking if you prefer to park yourself. Our room was huge and we had a balcony. We were on the 22nd floor so it was high enough off the street to be very quiet. The bathroom looked as if it were recently updated. Everything was very clean. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a nice assortment of hot and cold food & beverages. It was ready for you to serve yourself and you could eat and be on your way. We reserved the room with the breakfast & parking package. If you are coming with your car, I recommend this package because you will save yourself a great deal of money. There were a number of nice restaurants nearby (Legal Seafood is across the street.) The parks are only a couple of blocks away with several T stops nearby. We would definitely stay here again when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Anticipated our needs and tried hard”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here as the hotel staff met all of the pre-arrival requests we made and then some. Location is great, room was big and front desk staff were accomodating. Restaurant was very good too. Only downside were the bell staff who were not too interested in helping, but were interested in putting out their hand for a half-a$$ job.

Reviews.Title: “NEAR CHINATOWN”
Reviews.Author: DDS.LO
Reviews.Content: Everything is good ,I will stay there next time.Near Chinatown ,we went there for lunch and dinner even breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location, service and bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: kareng1999
Reviews.Content: This hotels is in the middle of all the sights and shops you could ask for. We walked everywhere. All around the freedom trail....down to Macys....the other direction to the prudential centre, copley square and out to fenway park for a red sox game as well. The hotel has a legal seafood restaurant right across the road and a new italian called vapiano worth trying too. It was my birthday while we were there and the hotel sent up complimentary cheese, crackers and fruit. It was delicious. The rooms were very spacious and we had a little balcony with a fantastic view of Boston. We would stay here again and thank the Radisson for a perfect three day sightseeing base for our tired legs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MKEL09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. The reception is undergoing a refurbishment and has signs up. We had planned our visits in advance and did'nt use the concierege but the staff in general were helpful and friendly. Bedroom was well appointed and comfortable (beds had individual settings and were excellent). Unfortunately there are no changing rooms at the Pool and Gym and the pool was fairly cold, albeit everywhere was clean . The location of the Hotel is excellent, everywhere is within walking distance and there is a very easy to use Metro network if required. The Hotel is on the edge of China Town and walking distance to the Metro and Boston Common. Whilst there we went to Harvard (HAHVAHD - Student Guides were free and excellent), Tour of the Boston Red Sox stadium, Freedom Trail using one of the costumed Guides, although also did some ourselves, Quincey Market, Prudential Center and ate at the Cheescake Factory several times which was very good. Beacon Hill is a really nice area to visit (at the rear of Cheers). The Vistitor center at Boston Common are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Boston Pops 4th of July, our "bucket list" priority, made more perfect with a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: billandgloria_10
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Boston, and being senior citizens who bravely DROVE there, we found it very easy to get to and from the interstate, a big relief. The hotel was an easy walk to the Esplanade, the Boston Gardens and Beacon Street. The trolley stops right in front of the hotel, which is another big plus. The hotel staff was genuinely friendly and helpful, the room we had was very well appointed and had a nice balcony with a sweeping city and Charles River view. We ate several meals including breakfast at the Theatre Cafe located on the mezzanine level. The service was outstanding and the food was always well prepared and presented. Always nice to know you can relax and have a pleasant meal without having to brave all the traffic that is Boston. It will be our hotel of choice anytime we get anywhere even close to Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJMTrips
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife and 12 year old son for three nights in early July 2010. The hotel is very conveniently located in the downtown area, close to Boston Common and the â€œTâ€�. The trolley tours also have a stop one block away. The hotel was clean and tidy, and our room was very spacious, with a separate sitting area which had a sofa bed for our son. He had his own TV, which he loved! The service was very good, and we had no problems. There was a bit of renovation being carried out in the lobby, but there was no noise, and this caused us no problems. The swimming pool was rather icy, so we didnâ€™t spend much time there, but I guess you donâ€™t go to Boston on the 4th of July to sit by the pool! We did eat in the restaurant on the first evening. The menu was good, and the food well prepared, but service was rather slow. Overall, we would recommend this hotel for its great location and convenience: they have just about everything you will need.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: HawkMD
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for a family trip in July 2008. We wanted a centrally located hotel with a pool for the kids. The Radisson fit the bill very well. The location was good with several restaurants in the area. It was easy to walk around in Boston or just hop in a cab. The pool and fitness area were nice with good views on the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: RetiredPD2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days in July. In spite of the ongoing renovations, my wife and I enjoyed a large comfortable room. Services were excellent including bellstaff, doorman, garage, waitstaff, bartenders,bell service and concierge. All were friendly and couldn't be more accomodating. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: nleemcg
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay for a wedding with many friends traveling from all over. The location was perfect and very convenient to the church and rehearsal dinner, hair salon for the wedding party, etc. Everything was within walking distance. The employees were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean, and had a great view of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: elginadam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in downtown Boston to walk the Freedom Trail. The location is perfect and the views from the balcony were great. Hotel is clean and rooms were quiet and comfortable. Parking, at $30+ per night, was kinda high, however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4x4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights when we arrived in Boston for the start of our fly/drive holiday. Very efficient and friendly staff, rooms very clean with everything provided that you could need away from home. Only slight complaint the air conditioning was too noisy to have on at night so the rooms could get quite warm. Ate breakfast in the hotel - good value for money if you have the buffet and very good food. Use the Charlie card if travelling on the subway - concierge at the hotel very helpful and might have a spare one in his pocket!

Reviews.Title: “great location,great room.best value for money”
Reviews.Author: piru1966
Reviews.Content: location:easy walk into the street of boston and sightseeing the room was wide,very clean,the bed was exalant with special tunings, parking at the hotel:we stayed 3 nights they charged us 80 dollars for the 4 days! best shower and bath, well kept nice indorpool opened till 11 pm 'was very relaxing for kids after walking all day down the street:coffee and cvs and restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful & helpful staff made our trip to Boston great!”
Reviews.Author: Johlerfam
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston about 9:30 a.m. and I didn't expect they would be willing to check us in that early; I was fully prepared to keep my luggage in the car until later in the afternoon. However, they did check us in right away, which made it so much easier to get started on our vacation. The concierge was very friendly and helpful, suggesting a wonderful place to get dessert around the corner, as well as providing good counsel on transportation options to get to the aquarium on a Sunday morning. We walked the route he suggested and it was fine. We asked for late checkout as well, and they gave us until 3:00 p.m. Early check-in and late check-out like that is almost unheard of! The location is great, right around the corner from the Public Garden and Boston Commons, near all sorts of restaurants. The rooms were nice, not over-the-top, with Sleep Number beds. The vending machine in the hallway sold bottled waters for $1.00. We paid $199 per night and $34 for parking in their garage. Compared to many of the alternatives, I think we got a bargain. I would highly recommend this hotel for sightseeing in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: imazoe
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is within walking distance to many sites and points of interest. The hotel itself is slightly aged but it does hamper the accommodations. The hotel room was very clean, spacious and had a wonderful view. The select number mattress was very welcoming after a long day of walking. The room included all necessary amenities. The staff was pleasant, courteous and efficient , especially John, the concierge. Highly recommend this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: yumas_nl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights while on a business trip in June. I must say this is a great place to stay in Boston. The rooms are clean and spacious, location is great, many restaurants nearby and close to public transportation, although pretty much all interesting spots are at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: BostonRae
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for the 5th year in a row and although there seems to be a problem with getting the room I want right off the bat, despite a reservation made months in advance, it is still my hotel of choice. I'm not sure why hotels cannot guarantee a room when you make a reservation 4-6 months in advance. They have your credit card, if you don't show up, you get charged for the 1st nite and they can still rent the room right? Anyway, the last 3 years have required my insistence on not taking the room they have tried to put me in and getting a room that I want. So if this happens to you? Just keep asking at the front desk until you get someone who will listen. This year, Rose was my go-to girl who was more than willing to try to find something for me as soon as I asked her. Thank you Rose! I have always found the bellmen, doormen, cleaning ladies and most of the front desk folks to be friendly and accommodating. "Concierge" John is always a great help and always has a smile. All rooms have a private balcony which is a plus. However, the West side of the hotel has a better view now that the 42 floor Westin has been completed. If you are going to be there over the 4th? Try to get a room on the 21-24th floor and you'll have a grand view of the fireworks and not have to deal with the 500,000 people at the Esplanade. The rooms have always been clean on all of my stays. The beds are Sleep Number beds but the pillows are a synthetic pillow that is like a rock after about 5 minutes. if you can, bring a pillow from home - I did this year and had a much better nite's sleep. My room this year also had a new flat panel TV however, for some reason, all of the channels were analog (which doesn't even exist in my part of the country anymore). Down in the bar, they were digital and in HD. Hmmm.. I didn't question as it was not that big of a deal-I wasn't there to watch TV. As far as I am concerned, the hotel is very centrally located. I usually walk anywhere from 12-15 miles a day while in the city. Most areas of the city and out to Fenway, can be walked quite easily. It is very rare that I have found the need to use any public transportation. If need be, the T can be had within a block at the Arlington Street Entrance or the Park Street Station in the Boston Common a few blocks up Tremont Street. Speaking of the T, get a Charlie card - just ask one of the MTBA workers in any station, they usually have them. It's so much easier to use. Another plus, if you decide to take the Upper Deck Bus Tour, the BeanTown Trolley or the Old Town Trolley tour, they all stop right in front of the hotel. $15.00 should get you to and from the hotel and Logan via any of the shuttles driving around Logan. If you get really lucky, you can score one for $13. Cab will cost you about $25 - ask the front door guy to get you a shuttle unless you need to leave immediately since there are always cabs waiting and a shuttle may take up to 15 minutes to arrive. Despite the problems with getting the room, or one near it, as per my reservation, I plan on returning next year. I like having a balcony. I like the location. For the most part, the staff is great - there are just 1 or 2 front desk ladies that are not quite as willing to work with you.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Boston restored my faith in chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: UKexpatNewYork
Reviews.Content: We normally avoid the big mid-range chains following a disastrous stay at the Hyatt in Philadelphia, but when we were planning a July 4th trip to Boston with my parents I couldn't find anywhere with availability that I really liked the look of on Tripadvisor, so we ended up at the Radisson. The first impressions weren't great - the lobby is under construction and the open part is cramped and very dark. The elevators are very slow and are keycard-operated - we found that it took several dips of the keycard before it registered. The concierge, temporarily relocated to the ballroom annexe, was so busy with some other people that he failed to even acknowledge our existence and after waiting for 10 minutes we gave up and left. The hotel grew on me though. The room was spacious and light with a nice bathroom. Our balcony (which could have benefited from some chairs or something) had a good view west towards the Charles River and overlooking the pool terrace/sundeck. Our room was deadly quiet all night and we slept very well. My parents didn't do so well - their neighbours had a loud raucous party all night the first night and the hotel management didn't seem to be able to deal with it although they comped all 4 of us breakfast the next morning. We had a great view of the fireworks from our balcony which was very convenient. I wouldn't put this hotel on my top ten list, but if I was going to Boston again I would probably stay there.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT in every way & amazing downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey7733
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the downtown Boston Radisson for 3 nights in July and absolutely loved it! I had never stayed at a Radisson before and I'm so glad I finally did. I will never stay anywhere else again in Boston when I go home to visit. We had a great, spacious room, awesome Sleep Number bed (especially good if you and your partner like different levels of firmness, which we definitely do!), immaculate in the room and in all of the common areas, huge rooftop patio outside of the pool, and such a perfect view of downtown Boston. My boyfriend is actually a professional photographer and got an amazing shot from our balcony of Stuart St., the Boston Common trees, the gold dome at the top of the state house, and even the Zakim-Bunkerhill bridge behind that. We were on the 22nd floor on the east side of the building. The location is in the theater district which is very small so it's not like it takes you any time to get out of that neighborhood- even if you have NO plans to see a show (we didn't), this location is key for anything you want to do downtown. In reality, Boston is not a very big city and most things are walkable. From this hotel, you can walk to Back Bay (lots of amazing shopping on Newbury St. & Boylston St. and great restaurants & nightlife), Downtown Crossing (more shopping & restaurants), Chinatown, Government Center and even North End (Boston's "Little Italy")/Marina/Aquarium if you are up for a 20 min walk. One other key thing I want to point out: the weather was insanely humid & hot during those 3 days and the garage attendees had a cooler full of ice cold sodas, waters & gatorades to hand out to guests on their way in or out of the garage! Such a nice touch that you would never expect but appreciate so much. Just goes to show what wonderful people are running this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: tutudanc23
Reviews.Content: Great room w/ a view of the fireworks on the 4th of July. Couldn't get much better!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Price and AWESOME Service”
Reviews.Author: 760guest
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and superior service. Our experience at the Radisson Hotel Boston was great ~ from check in to check out. Location - perfect, Value - perfect, Staff - professional and very pleasant. The Concierge Service is the GREATEST... We visited the Concierge right after check in and received wonderful suggestions on the area, which made our short stay much more enjoyable. Not only did they know the best places to visit, they made all the arrangements for us. All we had to do was show up and enjoy ourselves. Not only will we return to the Radisson in Boston, we have made Radisson Hotels are number one choice for all of our future hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: milwphil
Reviews.Content: I don't typically write reviews partially because there's so much information on the web I usually find reviews to counter other reviews--and I'm back to where I started. However, I feel my stay at The Radisson Hotel Boston warranted taking a little extra time to post a positive review. The room was up to date and exceeded my expectations for comfort. The staff was exceptional....from my first contact with the Doorman getting out of the taxi to checkout---it's a First Class operation!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Niki47
Reviews.Content: Despite what I read in the travel guides, I found the location excellent. It was within walking distance of all the Back Bay and Boston Commons site, and not too far from the T stop. The hotel was clean, the rooms comfortable. We only had breakfast at the hotel and it was typical hotel food. All the employees were friendly and helpful. There were many resturants in the area, both Legal Seafood and Maggiano's were across the street. My only issues were 1) due to flight delays we didn't get to the hotel until almost 11 and the dining room was closing as was room service. The desk attendant told us all the resturants stopped taking reservations at 11. We found out later that some in the area actually were open very late since it was the theatre district. 2) our room was two doors down from the elevator and we could hear the motor going on and off all night. It was very annoying and I should have asked to be moved but didn't. That was my fault. On the plus side, after I made the reservation, I joined their gold club memebership or whatever it was called, and they sent me an email to get discount rates on my first stay. When I called and told them I'd already made the reservation, they gave me the lower rate immediately. A good place to stay just make sure your room is far from the elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Great Night for Baseball”
Reviews.Author: hockeygump
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Radisson Boston for the night. The lobby is being redone so they had a temporary front desk set up. The Staff were apologetic and very professional. We love the location of the hotel because you can walk to just about anywhere in Boston from there - that night we walked to Fenway (too bad they lost). Good walk back and a good night sleep. They have the sleep number beds there which is pretty cool. Up at 5 to tget to work in CT the next day so we couldn't enjoy the breakfast - just went across the street to Dunkin Donuts, grabbed 2 coffees and headed back. It's a great hotel. We will stay there again for another game this season and are already planning for First Night Boston up there New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BethNJ
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great! Right next to a food court with many choices. Very close to the Public Garden with the Swan Boats. Not too far to the T which was nice. The rooms show a little age (dirty carpet, dented furniture, torn wallpaper) but were very clean otherwise. I personally don't like the Sleep Number beds, but they were fine if you do. Overall, good hotel. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP AWAY, SAVE YOUR MONEY, NOT WORTH IT, OLD”
Reviews.Author: geraldine76
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked good from the outside. The lady at the customer service desk was plain cold and unfriendly. The "lobby" was plain decorated with an old carpet and few old furniture. It was as if time had stopped. I should have run out of the hotel once taking a look at the lobby! You can tell is an old hotel that needs refurbishing. The room was clean but not impressive. You also have to pay for the parking space, not free for customers. For approximately $400 a night, you are better off staying at a Best Western and Motel 8. Save your money! Not elegant, not luxurious, not charming.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel at 1800Hotel.com. I think we paid about $140/night including taxes. The positive of this hotel is the location. It is a great base for exploring the city. You can walk almost anywhere, plus it is close to the T and to an Old Town Trolley stop. It is also close to almost every chain restaurant (melting pot, legal seafood, flemmings, maggiano, CPK) and a food court with Starbucks and Dunkin Doughnuts. The hotel itself is not great - just 3 stars, although it will be better with the on-going renovation. The lobby is under construction and the concierge and business center are now across the parking lot in the building next door. The pool area is really similar to a 2 or 3 star hotel. The rooms are ok, and ours was stained all over the place. (that doesnt usually bother me, but with the construction gave the hotel a kind of seedy feel). Housekeeping is very good and tries hard. I would stay here again, hopefully post-renovation, but only at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, really comfortable and great location too!”
Reviews.Author: krisklacanada
Reviews.Content: I heartily recommend the Radisson Boston. We booked a significantly discounted non-refundable rate far in advance and I was worried that our accomodations would somehow be "less than". Not at all! We had a beautiful clean room on the 21st floor with a great view of downtown, the Pru tower and the Charles river in the distance. There were 4 of us in the room but we were very comfy. We always had ample clean towels and the room was very quiet for the most part. The hotel staff were very helpful and attentive. Before arriving, I was a bit worried about security being located in the downtown theater district but my fears were allayed by good locks and lots of hotel employees. We used the concierge for a car rental, restaurant recommendations and other touring tickets. Everything they did was great! The hotel is an easy walk to the T and the Freedom Trail and there are lot of really good restaurants within a 2-3 block radius. The lobby is not so gorgeous, but don't let first impressions throw you. This is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for shopping”
Reviews.Author: LondonJimmy
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip to Boston last year, and stayed for two nights in the Radisson. The hotel is in a great location, near to the park, the shops and theatre district. There is a 7/11 around the corner as well. To keep things brief.... Good points: -Locations -Beds -Big rooms, had a nice view -Nice bathroom -Good service, was upgraded to a larger suite Bad points: -fitness centre had seen better days Would stay there again, nice visit.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable beds, super clean and big rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Boyset
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms in this hotel for 6 people, from the reviews I read here. We were totally happy with our stay. The hotel staff was so helpful and accomodating. I called the hotel, after I booked the rooms from priceline, to ask if we could have connecting rooms with nice views and we got it. Not to mention, the staff allowed us to check in 3 hours early. The beds were heaven sent after a long day of walking. Close to Boston Common, subway, etc. Legal Seafoods just across the street. I can't forget to mention the bellhop (didn't get to catch his name), who made sure we got a taxi for the airport on a rush hour and with a game about to start in Fenway Park. Will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the Back Bay.”
Reviews.Author: a032215
Reviews.Content: A family member sent us an invitation to their wedding and the reception was at the Raddison. I did not know what to expect and was blown away by the rooms and service. The reception was also well done.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Closest-to-Budget-Range”
Reviews.Author: meizhen
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were totally satisfied with Radisson for the following reasons: 1. good location - approx. 15-min walk to Prudential Centre, if you like shopping; 10-min walk to Paramount deli along Charles St for a delicious, value-for-money breakfast; along the way you'll pass by Public Garden and Boston Common and Beacon St; if you're a great walker, you can stroll to the Freedom Trail from Boston Common.; within walking distance of Copley Square. 2. within easy reach of a few T stations in different directions; 3. attractive lower rates if you book early; 4. friendly, helpful staff; 5. free wireless; and 6. spacious, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ScottandDale
Reviews.Content: Stayed there using priceline so was not sure exactly what we would get. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very nice and helpful. Loved the sleep number beds! My only complaint would be the high cost to park there but from what I have heard that is common in Boston. Would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fun 2 Day stay”
Reviews.Author: moink345
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and i stayed for 2 days and had a great time the hotel was located a few blocks from the subway green line which took you to all the tourist spots and fenway park. It was also walking distance to newbury street and Boston common. Only wished that the hotel had a little bigger bathroom but other then that the stay was great. Oh the parking was $34 a night not sure if thats a normal price or high for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good position”
Reviews.Author: Yuza77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situadted cloese the subway ARLINGTON (the best stop I think) and very close the best restaurant and the best road for the shopping NEWBURY STREET

Reviews.Title: “Internet Reservations not honored, RUDE”
Reviews.Author: EchelonTim
Reviews.Content: We booked a room online, with a King-size bed as we had our one year old with us and needed room for his pack-and-play. When we arrived we were told that two queens was all that was available. It wasn't just the room not being what they promised, it was the way they handled it. They were outright rude.
