They told my wife that we didn't book a king. We went down to the desk and showed them the printout confirmation that was clearly marked "1 King bed". We got no apology, no "our mistake you did book a king" we just got a blank stare and a rude response that there was nothing they could do. The next day we get a call from the front desk. The lady said she heard we may want to switch to a king room, we let her know that a king is what we had ordered originally. She told us that rooms are not always available when you check in that they were sorry that we didn't get what we were looking for the night before. I tried to explain to her that once again we had found what we were looking for, we were looking for a king room, had ordered one in advance and they agreed to give it to us, that is why we were staying there in the first place. Had we known they couldn't or wouldn't handle our needs we would have stayed elsewhere. She said that they give out the rooms on a first come first serve basis. I asked her if we had not shown up if they would have charged us for the room, she stated they would have, I asked if she thought it was fair that they would charge us for a room had we failed to meet our end of the obligation and yet they had no compunction about not keeping up theirs. There was no sense that they had any remorse for not giving us the room we wanted. Most hotels would give a free upgrade or at least be apologetic if they failed to provide the service they promised. At the very least send up a complimentary cup of coffee or something. The whole attitude was just off. Other notables. Carpet stained, Beds weird blow up mattresses, disgusting bird poop stained "balcony", Carpet and furniture in really dark and dreary depressing colors. Do not stay at this hotel. PS Parking at the hotel is $ 38 a night, i mean I'm just saying

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the rightest location”
Reviews.Author: Robertomazowiecki
Reviews.Content: This was a good 5 days stay in Boston. The hotel is very well situated, close to so many restaurants in the very centre of Boston. The room was ok and I generally felt in the hotel well. All rooms have balconies, which is important for me (I avoid hotels in which it is not possible to open or partially open the windows). However, as the other reviewers mention the acoustics of the building are quite poor - I could hear many loud noises from the corridors or other levels. so if you mind it, this is not a right choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very contemporary and clean, neat rooms at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: slangrana
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12 and we got an interconnecting set plus an adjacent room. Our family was the most comfortable at Radisson Boston. Excellent service and perfect location too!.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: KimCT
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Boston hotels however I decided to try the Radisson due to the good TA reviews and the family package (breakfast & free parking). The rate was very reasonable for Boston. We stayed three nights and had a nice corner room on the 14th floor. Balcony and view were great. The room was clean and the bed quite comfortable. Never slept on a Sleep Number bed before however I found my perfect number - 100. The only downside to the room was the air conditioner - it was so loud and pumped out freezing air when it kicked on. On the last night we decided to turn it off and sleep with the balcony door open. This worked out better for sleeping. The room in general was quiet and housekeeping did a nice job. The beds in a double room are queens. Our room was very roomy for four people. Security within the hotel is a comfort. We never waited more than 2 minutes for an elevator and we used them a lot. The pool area was great for kids and adults too. The Hotel also had outdoor sitting areas which many of the guests were using and a small workout room. The breakfast was buffet style and fine. Some of the selections were hit or miss. The variety was quite good so everyone should find something to their liking. My son ordered blueberry pancakes from the kitchen and they were delicious. The staff was amazing - everyone was friendly and went out of their way to assist you. Parking was convenient. We never used our car while in Boston as everything was either accessible by the T or within walking distance. The T is a short walk. Very easy access to Fenway Park, the Common, Quincy Mkt, North End. It's also within walking distance to Chinatown, shopping & the Children's Museum. Yes, we did them all plus some. Legal Seafood is right across the street. I've been to Legal many times over the years and it is still quite good. Nice childrens selection including 1/2 lobster. Try to do one meal in the North End, so many excellent restaurants and pastry shops. This Hotel and location worked out perfectly for our weekend family getaway. We packed a lot into three days. When comparing this Hotel to others in Boston, I'd say the rooms are probably larger than most and the service is as good if not better than some of the higher rated hotels. This Hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: From_the_Farmlet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a family trip to Boston. We stayed there only one night but wished we had stayed more. The Radisson is in a great spot - a block or two south of the Boston Common, a couple blocks from Newbury Street, very close to green/orange lines on the T... we arrived at noon and immediately checked in as the room was already available. The rooms are super clean - the best part is that there are no comforters on the beds, just clean white duvet covers so you don't need to worry about somebody else's disgusting blankets! The beds are sleep number which the kids loved... my husband and I unfortunately picked the "wrong number" and ended up sleeping on too soft a bed (would recommend not letting your children play with this before bedtime- you'll regret it!) We also loved having a balcony off the 17th floor... cool city views. We packed a lot of walking into 2 days... we weren't quite ready to leave at noon and so the front desk staff allowed us to check out late (not a problem on certain days she assured us)... so we all had time to unwind in the pool before heading home. Very short but wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, affordable place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Wanderfool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and could've stayed a week. Everything was great. About the only thing they have a problem with is the elevators. Had to wait frequently. It's about 10-15 minute walk to the nearest public transportation, but the weather cooperated and it's in a nice neighborhood. The concierge was friendly and helpful in recommending a restaurant to get a good lobster dinner near the T stop before the Celtics game.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a Boston Trip”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: My friend managed to grab the hotel at a great rate on Hotwire and after reading the postiive reviews here, I was pretty excited about the hotel. The location of the hotel is good, although it is a slight distance to the nearest subway system (5 to 10 minutes depending on how you navigate and your walking speed). That said, we did most of our travels around the area this hotel is located in at the Back Bay area (where you will find Trinity Church and the very pretty Boston Public garden) where one can find many nice restaurants to dine. If you are a steak lover, the Boston outpost of Smith & Wollensky is just around the corner from the hotel. The Freedom Trail is also very walkable from this hotel; one just need to walk to the Public Garden and walk across the garden and you will see the Massachusetts State House's distinctive gold dome roof. From there, there'll be signs to navigate you. I even managed to walk all the way all the way to Quincy Market (reckoned it'll probably take you 30 minutes if you intend to bypass public transport and choose to walk there form the hotel) and the waterfront before coming back to the hotel by walking past financial district and Chinatown. Yes, I walked alot. But that said, the beds this hotel has are amazing for you to rest at night. The beds can be made firmer or softer with the button and the room is spacious. The washroom is bright and clean and closet space is adequate. There is also free wifi in the room which made our lives so much easier when it comes to searching for sights. I highly recommend this place for anyone if you can get it at a rate below 120 bucks per night!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: AngelXIII
Reviews.Content: First time at the Radisson in Boston, MA. Overall: Good choice and I recommend it to others. Best aspect of this hotel is probably the location - it is in the theatre district of Boston. Blue Man group performs around the corner and many other venures are walking distance. A quick walk and you are at the Common in less than 5 minutes. Little bit longer walk towards the other direction brings you to the Prudential Mall. Eateries everywhere, Legal Seafood across the street. Nice pool room. Rooms are pretty large and clean. Every room has a private balcony, something you don't find that often. Service is fine, the front concierge outside is super-helpful and will volunteer his help and directions to guests. Nice guy! Overall good experience and I will go back there - probably for business as well as leisure. The room was incredibly affordable for the location, yet another big plus! Free and reliable WIFI - so what else is there to ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: HemanTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very good experience for me during my weekend stay. I was put in this hotel for weekend during my business visit. This hotel has excellent service, staff is was polite and helping. I liked the breakfast served by them lot of choice in continental

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for meetings”
Reviews.Author: overtheroad56
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The restaurant staff was super, the rooms are very clean and the staff was friendly. All of our meetings went very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: tamsin13
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Radisson over Mother's Day weekend and very much enjoyed the hotel. The location is very good -- about 3 blocks away from Boston Common, and while the weather did not cooperate for us, you can take the Swan Boats out on the water in the Common at a very inexpensive price -- a fun, easy add-on to your trip, especially if the weather is nice and you have young children. The hotel has a restaurant which had a very nice Mother's Day brunch and buffett breakfast at an affordable price -- $16 which included omlettes made to order, as well as pancakes, in addition to the normal items on the buffet line (scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits/gravy, french toast, fruits, etc.). I believe kids under 4 eat free. The room had a great view of the city -- we were on the 21st floor -- and it had a small balcony, although I was a bit nervous about the balcony with the two kids (approximate ages 4 and 6). The room itself was a fairly decent size, especially for city accommodations. The pool is quite nice, although I did not notice a hot tub, and there were 4 or 5 exercise bikes in a separate room off the pool with glass windows looking onto the pool so a parent could work out while watching older kids swim. Also, there was a nice rooftop deck outside of the enclosed pool with tables and chairs. Parking was easy, albeit typically expensive for the City (valet price was $39). It is a bit confusing with respect to where to pull in to check into the hotel -- pull into the garage area and park to the side -- as there was a bellhop at the curb just past the entrance to the garage which lured me to drive past the parking entrance. Internet was free and the wireless connection worked fabulously in the room. The hotel was reasonably priced at $215 before taxes -- very fair for downtown accommodations, and in fact, it was one of the cheapest hotels we found in the City but for those not use to city hotel prices, it might seem a bit high. The "T" (or subway) is an easy 2-3 block walk so you can go pretty much anywhere in Boston. All in all, if you're looking to stay in Boston and you have kids, this is a great choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, extremely clean, very comfortable and safe”
Reviews.Author: jude1299
Reviews.Content: Any time I need to stay in Boston, this is the only Hotel I will stay at. The rooms are large and clean, and the location is perfect, its right in the Theater District, there are so many dining options including the Theater Cafe' which is in the Hotel itself. They have a breakfast buffet that can't be beat! The staff is very customer service oriented. Check in and check out is seamless! You can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great staff, great location - highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ash90
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights here whilst stranded in Boston due to the volcanic ash cloud. Had to leave our previous hotel as it was booked up and the staff here could not have been more welcoming. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable and always very clean. A balcony was an added bonus. This hotel is a perfect location for a visit to the city - Boston Common, downtown Boston, Quincy Market and Newbury Street are all with walking distance. You will also be spoilt for choice for restaurants surrounding the hotel and we often popped into the hotel bar for a drink in the evening and sometimes a slice of Boston cream pie. The business centre has free internet which was extremely useful and if we had our laptops with us we could have made use of the free wireless in the rooms. The best thing about the hotel was undoubtedly the staff who made a stressful situation for us easier. The reception staff, concierge and all the staff were very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel for your trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the occasion!”
Reviews.Author: scarlettsox
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston with 2 friends for the Sox game. Hotel was perfectly located just a couple blocks from the T and just three stops to Kenmore. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was a great size with 2 queen beds. Bathroom was clean with a very deep tub and rain showerhead. Parking price was very fair; I've paid $25 to park for a day in Boston so $34 to park for 24 hours in a garage attached to the hotel seems like a good deal to me.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: momof3Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with this hotel. Very spacious rooms. Great service. Just blocks from the Public Garden.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Stay Ever in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: BennyR63
Reviews.Content: To Whom It may Concern, I travel every year to run in the Boston Marathon. I have had the pleasure of staying at many fine hotels in the Boston area. From the minute I arrived to the minute I left the staff was just incredible! The parking attendants, doorman, receptionist, Chris the repair guy, maids, room service attendants were absolutely fantastic! I traveled to Boston by car and was accompanied by my son and his friend.The respect afforded my son and his friend was spectacular. My son needed directions, the staff directed him with simple instructions and treated him like an equal. Location was only 500 feet from the bus pick up and the finish line. Easiest travel to my hotel after a long 26.2 miles. The staff was handing out water bottles to the returning runners, greeting them with smiles and congratulations, and offering assisstance of any kind. I could keep going on but I will not! I will be there next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Boston”
Reviews.Author: jim_shepelwich
Reviews.Content: Great service, good size room with balcony, very comfortable bed and friendly staff. Very convenient to good restaurants, the Public Garden and theatres. The families with kids came in on Friday.

Reviews.Title: “favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: boltlarry
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Boston. Right in the center of the theatre district.......lots of great restaurants within walking distance. My wife LOVES the sleep number bed-makes for a great night. We stayed on the 22 floor- what a great view of the city from the balcony. will stay here again. Only thing is the parking is expensive- $34 for overnight- but not too out of line with the rest of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nandj2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a very long (29hr) series of flights. We were very happy from check'in onwards. we were warmly greeted and given advice on local eateries late at night (we were looking for dinner at around 1030pm) . The room was certainly above standard for the price. It was spacious and had a very comfortable bed, with adjustable sleep numbers. This function was difficult to figure out but the bed was very good. I would'nt hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: BuzzMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Radisson. The room was clean and spacious and the staff friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was very simple and easy. There are probably better locations in Boston, but it is close to the Common and the subway is a short walk. For the price I think it would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: neyruz7
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in Boston for just one night. After a long day at work and dinner I finally check in. It was probably the fastest I had ever been checked. I actually made a comment to the lady that checked me in "wow, that was easy. Thanks". I went right to my room which was pretty big, much nicer than most hotels I stay at for such a great rate and it was very clean. After winding down, I went to sleep on a pretty comfortable bed. The next day, checking out was just as easy. They gave me the option to dial a number from my room to check out and leave a fax number where they would mail me my receipt, but I didn't have my fax on hand. I will next time. Even so, checking out downstairs was just as quick and the gentleman at the desk was really nice. Overall, it was a great stay. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great location, very clean and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: livethedreamandgo
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The location was very central. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. We found the swimming pool a great bonus especially for children. The staff in every department of the hotel were extremely pleasant and efficient. We booked a tour with the concierge and two days later when we went back to book another tour, he remembered our surname. We were really impressed! Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I think the Radisson even arranged for the good weather we had...”
Reviews.Author: GemmaNY
Reviews.Content: The Radisson staff helped make a long weekend in Boston a success for our group of 8 family members, ranging in age from 6 to 60. When I arrived, I found that my helpful check-in clerk had already arranged for me to have a room adjacent to my sister's - even though neither she nor I had thought to request that when we made our separate reservations. With a variety of tastes to please, we made daily visits to the concierge for recommendations and reservations. His dining and activity suggestions were right on target and allowed us to make the best use of the time in Boston. Our rooms (we had 3) were clean and well-appointed. Each had a balcony from which to enjoy the cityscape. The Radisson is conveniently located near Boston Commons and the theatre district and just a couple of blocks from the green line T station. There are numerous dining options from simple food court to upscale restaurants within a block or two. The price was better than comparable hotels in the same area

Reviews.Title: “The staff are superb!”
Reviews.Author: NhDemps
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The one overwhelming factor that puts this hotel over the top is the excellent personel. Upon arrival the staff in the lobby and front desk could not make a visitor feel more welcome . When visiting the Theatre Cafe I felt truly at home and welcom. The bar staff is on top of everything. Great conversation, drinks, food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Asked for Better”
Reviews.Author: kp466
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible experience with booking at the Marriott LongWarf, so we decided to give the Radisson a try. What a great experience! From the booking to the check out and everything in between! The rooms were fantastic...so clean and comfortable...plenty of space for our family. The breakfast was a great bonus. The kids completely enjoyed the indoor pool at the end of a busy day and the location was so close to everything! The staff was amazing...particularly the concierge, who knew everything about Boston and was able to do everything from get you a cab, to make reservations for a tour or recommend a restaurant within walking distance. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: fofinha99
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a really clean and newer hotel with a nice pool and right in the heart of the city. We were also looking for a reasonable price ..we found it all here! We had a great private balcony overlooking the city, the room and bath were spotless and very well cared for and plenty of space. Everyone in the hotel was super friendly and nice...great concierge, the tour bus/trolley sightseeing bus stopped right in front of the hotel. We heard the restaurants were great but we were happy to get out in the a.m. and scoot right across the street to a Dunkin Donuts which was handy for breakfast and coffee if you like to get right out. Easy parking, nice lobby, we'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Did everything it said it would”
Reviews.Author: SidCupLondon
Reviews.Content: Reasonably located and friendly without being over the top. Would use again. Only gripe was that we booked the B&B package but when we went to have breakfast we were told that only two people were included and that we should have booked the 'family package'. I was invited to look at my reservation confirmation to confirm this, which I did but it simply said B&B package. The restarany staff, who were much more customer friendly than the front desk relented and honoured the deal we thought we'd booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with everything you need. Nice air beds”
Reviews.Author: 2Pieces
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business a while back and never got around to posting a review. The hotel is located on Stuart St. not far from the Theater District and has all the amenities you could ask for. Plenty of things to do within walking distance as far as restaurant and bars are concerned. The room was large and had 2 queen beds. The beds are the type that have an air chamber in them and you can adjust the firmness to suit your comfort level. I thought that was pretty cool. Had an amazing view of the city from the balcony of the room. Staff was friendly and accommodating and I think parking was complimentary as well. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “When I return to Boston, I'm definitely staying at the downtown Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: IowanSiouxCity_Iowa
Reviews.Content: I came to Boston never having ridden a subway or traveled much in a metropolitan district. The concierge and other staff members at the Radisson knew the city so well. I was given directions, had transportation arranged for me, and had a comfortable, clean room that felt like home. Everyone here was so positive. It appeared that they loved working at the Radisson, and they were committed to making my stay in Boston memorable and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom25
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel is FANTASTIC! Clean, comfortable and quiet. Best yet, the hotel is well maintained, which is nice to find these days. In short, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable experience.”
Reviews.Author: EljNewYork_NewYork
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was centrally located and walking distance to the Commons. The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service & location”
Reviews.Author: Sheri67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, great big room and a lovely comfortable bed. The hotel is right in the theatre district and walking distance to Boston common and you can also hop on the Boston trolley tour right across the street The concierge and guy on the service desk were so informative and the staff overall were extremely helpful. We went to the Wrentham outlets two days running and had a door to door service pick up which the concierge will organise for you and I would recommend that as a first stop for all shoppers. Great bargains to be had and I would recommend bringing a bag on wheels to carry all that shopping back. I would definitely stay there again as we had a wonderful time. Caroline, co clare Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: BUCA479
Reviews.Content: The staff was always pleasnt and helpful . The rooms were clean and comfortable. The food was great (loved the breakfast) . It was everything I hoped it would be plus more.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sabbielm
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean and spacious! Comfy beds. We had an amazing view of the city, from the Charles river, Dorchester Heights, to the harbor islands. Conveniently located to many area attractions,(Boston Public Gardens, Fanueil Hall, the Prudential ctr. to name a few). The service was outstanding! The Rustic Kitchen restaurant was excellent! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service - just great.”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller074
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a short walk from Boston Common and close to several train stations. The check-in staff were very courteous and kindly gave me access to a room before the regular check-in time. The room was spacious with a great view of Boston from the balcony. The beds are terrific with adjustable firmness so you can get the perfect level for yourself. The restaurant offers a good breakfast with either buffet or a'la carte options available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Very Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: JaneHill
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the Radisson, the front desk staff were very friendly & helpful. Location is excellent - right in the center of the city. Night life is great. The rooms are very good, very spacious and comfortable. I would recommend staying, value for money & great location, walking distance from everything, e.g Boston Common & Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: ExLabRat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and loved it. The location was perfect, the rooms were clean and tastefully decorated, the view was great and the most amazing part is that the room was cheap. My only real complaint is about the beds, they were "Sleep by Number" beds and we definitely did not find our numbers but maybe next time we will.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the City”
Reviews.Author: GoCeltsGo
Reviews.Content: We booked a great package. It included parking, breakfast, and $50 credit toward Rustic Kitchen, all for a really low price. All the reviews are correct in saying how clean the hotel is, how helpful the staff, etc. We did the self park and it was very convenient. Check in went smoothly, lobby is nice, if not small. I like the security of having to use your room key to make the elevator go up. The room was pretty spacious and again, immaculate. View from the balcony is so pretty, especially at night. We dined at Rustic Kitchen (which I will review separately) but I would HIGHLY recommend it. You can't beat the convenience either. It was a short walk across the lobby. The sleep beds are very comfy and easy to use. Noise between rooms is minimal to non-existent. Breakfast buffet was great. They will even make you omelets and pancakes to order. This hotel is also very close to evertyhing. The night we stayed the temp was in the 60's (in March!) and we walked over to Newbury Street. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would love to come back with the kids and use the indoor pool, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: barryjohnsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely superb in every way. Friendly and helpful staff, huge rooms and great location. In particular I loved the adjustable beds which gave a great night's sleep. Most rooms have a balcony and a great view overlooking the city. Most places of interest can be easily reached in a 15/20 minute walk. The T is only 5 minutes away, and the main shopping area is less than 10. Be sure to check out Jacob Wirth's bar/restaurant up the street. Beautiful German beer and very tasty food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient to both Mass Pike and downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: DobeWatson
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest things about the Radisson is that you drive off the Mass Pike and five minutes later you're parking your car. Ditto for going home. And its within walking distance of most of downtown Boston. I always stay there.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Rosepasco
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with our overall experience at the the Radisson.From the moment we entered the lobby until we left we were treated well. THe rooms are super - the staff heloful and pleasant, the location offered easy access to many Boston sights. A must stay if you are in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: motherbored5
Reviews.Content: Went for a getaway w/husband. Location great - close to Common, Public Garden, Beacon Hill, theater district, comedy clubs, China Town. Had nice room on 23rd floor w/ balcony views of city & harbor. Room was very clean w/ all the essentials & very comfortable. Esp.liked the scrupulously bathroom. Staff were helpful- quick in & out. Breakfast buffet more than adequate. Only suprise was how loud the city is at 2am- when the bars/ clubs close & everyone is on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a perfect location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BiddefordMike
Reviews.Content: From check-in to departure we had a great stay. Location allows a nice walk to the North End in one direction to the Prudential Center in the other. Staff were all very helpful and personable. Rustic Kitchen was fantastic and the Beakfast Buffet was excellent. The only issue was the sleep number bed control didn't seem to work. We didn't call about this as we only stayed 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: cbdun
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Clean rooms, clean hotel.Excellent location. Excellent breakfast buffet - overall wonderful hotel.Would stay again,and reccommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Ugly on the outside, beautiful on the inside: Well worth a look.”
Reviews.Author: Eyes_Wide_Open01
Reviews.Content: Aesthetically, with a carpark on it, it will never win any architectural awards: I gotta to be honest and say when I first saw it I thought â€œwhat have we here??â€� (and not in a good way) First impressions can prove wrong. And on this occasion, they did: Good - Front desk: Yes I know its subjective, but I dealt with them multiple times: friendly ever time (different people too before you wonder). - Location is good: in between Back Bay (5~10 min walk) and the CBD (5 ~ 10 min walk). Easy access to all of Bostonâ€™s amazing tourist/historical sites - Room was clean, fresh. Beds were â€œsleep numberâ€� beds (which may mean something to those who follow these things) I found them fine. - Not often the television selection options raise my eyebrows given I donâ€™t normally watch much TV (let alone when Iâ€™m travelling) but if you have kids etc, options available, plus a game console if memory serves is advantageous. - Car parking: I didnâ€™t use (youâ€™ve have to assume a valet charge) it but it is literally under you. Handy. - I really like hotels that actually tell their guests to tell them what they want washed linen-wise. Iâ€™m not talking about bedsheets etc: the fact that towels must be in the bath to get changed I think is a big step forward and should be encouraged industry wide. If I stay more than 1 night, there is no point changing 7 towels when I only use 1~2 towels and 1~2 facewashers. Obviously the lot is changed if a new guest uses the room, but these sorts of environmentally friendly actions add up in my view. Bad - A pet peeve of mine: paying additional charge for Internet access. Iâ€™ve written this before: I donâ€™t understand why the more expensive the hotel/motel, the commensurately more expensive the internet access. The point? You pay for it here too. - Really stretching here, but if you are arriving by train (or bus), those stations are some ways (15~20 min walk) away. I was too stingy to pay for a cab. I didnâ€™t actually open the bar fridge and didnâ€™t look at the cost of selections available so have no view on that. Overall? A solid experience. Good front desk, clean + quiet rooms. Boston is normally for some reason an expensive city for (even basic) hotels. This one is one Iâ€™d consider again..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience At the Raddisson - awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: GusSaugus
Reviews.Content: Looking for a night or two away - we went to the Raddison Boston on Stuart Street. Great time - Hotel was clean with many updates. Awesome staff helped along the way. Rustic Kitchen restaurant was outstanding. Food and service was great. Location is excellent - right in the center of the city. Night life is great. Can't say enough good things about the people that worked at the hotel and restaurant - they made our stay so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: marcellous
Reviews.Content: Very clean, safe and friendly atmosphere! Great place to stay when visiting Emerson University or theater district! Food in the restaurant was excellent and the Sam Adams Boston lager was outstanding! Staff was friendly and helpful. Good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson was handy to T stations and activities”
Reviews.Author: sjm2003
Reviews.Content: We live close to Boston, but never seem to get there, so I went to the Radisson with my 7 year old for the weekend. The hotel was just a $8- cab ride to the Children's Museum, a T ride to Fanieul Hall & Haymarket and a short walk to Chinatown. The pool was nice and I liked the fact the sun comes in the glassed room. The staff was extremely accomodating. Many travelers were not satisfied with the bed, I have a bad back and was completely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: MungoNewYork
Reviews.Content: Use the Stuart Street hotel as a great base to tour Boston. China Town on door step with some great restaurants, the historic Beacon Hill district just down the road. Very handy for all trips, especially if you're coming in by train (hotel just 10 mins away and airport 25mins).Good value breakfast. Staff attentive. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: ken4401
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was a pleasant surprise. I had stayed at a couple of four star places in Boston and four times the rate, and found the Radisson actually more pleasant than those. The room was large and well appointed. Sleep Number beds were a bonus. All was clean and good repair. The heating system as a bit noisy and recycled constantly without ever really warming the room. However, being there for only one nigh I did not seek to have the matter resolved. Service by staff was excellent. This has become my first choice for a downtown hotel stay in Boston. For theatre buffs it is perfect--right in the hart of the theatre district.. High speed internet service was free, something I really appreciate (I hate paying the high cost of a hotel room and then having to pay another $0-$13 for Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: HamondFamily
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute trip and traveled to Boston over President's Day Weekend with our 2 year old and 6 month old. The hotel was very accommodating. We had a room with 2 queen size beds and they provided us a crib and refrigerator. Both kids loved the pool. The hotel is in a great central location. We got a great price with AAA membership. We will definitely come back to stay. The only downside with our stay was the parking was expensive. My husband ended up parking in a lot near Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our entire holiday”
Reviews.Author: terri_j_clarke
Reviews.Content: Its ideally situated, in the centre of Boston, within walking distance of the Prudential Centre in one direction, and Quincy Market (a stroll through Boston's lovely park) in another direction. The rooms were very clean - with sleep number beds - bliss! and coffee maker and well stocked, sizeable bathroom. The staff couldnt have been more helpful, from the guys parking the cars for you, who must have been freezing standing out in the snow, but they were so friendly and smiley, the receptionists who checked us in quickly and happily, and the lovely girl at the desk who offered us the use of the hotel's umbrellas. The facilities are great, with a pool as well. The food at breakfast was very good, varied and our glasses were constantly refilled with fruit juice. What can I say? we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gunna32
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at Radisson . The rooms are nice and clean and the bed was excellent with a duvet . Allt he staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is good in the theatre district and one can walk to most places of intrest .

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Weekend enhanced by wonderful stay at the Boston Radisson”
Reviews.Author: kevcon313
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed Saturday February 13th at the Boston Radisson. We are born and bred Boston natives but like the Radisson in Boston when we like to get away for a night. It's location on Stuart Street is central to many activities in the downtown Boston area. We checked in midafternoon and were greeted by a wonderfully pleasant and knowledgable front desk staff member Crystal. She explained all the particulars of the 'Sweetheart Package" I had booked online. Our room was upscale and immaculate. The bed was a sleep number mattress king and extremely comfortable. The shower pressure was great. The balcony views were tremendous. All food options (room service, breakfast buffet, and Rustic Kitchen restaurant) were fabulous. (Note: I highly recommend the Rustic Kitchen for a great affordable dinner.) Checkout was a breeze and with parking on-site, you could not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a Boston Theater Get-Away!”
Reviews.Author: lrh2388
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year old nephew to see Blue Man Group and decided to make it an overnight trip. I chose the Radisson Boston because of its location but was thrilled to find a friendly and helpful staff...beautiful sparkling rooms...comfortable sleep-number beds...and a lovely restaurant for a pre-theater dinner. In addition the pool was an extra treat for a 13 year old in the middle of a snowy New England day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: NameNo
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Radisson as we were in Boston to watch the Red Sox season opener at Fenway Park. All I can say is that I loved it and that the hotel was in a great location. The beds were super comfy and the staff were very helpful. I hope to visit Boston again in the near future and the Radisson will be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location ! Ideal for exploring Boston !”
Reviews.Author: Deise_Boy08
Reviews.Content: Great location......We had room on 23rd floor fabulous view with super king-size bed. Didn't dine at the hotel so don't know about the food ! Car hire just around the corner at plaza. Easy access to Boston common, shops and theaters.....Would recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Once again a good stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Camtraveller38
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time at the Radisson in Boston and once again a good stay. Reception staff were very helpful allowing us to keep our room later for our eveining flight and assisting us with our on-line checkin when we had problems in the Business Centre. This hotel is well positioned for all attractions as it is mid way between both sides of Boston. Would definately stay again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised experience”
Reviews.Author: Grammi5
Reviews.Content: From the Valet who parking my car to the checkout I enjoyed the experience at this Boston Hotel. An easy drive to the hotel located in downtown Boston. Parking was underground, and handled by a valet. Luggage was promptly handled and check in took no time at all even though lobby was busy. The room was clean and well appointed with a wonderful view of the city. The staff was friendly and helpful without being intrusive. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, comfort and service.”
Reviews.Author: LaurieQuilter
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of my 50th birthday at the Radisson in Boston. We chose the hotel for its convenient location near the theater and good restaurants. After casually mentioning my birthday at check-in, I was thrilled to find chocolate dipped strawberries in our room that evening with a note signed by several of the staff. A very nice touch! The room was immaculate with very comfortable bed/bedding. We walked from the hotel to dinner, Back Bay, theater that night...great location. The room was the quietest I have had in a city. We will definitely go back for more city getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Needs policy changes”
Reviews.Author: Ealge3
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed over the Valentine's Day weekend. While the hotel was clean and the staff friendly, we were placed on a floor with a group who could not possibly have been more noisy, drunk, disrespectful and obnoxious. We called the hotel staff who did respond, however the noise continued until after 2:00 a.m. on both evenings. The same noise and banging and yelling began again at 7:00 a.m. The hotel should have a policy wherein they put these party groups on a floor with other party groups. To spend the money and time planning a get-away, only to have it ruined is disrespectful. I cannot believe that the entire hotel was booked solid so there was no reason to put any guest with children on a floor occupied entirely by a traveling party. I must say, the weekend was ruined and we will not be returning to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: CorinnaH3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the radisson for one night at a weekendtrip and I have to say: I was really surprised. The rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable.. We definitely got more than we paid for.... It is very central and there are lots of bars and clubs in the area you can easily reach by foot..

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: Gatsby97
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston to see the Blue Man Group and we stayed the night. The location was excellent - walking distance to the show. Plenty of good restaurants in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for what you get - Fantastic Concierge John Hallett”
Reviews.Author: Jonesilla
Reviews.Content: Just a weekend get away for a Mom & Daughter. Rooms were clean and very nice. Found the rooms to be dry and the hotel did not not humidifiers. Service was good so no humidifier was acceptable. Mike from the theatre lounge (bar) was super friendly and went out of his way to make you feel welcome. Breakfast was good at the hotel. You are in the centre of everyting! All in all, Service made the money spent worth it. John the concierge, made you feel like he woke up in the morning to make sure you had a good day. The sleep number beds were great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bentist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for a convention at the Boston Convention and Exposition Center. The staff was great, the room spotless, and the location is excellent with lots of nice restaurants within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: kc9427
Reviews.Content: We had a business convention in Boston and this hotel was our choice because we had stayed here the year before, I would recommend this place for those who are visiting Boston. Rooms are very clean and the shuttle service to and from the convention was great. The parking garage was another plus.

Reviews.Title: “My Lady was extremely happy”
Reviews.Author: mason1225
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Radisson for different Meetings, Dinners and Plays. This was my 1st experience in an overnight stay. I can only say that the Radisson Hotel in Boston is everything a person would want when not at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value without sacrificing any quality.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityMary
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't have stayed at the Radisson if it were not "strongly recommended" by my clients. I usually stay at more upscale hotels. However, I was very pleasantly surprised by my very nice room (big, comfortable, bright) and the absolutely wonderful view. The staff was also very nice and efficient and we got an excellent recommendation for dinner. The location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Totally comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: elvisdog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a prime area of Boston, everything is within walking distance. I love the location and feel very safe there. In fact, my husband left his credit card behind in the room and the staff was honest and turned it in to the front desk. We were able to retrieve it later that day.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel is Boston is good value and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler0969
Reviews.Content: This is a quite hotel in a convenient location. It's treat to stay in a first class hotel where one does not have to pay for high speed Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room great value for money”
Reviews.Author: joncorMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The service was great and friendly. I needed a minor maintenance job done and it was fixed properly and quickly.The room was amazing. Just didnt have a fridge/mini bar. Location was very good, walking distance (few minutes to Boston Common, trolley pick-up point, etc.) I had room service. Was quick and correct.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best option to stay in Boston Downtown”
Reviews.Author: greenbest
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for restaurants and downtown promenade Hotel very smart and quiet Staff very nice and high quality Big rooms with fresh air Excellent price rates I would recommend this hotel to everybody

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in beautiful Boston”
Reviews.Author: hughesnz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located, the room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. Hotel service was excellent and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bostin hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: jacqui7206
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed to the Theatre district a short walk to the park and to Downtown I thought it was a lovely hotel and would definately stay again, all staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience perfect for downtown tourists, incl. families”
Reviews.Author: MNnortherner
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is a great choice for families visiting Boston -- they have an indoor pool, fitness room with glassed wall looking into the pool area (great for a workout if you have older kids who don't need you in the pool with them, but still able to supervise a few feet away), very spacious rooms with balconies overlooking the city skyline and Boston Common a few blocks away. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown and in the Theatre District, but also proximately located to the Newbury Street shopping, Freedom Trail, and even a reasonable longer walk on a nicer evening to North End or Charlestown. Two T stops are within a couple blocks from the hotel. The dining choices are plentiful within just a few block radius. We had tickets to the Nutcracker at the Opera House and were able to easily walk to pre-theater dinner at Teatro and then another couple blocks to the Opera House, and back to the hotel again after the performance. If you need to rent a car while in Boston, Hertz has a rental office just a block or two from the Radisson, so we could avoid the $40/day parking fee, and just rent a car 2 separate days when we did area day trips. The hotel was quiet on an upper floor, although sirens and louder traffic sound could travel up, but not to the point of disturbing, in our opinion. And if you are staying for First Night activities, the location of the Radisson is great for taking advantage of the performances, ice sculptures, grand procession and fireworks. The hallways were quiet, the staff pleasant and responsive. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: audreylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week before Xmas, just as the snow hit Boston, and had a great time. The Radisson is in a great location, very close to Boston Common, shopping, dining and all that we needed for a perfect citybreak. Room was pretty decent, and had a really comfy bed. The hotel staff were lovely, we didn't try the pool or on-site dining, there were too many other options nearby. Overall, very comfy and great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations for a Very Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: babyglitz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Boston for the first time for both of us over the New Year. We stayed at the Radisson on Stuart Street from December 29th-January 1st. I was impressed from the get go. Check in went very smoothly as we had an early flight and arrived at the hotel before noon, there was already a room available for us! (Check in is at 3pm) The hotel is located right smack in the central of downtown. We were in walking distance to just about everything we needed, a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts were just a block away for an inexpensive breakfast. There were plenty of ATM's nearby along with a couple convenient stores. The most important thing within walking distance to the Radisson was the 'T stop'. There were 3 'T stops' within a reasonable distance that can take you anywhere in Boston. There are many restaurants within walking distance along with a Legal Seafood just across the street. We frequently visited the bar/lounge at the 'W Hotel' which is directly next door to the Radisson and a block down. The rooms were very clean and accommodating. They came with a safe, sleep number beds and the bathroom was spacious enough for the both of us. My favorite feature was the small balcony with a gorgeous city view. My one and only complaint on the room is the noise level. The walls must be very thin because we could hear just about everything happening on either side of our room along with the room above us. At check out on New Years Day we were unable to catch an elevator down to the first floor for about 20 minutes. I realize this is because the hotel was busy and we had a luggage cart for our bags. 5 Elevators came and went before we found one we could actually squeeze into. We were also in the middle of the hotel on the 12th floor. TIP TO GUESTS: Try to check out before 10am so this does not happen to you. We used our Triple A Discount and were able to book a comfortable room in downtown Boston for 3 nights for just $460. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston and I will definitely stay again if I return to Boston on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect destination!”
Reviews.Author: racerqueen3
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years Eve and Day w/ husband, 2 kids and 2 kids-in-law...was close to Fenway ... I would highly recommend this hotel...quick check in...rooms were more than you can expect...sleep # beds were great...staff was professional yet warm and friendly...no internet issues in all 3 rooms...food was high priced but all we ate was well prepared...esp. the chowdah...would surely go back again..

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Sojourn3
Reviews.Content: Good location. Near 2 metro stops. Comfortable but internet service kept crashing several times each day. Needed Guest Services a few times and when called immediately came to resolve issue (ie, safe wouldn't open or needed extra towels, etc.) Parking extremely expensive at hotel. They have "cheaper" places under Boston Commons but no "in and out" privileges. Pool was small but completely adequate for kids. Got a good price off Radisson's website using Am Ex.

Reviews.Title: “A top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: gledhillro
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our one night stay at the Radisson -Boston. Check in was quick, our room was ready and the staff was very pleasant. Once we got to our room, we were extremely happy with the size of the room, the cleanliness of the room as well as the bathroom and the sleep number beds were spectacular. I recommend this hotel to nayone staying in the theater district area of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: paulrb48
Reviews.Content: Stayed over christmas with family in 2 rooms. Although upon entering it appears strange with the lobby appearing to be an afterthought bolted onto the side of the carpark, the rooms and faciliities are excellent. Rooms are clean and spacious, views from our 24th floor rooms were spectacular, gymn and pool clean and tidy, and the location meant everything was easily accessible. Free wired internet in room, and free wifi in lobby, cafe (expensive and not great), and pool area. Pool is an odd choice for wifi as the humid atmosphere not great for electronic devices. Business centre in lobby also has access and printers. Only light negative is the old fashined rooms have old style tvs in cabinets with old desks and tables. At some point they all need a refresh. But at the price it's all good and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for theater dist.,common,Fanuel Hall,North end etc.”
Reviews.Author: MaineJed
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for weekend getaway and theater show @ the Colonial.Easy to get to,covered parking in attached garage which was great even though it was $34/24 hr.,not bad for Boston.Walk or take T to many of Boston attrac. Plenty of places to eat nearby from fast food/coffee to nice sitdown rest.Across the street is small food court with coffee ,pizza,sand. shops.Didn't eat @ the hotels resturants.Thought the breakfast menu @ the cafe was a little too pricey for basic breakfast fare.Room was great,spacious,21st floor great view of city,comfortable bed. Will definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyuszi
Reviews.Content: I moved away from Boston about a year ago and have come back to visit a few times, and the Theater District has become my favorite location in the city to stay. It's very convenient to downtown, South Station and Back Bay, with nearby stops for the Red, Green and Orange lines to get anywhere else. I've stayed in the Courtyard around the corner and the new W next door looks quite snazzy, but the Radisson is definitely the best value on the block. I got a great rate through my AmEx rewards program and if I can keep getting such a good deal, I'll never stay in any other hotel in town. The room was *enormous* - I had a standard room but it's bigger than so-called suites I've had in many other hotels. The King size bed was quite large and comfortable, though I'm not super excited about the sleep number bed - prefer the chains that have the heavenly bed or the tempurpedic. The living area had a couch, a comfortable work desk and separate climate controls. The bathroom was on the small size, but not uncomfortably so and the shower stall was a very good size. I was on the top floor with two giant window banks that gave a nice view of Back Bay. The room was well cleaned every day. The internet was free (yay!) but only wired. Since I was travelling for fun, I didn't check out some of the features that are important to me when I travel for work - specifically room service, the hotel restaurant and the fitness room. However, as far as food is concerned, there are so many options nearby for eat in or take out, it doesn't really matter and the Commons are nearby for running. The staff were all friendly and quite professional, I have absolutely nothing negative to say about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: NiceguyID
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience at Radisson Boston had been exceptional. The services had been great since we check-in until check-out. We especialy enjoy the "my number" bed, which allow us to set the softness of the bed. Radisson is within minutes of walking distance to most places we like to visit. Just one block away from the theater district, very close to the Boston Common, and surrounded by many great restaurants. We'll certainly come-back when we next visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “The maid ripped off our stuff!!”
Reviews.Author: VetteGirl6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston for 5 days for fun and visiting relatives. Among other things, we brought several DVD's in case they had a player in the room, which by the way was dingy and dark. When we realized they did not have a DVD player, we put all the DVD's back in the suitcases, which were then stacked in the corner of the room. When we got back home, we opened the DVD cases, and all 7 cases were empty! We told the management that the maid had to be the culprit... no one else had been in the room (that we know of). She obviously took each movie out of the case, then put the empty cases back in our suitcase, figuring that we might not discover the theft for some time. All we asked was that the Radisson replace the DVD's that were stolen ($120 worth), and this was after we dropped over $2,500 on 2 rooms, dinners in the hotel, etc. They told us to get lost. We go on several vacations a year, and WE WILL NEVER STAY AT A RADISSON AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAXIMUMTOURS
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson and was very satisfied. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The best part about the hotel was location. We had gone to Beacon Hill to Cheers and were able to walk back to the hotel. We went to see Blue Man Group in the theatre district, got out at midnight and it was snowing. We were so happy to be able to walk right back to the hotel rather than having to get in a car and drive. We went to Prudential Center and Museum of Fine Arts and then took the T to the Arlington stop and walk back to hotel. The Museum of Science was just a short cab ride away too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Hawk42Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: Great location to all things to see in Boston! Elegant, comfortable and super-clean rooms! All employees were helpful and knowledgable about anything we asked. I would definately stay here on our next trip to Boston. When in town definately take the trolley, a Harbor Cruise and take the "Ironsides" tour! All a "must-see"!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lauren137
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Radisson and I can't honestly say enough good things about it. We stayed in a huge room (more like a suite!) and housekeeping was wonderful. The staff was extremely accommodating and the concierge twice recommended awesome breakfast spots for us. The location is fantastic; very close to the T, shopping, and great dining choices. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - What a Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dimitra11
Reviews.Content: Incredibly clean, GIGANTIC, rooms with very modern bathrooms with lots of light. There was absolutely no noise coming into my top-floor room. I couldn't believe what a shock it to find the Radisson so improved! This hotel rivals the Copley Westin and the Hilton Back Bay in room comfort. In fact, the rooms are nicer! The location is not as nice, unless you plan on being in that part of town for work/theater, and there is nothing to write home about the lobby, but rating the rooms alone, I would give the Radisson rooms 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel in Theater District”
Reviews.Author: TimBreen
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable stay .The room was very spacious and elegant.Bed was very comfortable and the adjustable settings was added perk. Room looked like it was updated within past 2 years Great quality fixtures Great views of Boston but really appreciated the convenience of Great restaurants just within 100 yards of Front door. Great place to call Headquarters and enjoy Boston Common and the Public Gardens felt very safe >City semed to be vibrant that night . many night spots to choose from.We took a few in . Staff was very knowledgeable and helpful but not overwhelming. room service was quicker than I expected

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: NJLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my mother, just returned from a one day sightseeing trip to Boston. We spent two nights at the Radisson. The hotel was very centrally located, the rooms were very clean and comfortable and housekeeping was excellent. The front desk staff, however, were a bit chilly and the internet access in the room was not wireless - very 20th century. In addition, more money should have been spent on insulating the bathrooms so that we did not have the auditory pleasure of listening to every toilet flushing and every shower taken by every individual in the hotel (only slight exaggeration.) We had a package deal which included parking and breakfast for two. While booking the room, we asked if was possible to throw in an extra breakfast for my mother, but the answer was no. After we arrived at the hotel, I noticed a note on the bathroom mirror with a name and extension of a person to call if we needed assistance. I called and told a manager at the hotel about the breakfast request and he promptly said my mother's breakfast would be on the him. Very nicely handled. All in all, I would recommend the hotel as a mid range hotel of reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn87
Reviews.Content: I could not believe I found a hotel in downtown Boston with the rates I got. We had parking and a very good breakfast included in the price. We had never been to Boston before. When we got to the hotel which is conviently located, the employees told right were to park. The check-in and out process was very quick. The employees were all very helpful in telling us were things were located. Our room was clean and spacious. The kids loved taking a dip in the pool. I would rate the stay an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet hotel downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter001
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. It's walking distance to most of the attracions and if you want to go further you can pick the "T" (Boston metro system) that stops very close to the hotel. Rooms are very large, clean and comfortable, with nice views. If you have a car while in Boston I recommend you choose the "package" the hotel offers: it includes breakfast and parking. Parking in Boston can be diffcult and very expensive. If you reserve the hotel including breakfast and parking you will save a lot of money and it will be very convenient. I can highly recommend this hotel! (And Boston is a lovely city as well!_

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: BKLYN13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the theatre district centrally located to all neighborhoods - Back Bay, Downtown, Boston Commons, & a nice walk to Beacon Hill. Rooms are impeccable & the sleep number beds are a nice touch. I didn't use the indoor pool or fitness center but they looked nice. Bathrooms are clean & large. My room had a balcony which overlooked the skyline - nice. The only complaints I have are: 1) the breakfast was one of the worst that I've ever had expecially considering the price they charged for the buffet. The scrambled eggs looked yucky & the pancakes were cold. Do your self a favor & walk to the Paramount Cafe [44 Charles St.] which serves breakfast all day at a reasonable price. 2) The elevators were hit & miss - sometimes you get in and the door just remained open. You get out for another eleavtor & the one I was in closes & goes. On Sunday, one of the elevators was out of service. People were scrambling for elevators - going up when they had to go down just to get in one before it was packed. The other suggestion I have is they should charge a little less for the parking, but they may be a pipe dream since is Boston & parking comes at a premium. The hotel is easy to find when exiting the Mass. Tpke from the west. The concierge was also friendly & helpful. Overall, I would strongly suggest this hotel when you visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: foma
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Radisson every year for business, and have always found it to be a satisfying experience. The staff is helpful, the rooms comfortable and the location is convenient to Boylston Street.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: shelbylou1
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant experience at the Radisson. It was exactly in the location I wanted (downtown Boston), which is the nicest location in Boston. I was greeted by the valet attendant (included in price) and assisted in a quick and courteous manner. The lobby was beautiful and included a very helpful area for tourists. The room was spacious, clean & classy. Also included was the buffet breakfast. Checkout was quick and efficient. Oh, one more thing, I left my coat in the closet and they allowed me to retrieve it only after I provided ID. Another safety feature is that the elevators will only function with the room card. In other words, random people could not just roam the hotel. I will DEFINITELY be staying there again. WELL DONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average facilities”
Reviews.Author: hammyhybrid
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Radisson, Boston, for 5 nights. Location is ideal, minutes walk from Boston Common, close to Back Bay and Downtown for shopping, also close to Beacon Hill and only minutes from the subway. Rooms look great on the website but are a bit more tired looking in reality: comfortable, but a bit dated. Beds comfortable (although I did find the "sleep number" bed a bit pointless). Bathroom was adequate and clean. Although the room was on the 23rd floor, there was significant external traffic noise all the time. The plumbing is also noisy: significant shower and flushing noises from the next room. Lobby area is grim: dark, low ceilinged and not what one expects in a 4star city hotel. The pool was clean, but tiny, so don't expect to keep fit while there! Only used the restaurant for breakfast which was fine, but expensive (my room rate included a $15 breakfast voucher which just about covered cereal toast and coffee). Good points: location, comfortable rooms, price. Bad points: noise, rooms a bit dated, noise, awful lobby area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cruadin
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a one night get-away stay. The Radisson was perfect for its central location -- close to the Common, the Museum of Fine Art, the Freedom Trail and other attractions. Not to mention that it is within walking distance of many fine restaurants. The room was clean, comfortable and very spacious -- and it had a balcony! Every member of the staff we dealt with was courteous, helpful and professional. We got the breakfast and parking package -- the Radisson has an attached garage, a big plus in Boston -- and we were very happy with our whole experience. I would definitely recommend the Radisson for anybody in Boston for a relaxing get-away or for business.

Reviews.Title: “Always A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wildpopie
Reviews.Content: You couldn't pick a better place for cleanliness, friendly staff, spacious, within walking to Copley Plaza shopping, the Prudential Center. right at the Theater distric, great restaurants..Huge Movie Theater.... need i say more. If going to Boston just book here and be very satsfied.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY Recommend Radisson Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: lmpg11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Radisson. We were in Boston for the first time, and purpose of our trip was to visit our daughter who was in the hospital having her first baby. Being totally unfamiliar with Boston and the public transportation, two staff members in particular, went out of their way to help us plan the best route to the hospital, and other places we wanted to visit. John the Concierge, and Richard the Doorman, spent a great deal of time with us, answering our questions, and advising us on the quickest way to get to our destinations. Both gentlemen were extremely personable and professional and we thank them sincerely for all the help they provided. Any staff members we came in contact with were polite and helpful as well. The hotel itself is clean and decorated with simple elegance. Our room was very comfortable, and the Sleep Number bed a real bonus. The breakfast buffet had a nice choice of items, and everything was delicious. We had drinks and dinner at the Rustic Kitchen, and were quite impressed with the quality of the food, and the large portions. We sincerely feel this hotel is a wonderful value for the price paid. The accomodations and service make this Radisson Hotel the place to stay when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Gollyman
Reviews.Content: Excellent proximity to Boston Common, Theatre district, Park Street , Newbury Street and Copley Square. Nice staff. Large clean modern rooms. Didn't have breakfast. Ony few Minutes walk to nearest subway station. Recommended. N.B. If you stay here be sure to eat in Maggiano's Italian opposite the entrance......best meal in boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great central Boston Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brightongastro
Reviews.Content: Good facilities, service and location. Easy walking to conference center and central Boston attractions. Close to good local eating. Safe and secure location. Convenient for shopping, theater and other attractions. Clean spacious room - much bigger than many others - with private balcony, tea and coffee maker, clean bathroom with good toiletries. Friendly and helpful staff in every area. Pleasurable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reaper69316
Reviews.Content: Pros- Great Hotel and location the bell hop guy at the front of the hotel was much more help than the concierge in the lobby -Room was always clean and cleaning staff and bartenders were very nice and polite. -left credit card at rustic kitchen and it was returned the following day, unlike the thief's at the Radisson in Manchester. -Bathrooms were always clean and the hotel was very quiet. Cons, Whoever the guy was that answered the front desk phone when i pushed zero was by far the rudest person at the hotel. - the theater cafe place is very expensive -Be careful leaving items at your hotel the Radisson in Manchester stole are acer laptop and were very rude about investigating the situation. -You have to take two different elevators to get to your room we found this difficult with small children. Other than that this was a great hotel to stay at if your visiting boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: princess41
Reviews.Content: We picked the Radisson because our daughter and her friends stayed there a couple of years ago. So I checked the recent reviews on trip advisor and they were pretty good, so we went ahead and booked it. Took the breakfast and parking package. The only thing we didn't care for at the hotel was the breakfast so I wouldn't recommend it. Next time I would get the cheapest rate I could and just pay for parking and either bring something from home for breakfast (there is a good size fridge in room) or go across to Dunkin Donuts or 7-11, etc. The location is excellent. Plenty of restaurants across the street or 1 or 2 blocks away. Took the Old Town Trolley Tour, very good. Toured the Sam Adams brewery (took the T there - Boston's subway). Also took a tour of Fenway Park. Plenty to see and do, we were only there for the weekend. Not enough time to do everything. Hope to come back in the future and stay here again. Found the whole hotel (room, bathroom, hallways, etc) very clean. All employees we encountered were helpful and professional. Breakfast was served in the Theatre Cafe (they also serve lunch and dinner). There's another restaurant in the hotel (Rustic Kitchen Bistro Bar), we ate there for dinner, very good. The other night we ate at Legal Seafood, also good. They have a pool and gym but we had no time so can't comment. I also picked this hotel because they don't allow pets, many others in the area do. So if you're considering the Radisson, go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service and fantastic room!”
Reviews.Author: pplios
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in August 2009 with my husband and we had a fantastic experience. The room was huge, with a separate seating area and breathtaking views of the city, and though the bathroom was a bit small, the shower was excellent, so no complaints at all. Unbeatable location for shopping and sightseeing and good breakfast although a bit pricey (but then again, we don't eat much in the mornings). The concierge was a great help and his recommendations were fantastic. Overall, the views from the room were some of the best I've ever seen, it 's worth going to this hotel just for that!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel ... beds are awful!”
Reviews.Author: andychern
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about the hotel ... except the sleep number beds are awful. Probably just me, but had a hard time finding my sleep number ... and once I did, it was basically an air filled water bed. Oh well, after a day walking around the city, it didn't matter! Still recommended!

Reviews.Title: “not such a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: wlaura
Reviews.Content: arriving in Boston for the first time and choose the Radisson as we have seen all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. The only thing we agree is that the hotel is in a very central area. All the rest is not accurate. The general level of this hotel is worse than the level of a "Holiday Inn" . Air conditioning -there is not a central system and in every room you have your own "engine" so if you have to use it is very very noisy... Bathroom-very small ,very "basic" ,the tub and the shower together and the color of the tub showes that they do not use chlorine to clean it so it is disgusting... No mini bar in the room. The lobby is outdated and there is no sitting area Breakfast-$17 +tax for a couple of eggs and a sausage ,they do not have basics as plain yogurt for example I tried the scrambled eggs and they were very bad ,a lot of butter Do not try this hotel in case you are looking for a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: MyTravelReview_9
Reviews.Content: We were able to secure an amazing price so we weren't expecting a 5-star but I was expecting a bit more based on the reviews. We felt the rooms were nice enough but the hotel seemed a bit "worn." From walking into the lobby you get the sense that it was remodeled a few years ago and could use a refresh... even the interiors of the elevator and the halls were definitely well walked and worn. The room itself was clean enough (still a bit worn, but CLEAN) and the bathroom(most important IMO) was impeccable -- the cleaning staff was WONDERFUL. Nice enough hotel if you can get a great price. Could use a slight refresh though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: jcmarshall69
Reviews.Content: Location is just perfect. Short walk to Commons, plenty of dining choices, few blocks to Copley shopping center area. Right across street from Legal Seafoods - incredible!! Great italian dining just around corner from there. Desk staff for local information was among the best we have ever experienced. Solid suggestions, not just expensive ones. Clear directions, and map. Front area bell hops were eager to assist and did not just have their hand out - really great attitude. Suggest taxi from airport - shuttle is short, but multiple stops. Will definitely stay again!!!!! Did I mention the view?? Super!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent staff, excellent dining, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: JLR4
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel in Boston is 5 star in all aspects, the staff were all very polite, professional and courteous. The rooms are very clean as is the bathroom. All the beds in the hotel are sleep number mattresses and are very comfortable. The restaurants have a great selection and the food is delicious. The Radisson is centrally located in the heart of Boston and is only a few blocks from the train station which is perfect walking distance. I would and will stay here again and I would recommend the Raddison Hotel in Boston to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: funmom22
Reviews.Content: As a previous resident of Boston, I am very particular where I stay in Boston when I go back to visit. The Radisson was less expensive and much nicer than many hotels in downtown Boston. It is so convenient to the heart of the Boston Theater District, as well as the Public Garden. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “our favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: franscene9
Reviews.Content: The Boston Radisson is great because it is located in the Theater district and close to the Common, Beacon Hill, and downtown. The rooms are large and doubles have queen beds. They keep the place very up to date and we've experienced the constant improvements first hand. South Station (amtrak) and several subway stops are within walking distance. They have the wonderful Rustic Kitchen restaurant and the Theater Cafe (great for breakfast). They also have the Stuart Street theater where I've seen some great shows. Plus you can walk to all of the other theaters and several nice restaurants. I have stayed there at least 12 times over the last 6 years with several other guests such as spouse, college aged kids, and middle aged sisters. While our daughter was at Boston University, we stayed at several other hotels too. Compared to the Radisson, none have as many of the features we care the most about.
