The people who work there are terrific. One time, we had a last minute one night need for a room. They were advertising a $99.00 Monday night special which is what I reserved. We arrived really early and the room we booked wasn't ready. They put us in a giant top floor suite(!) that was clearly not part of the special but since it was available and we were there, why not? And one last thing. I belong to the frequent stay club. It takes a whole lot of points for one free night and we don't go often enough to arrive at that number anytime soon. So, I use points plus cash. We saved over nearly $300. on our recent stay. As you can see, I'm a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Recommend It!”
Reviews.Author: jacqui1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Radisson Hotel Boston while on my honeymoon and couldnt fault it. We found the staff really helpful both when checking us in and when we needed to book a car to travel around. Our room was fabulous and it was a great help to be able to use the business centre also in the hotel, as we didnt have a clue where we were going and needed to check things online. We only had breakfast there but it was delicious too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: vacation094
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Radisson in Boston many times and as always we enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very relaxing and comfortable with great views of Boston and the Harbor. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to shopping and great restaurants in Boston. The hotel's restaurant has good food and a nice bar. I intend to stay there every time I go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK....but”
Reviews.Author: dranyam1
Reviews.Content: I felt I had been scammed....like the pictures I looked at were the ones they shot on opening day. The room could use some updating. The beds were sleep number beds and I felt like I was beside a huge compressor and everyone was adjusting their beds all night long. The pool was adequate with a great roof top terrace. I didn't use the fitness room but it faces the pool. All in all...it was OK. Cheaper than a lot of the other hotels in the area and not scroungy. :) Internet was a cable connection...not wifi. I think the location was fantastic...right on the edge of the theatre district and just a block from the Arlington T stop. Although, I hadn't been to Boston in years, I was able to negotiate the T like a pro again.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown loca in theater district”
Reviews.Author: TXglobetrotter_09
Reviews.Content: I love this theater area. Close to a central park, the T (subway), great shows and plenty of food. Nice hotel with sleep number beds and nice views of the city. newly remodeled bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in Boston theater district”
Reviews.Author: PownalMike
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was the perfect location to stay for our anniversary theater getaway. Sushi at Oishii (a short walk) was a fantastic way to start the evening, followed by Jersey Boys at the Schubert Theater (also fantastic). This hotel is so convenient to the theater, and the room/parking/breakfast offer from the Radisson made the Boston visit nice and easy. Our morning swim at the pool was an added bonus, and the breakfast buffet was one of the nicest I've seen. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Radisson - A one night getaway”
Reviews.Author: bsfrench
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel overall. The place is extremely clean, has pool, lounge, valet parking. Definitely do the valet parking, can't beat it for the cost of a tip to have someone get your car for you. Stayed in a room with a King size bed. All linens and bed cloth were white. Again, very clean, no signs of any stains anywhere. Went to Fenway Park for a game, instead of taking a cab, walk a few block to catch the "T" train. Cost was $3.40 for a round trip ride. My only problems with the Hotel were: 1. The Location - good luck getting here without a GPS, Cab, or a Chauffeur. Even getting out was not easy. Make sure you get real good directions before getting there and prior to leaving. 2. The room card was also used to work the hotel elevator. After the explanation by a hotel staff member, it was easy, but if none were around, it's a little annoying. But not a deal breaker. Overall, from 1-10, I would give this Hotel an 8.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLUV2Travel24
Reviews.Content: We very much liked the Radisson, located in the theater district of downtown Boston. The location was convenient to everything without being right in the middle of it. Boston Common and the Public Garden are only a couple blocks away, T lines were within easy walking distance and several good restaurants are across the street in nearly every direction. We took the Sliver Line of the T from the airport which required taking a bus and two different subway lines. Luggage made it a struggle I won't repeat due to the transfers required to get to the Radisson. Next time we'll just take a cab. It was worth the extra few bucks to save our feet and backs! The hotel was clean and Sleep Number beds were comfortable. Rooms are good sized and bathrooms bright and not too small (if you close the door.) Hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. I will definitely stay at the Radisson in Boston again!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: ChiKaty
Reviews.Content: A staff member really went out of his way to make my trip enjoyable. It's nice to interact with staff that aren't just robots and really try to help when you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel , Lousy Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SAM_smitian
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely located ,clean hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The dial-a-matic mattress is a gimmick , but none the less comfortable. Do not consider the breakfast if it is included in the rate. The food and service is terrible. Rather, there is a starbucks and dunkin donuts just a half block away. Go there and save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Could Haved Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: shersaint1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly, and the hotel itself was beautiful inside. I enjoyed the SleepNumber (sp?) beds and the bedding was very clean and comfortable. We ate at Rustic Kitchen, which is connected to the hotel, and our dinner there was wonderful. The doorman recommended a great spot to eat for dessert, Finale, which was only a couple of blocks away from the hotel. The free internet was a great plus! The parking is expensive, as it is everywhere in downtown Boston, but at least they provide in and out privileges, which were good until 6pm the day we checked out. This was a great asset to us so that we could go sightseeing via the subway, and come back to our car later. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our pick every time....”
Reviews.Author: krisntrev
Reviews.Content: We love to visit Boston..but we have two small children and need an afforable, centralized, kid friendly hotel to stay at. We always end up choosing the Radisson and are always extremely pleased with our stay. We selected a package that included our parking and breakfast for all of us. Our room was spotless, our car was safe, the breakfast food was awesome and we had the most amazing view of the city from our balcony. The childen loved the indoor pool and we all loved the room service where we ate cake in our comfortable sleep number beds! I will continue to choose the Radisson for our visits to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: eyenurse
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for four nights at the Radisson on Stuart St. in Boston. The room was quite large and included two occassional chairs and exceptionally comfortable beds with upgraded bedding. The bath had been recently renovated and was spotless. The negatives were minor and did not adversely effect our stay. The furniture was a bit outdated and there was no individual reading light for each bed. (There was one lamp between the beds which could not be set to illuminate only one bed, thus one person could not read without disturbing the sleeping person in the other bed.) A small refrigerator under the coffee station would have been nice. The low flush toilet sounded like a jet airplane and did not completely empty when flushed one time. Our room was very quiet and we were not disturbed by street noise or quests in other rooms. The security was exceptional. The room key was needed to operate the elevator, which would only stop on the floor matching your key. There was usually a security officer outside the hotel or in the lobby. Computers and a printer were available free of charge for the guests. This was greatly appreciated when checking in with the airlines and printing boarding passes. This hotel was centrally located and we were able to easily walk to the North End and south to the Christian Science Center as well as all points in between.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Zrubavel
Reviews.Content: This is a very centrally located hotel, with very good big rooms. The bed is very comfortable, equipped with a system that can tilt and soften the mattress according to your weight and position ?! I did not have the energy to try it, but was more than okay anyway. The drawback of the hotel is that is has no lobby to speak of, and there is virtually no place to stay but your own room.

Reviews.Title: “great service and nice room”
Reviews.Author: zeeartist
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location to all Boston transportation and within an easy walk of many historical sites and attractions. Wonderful service! The room was great for the price, with a logical layout, plenty of square footage and an opening sliding glass door out to a balcony. You will hear the sirens, but that will be typical at any hotel in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for college trips”
Reviews.Author: orientme
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and special package that included parking and breakfast buffet. If you want to show off Boston to your college-hunting teenager, this is a great place to stay because it's so central to everything. My daughter and I walked from the hotel to Newbury Street in the evening, and the next morning we got up and walked through the Common/Public Garden to Beacon Hill. For longer stays it's easy enough to get to Downtown and Cambridge from the hotel. Plus, exceptional breakfast buffet, nice linens on the beds. If our daughter ends up going to college in the area, this is where we'll stay when we visit. (That is, if we have any money left after paying her tuition!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: spm2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Radisson with a girlfriend. We had tickets for the theater and this was such a great location. We walked everywhere. The bed was phenomenal. Had such a wonderful sleep. The Rustic Kitchen (restaurant connected to hotel) was really good as well. We had booked the room, parking and buffet breakfast package which was well worth it. Would definitely recommend to anyone and would return again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Suited my needs exactly”
Reviews.Author: rollingstonegal
Reviews.Content: In the theater district, half a block from Gray Line departures, red trolley stops right in front. If you like walking it's not far to some landmarks. If anybody can figure out the subway, it's not far either. The lobby design is rather dreary but everyone is very friendly and makes up for it (keep an open mind; this isn't the Ritz). I never got the hang of that sleep number bed. Nice big deep bathtub with 2 grab bars if you ask for it. Pool area also very nice, as is the restaurant on the mezz. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location for Boston”
Reviews.Author: BeermatNC
Reviews.Content: We wanted a clean good value hotel in Boston close to the Downtown area for restaurants and the main tourist areas. The Radisson was excellent and worked perfectly for us and we didn't need to rent a car so long which avoids wasting time looking for parking, but requires excellent public transport which Boston has. The Hotel was clean and the rooms well furnished with free high speed internet and I would highly recommend staying there

Reviews.Title: “A very good value for a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Simone
Reviews.Content: We've spent there 3 nights with 2 teenagers and 1 child. The 2 communicating rooms were big and confortable, the service was perfect and the breakfast (included) delicious. It was also important the get the parking included (according to the price off parkings downtown). The location is alos perfect (15mn walk to old Boston).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: llq428
Reviews.Content: This hotel was warm and friendl. We had free parking and an awesome free breakfast buffet. The restaurants were great and the staff were warm and friendly. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: silversleuth16
Reviews.Content: Our stay couldnâ€™t have been more pleasant. The Radisson Hotel Boston is centrally located and within walking distance to nearly all sight-seeing attractions in Boston-Cheers in Back-Bay, Boston Common, the Prudential Center, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, the Wharf, and the Freedom Trail. Their Bed, Breakfast and Parking Package for $199/night on a Sunday+Monday was just what we needed. Parking can run $30+/day and many hotels in central Boston charge $200 or more just for a room. The rooms were luxurious, the Sleep Number beds comfortable, and the view of the city amazing. I donâ€™t know if all rooms feature a view. The king bed room we arranged for our travel companions ended up being a Junior Suite for no extra charge. Its bath was a little on the small size, though. The queen room had a larger bath and a spacious bedroom. It was a great stay and we will definitely choose the Radisson next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...again!”
Reviews.Author: NomadForLife
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another stay at the Radisson on Stuart Street. Twice a year I take my parents to Boston for a few nights of sightseeing and a Sox game. The Radisson was excellent...again! Great staff, always greet you with a sincere hello. Clean, spacious rooms with great views. Great neighborhood, amenities within walking distance. Grab a cup of Dunkin' and head to Boston Commons right outside the door! I love staying here! If you are looking for cleanliness, comfort and convenience without the high prices, this is the place! Happy travels and go Sox!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: MumsieDevonUK
Reviews.Content: Not very pretty externally but refurbished rooms comfortable,and small bathrooms well equipped .Great views over Boston.Conveniently situated to reach all areas of Boston ,within easy walk of subway stations ,with Dunkin donuts/Starbucks handy for breakfasts.Venture across the park or common to explore Charles St restaurants for dinner. Very near to theatres.

Reviews.Title: “InTown for the weekend - picked the BEST hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanS23
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel in Boston is an excellent facility - terrific staff, cleaniness and LOCATION. Close to everything, either by walking or via the T (2 T-stops within 2 blocks of the hotel) - this includes shopping, eating, & entertainment. We were particularly impressed when we checked out to find my daughter left her new slippers behind. After discussing with the front desk, we went back to our room's floor where the housekeeper already had found them, wrapped them in a plastic bag and quickly gave them to my daughter upon recognizing her - TERRIFIC service. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: jchristensen99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Radisson Boston, we love the city. This Hotel is one long block from Boston Commons (great location). We usually stay at 4star hotel at a discount - Priceline or Hotwire. This is mostly an average hotel that need a little updating, but makes up for it in location and value (we paid $100/night from Hotwire). This is a good choice if you are looking for a good value - not for a high end hotel. good luck

Reviews.Title: “Nice with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is in great location, only two blocks south of Boston Common, the Public Garden and Cheers and only a short walking distance to great shopping and activities. While the rooms have the same old boring chain hotel furniture, the room was large, clean and offers a balcony with views of the city and Sleep Number beds for a perfect nights sleep. My only VERY small compaint is they should include a couple of chairs for the balcony. It would have been nice to have a place to sit while enjoying the views of the city. Breakfast was excellent with everything you would ever want. For a good reasonably price place to eat, try the Rustic Kitchen attached to the parking garage on Stuart Street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on my own while visiting Boston for tourism. Check in and out was efficient, but frosty. Room had all the amenities you would expect, including a luxuriously comfortable bed, but the place overall left me cold (metaphorically speaking). Swimming pool was small and when I checked it out it was full of kids. I paid $170 per night which is probably about the going rate for a place of this quality. I didn't have a bad time, but would be tempted to try elsewhere next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Great Price, Great Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mohmohsin
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel were alright, nothing special. In fact if anything I had never slept on a sleep number bed before and found it a little irritating. Overall though the hotel was a real good value. I got a rate here which included parking and breakfast and was still less than the hotels around us. The location also couldnt possibly get any better. A short walk to the Boston Common, most of historical Boston can be reached by foot. Overall quite an enjoyable experience. If you are looking not to spend too much time in your room, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kmgTripper
Reviews.Content: Large clean room with all the facilities you need for a comfortable and relaxing stay. Free internet access in business center was a welcome bonus. The pool looked inviting but didn't test it out. The hotel is well situated for getting out and about in Boston - good for walking, and close to the metro and bus station. This was our second visit to Boston, both times we've stayed at the Radisson and I'm sure we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: bri4dee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston for a long weekend, neither one of us had ever been there before and we hag no clue where to stay. We could not have been more pleased, the location was within a couple of blocks from the subway and the common. The rooms were very nice. Best of all was our concierge. John haelped us purchase tickets for a whale watch (very fun). he had given us his card in case we needed help while we were out. Of course when we arrived at the pier we realized we had no tickets...panic. We called John who gor our confimation number and gave us all the info we needed to get replacement tickets on the spot...Thanks John. Oh...and did I tell you that this hotel was one of the lowest priced?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in downtown Boston.”
Reviews.Author: theautumnal
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in adjoining rooms when we took my son to college. We found the hotel to be elegant without being uptight. The staff was warm and efficient. And the rooms (we had two adjoining) were very comfortable, clean, and as an added bonus, we had balconies overlooking the lights of the city. The nights were chilly and breezy, and we enjoyed excellent room service dinner by our own city window. The Sleep Number beds, in our opinion, are much ado about nothing, but others may like them. The white sheets, duvet covers and crisp bedding were very fresh.. The details were top notch - like the shower curtain being curved out to open up the space, of course wi fi, and the small things that make a hotel room enjoyable and hassle free. I have stayed at most of Boston's high end hotels on business. This hotel was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if your going to the theater district”
Reviews.Author: KayKayCapeCod
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. We booked the Sweetheart deal and had Champagne and Chocolate covered Strawberries waiting for us, when we got back from the play.The rooms are beauiful and the Select Comfort bed was wonderful. Checking in and out was quick and easy (no waiting in lines)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewToCity
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 yr old daughter, 16 yr old son and I stayed for one night at the Radisson Hotel in Boston. We enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. My daughter thoroughly enjoyed the clean indoor pool, my son enjoyed the gym while my husband and I relaxed on the outdoor area just outside the pool , which is on approximately the 8th floor. We would lie on chaise lounges and enjoy the magnificent view of the city and were able to soak up the sun while watching my daughter swim and my son workout in the gym. We did not have a vehicle so parking was not an issue. There are plenty of restaurants and food areas just outside the hotel within walking distance. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: RobertColorado
Reviews.Content: The Radisson in Boston is excellent. I had tried other hotels there on business and this was for leisure. I checked reviews and it had good reviews so I thought I would give it a try. Our travel plans changed at the last minute and we called the hotel to change our dates to the following week. We had the best experience doing that and amazingly since our new dates were apparently during a less traveled time the hotel actually offered a lower rate and they were happy to change our dates! Check in was so fast it was unreal. The room was outstanding. Large comfortable and we got to try the sleep number bed. We did sleep really well. So well that we missed an excursion on the first day! The internet was free, wired, and secure. Very nice. The concierce was perfect and helped us plan our stay and offered great hints. Overall I can't imagine a better experience. We looked at the pool and work out area and thought we would use it but we stayed so busy being tourists that in the evenings we just crashed into our bed. What a wonderful staff! This is how a hotel should be. I highly recommend it. We had great views of the city and stood on our balcony and got some great shots at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean room, perfect Boston location”
Reviews.Author: bd9902
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything bad to say about the Radisson Boston. It's a great location a couple blocks from the Pike when driving in, super convenient parking (you can find cheaper parking, but not anywhere as convenient to the hotel) and close to Back Bay, Chinatown, Financial District and walking distance to South Station. The room was much bigger than I expected and was very clean. Housekeeping was great. The woman cleaning my block of rooms was across the hall and asked if she could clean my room when I was leaving for the day. When I got back, the room was spotless. As clean and reset as when I had checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel. Water too hot, so be careful.”
Reviews.Author: PetRotrip
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel in a great location. I would definitely recommend this to other people but I have some safety tips, though. The water in the lavatory is too hot. The knob of the faucet is a bit confusing that when I was trying to close it when I started to feel that the water was too hot, I was actually turning it on all the more. I got a scald because of this. At first I thought I was only absent minded that it happened to me. Minutes later, the same thing happened to my husband, only, I already warned him earlier so his was just a mild scald. The other thing that I noted was their tub. The tub is made up of prefabricated plastic (?) that when I took a shower and the tub was wet with water and soap, it became somewhat slippery. Also, the water pressure of the toilet flush wass o strong that when you flush the toilet, tiny droplets of water from the bowl strikes to the rim of the toilet seat. This is the only thing I do not like in the hotel. I already knew about the hot water and the faucet knob so I was already cautious in using them during the rest of my stay. All in all, the hotel room was nice and clean, though the nook where the coffemaker and the cups are located was starting to gather dust, but obviously cleaned well after the last user.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Freester5
Reviews.Content: I don't think you could find a better hotel in Boston for the price. From the moment we arrived, the customer service was exceptional. When we needed a rollaway bed, they responded immediately. It is one of the few hotels in Boston that can accomodate a family of five in one room. Most hotels seem to have a maximum occupancy of four people per room. The location can't be beat. It is a short walk to Boston Common, the Public Gardens, and several nice restaurants. The room always looked and smelled clean, which added to the positive experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: PJSLeicestershire_UK
Reviews.Content: Picked this on the strength of other reviews, and the fact that we got breakfast & parking in the deal. A great start to our New England vacation. Had a 23rd floor room so was well away from street noise, but the down side was the elevator. Was OK at quiet times, but took at least 20 minutes to get to the lobby at 9 o'clock Sunday morning. It took a while for an elevator to arrive (even though one went up almost immediately we started waiting - there was only 1 floor above us). Eventually one stopped, still going up but we got in anyway. Our entry made it nearly full, but it then stopped at nearly every floor going down, and despite it being full, about 4 more squeezed in. It eventually stopped just one floor up from the lobby, doors opened, closed - then nothing. By now it was stuffy and hot, and we had been in it for about 10 miinutes. Much button pushing got the doors open, so we got out & found stairs, as my wife was feeling faint! That put us on the street! Apart from that, nothing to fault really. Room was comfortable, although a/c was quite noisy when on (but nothing new there - typical US hotel equipment). Breakfast was a good selection & good quaility.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel a place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: petauke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Radisson hotel with my parter and we enjoyed every minute of our stay.We actually felt like we were cheating the hotel because the services, meals were far better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, minor hiccups”
Reviews.Author: wheels0207
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in a great location. The hotel is close to many restaurants, shops, and T stations. The rooms each had a balcony and the hotel was very quiet all weekend. The staff was very courteous and professional, but there were a couple hiccups that were out of their immediate control. For example, we were able to check in early and get an hour later check out. Also, we needed a refrigerator in our room. We called ahead and they had it in our room waiting when we checked in. These were both greatly appreciated actions by the staff. However, the hotel uses "Sleep Number" beds which I think are glorified air mattresses! They were a pain to use and uncomfortable regardless of the setting. You'd set it at one level at night then it'd be a totally different setting when you woke up. I even switched beds (since I had two queens in my room) and it was the same. I've stayed at a Radisson before with these beds and I was somewhat disappointed when I booked on Hotwire and found out it was the Radisson only because of the Sleep Number beds. Give me a quality standard mattress any day. I also had issue with the internet access. It is, at best, a medium speed connection with bandwith issues. I was able to connect with my company's network only for a short period over the entire three day stay I had. Also, the room air conditioner was very loud and the toilets had those pressurized flushing units installed that many hotels are using these days. They save water, but make it sound like a small explosion is going off in the bathroom when you flush it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: vande01
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night when we went to see the Yankees slaughter the Red Sox, and couldn't be more satisfied with where this hotel was located, its price, and the result of the game. Being in the heart of downtown Boston (theater district), everything is within walking distance, or at least short trolley ride away. Parked the car in the garage attached to the Radisson, then everything we needed was within a walking distance. Even Fenway Park was a mile and a half walk each way. Nothing is wrong with hotel rooms, rooms were clean and comfortable. And if you stay at this hotel you need to get the short rack of ribs at the rock bottom brewery (across the street). Would recommend and go back to this hotel my next trip up there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start-Bad finish”
Reviews.Author: villemom
Reviews.Content: Mother/Daughter trip to take in the sites of Boston. Booked through an on-line travel company with a great rate at the Radisson. Front desk had no record of reservation until I produced the written confirmation but still took almost 15 minutes to check-in. Couldn't tell if the clerk didn't know what he was doing or trying to find a place to put us. The location was perfect to walk or ride the T. Location very safe. But once I was home I discovered the hotel itself had charged my credit card more money for the stay. This was on top of what I already paid the travel company. I should have been smarter and questioned it at checkout. A lesson learned. Boston is a great city to visit - even for a country girl like me. Oh - and watch out for those ice machines that have strange black goop frozen in the ice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl0056
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem and cannot be beat for the price and location. We paid $160 a night but another guest told me he got it for $79 on HotWire. The hotel is located in the heart of the city and you can walk to most attractions. We were on the 10th floor and it was always very quiet at night. The room was showing it's age slightly but was still clean and comfortable. The maid service was excellent and everyone there was courteous, friendly, and helpful. We were pointed to great restaurants and always received accurate directions. Our room had a balcony (which is great if anyone in your party smokes). Quincy Market area was about a 40 minute walk and the harbor was about a 30 minute walk. There is a movie theatre that's about 20 minutes away. Right across the street there is a small food court which includes Duncan Donuts and a Starbucks. Legal Sea Food is right across the street and has fantastic food (try the baked lobster for a real treat!). Jacob Wirth's is a good German restaurant and is only about a block away. The trolley cars stop right in front of the hotel and Greyline tours loads right across the street too. This is really a great place to stay and I would definitely stay there again if I was in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best City Boston!”
Reviews.Author: shelovestotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 5 day trip to Boston. We stayed at the Radisson Hotel in the Theatre District. The hotel was fine. The beds were very comfy, our bathroom was redecorated with beautiful white tile and a beautiful modern sink. The shower was too soft for my liking but it was ok. The room needs some updating, I would suggest a flat screen tv and new art on the walls. It wouldn't take much to make it nicer and more comfortable. The free coffee in the room is horrible! Don't bother! They really need to have a much better choice for the price you're paying and the star rating. The location was fine. The staff is very friendly. We explored, the South End, North End, Harbor, Downtown, Chinatown and spent lots of time at Fenway Park!. This was our first time to see the Red Sox play at Fenway. What a great time! You have to do the tour, it's great . The bleacher bar is awesome! The party is at Fenway Park! Go Red Sox! We went on a sunset cruise on the Liberty Clipper, $30 per person and worth it! It that was relaxing, romantic and a fun thing to do. What a view coming in at sunset with the Boston Skyline. We walked over the bridge to Charlestown to see the USS Constitution and the Museum. We walked the Freedom Trail and ended up at Quincy Market to eat something and hang out at a small bar called Ned Devine"s. We ate at Legal Seafood which was ok. Regina Pizza in the North End, better known as Little Italy and that was great. The Barking Crab on the Harbor front is a fun place with good seafood. We grabbed a really good salad in the Prudential Center at Tossed. On our way to Fenway one day we ate at "The Other Side Cafe" on Newbury Street and that was really good. Very young crowd and great service! Went to the top of the Prudential Building and had a drink at the Restaurant. You've got to see the view! The people of Boston are so friendly and there is so much to do. We didn't want to leave! Walk down Commonwealth Avenue and enjoy the beautiful brownstones and bostonians walking their doggies. Stroll down Newbury Street, Walk along the Waterfront, take a ferry, walk the freedom trail, walk the streets of the South End and don't miss the North End. What a beautiful place with lots of restaurants and friendly people! Sit in Boston Common and people watch! Bring comfy shoes so you can see all of Boston on foot! If you get to tired, grab the T and get anywhere for about $2. We took a taxi from the airport to the Radisson at 1am and that was about $30. The taxi back at 4pm was $25. It took 15 minutes! Go to Boston, wear a Red Sox hat and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Radisson Boston”
Reviews.Author: tabataMilan
Reviews.Content: During my holidays in august i stayed at Radisson Boston hotel. This hotel it's very very nice, in a very good position, with a wonderful and confortable room. I kindly suggest this hotel for your journeys!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Radisson Hotel Boston was simply awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 07367Family
Reviews.Content: Our experience staying at the Radisson Hotel Boston was awesome, from ease of finding the hotel, to parking, staff, food, room and the beautiful view of the city. The staff in general were wonderful, polite and a couple stood out to us because they went out of their way to make our stay exceptional. The teenagers enjoyed the pool and fabulous deck area as did my wife and I. The location of the hotel is perfect for the sight seeing we wanted to do. Overall, for what the hotel offers they could easily charge more and it still would be well worth it. We said that hands down this will be our hotel each time we visit Boston from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: ajiit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after many hours of research, for I wanted to be sure that I would get a clean and bug free hotel from a good neighbourhood. At first Radisson Hotel Boston seemed to tick all the boxes, but then the worst happened. As I was returning from the bathroom on our first night there (we had booked two nights), I saw something moving on the floor. Yep, it was a cockroach. After some screaming and jumping around I got dressed and ran to the hallway. My boyfriend called the front desk and they sent the maintenance to kill the cockroach. My boyfriend had managed to kill one with his shoe, but there was an another one hiding some where. They weren't able to find the other cockroach, and so I demanded that we get another room, for I was not able to sleep in that room knowing that there was a bug on the loose. We got a new room with two queen beds (the old room had a king size one), and a complimentary breakfast. All in all they handled the situation well, but I can not describe how disappointed I was after having thought that this hotel would meet all my expectations. Would not stay here again (I was not able to sleep in the new room either because I expected to see another cockroach walking through the floor any minute)

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TCwarwick
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel woth our car we were met by staff who helped with luggage and directed me to parking, a great start. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The concierge staff where able to help with all needs, baseball tickets, restaurants and directions to local attractions. A reasonable walk to Quicey Market, and the pridential Centre. You must take a Duck Tour, tickets in Prudential Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, awesome view, comfie beds, very clean, great food”
Reviews.Author: monty354
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to Quincy Market. Great location, with shopping nearby. Room was very clean, beds were extremely comfortable, just an overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite in Boston - location, parking, comfort, staff are outstanding”
Reviews.Author: calflyer80
Reviews.Content: Several years ago I inadverantly stayed at the Radisson Boston. I now return everytime in Boston without hesitiation. Its location is ideal for both business and pleasure. Self-parking is easy and inexpensive for Boston. The hotel offers parking packages. Inspite of rumors Boston is not that difficult to drive in. The rooms are comfortable. The beds are outstanding and bathrooms are spotless. The staff is polite and helpful, they will make you feel welcome. There are many fine eating establishments within very short walking distance. The neighborhood directly behind the hotel is very interesting and worth a visit. There is a funny little bar (name?) directly behind the hotel that is different and worth a visit. In summary, I have never been disappointed at this property. If you are looking for a convenient, comfortable, and no hassle place to stay the Radisson Hotel Boston will provide all that you want and more.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from things to see in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Simlav67
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family in August 09. Staff goes above and beyond to make you stay close to perfect. We got a room for 229$ average per night including buffet breakfast for 4 and parking.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is incredible”
Reviews.Author: kslaser
Reviews.Content: As a regular business guest of the Radisson for over 4 years, I won't stay anywhere else in Boston. The staff is incredible, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and your choice of valet or self parking (for a fee of course) in the attached parking garage. Located in the Theater District, it convenient to most Boston attractions, venues and restaurants. The prices are comparable with other Boston hotels which tend to have much smaller rooms. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Best travel experience in a long time!!!”
Reviews.Author: deharley
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up at the Radisson, we were treated very well. The staff was friendly, helpful and polite! Would stay again! Even the other guests were smiling. Everyone we encountered were pleasant. Richard deserves credit for going out of his way to provide directions, pointers about the city and just doing a great job. My kids (teens) couldn't wait to see him at the door to say hello! Made our 1st trip to Boston a fun experience and we can't wait to go back and stay at the Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Family Vacation (without a car)”
Reviews.Author: SFBayAreaAbc123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights while exploring Boston. Hotel is very close to Boston Commons. and T stop(s). Very convenient for getting around without a car, which avoids driving in Boston and paying a lot of money for parking. (We took a taxi from the airport - $25 for the four of us. Before continuing our vacation we rented a car on the day of departure - AVIS rental office is a 10-minute walk, Hertz is right around the corner. ) Room was very clean and the Select Comfort beds are, well, comfortable! Internet speed was great (wired). Since we arrived after room service hours, front desk provded a menu for a chinese restaurant that delivered excellent quality food to the hotel. We were so impressed that we ordered it again the next night. Overall, staff was very friendly and overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CMRAB
Reviews.Content: First time trip to Boston so didn't know where to stay. The Radisson was a good central location between Back Bay and Freedom Trail activities, which was convenient. Plus, it was near the Boston Common - a great place for a morning walk. Staff was very friendly and the hotel/room was clean; we had a great balcony that offered a gorgeous view of the city...nice pool area was a bonus for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and gorgeous room with a view”
Reviews.Author: SouthWalesRosie
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and myself booked in at the Radisson for 4 nights . We had a great deal on their website. On arrival from New York in the afternoon our credit card was declined at checkout which alarmed us greatly. The desk clerk was most helpful and dialled the helpline for us---turned out my husband's card had been cloned somehow in New York and been used at Wallmart that afternoon. We sorted the matter out and the desk clerk was very patient and the concierge was helpful and friendly too. The room was lovely---immaculately clean with a sparkling bathroom, fab views and great beds. We never ate in the restaurants but had a lovely Thai meal at Montiel just along the street and PF Changs in a side street across the road, The Rockbottom also served up a good choice of food. Do the Duck tour--it was just amazingly good fun and visit the Science Museum--we spent a whole day there. I would definately recommend The Radisson (even if the pool was a little chilly for my taste!).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrabberWheels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the better values in downtown Boston. Location is quite good -- on the south end of downtown, just a block and a half away from Boston Common, 5 minute walk to subway station. A bit noisy at night, but that'll be true with any hotel in a large city. The staff was terrific -- friendly, helpful, on top of things. No complimentary breakfast, and the hotel breakfast buffet is pretty spendy, so I'd recommend grabbing something outside the hotel. Rooms were fine -- nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable. We had some problems with the internet connection, but may have been our computer rather than the hotel. Parking is tremendously spendy -- $34/night if you self park. Pool is pretty small, but we didn't need it. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Smack in middle of Boston”
Reviews.Author: maeziet
Reviews.Content: Just stayed, unbelievably courteous and professional service, fantastic top floor room, cityline and Charles River views, outstanding room, could do without the sleep number bed, fantastic value for the money. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for seeing the city”
Reviews.Author: traveling5487
Reviews.Content: Great location...near subway, sightseeing, restaurants. We never used our car. Very comfortable room....plenty of space for 4...and the kids loved the beds! Pleasant staff; courteous and efficient. Has a nice size indoor pool. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Radisson made me want to go back to Boston”
Reviews.Author: OtterNorm
Reviews.Content: Staff were great, the room as clean as if my mother cleaned it herself... The gentleman answering our questions about visiting Boston is an excellent ambassador of Radisson and Boston. Overall score was 10/10 for the four of us. Thanks to all the staff The Denis family

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to Stay,jusy like Home....”
Reviews.Author: SailorBoy01
Reviews.Content: IF you like history Boston is the place to go, a Good Walking town..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EllenFlorida
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Convenient to everything. Room was very large. We stayed with our 2 teenage children. Room was big enough for 2 double beds and a roll away. Lots of places to eat right around the hotel. Hotel has a very nice sitting area outside on the 8th floor. Pool was adequate but had such a strong chlorine smell that we didn't use it. Fitness room was small but with new machines. Do not buy the Beantown Trolley tour that picks up outside the hotel. There are other trolley tours that are nicer. The Beantown was a horror for us which included the driver getting in an accident. The trolleys are very uncomfortable and rough riding. Seats are not for the tall or the large. Drivers are idiots. Best is to walk about 3 blocks to the Arlington T stop and ride the train where you want to gol Get the one week T pass for $15. Sleep number beds in the room were nice. Bathroom looked like it had just been redone. I would recommend especially if you have a couple of kids with you the rooms are spacious for a city. We got a good deal of only $95 a night on Hotwire. But had to pay $20/day for the rollaway. Parking is $34 per day in the adjacent garage.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre District - This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Peppppy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight to take the pressure off attending a show at the Wang and driving home. You were virtually next door to the Wang, along with many of Boston's other Theaters. Check in was a snap and we (for whatever reason) were upgraded to a Jr. suite. Two balconies, comfortable room, shower, amenities, etc. Staff were all pleasant and helpful. Checkout was just as easy and a snap to exit the hotel. We are already booked for our next show in November. You can't go wrong - check out AAA rates to save 10%.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Boston location”
Reviews.Author: ldkldkldk
Reviews.Content: We selected the Radisson based on its central location in Boston and also the good reviews we'd read about it....and it all proved correct. We liked the room a lot and the staff was friendly, very knowledgable and helpful. We even got some umbrellas loaned to us during a rainy day. The next time we go to Boston we know where we'll stay and why. Thanks Radisson! They didn't bring us hot fudge sundaes everyday, though. How come hotels don't do that?? Just kidding!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: hethmar
Reviews.Content: From the outside the Radisson was very disappointing - an ugly concrete building that you could easily mistake for a multi storey car park. The lobby looks a bit dingy and lacking in colour. The staff on the whole were ok but there was some lack of enthusiasm. The room was average. 21st floor so had a good view of the cityscape. The lifts are a bit of a pain, you have to use your room key card every time you go use them to prevent outsiders gaining access to the hotel floors. The one thing I found a bit annoying was that I had cut my foot on the holiday. When I removed a plaster in the shower my foot bled a little and some blood went on the bath towel. I left this towel out prominently so that room service could replace it. That evening I reached for the bath towel and found they had simply refolded the one with blood stains on. I thought that was carrying economy a bit far. The breakfast was so-so, the bar ok. The "business centre" consisted of 2 old computers in a room off the lobby where it was difficult to gain access to a computer due to young people apparently using face book at the time. All together an average hotel with some room noise one morning where building work was being carried out on the roof. Good, quite central location though, in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn29
Reviews.Content: We were going to Boston to see Jersey Boys and decided rather than travel home (1.5 hours), we would spend the night in Boston. Upon our arrival, we knew it would be a great place for the evening. The staff was very helpful and professional. The room was comfortable and very clean. We decided to have dinner at the restaurant located in the Radisson and although the menu was not extensive, it was fine. The next morning we had a buffet breakfast at the same restaurant and it was very good. The breakfast was not the usual "continental breakfast" offered by many chains, but the real thing. I reserved the room the same time I ordered the Jersey Boys tickets and was able to get a package which included parking, room, and breakfast for about $229.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific city and beautiful hotel, great service, great rooms, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Allijose
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night but we would have stayed longer if we could have extended our vacation. We were there to see a Broadway Production at the theater which was only 2 minutes walking distance. What a great day. I was driving a Suburban, the extended version and I was very nervous getting into Boston with it. I was afraid not being able to park it at the Radisson, well they jumped to the opportunity to park it for us. They had great service. We took a package with parking and breakfast and was very much worth every penny. The food was very good at the cute little cafÃ© place they have for breakfast (eggs, bacon to die for, and everthing else). If we ever go back to another Broadway production we will stay at the Radisson again for sure. It's right in the middle of town, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “On Night in Boston”
Reviews.Author: joematch
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great room, and great location! I love Boston; and the room was very nice with a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Boston met our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: summersthebest
Reviews.Content: We had done many online searches for hotels near Fenway Park that had an indoor pool. Those we found were out of our price range. We had stayed at the Radisson Boston a few years ago so we knew it was a quality hotel. It had everything we needed for a family with teenagers. The price was right. The location was close to the T station. The indoor pool was perfect. The hotel staff was very courteous and the hotel itself was very clean. We definately will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + excellent service throughout the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DDCBA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Radisson the last weekend of July. Great location - within walking distance of everything. 1 block from the Arlington T-stop. The service from start to finish was fast and superb. The highlight was when we were sitting in the lobby w/ our friends and a front desk clerk overheard us talking about this being a trip to celebrate our anniversary ... he came over and inquired and wished us a Happy Anniversary. That night, upon return to our room from a full day of walking the Freedom Trail, we were greeted with a delicious bottle of champagne on ice along w/ chocolate covered strawberries! It was such a wonderful surprise! All of this, on top of a low low rate of $129/night w/ a full hot breakfast!! (booked in Feb 2009 - such a STEAL!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TribalMembers
Reviews.Content: Our room was spotless and comfortable. We had free parking and breakfast in our package. The location is close to the the gardens, historic loop and the subway train. The concierge was really helpful in directing us around town.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect for our group of 11; ages 10 to 78!”
Reviews.Author: ShorelineMom
Reviews.Content: It was very comfortable both physically and aesthetically for our family of 11. We had five boys in our group ages 10 to 16 and the pool and workout room satisfied them all! We also traveled with our elderly parents who could travel to attractions from the hotel effortlessly. The park and gardens were wonderfully accessible as were ever important coffee shops whether you're a Starbucks junky or a dedicated Dunkin' Donuts fan. I WILL definately return to this property - hopefully sooner than later~ Only suggestion - breakfast in the hotel Thanks Radisson for being reliable, predictable and consistent....it matters!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last weekend when we were in town for the Steely Dan concert at the Wang theatre, just a block away. We typically stay at more high-end hotels like the Mandarin, Ritz, or Intercontinental. However, we are off to Europe next week, and we were only in town for a concert, so we decided to look for something more affordable. We could not have been more pleasantly surprised! Positives: Great location. Easy walking distance to Boston commons, Newbury St., all the major theaters, and plenty of great restaurants. Legal Seafoods, Smith & Wollensky's and plenty others are within a block or two. The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. The bed and linens could have been at any much pricier hotel. The balcony was great for some fresh air, and great views of the park and city. Also, now that smoking is prohibited in all Boston hotels, the balcony can be handy for those who enjoy an occasional cigarette. Negatives: The outside of the building is far from appealing. The need for the use of a key card in the elevator is annoying. The bathrooms are rather small, and the water pressure in the shower was below average. Room service is ony available while the restaurant is open, which can be a bummer if you want to order a snack or drink after 11 PM. The lobby area is not very appealing, but who hangs out in a lobby at the Radisson anyhow? Overall, especially considering the price, I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for clean, comfortable accommodations in Boston. On a few previous trips we stayed at "value brand" hotels in the area, and none of them came even close to the level of comfort and cleanliness of the Radisson. Next time we are in Boston on a budget, this will be our default destination.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: aligod
Reviews.Content: My stay was delightful. The location was perfect for my needs. The staff was friendly and well informed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, beautiful, spotless....”
Reviews.Author: jphizz
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty from the time we entered the lobby. We were two moms with our sons, taking them to a Green Day concert, and were treated no differently than any diplomat. The pool and gym area were beautiful...the terrace was also, spotlessly clean and beautiful. The view? AMAZING from any room. Every room has a balcony, not to mention a Sleep Number bed! I would give our stay an absolute 10! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great location in Boston for a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dinah75
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful with directions and information. The restaurant was clean, the food was very good, and again the staff was friendly and professional. If I had more time, I would have gotten tickets to a show, since you're right in the heart of the theatre district. Plenty of good restaurants around. Public transportation is within walking distance. I'm planning to go back in May 2010..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: okierunner
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson Hotel Boston for four nights and would highly recommend this hotel. It was only two blocks to the Public Gardens, Commons and the T (subway). It was a very easy to navigate anywhere in town from this starting point. The rooms were very clean. The staff was very professional. The location was very convenient. The rooms were very quiet. The price was also much less expensive compared to the other hotels in the area. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends who were looking for a hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value but an Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2FromTrona
Reviews.Content: Don't really understand the rave reviews this place has got on here. This is an OK hotel but to say it's the best hotel somebody's ever stayed at (as one review does) makes me wonder what sort of places they've been staying at. On the plus side the location is good and only a 5 minute walk to the subway (toss up whether Arlington or Boylston station is closer). Rooms are a good size and are clean (although bathrooms are on the small side). We stayed on their "Free Friday" deal so I would say the place was good value (if I'd paid full price for both nights I wouldn't be so happy). Negatives are average service (not bad but certainly not memorable), dark dingy lobby, terrible looking building outside (the parking garage over the road has more architectural merit). And then there are the beds and air conditioning. The air conditioning units are very loud. We avoided using it the first night but it was so hot the second night we gave in and were woken up every time it came on. The unit seemed to wait until the room was really hot and then cool it until it was freezing and then start the process over again. As for the beds, I realize some people love the sleep number thing but it took us one night to realize the controls were screwed up and the left side control was actually adjusting the right side of the bed. My daughter's bed seemed to have a mind of its own; set it to one number and five minutes later it was a totally different number. Give it a week and we might have figured it out. I can only compare it to a Marriott where they have invested in good quality mattresses and avoided all the gimicky gadgets that are fine until they stop working properly. Overall, if the price was right (and it was a season that didn't call for air conditioning) I would still consider the hotel again. A couple of suggestions on eating. Fajitas & Ritas is a loud, lively, cheap choice for great fajitas and margaritas (imagine that!). Beware the portion sizes - we ordered a pile of extra sides and were ready to explode when we left the place. Stick with the basic chicken fajitas and you'll have more than enough food. At a more pricey end of the scale, the Legal Seafoods location opposite the hotel is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MurmursIRL
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in this excellent hotel with my wife and two youngs kids (2 & 5), the rooms are large and there was plenty of space for the kids to unwind play when we were not out enjoiying the atractions of Boston. Stay was part of a 16 day vacation to Boston and Upstate New York, we got a great deal from the Hotel which included breakfast and parking for $200 per night. Staff were excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a ideal position”
Reviews.Author: kelly123D3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with family. Hotel was very clean and the staff were helpfull. I liked the idea that you needed you hotel key card to access the lifts for security. Great location for hotel everything is so near by

Reviews.Title: “Great first trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Casualtraveler02
Reviews.Content: Not having ever been to Boston, it was nice that we had a great motel, centrally located in the heart of the city. It was so easy to get around. The staff here were so helpful. Our room was large enough for two adults and three children, they loved the pool. The beds were extremely comfortable, I will definitely stay at this motel when traveling to Boston in the future.

Reviews.Title: “PRIME LOCATION AND GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTeena
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate--room was large, clean and the bed was comfy. It is close to the Commons, subway and many, many excellent restaurants. We would highly recommend the Radisson Hotel Boston and will be staying there on all our future visits--our son and family live just across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: TIA1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights early July and was pleased with the location and thought the bed and duvet were especially comfortable. I did find the bathroom configuration a bit annoying, but I was pleased overall. The staff were all very nice and accomodating - my son realized he lost his stuffed animal and I knew we didn't take it out of the room, I figured since he slept with it, perhaps it was in the sheets and it was unnoticed at the time they changed the sheets. I went to the front desk and explained the situation. Approx. 30 minutes later they called the room to say they were still looking and they did not forget us, approx. 30 minutes after that they called to say they had the stuffed animal at the desk. I was very impressed and pleased with this. I agree the parking is high (but self-parking is less at $34/per day) but overall (and compared to other hotel prices) I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: WiltonOak
Reviews.Content: Traveled for a weekend to catch a SOX game and do the Freedom trail with teenage daughter. 2 night package with breakfast and parking was excellent choice. Staff was friendly and accommodating; room was quiet with updated bathroom. Indoor pool and outdoor sun deck were great for break in-between full day or touring and night of baseball. Excellent access to the T for getting around town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Family Stay including short walk to Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: 007TravelDog
Reviews.Content: I can attest to a fine experience for our family of 5 (kids age15, 12 & 9). We arrived by Train (South Station) and took a cab the short distance (6 blocks?) to hotel. Check in was fast & courteous. Extra sheets were brought right away for the portable cot we travel with. The elevator requires a room key so only guests can use it; a nice measure of security protection although we never felt uncomfortable day or night. The room was spacious & of standards we'd expect with desk & free internet; the bathroom was very nice & very clean and well appointed with bright white tile. The location is just a few blocks (less than 5 minutes walk) to the start of the freedom trail where the park service provides a wonderful guided walking tour with tons of history describing the people & the times & the buildings from colonial times through revolutionary times. Our kids got a little lost with too much information but as an adult I found it fascinating to listen to stories about John Hancock, Paul Revere & Sam Adams who were long time chums. We made the walk to/from Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market & the harbor (aquarium & whale watching pier) several times during our stay. Only once did we take a cab to go out to eat & we were sorry we did; the cabby took the freeway around the perimeter of where we were going & it cost about $14 for what should have been a 15 block $6 trip. Walking is pleasant in Boston; be sure to stroll through the classy homes on Beacon Hill. Maps are readily available on counters everwhere. Our stay included Harborfest & the 4th of July Fireworks (highly recommend it). It is a short walk (about 7 blocks?) from this location to a good view of the fireworks on the Charles River between Boston & Cambridge. Everyone has to walk anywhere near this event as there are thousands of people but it was a very pleasant experience as they closed several streets to accomodate & we were in bed 15 minutes after the fireworks with no car parking issues, no crowded trains etc. The Boston Pops Music is amped up (live) throughout the park & its really neat. This hotel is as close as any to this activity. We also walked to the Copley Square shopping area near the Prudential Tower. We rented a car for travel to the coast & what we thought was an easy return drive got us a few miles out in the wrong direction as the I-90 turnpike has very limited exits. This could have been avoided had we gotten directions from a local. The pool area was nice. Pool was a little cold even for a Northern Climate family and there was no hot tub to warm up in. The pool level deck has a huge roof top sun deck that would be perfect for a spa. A similar experience at a hotel in San Antonio was made very memorable with a couple of large spas on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest July 4th @ the Radisson Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: nyc1mxm
Reviews.Content: We planned a weekend in Boston not knowing much about where to stay. We selected the Radisson because of it's price and location. Quite frankly we weren't expecting much because of the low rate. However, we were pleasantly surprised. Not only does this hotel have a great location, walking to everywhere, the service was five stars. The staff was pleasant and professional. The room was like new and spacious. The food was excellent. We found it easy to get to Fenway, all of the historical sites and the Fireworks show on the Charles River. We highly recommend the Radisson and look forward to going back. A must stay...

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: onthegoindy
Reviews.Content: Good location to Boston attractions but not as good as other hotels which cost more. Trolley stops close and that's the way to see the city and sites. Good overall service with nice pool and avg. workout area. Very good buffet breakfast but pricey. Limited WIFI. Very convenient parking deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: murphman
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel in downtown Boston. There is a Starbucks,Subway, Dunkin Donuts and many other places to have a meal or desert close to the hotel. We walked to Quincy Market on July 4th and other areas of Boston. Boston is a very beautiful city and we were impressed how clean the city was.The only drawback from this hotel is the price for parking. 34.00 !!! Way too much money to park. I could not imagine staying a week here and paying the parking fee!

Reviews.Title: “It was..well...OK.”
Reviews.Author: mr.weinerdog
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights as part of a business trip, but brought the family (wife + one 10 year old) along. As stated by others, the location is great, and the rooms renovated. The sheets and duvet are nice, the bathroom nice and new. We did feel the cleaning could have been better- dust along all the baseboards, fingerprints on the doors, and the carpet, while newer, was stained and dingy looking. The same unfortunate choice of beige carpeting was used in the elevator as well- and that was filthy. During our 4 night stay, it seemed our room was cleaned very quickly and not very well at that (especially the bathroom). Also- they charged us 20$ a day to have a mini fridge in the room, which seemed a little excessive to me. Why do you need to pay extra for what you get for free in any roadside motel at a fraction of the room rate? Should also note that the pool and fitness area are ridiculously small and dated. I always thought that it was a health dept. rule that you were to shower before going in a pool- but here there were no poolside showers- or change rooms! Just a small pool with peeling concrete. A few kids in there and really it was full. For the size of the hotel, the fitness center was way too small as well. Overall...well it was OK. Nice bedding, quiet rooms. Decent price. But some questionable cleaning, charges, and pool area. I do recommend a high floor, not just for the view but for the street noise as well. It would seem this hotel is en route to the hospitals, and ambulance sirens go on...and on...throughout the night. A high floor and keeping the ac fan on solves this problem nicely. Would I stay here again? Only if it was a great deal. Otherwise, probably try our luck elsewhere. Not to be overly nega

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: finskiLohja
Reviews.Content: good location ,good service, big room to family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: cwatNyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and three kids as we visited colleges in the Boston area. The room was spacious and clean and the bathroom a decent size and updated nicely. I recommend a high floor to take advantage of the view. The pool and fitness area includes a nice deck. While the workout area was tiny, the machines were updated and working. My kids liked the pool. If you are a runner, Boston Common Park is just steps away. The location is perfect near the Arlington subway stop. We were able to reach many of the major colleges including Harvard, Boston University, and Boston College for our tours by train. The subway also gets you easily (15 minutes) to the aquarium and science museum (25 minutes). The staff was great, friendly and responsive. One exception was a female concierge whom my wife described as surly and barely helpful. Easily overcome by the use of the free internet access available in the business center. Valet parking with in-out privileges will cost you about $39 per day. I suggest self parking and using public transit as much as possible. Room service options are limited and there are the usual suspects of chain restaurants nearby. For more of a local flavor walk up Charles Street past Boston Common to the Paramount Restaurant (quarter mile). They serve great food at reasonable prices (be prepared to wait during weekend brunch hours). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Chinanomad
Reviews.Content: We have visited Boston many times staying at the Westin, Marriott and Hilton. The Radisson was as good, if not better, than these other hotels and the price was substantially less. The hotel offered packages that included parking and breakfast which was reasonable. The service was excellent and you cannot beat the location. It is in the heart of the theater district and two blocks away from the Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a expensive city”
Reviews.Author: riskyman
Reviews.Content: The Radisson in Boston is a good hotel in a very expensive city. We got a $145 rate. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. Clean and properly furnished. The location is kind of weird during the night but still safe. It was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ladybug810
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Excellent location...could walk just about anywhere, and only a few blocks from the subway stop. -Clean rooms -Friendly service -Yummy room service with reasonable prices (all things considered) -Very tall shower heads (yay!!!) -Thick walls -Gym Cons: -The sleep number beds are not comfortable. I know they're popular, so maybe it's just me, but I felt like I was sleeping on an air mattress. -I really wished there were a second sink outside the bathroom. It was me, my husband, and my step-daughter--and plenty of times I was really wishing we had a second sink. Overall, an excellent value and we would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ElPresidenteHalifax
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel Boston is a hotel like the others as far as a building goes, but what sets it apart from the rest is the service. From Jill in reservations willing to bend over backwards to make sure you have a perfect room to John H. at the Concierge desk making dinner reservations and printing out show times for the local theatre. I am from Halifax and I have been to Boston twice this year already and planning a third trip in the fall. On my first trip this year my friend and I were out and about and running a little late for our flight. We still had to stop by the hotel and grab our luggage. Due to the 1 hour cut off for international flights...I knew we would never make it on time. John H. was ready to help when I called. He checked us in with Air Canada from the hotel and had our bags at the curb ready for our arrival. We made it to the airport 15 minutes late but were able to get on our flight! That is fast thinking and great service! Boston is a beautiful city, full of culture and has many friendly folks! The hotel is in the centre of it all...it's great to wake up and head over to the local Starbuck's for a coffee and then a stroll in the public gardens before returning to a nice hot shower...anyway...enough of my stories...you should try it for yourself...ask for Jill, she'll take great care of you!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location, what else could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Chloe014
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson the week of June 15th and were very satisfied. We were intially scheduled to stay at a different hotel but based on my fellow "tripadvisor" reviews we changed our hotel to the Radisson. I was traveling on business with my family. The hotel met all of our needs. The location was convenient to my business location and my family enjoyed the gym and pool as well as the easy access to the area attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel is your are looking clean and updated rooms, courteous staff and accessability to local sites. The only downside parking is expensive at $34.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LaurelCF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before during the Marathon and have always found it to be very comfortable and in a convenient location for us. The internet was free and quick and easy to use. The bed was extremely comfortable--never even played around with the sleep numbers. Lots of elevators, convenient parking in the ramp attached. Walk out the door and there are a number of restaurants nearby, as well as a Dunkin Donuts and a Seven-Eleven kind of place. You're a short walk to Boston Garden and Commons and the Downtown Crossing Shopping District. The T is close. The staff was very friendly and efficient. We didn't use the pool or eat in the restaurant. Our only complaint was that the walls were kind of thin--heard noise from next door, but it may have been because we had a room with connecting doors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DGEMaryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Boston convenient to everything-- a few blocks from Boston Common and in the midst of numerous restaurants, shops, and historic sites. For points further away, several T subway stops are nearby. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious for a city hotel. The well-designed bathroom appeared to be recently remodeled with Euro-style fixtures. Plumbing and climate control were excellent. We did not try the restaurant or room service. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Also, unlike most high end hotels, wireless internet is FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: Cantabass
Reviews.Content: I attended the Boston Early Music Festival hosted by the Radisson Hotel. I chose to bring my husband and seven year old daughter with me. I participated in festival events while they enjoyed the New England Aquarium and Science Museum. We met up for meals at the Rustic Kitchen and Theater Cafe and enjoyed some pool time in the evening. The Radisson Hotel accommodations met all of our needs and provided us with an affordable but luxurious weekend to enjoy Boston on both a personal and professional level.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SpainBln
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Boston. The service was great and the staff were very friendly and kind, the room we were in was huge and very clean. We were given all the attentions we needed and the location in the city was very good too. I can't do nothing but recommend this hotel. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: slaw17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for me as my daughter lives close by and we are able to connect quickly with her and access so many wonderful restaurants and fun locations to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterMoray
Reviews.Content: Large room with 2 double beds. Efficient reception and an enjoyable stay. The view of Boston was interesting from room as we tried to identify buildings. The hotel is fairly central and close to Common. I would avoid using room phone as expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and accommondations where just great. Enjoyed our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: khoblock
Reviews.Content: Evertything about our stay was pleasant. The staff, the rooms, the sleep beds are the best. Service was great and the rate was reasonable. We will be returning. Karen and Mike Hoblock

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Ingredient for a Boston Break.”
Reviews.Author: travelBliss13
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this hotel, which allowed us to settle in and enjoy the experience. It is perfectly located - around the corner from Boston Common - and in the theatre district. All aspects of the hotel service were quick, efficient and friendly and contributed to the homely feeling. The room - and great bathroon - were spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean. We got lovely breakfasts and they varied the menu each day. The pool was a great bonus and the fitness centre was often in use. The business center, in the lobby, was often busy and it was great to have high speed internet access. This hotel contributed to a fantastic break in Boston and we would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “was great in 2006....and it still is in 2009!”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: 2006, Priceline (name your own price) gave us this hotel for a weekend. Fell in love with the balconies. Took us 3 years to get back to boston, but there was no doubt where we would stay..at the Radisson! Requested a top floor room, and or a suite and was given both. The suites are located next tot he elevators, which was explained to me at check-in. We decided to give it a try...you can hear the pulley system from the elevator, but didn't bother us..Crystal at the front desk called us after we checked in to tell us, if the noise bothered us, she could move us..that was a nice touch!! The beds were fun to play with...not sure if the sleep-number system is for me..but I least I got to try something new!
