Suite had 2 tv's, 2 balconies, a large living room with work-desk, small bathroom with shower stall..Our plan included the breakfast in the morning..ehh..it was fair, but adequate...I think the price was $15 pp, but being included in the price of the room, it didn't matter how much it was... The "T" is 2 blocks away..hotel is located in the Theater district..many, many places to eat. Chinatown is about a block away form the hotel. We took a walk through Boston Commons and just love the area. Fenway Park 15 minute ride on the "T". Can't say enough about the hotel--great views, always something to do, and if you can't find anything to do...just sit and people watch! Pool/fitness center are adequate. I liked the outdoor patio too.Anytime we walked in or out of the door, a staff member always gave us smile and a hello! Seemed the elevators were a bit slow...

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: lewiejay
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for Boston. Our room was generous in size, with comfortable bed and well appointed bathroom. We were able to get a competitive rate, which included our room, in and out parking and breakfast buffet for 2 for $199.

Reviews.Title: “Family's First But Certainly Not Last Trip to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: TheRobinsons620
Reviews.Content: Recently, my family and I made our first trek to the Boston area for our 2009 vacation. We opted for the Radisson because of the location, the price point and prior reviews from others. We certainly were not disappointed and were thoroughly pleased with the hotel, the location, and the service that we received while we were there. The concierge, John "JB" Bradley, at the hotel was like none other that we had experienced and we have traveled various places in the USA and internationally. He was absolutely wonderful and gave my family the best suggestions of things to do, when to do them and how to do them in the area. He made such a wonderful impression on my two little girls and parents with children, you know that goes a long way. Smile. My hubby and I were pleased and will certainly visit the Radisson hotel again the next time we are in the Boston area. We will be back! Smile. And before I forget, The Sleep Number beds were absolutely heavenly. The kids even commented on how well they slept. You definitely can not go wrong with this hotel. It's the total package, for sure. Enjoy! Smile.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better location, room and service”
Reviews.Author: luter
Reviews.Content: Located in heart of downtown, no need for a car (although we rented one and didn't even use it). Room was big, beautiful and spotless. Everyone super friendly and attentive. Bed comfortable and view on 22nd floor fabulous. We felt like royalty staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, efficient staff, very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: kellycal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night . The room was very clean and smelled great. I would rate this as a higher end hotel given the ammenities and service. All staff was friendly and very helpful. I would definitely return to the Boston Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Boston Radisson”
Reviews.Author: tampaguy44
Reviews.Content: The hotel's central location was very convenient to everything we wanted to do. The T-stop and the trolley stop very close for all other sightseeing ventures. Concierge John "JB" Bradley was the best. Gave us several eating recommendations, plus was helpful getting us trolley tickets and other things. Overall, he was the best we have ever encountered. I could go on and on, but space is limited. Suffice it to say, we were delighted to stay here while in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: mainer59
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, wonderful customer service, conveniently located in the theater district and near several colleges/universities. Easy walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Better than even the best reviews indicated”
Reviews.Author: hardymum
Reviews.Content: We just spent an overnight at the Radisson boston. I had read the reviews here and expected to find something "off" that perhaps wasn't as great as others indicated -- not true. It was a great stay. When I emailed with a question during the booking process, I received prompt replies and on check in we were given our room earlier than normal checkin without any hesitation. the rooms were clean, the beds were good, though I'm not sure what I really think of the sleep number beds. The balconies are a nice feature; you can go outdoors to enjoy the view, look down at rooftops nearby or see the sunset. The "railings" are concrete, so small children should be okay...my 5 year old was not allowed out there without an adult in case she tried to boost herself up to see over, though. A nice feature about the hotel that isn't mentioned in the reviews is that the pool is large enough for lots of people to enjoy it, and that there are two doors off the pool to the rooftop decks where there are tables and chairs to enjoy; we saw someone doing his morning stretches out there, a nice idea. The bathrooms were clean and the supplies were nicely presented and unscented but rich. My only small complaint is that like many hotels, there is a sign asking for you to re-use your towel, and we invariably go through them and need more. I know it's in the guise of asking you to conserve energy and resources, but I'm on vacation, okay? :-) The breakfast buffet was yummier than I've seen elsewhere. Eggs with cheese not overdone, biscuits & gravy, bacon, great potatoes with onions, pastry, waffles, hash, etc. our waiter was very considerate and thoughtful, including catching us at the elevator when my daughter left her "blankie" behind. All in all, a great place to stay overnight. It's very close to Chinatown and the common and public gardens. there's a legal seafood across the street on Stuart and a Cold Stone ice cream (pricey but good) in the next block up Charles St. Also a P.F.Changs in that block. Be aware though that the free internet is not wi-fi. I was disappointed that we couldn't connect with a handheld and wished I'd brought a laptop to plug in. I feel very satisfied with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean, and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night over memorial day weekend. The hotel is very clean and in a great location in Boston Common area. You can basically walk to everything in Boston from this hotel. The hotel offers great views from the rooms of the Boston skyline. The rooms are pretty basic, very clean, nice bathroom, and a balcony to take great pictures of the city. The only negative is $34 a night for parking. It was well worth my $100 for the night, and I would definately go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful to children!”
Reviews.Author: Disney2012
Reviews.Content: Great stay in the beautiful city of Boston. Concierge was wonderful and made us feel at home and welcomed immediately upon entering the doors! Very knowledgeable and efficient staff. All staff, EVERYONE, was friendly and smiling! The location of the hotel was just a little off the tourist path but just minutes away by foot to the "T" or Trolley. AWESOME time in Boston and this hotel was such a GREAT choice. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convient location.”
Reviews.Author: showme2traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to Beacon Hill, Boston Commons and the theaters. Short walk to the T. Several restaurants close by. Hotel restaurant pricey for breakfast. Concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value - could not have picked better”
Reviews.Author: lsjJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Boston and we could not have picked a better location to stay. Boston city centre within walking distance. Numerous restaurants close by. The room was spacious and beds very comfortable which was wonderful as we stayed six nights. The outside of the building is deceptively ugly and the ample rooms more than make up for this. Free internet access and a helpful concierge also added to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gslink
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. We were either within walking distance to everything we wanted to do in Boston or we sometimes took advantage of the T which is about a block away (we used the week link pass - great value). The staff at the hotel are wonderful. I forgot my hat but they are well organized and will keep lost and found items for 30 days. I was able to have it shipped to me (my expense of course - my fault anyway). Very happy with all the service. We did the breakfast/parking package and I think its well worth the extra per night. Parking is always dicey in Boston and having it in a package is great. Breakfast is very good. Its a buffet but it was a little different each day and the hot items were of good quality, pancakes, eggs, sausage, etc. I love oatmeal and it is very good with lots of fixins. One minor thing is that the bathrooms are tiny. I smacked my leg on the sink trying to get dressed. Sitting on the toilet, you can touch the shower curtain and the sink easily to try and give you a perspective and I'm a short man (5'6"). Past reviews mentioned that some of the balconies are blocked and I asked about that and the answer is that they block them if high school/college age students will be using the room and sometimes they don't get in there to unblock them so if you want the balcony door to work just ask if it isn't open. Nice view especially from up high (we were on the 21st floor). Also it is a quiet hotel which you can enhance by asking for a non-connected room to the room next to it. Technology building is across the street and it has a few fast food places and a Startbucks so you don't always have to dine expensively on some nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room , great value- dont be put off by the ugly architecture”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a 3 night stay in a lovely king bedroom on a high floor. The room was very spacious , comfortable with an updated and well appointed bathroom- I loved the deep bath.The room had a small balcony which gave the option to let in some cool air on a hot day via a sliding door.The TV was old style but lots of channels. All the furnishings were really comfortable, the sleep number bed was fine but I wouldn't rush out and buy one! The room was quiet both from the street and between rooms- another great feature. I booked several months ago so got a fabulous rate on the "business plan" that included $15 towards breakfast- the full hot buffet was an extra $2.80 plus tip and the hot offerings were changed every morning which is a nice touch. Internet was free and there were also computers in a small room off the lobby.It is a short walk to both the Boylston and New England T stops. You can't help notice how cheery all the staff are-everyone you encounter will smile and acknowledge you- another pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “We were more than satisfied with our stay at the Radisson Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Legendair
Reviews.Content: This hotel has come a long way from once being the Howard Johnson 57 Park Plaza. The Radisson has done an excellent job updating their rooms. Our room happened to be an over sized room which was spacious and comfortable. The lobby could use some work. The sundeck was a retreat from the city. This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to anywhere in Boston. I am a travel agent and have stayed in most hotels in Boston and this hotel I would recommend. I still haven't figured out my sleep number yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price, Free Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: essendon2000
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7.00am expecting to wait until 3.00pm for a room and we were immediately given a free upgrade to a suite which was great. We paid approximately $100USD per night which was good value for a hotel of this calibre. Very comfortable beds which you can adjust to the softness/firmness of your choice. Good gym which had 2 x treadmills, 2 x cross trainers and free weights and good indoor pool. Would highly recommend this hotel. Quite a small bathroom but was ok. When you flushed the toilet sounded like a 747 taking off.

Reviews.Title: “Family breakfast and parking-great deal”
Reviews.Author: BlackLab47
Reviews.Content: We chose the Radisson Boston for its close proximity to Emerson College. This turned out to be a great choice for us for our 2-night stay. The room was large with very comfortable sleep- number beds. Very short walk to Emerson (1 block) if you cut through City Place. Boylston subway stop close by (green line), as is Boston Common/Public Garden. Faneuil Hall, North End are walkable distances. Our kids enjoyed the indoor pool and next to it there is a spacious outdoor deck with a nice city view. We chose the "Family breakfast and parking" rate, which was a money-saver for our family of 4-breakfast was excellent and Theatre cafe is very nice with attentive staff. The breakfast included a full hot buffet for four (regular hot buffet rate is $16.95) and parking until 6 pm on day of checkout (I think the rate to park in their garage is $37/night). We paid $216/nite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, location”
Reviews.Author: ibbyCalif
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Easter weekend. Hotel borders Chinatown and is in the Theater District (there's a theater in the hotel). Boston Common is 2 blocks away. Area was safe. Hotel was clean, modern, w good staff. Our rooms had balconies w great city views,sleep number beds, in room coffee maker, safe, iron, cable tv w lots of channels,free wifi, nice bathrooms, I THINK there's no charge to dial out on the phones. Good gym, indoor pool, and a concierge desk.They have a restaurant, didn't eat there. Lots of dining options nearby. Outside of a siren now/then, hotel was quiet. 1 mile ($6 cab ride) to South Station, catch Amtrak,commuter trains, buses, and a Silver Line bus to airport / convention ctr. from there. Bus takes about 20 mins to get 2 airport from South Sta. If u take the Blue line train from the airport, u need to connect 2 the Green line. Arlington Station is closest 2 hotel, about 4 blocks away. NO ELEVATORS. U will have to schleep your bags up the stairs. Otherwise, this is a good station to get to anywhere , Fenway is about 3 stops away. Glad I did not rent a car,parking charge is an obscene $30. Got good AAA rate. Join the rewards program (free) and get points for future stays at any of their locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Sheil21
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Boston and my stay at the Radisson was great. We got a fantastic price of $109 a night and having booked "bargain prices" before I was a little hesitant when we arrived but we did get what we requested, a high floor room with a great view of the city. My only complaint was that they did not have a king bed available when we checked in, we could have moved but choose not to. The bath amenities are nice - deep soaker tub and other upgrades and I think most (if not all) rooms have a balcony, which is nice to get some air in the room. About 2 blocks from the T and Boston Common it was very easy to get around the city. In the transportation building across the street there are several fast food type places (nothing big name I can remember), a Dunkin Dounuts, Starbucks, California Pizza Kitchen and PF Changs. We went to PF Changs and had a very nice dinner. There is also a 7-Eleven near the hotel, which we would usually stop at on our way back from the Boyleston T stop. Highly recommend the Intermission Tavern and NY Pizza, sadly can't say the same for the Sweetwater (Grill/Bar) - what kind of place says "kitchen open until 1" and then has last call at 12:30? All in all a great place to stay. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel or use the pool so I can't speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson Boston Delivers!”
Reviews.Author: CT_Family_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Super location in Boston's theater district, 2 blocks from Boylston T stop. Got excellent deal on a package with room and parking included. Nice, clean room with balcony and view. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TeeVermont
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I spent 3 nights in boston to look at schools. If it hadn't been for the staff at this hotel we would have been totally lost on how to get around and what to do. They were great. The Concierge John Hallett was the best. The hotel is very nice with parking this is a big deal in Boston. They also have a very nice pool area. The location is the best, close to everything, shopping, restaurants. The morning that we checked out I went out to my car and notice that my rear tire was so low on air that I could not drive it to the gas station. I went back into the hotel and the girls at the front desk new just what to do. They called maintenance and there was a guy waiting for me with a air compressor to blow up my tire I could not believe it. I will stay at this hotel everytime I come to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Superk16
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for your money! Booked a package (room, breakfast buffet, parking) through the hotel and couldn't believe what we got for out money. The room was a junior suite even though we requested just a regular king room and was very room and clean. The room even included a balcony. The location was perfect as everything was within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It was easily one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: dobtv
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we were treated to the best service and accomodations. The staff was excellent in their assistance and advice. We were on a bargain package rate but we still had our every request met - top floor, two queen beds and a beautiful city view. The room was terrific - very comfortable and spacious and extremely clean. We were given great suggestions by the people at the information desk regarding things to do and how to get there. We got a bonus at the end of our stay when we were told we would be allowed to keep our car in the parking garage until 6P - thus allowing us another day to enjoy Boston. Our experience was highly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kinnittyman
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a 5 night stay in the Radisson Hotel Boston and undoubtedly the most attractive aspect of this hotel is the location. Within easy walking distance of everywhere-Faneuil Hall, Fenway, Prudential, basically everywhere. To be fair my dealings with hotel staff were minimal-basically all i did was check in, check out and orgainse a trip to Wrentham Village with concierge but that was all handled well enough other than the fact I got overcharged by $10 for the bus to Wrentham. Other than that everything was fine. Lovely double room with two queen beds and power shower in bathroom. A food court is located just across the road with the usuals-Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Sbarro etc wtih a 7-eleven next door to that. Lots of places to eat in the near vacinity and the T if needed is close by at the Common or on Arlington St. Really had a fantastic trip and the location of the hotel was such a bonus in this. Probably a tad expensive at over $400 each for 5 nights so might pay to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: Radler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family 7-10 April. The appearance is very much 1960s 'concrete jungle'. Upside: the hotel is in a good position, it is clean and well priced. Downside: the reception staff are not in the least bit interested in you. There were a few occasions when they could have engaged us in conversation but they did not. Overall we had a great time in Boston and would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !”
Reviews.Author: Tunakel
Reviews.Content: What a jewel of a find. We were not expecting what a fabulous deal/value we received at this hotel. All the servises avaliable were top notch, and our room was just the best. I can not explain what a delight it was to deal with professional staff members on all levels. We will be returning soon, and will not look for any other hotel in the future. Thank you " Radisson".

Reviews.Title: “unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: effieQueens_NewYork
Reviews.Content: stayed april 10th through the 13th. Disappointed given the reviews I had read on numerous web sites. Room was simple, descent, average to small, with small bathroom. Liked the white bedding. Cons - Adjoining bathrooms could be heard in our roof when sinks were running or toilets were flushing. Heating system was so loud that it woke us in middle of night. Lobby dimly lit, and tired looking. Fitness center consisted of 5 machines, and some free weights overlooking the pool. Pros - Centrally located to many tourist areas. Self parking adjacent to hotel very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could want in a business hotel, pretty much”
Reviews.Author: thehankster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Great downtown location close to the T, restaurants, shops, bars, whatever you could possibly want. Rooms recently remodeled, it appeared, and nice. Bed was comfortable -- I love Sleep Number beds -- and the desk was large enough on which to get some serious work done. My room had a balcony -- I think all the rooms have one, but I'm not sure; it was nothing special and fairly small, but it's nice to have a balcony nonetheless, and it's a rarity in downtown Boston. My only complaint is that you could hear a lot of noise from the hall inside the room. It wasn't deafening, by any means, and I wasn't awakened by it, but I did think it was odd. Pool could've been a bit warmer. And a bit deeper. The shallow end was 3 ft, and it seemed like the deep end was about 3.25 feet. But it was fine; I went swimming a couple nights. Exercise room looked nice enough; basic, but gets the job done, though I didn't try it out. The internet (complimentary) was extraordinarily slow when I arrived, but on the second night I received a note under my door saying their internet connection would be taken down that evening for upgrades to their bandwidth, and -- wow -- it made a big difference. Printed out my boarding passes in the business center -- for free -- and it was easy and quick. The Theater Cafe has a fairly reasonable breakfast buffet (about $14.95, as I recall) with your basic "American breakfast" staples: eggs, meats, pancakes, potatoes, pastries, etc. Service is good, and it ought to be, as there were only a few other customers in there the two times I ate there. I was not wowed by the buffet, but it was pretty good -- and given how expensive food can be at hotels it was actually a pretty good bargain. Service was great. Very friendly staff. Early check-in was no problem, and I don't think I've ever had a quicker check-in experience, actually. They were ready for me. When I arrived, there were approximately 1 million people waiting for the elevator for a job fair that was taking place that day, and I had to wait about 5 minutes before I could actually get a place in an elevator (this only happened that first day). All the job-seekers got off on the sixth floor, leaving only me and a lady who immediately quipped "I'd be really annoyed if it (the number of job-seekers) weren't so sad." Amen.

Reviews.Title: “best deal in boston”
Reviews.Author: livdog23
Reviews.Content: I have been many, many, times to Boston for events or visits with friends, but this trip and hotel made me say "wow". The balcony views for great ( stayed on the 24th of 24 floors), the room itself was what you expect in a upscale hotel. In the morning I walked the common and really enjoyed the surroundings. I do have to say that everyone that work there from the desk to the maids were friendly, but no one went out of their way to help out. The one thing I have is parking, why would a hotel not just roll that price into the price of the rooml, expect to pay the extra for the parking. The one other thing was that unless you are a single traveler the bathroom was a bit on the smaller side. I could not believe how badly marked the directions back to interstate were . I just think that it's that way in Boston. I booked my room thru a travel discount site, that is the way to go. Everything is within walking distance or a short subway stop away...overall a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great view, LOVE BOSTON!”
Reviews.Author: AsylumGal
Reviews.Content: They put is in a Jr Suite....roomy and clean. Friendly staff, great location. Balcony and sleep number bed.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: galwaylass
Reviews.Content: only stayed here one night on our way back from skiing. very clean rooms, lovely breakfast. couldn't fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonyes
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this Radisson for three days over the weekend. It was certainly a pleasant hotel stay, but not luxurious. Staff was exceptionally friendly, breakfast buffet was very nice, and the balcony we had overlooking the city was a nice touch. I enjoyed the pool, but it is a tiny thing and offers depths of only 5 ft. The room felt cramped, and the sleep number beds were kind of fun, but not spectacular. I made the mistake of getting supper from the hotel's Theater Cafe- it was awful. And needlessly expensive, of course. I guess that is why- with the exception of breakfast- this restaurant is always empty. My recommendation: take a walk to "Rock Bottom" down the street. Great service, great food, great beer. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: BCains
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, situated between Boston Common and downtown shopping such as; The Prudential & Newberry Street all within walking distance. Not only did we have great service, clean rooms and all the necessary amenities, we had a room with a view overlooking the city towards The Prudential and John Hancock Building, it was beautiful. The hotel is close to many restaurants and bars (original cheers), aswell as a food court for simple take aways and treats, it also have free internet in the business centre. If i were to return to Boston i'd come back here again, thats for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: helstravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the theatre district and handy for a diversity of places to eat as well as walkable of so many sites and access to the subway. The staff were more than helpful with every aspect of our stay from start to finish. The room was excellent and the tea, coffee and all the facilities provided in the room could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Boston”
Reviews.Author: BarryBarnstable
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in an ideal place in Boston. Stayed here for 6 nights over Valentines and enjoyed both the city and hotel. Location : Great location close to many restaurants and within easy walking distance of several bars. Just a single block from Boston Common which is a great starting point to see the city. There's a food court across the road from hotel where you can get Pizza's until late at night or Starbucks in the early morning. Being in the Theatre district it's ideal for those who are visiting just to see a show but if like us its food and drink in a safe area you want, its perfect. Rooms : Our room had a balcony which made the room feel open and bright, unfortunately these doors were sealed shut but I heard other rooms weren't, so check when booking is this is something you want. The room is a decent size with two king size beds both with the sleep easy system which sounded like a gimmick but was great. We had all the usual amenities (iron, hair-dryer, kettle) and plenty of TV stations. We were on the 20th floor and apart from randomly hearing the usual US sirens throughout the week the hotel was quiet. Staff: The friendly reception staff were efficient and Housekeeping kept the room clean and tidy. Restaurant / Barstaff were also efficient whether clearing our plates or serving evening drinks. Additional : We only had a car for a couple of days so didn't opt for a room/parking package but the costs each evening were $39 which although seemed steep are pretty much the same as other parking garages in Boston. Would be better if they provided a bit more of a discount to guests. Taxi from Logan airport to the hotel costs $30. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel mainly for the location but also for the quality / price. Very enjoyable stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody was smiling and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: SteveBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very nice rooms and baths and is very comfortable and convenient. You can walk through the Transportation Building across the street to get to the subway station at Boylston. The nicest hotel in Boston for the money. Close to the theater district and the Public Garden. Lots of restaurants in the area. When I went down to the lobby at 7 AM all the staff were smiling and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Cmwright05
Reviews.Content: I have to start of first by saying that this hotel really impressed me! I have stayed at numerous hotels in Boston, but by far, this hotel has been the best! I booked a room for my boyfriend and I as a surprise for Valentine's Day. With this booking, I received a tremendous amount of value for the price. First of all, I was upgraded to a junior suite without even requesting it. Secondly, we had free parking with all day/night access. Then we had chocolate covered strawberries and a big bottle of champagne delivered to the room. To top everything off, the next day, we had a buffett breakfast, which was also included in the price. All of this, including the overnight stay cost only $169+tax. I thought this was a remarkable price considering that other overpriced hotels in Boston, normally do not include anything at all. The staff at Radisson was very professional and courteous. I felt like we were treated with utmost respect the whole time of our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. The location was great too, as plenty of restaurants, clubs, theatres were within walking distance. My boyfriend and I are already planning our stay with Radisson for Valentine's Day 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Radisson Boston”
Reviews.Author: karen h
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Radisson Boston for a conference with a co-worker. Attached parking garage is very convenient, especially if you wrangle a package that includes parking. Walk to subway in the winter is a little long, but really only about 4 blocks. Do ask for room on a high floor looking toward the Pru. Rooms have cement patios but some of the sliders are nailed shut, so if you want to use yours (chilling beverages in winter or stepping out in warm weather), ask for a room with a patio door that opens. Sleep number beds are comfortable and easy to operate. Recently renovated rooms are moderately spacious and pleasant. The staff was friendly and helpful. The area has several very good restaurants and is on the edge of theatre district. Across from parking garage, the Rustic Kitchen restaurant is a good epscale choice for moderately priced (for a city) Italian food and a large bar with good specialty cocktails & friendly staff. One can walk from Radisson to the restaurant without being exposed to weather - no coat or umbrella needed. It's an older hotel so doesn't look like much from the exterior, but is nice inside. For the price ($150 +/-) I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise and a great value”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson Hotel Boston four times over the past couple of months, all on short business trips. Each time, I booked the room through Hotwire for a very reasonable rate, and every time, I have been quite pleased with the quality of the room and the central location. The Radisson isn't much to look at from outside -- it looks like any other 70s-era, urban-renewal short tower -- and for that reason, I hadn't gone out of my way to stay there. However, I am glad I took a chance, as the property has become my default choice when traveling to Boston on business. The lobby and public spaces are pleasant if a bit generic -- but clean and well maintained. The staff are warm and friendly if not boutique-hotel effusive. Works fine for me. The rooms, though, have consistently been a nice surprise. They're a cut above other three-star hotels in the area, and would remind you most of a (slightly) bargain version of the newer hotels along the harbor, the Intercontinental and the Westin Waterfront. For a significant step down in price, you don't give up too much luxury. As others have noted, the property offers dual queen "SleepNumber" beds -- which are far from the gimmick I expected and are very comfortable indeed. The other furnishings are also good-quality and nicely designed. Only the technology -- an older 27" tube-type TV (free HBO) and wired internet (slow on the occasions I have tried to use it) are noticeably lower in quality than the next tier hotels. The Radisson is located in Boston's small theater district, close to the Common, and an easy walk from Newbury Street. The area, fringing Chinatown (excellent food options for adventurous eaters) and the vestiges of the Combat Zone is a little sketchy at night, but be sensible and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passerby789
Reviews.Content: Stayed thurs through sun and got the hotel for 79/night on hotwire. 3.5 stars Pros: -Very friendly and jovial staff. -very spacious room (2 double beds) -beds were those sleep number beds where you can adjust the softness. -free internet, wired only. -centrally located, we walked to newbury st, boston commons, public gardens, west end, north end, every where. a few blocks from the orange line. Cons: -street parking is nigh impossible around the hotel (and most of downtown boston). parking garage is $19 for 12 hours, $35 for up to 24 hrs. -towels were dirty. i don't think they changed them after the previous ppl left the room. this was very gross.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great price”
Reviews.Author: longislandmom_8
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected pleasure. Considering the price of other hotels in the Boston area, especially weekday, we definately would stay here anytime. We booked through Amtrak and got a price higher than if we booked it on our own. Ugggh. Also, when we went to check in, we were told through Amtrak they could only give us 2 dbl beds, not the 1 king we were supposed to have. Would not book through Amtrak again. They were not nice nor helpful. The front desk could not have been any more helpful. They gave us an upgrade to the top floor in a suite with king bed, two walk out terraces with fabulous view of the city. Could not have been better. Even if we did not get an upgrade, the service and hotel was certainly a great find for about $150-175 a night. We have stayed at other Boston hotels, not as convenienct, not as clean and not as pleasant. BTW, is is located in theater district/Chinatown walking distance from South Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmeMaine
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many different hotels in Boston, including Hilton, Sheraton and Hyatt, I can honestly say that the Radisson holds it own against all of them. The rooms are crisp and clean. Bathrooms are a good size and completely remodeled and look great. The room carpeting and wallpaper are all new and clean. Outside hallways are spotless and elevators are fast. The hotel has installed Sleep Number beds which can take a bit of getting used to and you will either like them or dislike them. If you book your room on the east end of the hotel you will have the best city view of any hotel in Boston. Also make sure you donâ€™t get a room thatâ€™s adjoining to another room. We were at first put in one of those rooms and all was fine until the â€œneighborsâ€� moved in. They were extremely loud people and we could hear every word coming from the door including their arguments and dinner reservations, etc. They became so annoying that I went to the front desk and asked to be moved. I was promptly moved to a room that didnâ€™t have the adjoining door and it was very quiet and well insulated. The best thing the hotel has going for it is itâ€™s staff. All are very friendly and respond quickly to any issue. From Pre-arrival emails to switching rooms to my departure I was very impressed with the staff. They are currently remodeling their pool and work out area as both are closed for a few months. When this is complete, this hotel will be even better. We booked a bed, breakfast and parking package at a great rate. I highly recommend this as many hotels are charging $40 a night to park now. The breakfast buffet was good at the Theater CafÃ© with very friendly staff. It was great way to fill up before walking the city. All in all, this hotel is a great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: siddharthaggarwal
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights with my wife in Nov 2008. Had a great time. It is one of the best locations you can find in Boston. Eating joints are conveniently located, so we didnt get a chance to try the in house dining. The room was on the top floor and had a beautiful view of downtown. Neither the airport nor Cambridge were more than 5 miles away. In short - we accomplished a lot by just walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: lawman
Reviews.Content: Excellant value with breakfast and parking package. The service was very good. The rooms with nice with a balcony. The area is not bad at all, and walkable to anywhere in the city. Would stay at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MerrimackMrs
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a girlfriend getaway stay at the Radisson this weekend. Although the Radisson is not the most high end hotel in Boston it really is a great value. I did a lot of research for hotels in Boston prior to selecting the Radisson and it was the most economical for what you get. Rooms were clean, check in was friendly & professional and the location is VERY good. We were able to walk to Newbury Street and the Prudential Center with relative ease. There are also some good restaurants very close to this hotel. I noticed that there were a lot of other girlfriend getaway groups staying and even a bunch of guy friend getaway groups too. The only complaint I have is with breakfast, which we only had on Saturday morning. If you order off of the menu be prepared to wait an inordinate amount of time for a simple meal. I'd suggest getting the buffet instead.... it's a much better meal and deal anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JerseyTracyJean
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in Boston at the Radisson. Loved it! The hotel wasn't super fancy, but nice. Our room was BEAUTIFULLY clean everyday. Really exceptionally clean I would say. I was on a high floor with a great view of the city. Personally the balcony was a little scarey for me but that's my problem. Because I was attending a conference in a different hotel, I didn't have much contact with the staff but what I did have was friendly. The location was super!! good restaurants of a variety of cuisines all in the immediate area. Right in the theatre district. Just a couple blocks to Boston Common. A leisurely stroll to the Quincy market area (maybe 20 minutes very relaxed pace). I grabbed a sandwich from the cafe. It was fine. Also had the breakfast buffet one morning. It was good but not spectacular. I would have liked it a lot better had it been included (apparently they have a bed and breakfast deal I missed) rather than full price ( I think it was like $17). And I paid way less for my room than what I see here as average room price. I'll definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueen33
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location. The only damper on the room was there was no LCD TV and the desk and TV armoire were beaten up, otherwise the room, bed, bathroom and view were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Huge Room!!”
Reviews.Author: Burn1911
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay for 2 nights. The hotel was very clean and in a good location for us to do what we wanted to. We asked for, and got, an upper level room and the views were great. Some good restaurants within walking distance, DEFINATELY try Montien, the Thai restaurant that does the BEST crispy thai phad noodles EVER!!!!! also went to Jacob Wirth and that is the 2nd oldest pub in Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: babydocwhit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a conference, and had a very nice experience. The location was great, the concierge was fabulous. We walked three blocks to the Freedom trail, and were also near a subway stop and Boston Common. The hotel was in the Theater District, so when the baseball game was rained out, we were able to get last minute tix to the Blue Man Group a block from the hotel. The room was nice as well, and clean. The bed was great, we had fun playing with the sleep numbers. I was happy with the price of the hotel, booking at the conference rate, but would have questioned the price if we'd had to pay full rate. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bexthreekids
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be ideal for our family. Since there are five of us, including 3 teenagers, we need two rooms when we travel, which can get pricey. We were given a terrific rate on both rooms and got adjoining rooms high up with a really great view of the city. We were impressed with the Sleep Number beds, the amount of room we had, and the cleanliness...a nice surprise. A great find in the heart of the Theatre District of Boston - within walking distance to everything. Only glitch: my husband misheard the woman at check-in advise him of our free breakfast.....we went to the cafe inside the hotel that she'd suggested, had a light meal from their buffet, and were presented with a check for over $70!! We asked at the front desk about having that discounted, since we weren't expecting that expense and since it was SOO high, but since we'd gotten a great deal on our rooms, they weren't able to reduce the charges. Oh, well. But we did love the hotel and the location and would definitely seek it out again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in the very centre of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cirilla80
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night Bed and Breakfast Package during our honeymoon in New England. The King Bed was very very comfortable, maybe also thanks to the Sleep Number item (it allows you to regulate the softeness of the bed). The room was huge and very clean. The buffet breakfast was very good and with different courses (delicious fresh fruit was included too). The position then is great very close to newbury street and toi the beginning of the freedom trail. Last but not least, it is very close to a delicious restaurant, Legal Seafood. Just one smal lack...the swimming pool. It is very small and crowded with children. I would reccomen it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: epsharon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business and the conference I attended was on the 6th floor of the hotel so that is the main reason I chose this property. I stayed 9/16 to 9/18 at a rate of $239 plus taxes which was the conference block rate. I was very pleased with the room. It was average size on the 20th floor with a great view. The beds were comfortable (sleep number adjustable beds) and the furnishing were relatively modern. The bathroom looked nice although not that big. They leave a USA Today paper outside your door each morning. My main complaints with the room was no mini fridge and no soap dish/shelf in the shower so you had to bend down to grab your soap and shampoo. The outside of the hotel is not glamorous, nor is the lobby but that really didn't concern me. The pool was average size and they had a decent fitness center with a couple of treadmills and a couple of cross trainers both with personal color tvs. There are no weight machines and no free weights with the exception of a few dumbbells. The main thing that is great about this hotel is the location. You are right in the middle of the theater district and 2 blocks from Chinatown. Fanheuil Hall is about a 15 minute walk. Boston Common is a five minute walk and the closest T stop is the Boylston stop which is also 5 minutes from the hotel. One block away across the street is City Place which has a food court which includes Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks and Cold Stone along with some chain restaurants like PF Changs and Rock Bottom. Legal Seafoods is across the street (great seafood!!!) and McCormick and Schmicks is a block away which has great happy hour FOOD specials (be warned the alcohol is grossly overpriced - $5.25 for a Coors Light draft) Would stay here again in the future for pleasure if could get a better rate. I've heard that people have booked for less than $200 per night and I'd say if you can find that, it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for business or tourism”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson 3 nights on business, rooms are recently redone an are better than average. Good bathroom and showers, great beds, although TVâ€™s are old style. Breakfast buffet OK, the Rustic Kitchen restaurant attached is excellent for dinner. Great concierge service, poor lifts (elevators) too slow!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Bittern
Reviews.Content: Stay: Aug 2008. Rate $170+taxes see below. Location: within easy walking distance (even with a wheelie case and aged 70!) from the MBTA T-system Boylston St station. (Get a Charlie-Card from Logan Airport-much cheaper and more interesting than a taxi-even arriving at 21:00 hrs.) Welcome friendly and cheerful. Dining-room staff cheerful and helpful. Good buffet breakfast but with sufficient choice for variation over three days; a la carte also available (but we had inclusive package via Internet booking). If you like two TVs on different channels and a simultaneous view of the traffic at Stuart St / Charles St crossing, sit at the natural-light end of the dining roomâ€”or on the terrace for traffic noise only; otherwise have greater peace in the other half of the room. Room on 22 Floor. Clean, some traffic noise (over-looked the road crossing; we had asked for a room not facing the road!-so minus points for this)â€”but used earplugs. Surprisingly we found no fridge. Plenty of space for moving about and clothes storage. Huge bed (UK Super King/US King) with the option to change the hard-/softness of the mattress on the left and right sides independently. Free internet use in reception / lobby. Helpful local advice centre in lobby area. UK and other non-US visitors beware of prices: those quoted are without taxes (it tells you this) but the taxes are: State 5.7%, City 4%, CCF 2.75%, so you need to add 12.45% to the stated room price and allow for the normal US tipping expectations. If you want a hotel in the centre, without paying for luxuries you will not use (our usual choice), then this will meet your needs. The hotel is near enough for you to buy food from a market and then watch bats flying as you have an evening picnic on Boston Common just one block away. Not perfect but a good choice, weâ€™d choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: la808
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on good reviews and a reasonable price (under $200) for Labor Day Weekend. I was not disappointed and would stay here again in a heartbeat. We had a room on the 23rd floor with a balcony and view of the Prudential Center. The room was extremely spacious and very clean. There are numerous eateries to choose from across the street- Legal Seafoods, Maggianos, McCormick & Schmick, RockBottom, Bennigans. For a quick breakfast, Au Bon Pain, Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks. There is a 7-11 one block away. The Boston Common, T stop & shops on Newbury street are about a block & a half away. It is in the heart of the Theatre district. Pluses: Location, Location, Location Sleep number beds Great deep tub for soaking and rain shower head In room safe Fabulous housekeeping Helpful bellmen Minuses Elevators could use some cleaning Expensive parking Pricey in hotel restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Good Time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TheLadyNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson, near the Common. This was a pretty good location, close to a Trolley Stop & not too far to walk to the Pru Center. We arrived a little early at 1:30pm but were able to check into our rooms. We were two couples & wanted to be in rooms on the same floor with a good view. The reception agent (not very friendly & almot rude) advised us that there was only one room availabe to meet that request. so we ended up on a lower floor. The room itself was fine - we enjoyed the Sleep Number beds - kept very clean. The maid, however, did not discard the water from the melted ice in the bucket for two days. Breakfast in the restuarant was OK except for the LONG wait for our food that we ordered off the menu vs. choosing the buffet. The Consierge was NOT helpful at all. I called down to the desk for help with a dinner reservation. He was obviously busy with other guests and asked if he could call me back in my room which he NEVER did. I ended up making the calls myself. Overall, Boston is a great place to visit. We had some great meals at Fleming's (steak house), Top of the Hub and Artu (Italian) in the North End. Even though we're Yankee fans, the tour of Fenway was good. Try to make plans ahead for the Duck Tour as it was sold out on the day we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: earlyages
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews I selected this hotel. Great location, staff very helpful and the rooms were better than expected. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “COMFY but with Construction Views”
Reviews.Author: MandyS.
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I along with our 2 month old stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights Aug 8-11 2008. We flew in and arrived at 11 AM without reservations and were so surprised that we could not only have a room with a high floor (23rd) but that we could go ahead and check in and have our room at 11 AM. The lady who checked us in was very pleasant. The bellhop was very courteous and he even gave us lunch and dinner recommendations as he walked our luggage up for us. It was such a nice treat to be able to take a nap while our baby did right when we got there. The room was very nice and clean and large enough for the 3 of us. We got a king room on the 23rd floor, but were a bit dissapointed that our gorgeous view was of large construction of a high rise building directly in front of the hotel. They started early too, like at 7 am banging, although it was a distant sound. It was still a sound not all pleasant to the ears. The linens on the bed were very comfy with the down. The maids were very generous and gave us PLENTY of towels and washcloths. With a 2 month old, we needed them! The maids arrived promplty between 10 and 11 am and this worked out perfect for us as we were always leaving at that time. One thing that was a dissapointment was there IS NO FRIDGE OR MICROWAVE. Which I'm sure is a reason to drum up business in the hotel bar and restaraunt, but a bit of a shock as most hotels of this stature have them, their food should speak for itself right? We never ate at the restaraunt as it seemed a bit overpriced by the looks of the food. We usually always try out the hotel restaraunts but didn't want to this time for that reason. However Legal Seafood is directly across the street and also the California pizza kitchen and another mediteranian restaraunt across the breezeway that was to die for! The concierge should recieve a RAISE-- he was EXCELLENT he booked us everyday with something! We went to Cape Cod, booked Dinner reservations, Booked taxi's-- He tooked care of everything and really made us love our vacation! He also recommended his favorite lunch place--The Intermintent Tavern--GREAT!!!! They had awesome food-- not much of a place from the looks, but you must GO!! the food was lovely. THANK YOU!! One thing that was unnacceptable though was the business center--only had 2 computers--in which teenagers who had walked in off the street were using to play solitare & get on myspace. I had to print out our boarding passes on the morning of our flight and I had to get the concierge to help me with it. That was VERY nice of him. I think the business center should be monitered by room key if you ask me! For the Money this was an awesome place to stay, but next time well make sure we have a fridge and microwave--as with a baby we sure would have had an easier stay, especially storing milk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: iowatulips
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel Boston was a great choice for my recent stay in Boston. As a first-time visitor of the city, I wanted something relatively central to the city and a place where I felt comfortable and safe. This delivered on both counts! I stayed 7 nights, from July 29-August 5. I booked my stay on Hotwire and paid just around $210 a night for the room, which for Boston is good, but I wouldn't have wanted to pay much more. Really, you're paying for the amazing location, not because it is an over-the-top hotel or anything. But, for the $210 a night, it was worth it and this hotel would be my first choice if I ever have the opportunity to go back to Boston! We stayed 7 nights, but weren't in the hotel long enough to enjoy some of the amenities - didn't go to the pool even once - there's just so much to do in the city! The staff is friendly and check-in was super easy. If you book from a third-party site, you canâ€™t use their online check-in system, but it really doesnâ€™t take long in the hotel. Maybe 5 minutes. Our room was on the 21st floor - pretty basic hotel room, but very clean and well-maintained. Like a previous reviewer, I think the bathroom had been recently updated. The tile and fixtures looked brand-new and remarkably clean. There was plenty of counter space, but the sink, toilet, and shower are all in one room; however, they really thought through people getting ready in the morning because in addition to the giant mirror in the bathroom, there were two more giant mirrors with outlets nearby in the room. The sleep number bed was great. My friendâ€™s bed was really comfortable â€“ mine I think was broken â€“ but it was just me in the bed, so I slept in the middle anyway! Every room has a balcony - our only wish was that there had been chairs or something to sit on outside to enjoy the spectacular view of the Prudential building and others. Just amazing. The hotel had free internet access and a free safe in the closet to store valuables. There was a small counter with coffee pot and ice bucket with a large space below to store luggage or whatever. No refrigerator. Ice bucket and soda vending machine just down the hallway. The room was cleaned every day â€“ bedding is changed every 3 days unless you ask for it to be changed more often â€“ but they still made the bed and cleaned up. The hotel is barely two blocks from a T station (took us less than 5 minutes to get to Boylston T station), within walking distance to - well - everything, and there are multiple restaurants just outside the door. Like other reviewers have said, there is a food court just down the street called City Place, where you also go to book/arrive for Gray Line tours. There is a 7-11 just around the corner, along with a Dunkin Donuts, California Pizza Kitchen, and Cold Stone Creamery. Legal Sea Foods and Finale are both excellent nearby choices for a great meal! Breakfast at the hotel can be expensive â€“ we solved that with bagels from Dunkin Donuts and peanut butter and jelly from 7-11! Helped us spend money for amazing meals elsewhere! :-) The number of things you can do in the city is just immeasurable. Being there for 7 days, I thought for sure weâ€™d run out of options, but we left wishing we had more time! I can't review everything here, but I will in time, so hopefully they're helpful! I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hate2clean640
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in this hotel from July 28-August 3, 2008. We picked this hotel because they let you reserve a room on their website with 5 people in a room, because of the reasonable price and because of the great location, in the theater district, near the parks and subway. We had 2 adults and 3 children, one of them in a crib. I checked the hotel rates a week before we left at the Radisson website and got an even cheaper rate with no cancellation penalty. We paid an average of just under $200 a night. The room was average size with a balcony, we had room 2007 on the 20th floor, with a wonderful view of the Back Bay skyline and the John Hancock building. The room was very quiet when the balcony sliding door was closed. The bathrooms were pristine and clean, looked like brand new tile and fixtures, the shower was the rainfall type shower head, wonderful. The bellmen and concierge were helpful with everything from finding a drugstore and a cab to finding a screwdriver so we could change batteries in a toy. Our toilet had a problem one day and a building engineer was in our room within 5 minutes and had it fixed in 10 minutes. The other reviews were accurate in describing the nearby food court and 7-11 convenience store, both in the adjacent block. We were only a few blocks from China Town as well. I recommend Legal Seafood across the street as well as Finale, an outstanding dessert restaurant in the Boston Park Plaza Hotel building 2 blocks away. Also in the nearby City Place food court is the Gray Line office, from which we booked BeanTown Trolley Tours and a Gray Line All-day Cape Cod Tour. The Radisson is a stop on the BeanTown Trolley, as is City Place, another convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rhine-and-Roses
Reviews.Content: I arrived at noon for a one night stay at the Radisson. I was pleasantly surprised to find they had a room available. Check-in was quick and cordial. I got to my room on the 9th floor and found it as it should be- clean, up-to-date and comfortable. The view was of the indoor pool and treadmills in the fitness center on the floor below. The bathroom was large enough, with the sink inside the bathroom, however, there was only an inch between the door and the toilet. I found that odd, since the bathroom was large enough- it's the placement that was off. The bed was comfortable. The room was spacious. There were two easy chairs and a table, in addition to the desk, two beds, and chest with a TV. There was a coffee pot with coffee, but no refrigerator or mini bar. I locked myself out of the room and handbag in. Security came immediately and let me in, then checked my ID to make sure I wasn't going into someone else's room. He was serious about the id, looking at it carefully. In the morning the elevators were terribly slow. Management needs to put in a service elevator as clearly a major part of the problem was room service and housekeeping taking up a huge amount of space in the elevators. Going down, then back up, there were two waiters with large trays, one person with an enormous laundry cart, and one woman in a Radisson desk uniform pushing past others to get on the crowded elevators. Shouldn't happen. The morning elevators were my only complaint about the hotel. I had to wait with a dozen or more people for more than five minutes for an elevator. The hotel is located across the street from a small food court that included a California Pizza Kitchen, a Dunkin Donuts, as well as about 10 other restaurants/fast food places. The hotel had a restaurant, but I did not use it. Their menu prices were quite reasonable for Boston. It was a 7 minute walk to Boylston T station.

Reviews.Title: “Beds Are Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kathmcc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Raddison, Boston. As stated the outside of the hotel really lets it down because the hotel is excellent. Our room 1701 had a living area, two televisions, two balconies and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on (stayed at Hiltons and Burj). The staff are some of the friendliest and welcoming staff I've encountered. The Gym is small but adequate and I enjoyed a lovely swim in the pool. They also have a terrace to sunbathe on if you so wish. The bar is very good for a quick drink before you hit the bars and superb restaurants in Boston (Legal Seafoods across the road serves the best dressed lobster in the world). All in all a wonderful stay in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler from CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Radisson Hotel Boston on Stewart Street. It was an average hotel. Not a lot of frills. It was a short, 4-5 block walk to the closest green "T" line, which made getting around the city convenient. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and average size. Two adults and 2 children had lots of room. It did not have a refrigerator, which was a disappointment. The pool was cool, but the kids enjoyed it anyway. There was no spa for them to warm up. They had a small exercise room, next to the pool. Radisson states they are a "green enviornment friendly hotel", but the housekeeping staff did not seem to understand what that means. I tried to use our towels for 3 nights, but every evening there were "fresh towels" for us to use, despite following their instructions to reuse them. Overall I would stay there again if we were traveling to Boston. The hotel was convenient, staff were helpful and the room rates were reasonable, compared to other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View”
Reviews.Author: red-headtraveller
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here only one night at the end of our trip visiting friends for the July 4th weekend. We were on the 22 nd floor in room 2219. The room had such an incredible view of the Hancock building. I sat next to the sliding door and just gazed at the view. As another reviewer said, you don't really want to sit on the balcony, but its nice to go outside to take pictures. The bed was very comfy, a sleep number bed. I feel that I'm pretty picky now with beds, because we have a tempurpedic bed at home. Also the bathroom was nice too. We meant to try out the pool but didn't. The one thing the room didn't have was a fridge. We ended up taking a taxi to the airport for about $15 instead of trying to take the subway. We would have had to take 3 different trains, so we decided to take a taxi. The lady at the desk told my husband that they had a shuttle to the airport for $15 per person, we figured the taxi wouldn't be that expensive, and we were right!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: posh-bird35
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Radisson in early June. Originally we thought the hotel was in Cambridge so were delighted when we realised our mistake, and were actually right down-town. The lobby may not be too snazzy but do not let appearances fool you. The room was huge with a separate lounge area with a 2nd huge TV. The bathroom was very modern with all the trappings you would expect from a four star. Bed was extremly comfortable and the views of down-town Boston from both balconies was really amazing !! I cannot fault this hotel on anything...we did not eat here so cannot comment on the food...location was excellent and all staff extremly helpful. When we visit Boston again we will return to the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Main thing the room was a delight... the lobby less so”
Reviews.Author: Keness
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for 6 nights and enjoyed my room very much. The free internet access is a great asset and the friendly staff is most certainly even more so. I had some disagreement concerning room billing and the personnel was most forthcoming. Two things bothered me: the hotel atmosphere is the culmination of anonymity. Lobby practically nonexistent and you felt sort of out of place even sitting down waiting for a colleague. .. I would have enjoyed a drink/piano bar.. . Furthermore the outside of the buliding resembles the lobby atmosphere.... more like a multiple story parking house with elevators carrying the cars to the different floors with not a living soul around..... :-). It is well situated in the downtown area.... I had a balcony overlooking beautiful Boston from the 21st floor but the balcony is in no way a place to put an armchair and enjoy the view . Nevertheless: to cut a long story short: go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie00
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is a nice place to stay. It was blocks away from the Boston Common (start of the Freedom Trail) and the subway station. This isn't the nicest place I've ever stayed, but for the price and the location, I would definitely recommend it! The breakfast at the hotel's restaurant (not complimentary) was wonderful. Be sure to try it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: jillmurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison last week and absolutely loved it. We were going to a Red Sox game and decided to book something in Boston for the night through Priceline. We got a great rate of $89.00 on priceline and were so lucky because with the NBA finals in town there were no hotel rooms to be found. Our room was on the 18th floor and had a nice view. I thought the rooms were great. They were pretty large compared to some of the rooms in the city, and it was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to both families as well as couples and business people. It is ten times better than the Park Plaza which is another 3 star hotel in the same area!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosrm
Reviews.Content: the low ceilings in the lobby and shabby elevators kind of spoiled this hotel; the rooms are small but comfortable and the staff was helpful for the most part. There was no free wireless internet and the workout room was a joke, however I got directions to a health club on Boylston street which was nice. The location is good- however I would rather stay at one of the hotels near Copley place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Looby1970
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline.com. Had never used it before so I was a bit worried, but turned out great. We paid $125 a night instead of the $300+ standard rate. Hotel doesn't look that impressive from the outside but is newly renovated on the inside. Right from check-in the staff couldn't have been nicer and were extremely professional and courteous. Shout out to John H. the daytime concierge, he was extremely nice and helped us with the trolly tour. The rooms were very nice. We were on the 16th floor and had no issues with noise from the street. There is a bit of construction going on next door, but we had no issues with it and actually enjoyed watching the crane at work! The room had 2 queen size sleep number beds - they were quite comfortable and the kids had fun pressing the buttons and making the mattress go up and down! The bathroom was very bright and modern and extremely clean. The rest of the hotel was very clean also. The kids had fun in the pool, however, not the most impressive pool I've every seen and I decided not to take a dip myself. Could use some work. Nice sun deck attached though. The location of the hotel is great. Only 1 block or so to the T and Boston Common. Plenty of restaurants, shopping, etc. in the area. We had a great time in Boston and would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel...great location...but avoid the breakfast deal/ scam!”
Reviews.Author: HippoNJ
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights on a family trip to Boston. The rooms were newly renovated, clean and comfortable. When making my reservation I opted for the $15 daily breakfast coupon (by paying $10 extra a night)...that was a mistake...when we visited the hotel cafe we found the breakfast prices to be VERY high...$16 for the breakfast buffet...and about $10 for every entree...so breakfast for a family of 5 would have been big bucks...so much for the $5 savings with the breakfast coupon. When I attempted to return the coupons and insist on a refund of the $10 a day, the front desk gave me a very hard time...after a bit of an argument, they issued the begrudgingly refund...call it a coincidence, but that night we received a surprise 3:30am wake up call....clearly a little revenge from the front desk staff....we promptly unplugged all our phones as to avoid any further "mistakes" by our pals at the front desk!!! Besides this little issue, the hotel was clean, reasonably prices and well located. MANY great restaurants within walking distance...

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Leaudemiel
Reviews.Content: We took a chance and booked this on Hotwire for a weekend trip to Fenway. The location was great- close to the T, and yet walkable to bars/restaurants/etc. But...the room had ants. The sliding glass door was so thin that we could hear all the construction (they start early!) next door, and the street noise from a club next door was a little much at 2 a.m... this coming from a room on the 24th floor. I dont know if its louder down by the street. Would I stay there again? If there was a deal. If I found a better deal somewhere else, I would go there.

Reviews.Title: “A great station for our Boston Adventure”
Reviews.Author: mrmckille33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 4 days. When arriving we were very worried as the outside of the building looked old and dated. However, once we got inside we were very impressed. The room was big and had 2 large beds in it. Bathroom was great as well. Used the pool whislt staying. This was clean but not too impressive, a juccuzzi or sauna would be nice. Ate at the cafe ajoined to it and had Boston's biggest burger which was great. Overall this hotel is very much get what you pay for but I'd recommend it for a typical city sight seeing tour where you just need a room to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bradytomoss
Reviews.Content: Sept, 2007 my wife and I stayed three nights at the Radisson while in town to sight see and attend a Pats game. The location of the hotel is ideal and is walking distance to everything i.e Boston Commons, Faniuel Hall, Back Bay Shopping, etc. The hotel itself was as impressive as its location. The rooms were a good size and the king size sleep number bed was very comfortable. The staff were also very helpful. We arrived very early (9 am) and were provided with our room. Initlally our room was situated next to the elevator and was a little too noisey for me. The front desk staff provided me with another key to a room to see if it was more to my liking. It was! Great view, great layout, great bathroom. Also, John, the concierge, was without a doubt the best in the business. Very helpful! We're heading to Boston again in May/08 but unfortunatley the rate for the hotel was too expensive for us. We paid $209/night back in Sept. I wish more subscribers would add in what they paid so that readers would have a good idea on what to expect and where to find the best deals. Boston can be a very expensive to stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Bec4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel and really enjoyed,big comfortable bedrooms with amazing views (Ask for a city view room,high floor)It seems the bathrooms have been recently upgraded and were really great.Don't get me wrong this is a very ugly hotel from outside and the lobby could do with an upgrade but if you want a great location with very friendly helpful staff(-Wendy springs to mind)that is remarkably quiet it is a great value choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great pool, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: spiceylife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in Boston for 3 nights in March 2008. The hotel is easy to find and we had a fantastic view from our window. The room was clean and a good size. We couldn't work out how to make the water come out of the bath tap rather than the shower so kids couldn't have baths. The kids enjoyed the pool and the small fitness room has glass walls so you can watch the kids swim while you work out. We had dinner at the Rustic Kitchen one night - my scallops were fabulous - and the breakfast buffet was great. Great advice and directions from the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: brads45
Reviews.Content: Recently spent our first weekend in Boston at the Radisson and we were very pleased with the experience. The hotel is located in a safe area and very near Boston Commons, the Freedom Trail and T-Stops. We received a very reasonable rate, the staff was friendly and helpful and the room clean and comfortable. If you like seafood, be sure to eat at Legal Seafood which is adjacent to the hotel. We very much enjoyed downtown Boston, would love to come back, and would definitely stay at the Raddison again.

Reviews.Title: “Practical option”
Reviews.Author: MsVacationLondon
Reviews.Content: Although the Radissonâ€™s location in the theatre district isnâ€™t very exciting in itself, it was extremely convenient and central for visiting other parts of the city. Good points: smooth check-in, even late at night; location, very comfy beds, good thick curtains, excellent shower, carpeted hallways to deaden noise, well-thought-out arrangements for leaving bags after check-out. Not so good points: balcony over-looking building site, shouting in the hallways, lack of cafÃ©s/diners in the immediate vicinity to ring the changes at breakfast. Overall a good, practical option if you can find a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotell”
Reviews.Author: kcrules
Reviews.Content: The Raddison Boston Hotel is 5 blocks from Quincy Market,4 blocks from Newbury St. and is easy walking distance to both places. If you book a night at the hotel take the pre-paid parking option, you save$$, the beds are the Sleep Number Beds and are nice,the rooms are clean with plenty of room and the staff was very good.Give it a try..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet. roomy, comfortable, well-located”
Reviews.Author: ANorthsider
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 7 nights in March and I can only echo what previous reviewers have said. Great location - one block from Boston Common and the Public Garden, near Boylston T stop so all of Boston is accessible. Rooms are a lot larger than usual for Boston. The fact that each room has a balcony adds to the sense of space and the view is great. Beds can be adjusted to your liking. Good heating & ventilation in rooms. Staff are very helpful and rooms are kept spotless. Room was quiet - we rarely heard other guests.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't find better in boston!”
Reviews.Author: adomurph
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i recently spent a most enjoyable 5 nights in boston staying at the radisson on stuart street. the locataion couldn't have been more central - 2 blocks from boston common, a 5 minute walk from the main shopping precinct and some excellent restaurants outside the door! the staff of the hotel were top notch, always courteous and extremely helpful and couldn't do enough for us. the rooms were spacious, luxurious and immaculately cleaned and having a balcony proved to be a nice surprise. i wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone, and if we were to return to boston, i wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEA_50
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Nice accommodations, good service and centrally located near shopping, China Town, Back Bay, Theater District. You can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrPizz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for a week when I was in Boston for business. I was very happy with this hotel. It looks kind of old and ugly from the outside - but inside it's fantastic. All the rooms have a full balcony, which is not something you see very often. My room was on the 23rd floor, and I sat outside and watched the sunset over the city most evenings. The room itself was great. I particularly liked the bed - which had a feature where you could adjust how firm you wanted the mattress. Honest to God, I think I slept better here than I have at any other hotel room in my entire life. The location is also great. I had one day off during my stay, and it was an easy walk to all the tourist and historical sights downtown. Plus, you're only about a block from Boston Common, which was great for jogging in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor”
Reviews.Author: cfalker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for two nights. The location is great. The dÃ©cor is tired. There doesnâ€™t appear to be any handicap accessible way to get to the front desk. The room was huge. There was a complimentary bottle of water. There was a light out in the bathroom. I wasn't crazy about the sleep number bed. There was someone very loud in the next room. The exercise room is in the pool area and was very humid. The exercise equipment was old and one of the two stepper machines wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacation_bug333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We stayed on the 24th floor - a great view. The room was big and very clean. In a good location, walking distance to a lot of restaurants, bars and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean...but those beds”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: Ok,nothing relevant to say here,the usual clean and crisp Radisson hotel,nice rooms,perfect location and nice staff. But those beds...no no no. the famous sleep number bed. It is by far the most uncomfortable bed i''ve ever slept in. No matters how they dress it up,it is basically and ugly overpriced air mattress,whit all the pros ( pros ? ) and cons ( cons !! ) of an air mattrress. I've basically slept for 8 hours in 2 nights waking up with a lot of pain and aches...terrbile. Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa026
Reviews.Content: Definatly one of the better Radisson hotels I have stayed in, you know what to expect when booking a Radisson but this one had a little more, something that made us feel more comfortable. Staff was very helpful, rooms had a bit more space and even if our bathroom was a bit cramped it was fine. I know other rooms had bigger bathrooms but it was not a big deal to us.
