I am a little unsure of the location, it is close to nice shopping streets but if you turn right toward China town there seemed to be an awful lot of homeless people and drunks. I turned around pretty quick. We had room service and the food was very nice tho expensive but that is to be expected. I also bought a bottle of wine, regular price from a store $5, for $25 and thought even for room service that was way too much. But I cant fault the hotel for that really, that was up to me. You wont be dissapointed in this hotel, no luxury there but otherwise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in a convenient part of town”
Reviews.Author: induway
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed in a small hotel near Tremont street because on the web it was described as "charming." I should have known "charming" was a euphemism for "dorm room." So for the same price as this "charming" hotel - about $150, we switched to the Radisson. Not only is the Radisson in a MUCH better area (close to Chinatown for late night eating), walkable to the Commons, walkable to the Pru, and also in the middle of the theatre district. The hotel lobby is .... well pretty non-descript. typical 3.5 star corporate hotel lobby. The hotel's exterior is very concrete and not the most interesting. However, the rooms are FANTASTIC. We had a room on the 21st floor and we had the MOST amazing views of Boston skyline. We had two queen beds, a small sitting area and a very nice sized bathroom. For the same price, this was SUCH a HUGE step up from the "charming" inn. Internet connectivity is free and via an ethernet plug in the room - there is no wifi. Not a problem, just a note. The hotel also has a heated indoor pool and a small work out area next to the pool. The hotel staff is okay - not exactly the most friendly nor the most helpful, but it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hurrah!”
Reviews.Author: meanjanine
Reviews.Content: The price of a deluxe king room was cheaper than a double in another nearby hotel, so we decided to forgo the independently-owned hotel experience for a chain. I am very impressed! We had an issue with our heater in the first room we stayed (started to smell quite like a fire and emit a little puff of smoke!) and we were politely and quickly moved to another identical room on the 22nd floor. The sheets and towels were luxurious in comparison to other hotels I've stayed at-- and excepting in Manhattan, we usually stay in 3 star hotels. The Sleep Number gimmick didn't factor into our comfort though it was a novelty to be toyed with. Breakfast in the Theatre Cafe was good, hearty eggs & bread type stuff. Great coffee. I suggest getting the Breakfast Package when you book your room, it would have been a better deal for us if we had. Parking: Free, free, free-- but you must denote this on your reservation, I think. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpfu-- this was consistent with every staff member. The man who saw to our heater incident was especially kind and I appreciate that. Noise level: Could hear a bit through walls. At 2am there was a major commotion in the street below: Car horns, sirens, shouting-- sounded like something serious. I could hear everything. I wasn't bothered by it because I was comfortable and sleepy. Hiking the nearby Freedom Trail from end to end made me tired! Did not use pool though it looked lovely. I may seek Radisson Hotels in other cities, but when in Boston, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: KINGHOPWAS
Reviews.Content: Received a warm and friendly welcome though it was little off putting to be offered a suite on the top floor, "though there is a problem with the leaking roof" or a King on a lower floor. Didn't fancy paddling across the bedroom so opted for a lower level. Nice bedrooms. Pool was adequate but in need of a refurb, elsewhere the facilities were excellent. Had breakfast and Christmas dinner in the restaurant which were both fine. Location of the hotel is superb. Lots of choices when it comes to dining, from the nearby food court for fast food through to exclusive restaurants plus china town just down the road. The common and start of fredom trail are are very short walk away and the Beacon Hill area is close too. A couple of tips: If you look 35 (no exaggeration) or under and want a drink - take your passport. The drinking laws here are oppressive. The ONLY ID the bars/shops/restaurants/hotels will accept is a local drivers licence, US forces ID or passport. You can't even select a bottle of spirits in the liquor store, it's kept in a roped off area for staff only. If using the metro, known locally as the "T", get a 'Charlie' card from the concierge and save 15% on this excellent service. If staying over Christmas be aware that unlike many parts of the US we have visited much of Boston closes down from mid day Christmas Eve until the 26th. Very few restaurants are open and only some corner stores. The T does still run though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea_me
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson with my fiance for two nights over New Years after a 3 night stay in th Hilton Financial District. We switched to the Radisson as we'd been given a special rate for a wedding we were attending in Boston at the Hilton, which was not valid for 30-31 Dec and the Radisson was approx. $50/night cheaper for those 2 nights. The hotel building is incredibly ugly from the outside, it's a high rise (20+ floors) grey concrete structure, built probably in the 1950's. The interior is fine though, however the lobby has an odd feel as it has 3 seperate outside entrances to it. Our room was on the 16th floor and was huge. On entering the room you walked down a narror corridor into a spacious sitting area with sofa, armchair, TV, desk etc and then on into the bedroom area. The bathroom however was tiny, definitely the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. It had a toilet, sink and shower crammed in - when you got out of the shower you practically crashed into the sink! It was quite strange that in such a large room the bathroom was so inadequate and was definitely a bit off putting. The room itself was clean and we were given a couple of bottles of free water which was nice. The loction of the hotel was good, just off Boylston St and approx. 15 mins walk from the shops at Copley Place. We didn't really come into contact with any staff, so can't really comment on that. All in all the Radisson was fine. We'd been at the Hilton for 3 nights previously and much prefered that so the Radisson was probably a bit of a let down for us. However I think if we'd stayed in the Radisson for the whole of our trip iwe would have been perfectly happy with it!

Reviews.Title: “Bostons Best Bet!!!”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: New Years Eve. Paid $168 per night. Stayed 2 nights. Hands down, this hotel is my favorite in Boston so far. The staff/ manager are very friendly. We arrived and were given the option of 2 rooms. A regular king, which we reserved and a jr. suite for the same price!!! Whoo hoo, that's a no brainer. So of course we took the 23rd floor jr. suite. Now, please be advised this room was next to the elevator and if paying very detailed close attention, this noise may bother you. But, as a teacher (we have a high tolerance of noise) and not spending a lit of time in the room itself, it did not bother us. It had a beautiful bathroom, spotless with an open glass shower, no bathtub. the living room extension had a tv cabinet with a small love seat and desk. This room comes with not 1, but 2 balconies. Score! In the bedroom area, it had a huge King bed, white heavenly linens, another tv! 2 night stands and drum roll.... a second balcony. Now, back to the noise... HINT- this side of the hotel (facing the Wang center) is a little noisy due to the construction that is going on. The other side of the hotel, facing the prudential building is a tad quieter, and the views, I think are better, but we were offered this suite and it was great! Had one drink at the Theatre Cafe that was frowned upon in the previous review. We did not have any issues with the staff, but the beer was a little flat. The pool is nice. The workout room is adequate, but Radisson should consider upgrading their equipment. This hotel is in the theatre district. Casual restaurants/bars to check out in walking distance are the Rock Bottom Brewery, Beantown Pub, Remingtons, Jacob Wirths, and the intimate Intermission Tavern. Walking distance to the Boston Commons/ Washingon St. and even Fanuiel Hall. The best part of this New Years Eve was watching the firework show at the Commons from our balconies!!! Again, Radisson Boston , best deal in town. Don't hesitate to ask to be upgraded. It doesn't hurt to ask. We didn't even ask, the manager just offered! We will be back at the end of Jan! ! ! Keep up the good work Radisson! Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: AUSUSA
Reviews.Content: We were on the 24th floor with great views of the city. The hotel is centrally located, room was clean with friendly service not only at the front desk but also the maids upstairs were super helpful for my friend and I. The rustic kitchen that is connected to the hotel was fantastic and my friend is still talking about the lighting in the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBE
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and definitely a good location for walking around Boston. Do ask for a high up room, we seemed to get an upgrade to a suite with a great view of Boston. We were disappointed with breakfast, the buffet was certainly not up to the standard we are used to in Europe in comparable hotels, so would not include that in our room rate if we use this hotel again. While there we got the bus to the Wrentham village outlet mall which the concierge organised but I think they may have added a few dollars on for phoning and also 30 mins to Salem which was interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: solo1raveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights, my second time staying at this property. The rooms are spacious, with a great view of the downtown buildings, location is fabulous for walking to many sites and attractions. Now for the room, spacious and up to date, especially the bathrooms. Bathrobes were very comfy, housekeeping excellent, beds and linens were most restful. I would stay again. Only issues were shower water was very warm but never reached really hot, the way I like it. Oddly, the flush of the toilet is so strong it sprays up and outside of the toilet, put the seat cover down when flushing, or else!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: youngandhiptraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked the Radisson through hotwire, and got a great $120 rate. I was surprised at how nice it was for the money. Out room was spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. And the service was friendly and efficient. The pool was definitely a family destination, but the exercise room was more than adequate. But the great part was the location. So close to Boston Common, Back Bay, and Newberry Street. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: fk1701
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband and our three year old son have just returned from our trip to Boston. We stayed at the Radisson for four nights and really enjoyed ourselves. The room and bathroom were huge and absolutely spotless and the view from the balcony was fantastic! We had breakfast in the Theatre Cafe every morning - there was a choice of hot or cold buffet and also an a la carte menu if you wanted something different (waffles, steak and eggs etc..) The food was hot, well presented, tasty and reasonably priced. The hotel is situated two blocks from Boston Common, 10-15 minutes walk from Downtown Crossing and about 3 minutes to the end of Boylston/Newbury St. We walked almost everywhere and found the area to be very safe. The only downside was the cost of parking - $28 dollars a night. We were a bit shocked, but this seems to normal for the area - very little parking to be found. Driving in Boston is a nightmare, all tunnels and one way streets - we definitely wouldn't drive again! Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Radisson and would definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry excuse for customer service”
Reviews.Author: JollyTugBoat
Reviews.Content: Contacted this property with a 5 night reservation. Was driving a large U-Haul type van. Was told by reservation staff and valet staff it should be no problem parking at a lot down the street. Arrived at the hotel. "Sorry there is nothing we can do for you" situation. What is a person to do. Had a 5 night reservation, big bucks. At least they admitted they had no idea on what to do and offered a cancellation of the reservation without any cancellation fees. I have never heard of people not being able to put their heads together to find a solution to a somewhat easy problem. I did get a reservation at another hotel, but this was after numerous hours driving around and waiting for people who couldn't do their jobs. Radisson, at least be honest if you are unable to accommodate large vehicles. It would have saved us alot of frustration and gas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gameday
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is a well-appointed hotel in a great location. The nice sized, clean room included two very comfortable beds and a large bathroom for a very reasonable price. The staff, in particular Crystal, was pleasant and accomodating. A friend and I stayed for a long weekend in late November. Neither of us had been to Boston previously and were not familiar with the transportation system. The concierge was extremely helpful, and we were easily able to make our way to all destinations via the train or bus. Our flight into Boston on Friday was cancelled, so we missed our Friday night stay at the hotel. We were offered an additional day at the hotel at no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 5 days and could not have faulted the place in any way. I have stayed in the Radisson on Lexington Avenue in NYC but Boston, MA was so much better. We stayed in a double double-bedded room, tons of space for two people and the beds really comfortable - I have to admit i did break the "inflating matress" but i did manage to laugh myself to sleep that night :). Free paper and water delivered to your door every morning and the view from our balcony window looked right across the city. The hotel is conveniently located one block away from the Boston Common and a few blocks away from ChinaTown. The bathroom was spotless and there were bags of fresh towels delivered every morning along with the maid-service. There are a couple of bars close in the area although the night-life was pretty quiet - ideal for families or romantic trips away. Ill definitley be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Radisson and Location”
Reviews.Author: feno
Reviews.Content: We (party of four) stayed here from 19th-22nd Nov, We had booked two rooms and upon check in we were advised that one of the rooms had been upgraded to a junior suite. Both rooms were great with more than adequate tea/coffee making facilities, plenty of toiletries in the bathroom, towels and terrycloth robes. The sleepnumber beds were unbelievably comfortable, one can change the firmness/softness of one or both sides of the bed. The swimming pool and gym area were an added bonus and kept very clean, also you pick up fresh towels from the poolside if using the pool or gym. The restaurant in the hotel was great. We found breakfast fine with a good choice on the menu. We had thanksgiving dinner in the restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed it and the waiting staff were more than pleasant. We got room service one evening and it was delivered quickly and unlike a lot of other hotels of the same quality not outrageously priced. The reception staff were very courteous and friendly and were only too happy to give directions or reccommend a good restaurant. All in all we had a fantastic stay and got a really good deal on the hotels website. We will definitely be staying here next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Dee&CeeR
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights prior to a fall foliage tour of New England. We had considered several hotels and picked this one due to location. They gave us a great Deluxe Room on 17th floor with balcony and a wonderful view of downtown and Boston Commons. The staff was cordial and the restaurant had good choices at reasonable prices. We took a trolley tour then visited several nearby restaurants and walked thru Boston Commons. When we return to Boston this is where we will stay!!

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are True - This hotel meets the mark!”
Reviews.Author: JohnSaintPaul
Reviews.Content: All of the positive reviews are true. I stayed for 2 nights during the week on a business trip and paid $259 plus tax on Radisson's web site. This is a four star hotel without a doubt. Ugly from the outside but clean, spacious, business friendly, and well situated in Boston. Nothing really fancy or modern. The service is excellent. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers and those wanting a basic four star hotel for a vacation. If you are looking for romance, luxury, or upscale surroundings, this is not the four star hotel I would choose.

Reviews.Title: “A short stay but generally good”
Reviews.Author: The_Truffles
Reviews.Content: Only a short stay in Boston on business...but a very decent room, reasonably helpful bellhops (although they ask directly for tips!) and a good location. A little on the pricey side, but it was clean and well placed if you want to take a walk 'round downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJerseyGirl
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at this hotel in late October for an annual meeting at the convention center and I must agree, it was a wonderful stay. The hotel had great location for walking to restaurants (you MUST try Finale 1 block away) and was a short walk to the Boston Commons, Public Gardens, and shopping in Beacon Hill. The hotel staff was very friendly and each room key sleeve has a pull out map of the area which was extremely helpful (and made for a cute souvenir!) Room was comfortable, clean, and plush and the view from my room, 2019, was awesome. Overall great stay. Sleep number beds were a bit of a let down (like sleeping on an air mattress) and the noise from all the other room's sleep number compressors being pumped up and down was loud and annoying. (I'm a light sleeper) Nice bathroom but water pressure stunk due to rain shower heads (not so good for us long haired girls) Only suggestion- put a chair or two on the balcony so we can enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: I was on business for the week and this hotel is certainly very comfortable and had free internet access in the rooms, which is great. Big beds that you can adjust to your own comfort. Free newspaper everyday. The bar was not in a great location and there is no real lounge area in the lobby to meet and chat. The location itself is good though only 10 mins from Boston Common and about 15 mins from Quincy market. For us it was expensive but this may have been because of the time of year and the fact there was a conference. The guy on the concierge was very helpful and didnt want a tip! Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Galadriel03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights this past September and I would definitely go back... the hotel is very clean, rooms are lovely, and location is great. It is just a few short blocks from the Boston Common & Public Gardens... and walking everywhere else we found quite simple. I admit I was at first worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but we couldn't have had a more pleasant stay. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and as I stated above the rooms were clean and beautiful. We paid $259 a night which is a bit steep, but to stay in a nice hotel right in the midst of things in Boston it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “City break hotel with expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Owen
Reviews.Content: We felt the hotel location was good for a city break. Close to theatre district and just a short walk to the city common and financial area. Plenty of bars and places to eat within short walk of hotel. No need to use the u/ground. Our room was very well appointed and maintained. Breakfast was ok, we didnâ€™t have room service or eat in the associated Italian restaurant during our stay. Couple of issues though relating to add on costs. Bear in mind we were on a touring holiday around New England with emphasis on touring and holiday. So I left both my laptop and cell phone at home. Use of the hotel PC to access the Internet just to check on soccer scores and F1 race (not on USA sports channel) was extortionate. With PCâ€™s costing little more than a few hundred dollars it should be free, not $30 per hour. Same with phone calls. All other motels I used during our trip I could make a short (10-15min) interstate call to my friends in USA for free. Same call at Radisson $23 !! Big Rip Off. Then there was in bottled water. In a room charged at over $200 per night they want to charge extra for each small bottle of mineral water that you use after arrival. Even Bigger Rip Off ! So whilst we had a good time in Boston and had no major issues with the hotel â€“ the expensive add on charges for services that cost the hotel almost nothing sours my view of the Radisson. But if you can address or donâ€™t need these things it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: beachlover325
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Radisson Hotel Boston from September 26 - September 30, 2007. For the most part we were very pleased but did expect a little more for our rate of $259/night. However, the Red Soxs were in town and we expected to pay a little more because of that. We used their "Express Check-In" which allows you to check in early (up to 1 week in advance). However, for a minute or two the hotel desk clerk was confused even though we were standing right next to the sign for Express Check-In and were trying to hand in the confirmation paper the website has you print after you've checked in online. Once he realized where our information was he just handed us the room key and we were on our way. We had room 1007, which has two queen beds (we had requested a king bed but they were out of those rooms), entertainment center/dresser, night stand, desk with chair, two other armchairs and another round table, and a large closet. The balcony was nice but we didn't really have a view of anything, However it was convenient to be able to check the weather before heading out. Our bathroom appeared to be fairly new and was done in stark white and modern fixtures. One bathrobe was provided. We barely ever heard our neighbors and we were very happy that we didn't constantly hear doors slamming like you do at many other hotels. We found the sleep number bed very comfortable although loud when turning up the firmness. Housekeeping did a great job everyday and never disturbed us until after we left in the afternoon. We ordered room service twice and it was delicous both times - both the breakfast items (belgian waffle, pancakes, fresh fruit) and lunch items (omellette, turkey club sandwich). Both times the food arrived quickly. It's a little pricey but worth it in my opinion for the convenience of being able to eat in your pajamas! The fitness center is small but has enough equipment and free weights to have a good workout. We found the staff to be pleasant for the most part and helpful when asked anything. Our location was great and we were able to walk everywhere - to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Boston Common and other Freedom Trail sites, the waterfront, tons of shops and restaurants, bars and clubs. We were very pleased with the hotel overall and would recommend it for it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VelvetVonBerger
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent and the bathroom was amazing! had a great room with a view of the john hanncock centre with a balcony to get some fresh air. Very clean - modern and smart. The hotel is loacted well within the city - close to everything and the bar downstairs was handy if you didn't feel like venturing out. Only downside was some of the staff were abit snotty - esp the guys at the door and that handle the luggage. Quite rude and even blanked us when we asked if they could call us a taxi. Not very nice or professional. Luckily it didn't ruin the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location. Not a bad hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: janeymcp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family for 5 nights. Room was a fair size and clean. Balcony was a bonus - great to see the city views, particularly at night when everything was lit up. The location was within walking distance of everything we needed and easy access to T for longer trips. Pool area was a disappointment - One of our main reasons for choosing this hotel was the pool as our son loves swimming but a refurb is going on and the pool heating was off so the pool was too cold to go in. We weren't informed of this when booking or on check in. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment on that. Plenty of restaurants across the street or within easy walking. Overall, not bad for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Insincere Staff”
Reviews.Author: whatdoesitmatter
Reviews.Content: I am writing to let other travelers know of my bad experience with The Radisson in Boston. After booking 3 rooms on Priceline.com, there was a huge mix up upon check -in. My friend was trying to be funny and booked 3 rooms and using funny alias's as our last names. Upon check-in, we realized that this going to be a problem. We take full responsiblity for causing a headache for the front desk but it was how they handled the situation that started our stay with The Radisson off on the wrong foot. First of all, there were 5 of us in our group, each of us in our 40's, and all of us work in the hospitality industry. We have the upmost respect for anyone that works in the industry and were definitely not trying to be difficult. The front desk was rude, condescending and insincere in trying to resolve the problem. We nicely offered them the option that if this situation is going to be a major problem we would just cancel the reservations and find another hotel. (No hard feelings, we would just move on) The five of us could not be more laid back. The response we got from the Front Desk," Fine, but you still have to pay for the rooms because they were booked on Priceline.com." They could not have cared less about trying to resolve the problem. Finally, we contacted Priceline.com and had a letter faxed over and eventually we were able to head to our rooms. Even after all of this headache, we chalked it up to the girl at the front desk having a bad day! No problem, we are in Boston to enjoy ourselves, not let some inadequate staff member ruin our weekend. After returning from a nice dinner and a night on the town in beautiful Boston, we were back at the hotel and taking the elevator up to our rooms. We were joking in a very nice way about not wanting to upset the front desk staff member. On the elevator with us was an employee of the hotel. Once we stepped out of the elevator and headed down the hallway, this employee actually stepped out of the elevator and started making sarcastic comments to us!! We were absolutely stunned by the lack of professionalism of this staff. The next day, four of us checked out and headed out of town. About 45 minutes later, we were trying to call our friend that stayed behind and realized that his cell phone was turned off. So, we called the hotel and asked to be connected to his room. They had no listing for our friend! So, we told them the room number and explained that we checked out about an hour ago. After being on the phone with them for about 3-4 minutes, they told us that he checked out. About 45 minutes later, our friend calls us from the hotel lobby telling us that he is getting ready to check out of the hotel. We told him that we had been trying to get in touch with him but the front desk told us that he had checked out already!! (Which he didn't!!) So then we figured, maybe we called "the wrong" Radisson. So, we call back and ask ed, "Is this The Radisson on such and such street?" They actually gave us attitude over the phone for asking for their location!!!!!!!!!! I am not making any of this up!!!!! That is when all of us had enough of this miserable staff at The Radisson. I have never written a letter of complaint to any hotel, restaurant, or any other type of service industry business. I sent an e-mail to The Radisson explaining my dissatifaction with my stay and received this cookie cutter letter of an apology mostly defending "the normal" behavior of this staff. After giving the manager all of the information that she needed to do her "investigation", I never heard from her again!!! Customer Service at it 's finest!!! I will never frequent a Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ftworthmike
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and excellent hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is in the Theater District and only a few blocks from the Freedom Trail, Boston Commons, and several subway stations. You can get a 7 day pass for $15, walk two blocks and be anywhere in the city in 5 minutes, including Harvard, Fenway Park , Boston Harbor, and other tourist destinations. The hotel rooms have been updated, the pool was clean, and meals in the hotel excellent. I would recommend this Radisson for singles, couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: paeath
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel! I attended a wedding and it was the worst service ever!! The waiter practically threw our dinner in front of us!!! Then he shouted at me cause i wanted chicken i did not have a sign in front me ( no idea you had to do that), then our table had a money kitty goin on the table, it was in a coffee cup but it was in obvious there was money in it!!! The rude waitor came around to clear our champagne glasses and water glasses, we were all at the table but passed no remarks at him.. then guess what money was gone!!! He obviously took the money, we spoke to 3 managers and they never even apologised!! They said we basically could not prove anything !!! The management crew really need to sort them selves out and as for the wait staff, they def do not have people skills at all.I will never set foot in this hotel again and i advice everyone else to do the same!!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: jenbren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Radisson while attending a conference in Boston. The hotel is pretty good and it seems like the bedrooms have been refurbished recently. The leisure facilities are a bit below par, but they are currently renovating the area and hopefully that will improve things (the fitness centre consists of two bikes, two treadmills, two steppers and some free weights, all of which are very old). Location-wise, the hotel is very close to Boston Common, but about 25 mins walk from the main "tourist-area" of Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market. However, this area is easily accessible using the T subway service. All the hotel staff were very helpful - particularly John, the very nice concierge!

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: mikden
Reviews.Content: It was hard to pass on a hotel whose reviews were almost all 4-5 so we tried the Rad. for one night and it was excellent. The location is great, the employees friendly and very helpful, rooms clean as a whistle and views outstanding. Try to get on the east facing side as there is a little more to see from your private balcony. We had a room on the 23 rd floor facing west and it was nice going outside for a drink or two overlooking the great city of Boston. We went with the bed and breakfast package which was 30 or so dollars more than the standard AAA rate but also included parking in the enclosed attached parking garage which is usually 28 dollars. So if you look at it as your going to spend the $28 on parking, spend a couple bucks more and get the breakfast too. Iincluded all the normal hot breakfast items such as bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, bagels, toast, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, milk, coffee, tea and juice...and maybe a couple more items that I'm forgetting. I'll be going back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: CorrindaL
Reviews.Content: We had a great one night stay here! Love the sleep number beds! The bell man was very helpful, the front desk person very nice. Location was great! Rooms very clean. The best part: having a balcony large enough to walk out on and look out over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great bet in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Shopananny
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend in Boston and selected the Radisson because I could use my Am Ex miles there. I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was not only very conveniently located, but also a top-notch accommodation. The room was spotless, and the fixtures and furniture seemed brand-new, the A/C worked beautifully and there was complete quiet. There was also the amusement factor of having a "Sleep-number" bed to try out. Though I may not rush out to buy the mattress for home use, it was certainly comfortable. I also noticed that the hotel had a pool which I didn't have time to use, but it seemed to be a big hit with families. Finally, the staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again my next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Boston Location”
Reviews.Author: Tuckers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Radisson Boston. We were very impressed with this hotel. I chose it based on the reviews I read on tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The hotel is located in the perfect spot! Its so easy to get to everything. Its a safe area, with plenty of restaurants and things to do within an easy walking distance. It is close to the subway stations, bus line, and even the freeway. The hotel bldg is nothing special, but inside it is very pretty. The lobby is large and inviting. The employees are all very friendly and helpful. The concierge desk lady, I wish I could remember her name, was wonderful! She helped us get some hard to get reservations for dinner, she gave us some tips on using the subway (we are from S. California and the subway was new to us), she also gave us some insight on different areas of town. They have on-site parking, which is nice. We got breakfast and parking included in our room rate, so that made things easier. We just parked our car there and left it there during our stay. We never needed it. The breakfast was pretty good. They had bacon, sausage, eggs, potatoes, little rolled up tamale sort of things, biscuits & gravy, oatmeal, cold cereals, fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, pastries, juices.. A nice start to the day. Their breakfast hours were pretty long, which is nice. I think it went from 6am t0 11am during the week and then until noon on weekends. We had a very large room on the 18th floor with a gorgeous view of Boston. We had a balcony, too. It was a little too hot out to enjoy the balcony, but it was nice to have. The beds were Sleep number beds and very comfortable. The bedding was soft & clean. The room also had a chair, table, desk area, armoir with tv, large closet, bar area with coffee maker, large modern bathroom with lots of counterspace. The bathroom was very clean (thats important to me). It smelled clean, looked clean, it WAS clean. They had free internet (it was pretty slow), and movies on the tv (you had to pay for them). They also had a tv station dedicated to Boston history, which I found very interesting. There was a pool, but we didn't use it. It looked nice and inviting, but we just had so much to see and so few days to do it all. They had a golf driving range, but its closed for the summer. My son was disappointed because he was looking forward to hitting some balls. Not sure why it would be closed during peak tourist season. Strange! There was also a nice outdoor patio area where people could sit, but like I said, it was really HOT out. We never saw anyone use it. This is not an inexpensive hotel, but I felt like we got our money's worth. The location is wonderful. The rooms are clean, large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: grobin
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay and would definitely recommend this hotel. Good sized modern rooms with comfortable beds (mattress can be adjusted to suit). Well located - within easy walking distance to City Centre and other districts, including Beacon Hill, Newbury Street and Back Bay. The hotel pool and roof top sunbathing area is a bonus, and provides a chance to wind down after a days sightseeing / shopping. Staff are very helpful - Concierge providing good info for eating & shopping locally. The hotel's breakfast buffet provides a wide choice, and at $16 is considered value for money compared to other local eating places. Will definitely stay there again when next visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireSmudger
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday in the US, staying three nights at the Radisson Boston and then moving on to Cape Cod. If only the hotel in Hyannis could have been as good as the Radisson.We could not fault it any way. The location was great and there were lots of wonderful restaurants nearby. The food in theatre cafe attached to the hotel served a delicious breakfast, whether you chose hot or cold. The rooms were clean and the beds, the most comfortable I have ever slept in! The staff were welcoming and couldn't do enough to help. I went down to reception one evening to report a slight problem with the toilet not flushing as it should , and the maintenance man had arrived at my room to fix it before I got back to it ! We loved Boston and we loved the Radisson- we will definitely go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed.”
Reviews.Author: SomeLameNoob
Reviews.Content: After a terrible day of air travel and getting lost in the backwards, crooked and completely terrible road system of Boston, MA; we finally found the hotel and I was thoroughly impressed. It was probably the nicest place I've ever stayed at. The hotel room was clean, modern, large and had a great set of sleep number beds. The parking was pricey, but most big cities are like that, I put up with it because it was such a nice hotel. They treated us very well and answered all our questions. They directed us towards local bars and restaurants with simple directions and gave us great directions to Fenway Park. I can't recommend this hotel enough. If you're in Boston and don't mind spending a few hundred on a hotel; this is the place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zosh
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable bed, pleasant bathroom facilities and a good location. It's near enough to a T station to make a car unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “baseball FANS from afar should stay here”
Reviews.Author: TOMMYNJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a prime example of you get what you pay for hotel. Great location, Parking problems do not exist and its a doable walk from just about everything is Boston. YOU can take a walk to Fenway park from here about a slow 45 min to an hour avg walk. That gives you a quick once over over Boston's shopping district. You can See the famous Duck tour land&sea boats and decide if you want to go. But do buy an advance ticket & come back the latter in the day or another if you want to do this boat/land ride around town as you will spend more time waiting than seeing sites or if you like to people watch you can just sit there and wait. But you can do that at the hometown mall. If your are driving into Boston this is the place to stay for a 2 night stint any longer and the value of this place goes down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: operman1
Reviews.Content: Radisson Hotel Boston was a great value for me since I used their website to book my stay. I had, unfortunately, forgot to bring my Red Sox tickets with me. I arranged to get my tickets to the hotel and the staff was wonderful with how they managed my panic. They were most gracious and understandable. Need to say that I got my tickets the day of the game. Another opportunity presented itself to the staff when my luggage was late,. The staff was very sympathetic and helped me with this too. The hotel was very good and had a wonderful bed so that I was somehow able to sleep despite my personal misfortunes. The conceirge told me how to get to places I was not familiar with. I loved the fact that this hotel had efficient elevators so that I felt that I was getting along wjtb my vacation in a good mannet. I just hope others may go to this hotel as it is in a very good location. This hotel has a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and just have to say it was brilliant , the location was central to everything the rooms were perfect the staff , great !! in particular the concierge John and Christine were so helpful and sent us in the right direction, regarding tours ,and restaurants, The usual Radisson style everything clean ,airy and spacious. Top Marks only drawback..... The hotel like most nowaday,s is non smoking.. but the balconies are available if you feel like a sly one. Great city ,quite in comparison to New York, but just as enjoyable without the hassle ,and only 10 minutes from the airport, Eating out dont miss PF CHANGS just across from hotel, Chinese food at it,s best

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Footloose39
Reviews.Content: I did the homework, scored a good rate and was very pleased with the Radisson Boston. The hotel is a half a block away from the big Hertz rental office downtown, a short walk to the Common, even shorter walk to the Jump on/Jump off Trolley stop, and a few steps away from the most delicious baked/stuffed lobster dinner anywhere at Legal's. Our room was on the 18th floor, a glass slider opened onto a balcony with a great view downtown. The room was clean, updated and comfortable. The sleep number beds received mixed reviews from our group (I liked it) but, everyone appeared to have gotten a good nights sleep. Radisson is a upromise partner, icing on the cake for you parents with a upromise college account for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: das4me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are finishing up a 4 day stay here and it has been a great deal all the way around. We booked with the hotel directly and got the breakfast package which included a nice breakfast for 2 each day and parking. We were here to see the sights and the location is PERFECT. Located in the theater disctrict we have walked to everything since we arrived. The room was very comfortable and clean. There have been some heat records set this week and I have to say that the temp in the room when we would come back after a day of touring, was soooo cold and comfortable. I would definately stay here again as it is a great place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TATraveller
Reviews.Content: Agree with all of the favourable reviews. Despite being an ugly concrete block, the hotel is comfortable and good value for money being about $50 per night cheaper than Jurys etc. The lobby is large and well furnished (previous reviews implied shabby but seemed fine to me). All rooms are large and have balconies, albeit concrete and not very decorative but still a plus. Pool (large but a little dated) is also a plus as is the very large sundeck with loungers. Be sure to ask for an upper floor (24th is top floor) - even numbers have a distant view of the harbour. On better edge of theatre district, good eating adjacent to hotel, close to park and Newbery Street shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dmun
Reviews.Content: Good central location, walkable to most popular areas. Easily accessed from the Interstate. Ok, it's not the prettiest (a concrete tower really) but then you don't have to look at it from your balcony!) A very high standard of finishings throughout. It definitely has a luxurious feel to it. Fast/ efficient check-im/out. No complaints at all. Excellent beds and rooms. Taking bags/ cases from the hotel car park to the lobby and then to your room is tricky due to having to use the carpark elevator, carry the bags down a small flight of stairs and then another elevator to get to the guest rooms. My advice is to park at the front door and offload luggage or use the valet parking service for a hassle-free stay. The breakfast in the hotel was good and at a reasonable price. I would definitely go back if visitng Boston. although it's not cheap it gives a great level of service/ accommodation for the price. I suppose you get what you pay for. You can book this hotel with no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beds & Great Self Service Options”
Reviews.Author: kitsan
Reviews.Content: Good Place to stay in Boston. Superfast check in on arrival, real time account on your tv, and checkout using your real time account on your tv. Front counter staff were friendly, concierge approachable and knowledgeable. Unfortunately, the in room safe was left locked by (presumeably) the joker who previous stayed there. They immediately offered to change a room when I called about it or I could use the safe at the front counter. We decided not to bother with a change as we had our stuff all unpacked. The sleep number beds were excellent. But as in many downtown hotels in big cities, Sat night's sleep was interrupted by police sirens and traffic though we were on 20th floor. There's a drinks vending machine and free ice machine on the floor, and there's a bank teller machine in the lobby. The location is great, 1block to Boston Commons and T stations, 15minutes walk (abt 4blocks) to copley place-prudential center, Hard Rock cafe (which is moving this June to Fanueil House). It's in the Theater district, and there's a legal seafood right across the street, lots of food and pubs across the road too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for my budget”
Reviews.Author: worcesterMAgirls
Reviews.Content: After doing some hotel searching I decided to make a reservation at the Boston Radisson. I only live about 45mins from Boston but its a long drive home after hitting up the bars. I was searching more for location than amenities. A friend was arriving at Logan and we didnt want her to have to spend a lot of money for a taxi to the hotel (according to the RAD's site, Logan is 3 miles away but still cost her $17 in fare). We also picked it based on its location to the local bars/night activity. It is located right in the theater district so if your going to see the Blue Man group this is within walking distance. I made this reservation on the phone with the front desk. The woman was very polite and informative. The transaction went without a hitch and she was able to give me the online discount. The hotel was very easy to get to from the Ma Pike. I fear getting lost on the many one way streets and dealing with rabid taxi drivers! Once we pulled in to the tiny entrance area a valet driver quickly unloaded our bags and took the car away. Check in took exactly 2 mins. With a license and credit card verification we were off to our room on the 19th floor.....however we carried our bags to our room. The room was beautiful and clean. The bathroom was small but modern and bright. The tub was huge and my boyfriend even took the opportunity to soak for awhile! Everything the website said would be in the room was in fact there....including the hairdryer which came in handy as I forgot mine. Upon entering however, the room was a stagnant 82degrees. With the AC turned on high the thermostat never went below 77, but it was still comfortable. The beds looked like they were fit for a king, complete with down comforters! No cheesy or stained top blankets from the 70s! BUUUTTTT...... the sleep number bed wasnt all that great. Its an overpriced air mattress and wasn't to my liking. Maybe sleeping solo would have proved more comfortable, but I felt every movement from my partner. Now when those infomercials come on I can change the channel and not feel like I'm missing out on the latest and greatest bed craze! The breakfast buffet was great! Everything was hot and tasty... a nice way to recharge after a long night! The biggest draw back of this hotel was the price. I recently came back from a trip to Mexico where I stayed in a 4 star all-inclusive resort for 7 days. For the price of one night in Boston I could have gone back to MX for 4! After taxes my bill was $317~ no room service or additional add-ons! Needless to say it took the wind out of my sail till I made it to CHEERS for a beer....then I forgot out the chunk taken out of my wallet! For the price we paid I think the bell boy could have atleast taken the luggage to the room! Would I stay here again, sure....If I won the lottery. I just dont have $300 to throw down for a one night stay! Next time I'll research more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Comfortable hotel - shame about the building”
Reviews.Author: Yorkhill
Reviews.Content: We picked the Radisson by chance out of a very long list of Boston hotels. Despite being the ugliest building in Boston it is a comfortable hotel whose location is fantastic for most of the central Boston attractions. The bed and breakfast package is good value too Rooms were comfortable and well furnished and most with great views (ask for a high floor number). The foyer and pool are dingy and in need of a bit of work

Reviews.Title: “The Best thing they could do is drop the Radisson name!”
Reviews.Author: margolemon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Radisson hotels throughout the country and they have all been the same...HORRIBLE! Until now! My wife and I were blown away by this hotel. I would actually have to say the this is the top 5 hotel rooms I have stayed in. If you are looking for breathtaking lobby's - stay away - the building itself and the lobby etc are very boring and kind of drab. However, the rooms are fantastic! Very clean, big and modern. When we got to our room my wife and I just stood there amazed at how nice and clean it all was. Whatever management runs the Boston site, needs to take over for all the other sites. We almost didn't stay at this hotel just because it had the radisson name on it...but i can' describe how wonderful this hotel was. EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and value co-exist”
Reviews.Author: TetonCLT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from May 13-16, 2007; in Boston for college graduations. The staff communications was the only place I could locate anything needing inprovement. Not sure if it's just the Boston melting-pot ambience but there are seem to be too many people there who practice ESL. The dialogues frequently needed repeating for both parties. Otherwise, the room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The amenities were good quality typical, and the maintenance had been kept in top order throughout the facility as far as I expereinced during this stay. There was a low rumble occasionally that began about 5 am - not sure if it was the "T" train outside or the elevator. Overall, though, we will likely stay here if we ever happen to visit the East Coast again, as well as seek other Radisson properties for future travel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcutie
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Boston for business a number of times now, always staying in a different location. This time my husband came along, so we were looking for a hotel with a good central location and high-speed internet. We found the Radisson online and thought we'd give it a try. Check-in was a breeze, finding our room was easy, and we were thrilled when we walked in and saw how huge our space was! The bedroom was at the end of the room, with its own TV and thermostat, then there was a sitting area with another TV and a desk. This was especially nice for my husband, since he was working from the hotel all week, and he felt like he had a little more space and wasnt confined to a small room. The bathroom was TINY and we did have some issues with the toilet. The force of the flushing was so intense that our floor usually ended up wet by evening time. We had a shower only, but it was a good sized shower with nice water pressure. The view from the room was great- we were on the 17th floor and enjoyed looking out at the city views. The workout room was kind of pathetic, but it was functional and we used it most days. Overall, we were extremely pleased with the place and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: roe1
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are nice and clean with good quality showers, beds and TV's. Outside the rooms the hotel is fairly ordinary and a bit drab but the staff are very efficient and helpful. The pool has too much chlorine in the water but the other facilities are good. Location wise it is great for public transport and is a good base to walk around Boston and take in the sights. There is also a great view to be had if you get on the higher floors which I can definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Runners Dream”
Reviews.Author: runnerorlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Marathon again. We have been here now for 3 years, and they just keep getting better. The rooms are big and comfortable for a city hotel, which is always nice. But what makes the biggest difference is their staff. Every year I come, they get better and better at their jobs. They truly know how to make someone feel like their at home. The front desk is amazing, housekeeping attentive, and the restaurant serves a greta meal. Come here and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: usurp66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson as one of a group of 40 that travelled to Boston for the St. Patricks day parade. I found the staff extremely helpful and pleasant. The hotel facillities are really good, including on site swimming pool, rooms are above average size, excellent beds, spotlessly clean, restaurant is well above average and hotel is very centrally located and convienient to airport (12 mins by cab) The reservations dept were extremely helpful throughout and were not in the least fazed by the inevitable changes to bookings that is inherrent in a large group. In short, highly recommended and would definately stay there again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, location, price...”
Reviews.Author: SwanPond
Reviews.Content: Love the Radisson-Boston: Sweeping views of the city from private balconies, spacious, nicely-appointed rooms, great service, and a fantastic location. And all at a great price! For half the cost of the fancier hotels, the Radisson provides many of the same services and amenities, such as valet parking, room-service (good and fast), clean & bright modern baths, robes, comfy Sleep Number beds, spacious rooms, newly-released movies, Internet connection, a quality restaurant/bar, convenience shop, concierge, and all-around attentive service. We would have been happy to just lay on our comfy king size bed, watch movies and order room service, but the city beckoned. The location is hard to beat. Walk to theatres, fine restaurants, shops, Boston Commons & Public Gardens, Copley Square, Newbury Street, Tob of the Hub, historic sights, and on and on. Most of Boston is walkable, but if you'd rather, 10 minutes in a taxi will bring you almost anywhere. Or take a trolley tour of the city and they'll pick you up right at the hotel. Because the Boston Radisson is so fun and affordable, we're already looking forward to our next weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Changing my mind about Radissons...”
Reviews.Author: Kimblypeg
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler who has high expectations for my hotel stays, I tend to book or avoid the same hotel chains based on my experiences there. For a long time, I avoided Radissons as a chain because I had many bad experiences with their brand, especially in the area of customer service. However, with my company booking travel, I sometimes have no choice in where I stay, and that is how I ended up at the Radisson in Boston. And boy am I glad I did! In the past my favorite hotels in Boston have been the Doubletree downtown, and the Tremont (currently owned by Courtyard by Mariott). But the Radisson blows them away. The rooms are a beautiful size, with balconies, and both a desk area and a sitting area. Additionally, there is a small shelf in an alcove just inside the door for the coffee machine and ice--a nice touch that other hotels would do well to adopt. I'm always frustrated by having to have my coffee machine on my desk or in my bathroom. The only thing that would improve the room would be a small fridge & microwave--with all the great restaurants downtown and a week long stay, I had a lot of leftovers that I would love to have kept and reheated for snacks. The bathroom seemed almost new, with an extraordinarily deep tub, and hallelujah, a bathrobe--again, a simple touch that ups the class of the room several notches. Service was prompt and professional, yet not intrusive, and the location cannot be beat. The fitness room is not spectacular, nor is the pool (no whirlpool or sauna), but both are adequate for the business traveler or casual workout. The location is fantastic, within easy walking or transit to everything you want to do in Boston. I highly recommend this hotel, and would come back here for a leisure stay. I'm hoping more of the Radissons that I will stay at this year are even half as nice as this one.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: deckbee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March. Rooms above average size. Our room was on the 9th floor. The view was brilliant. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and the bathroom spotless. Would definitely stay again as it is very close to Boston Common and shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SydneySue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just before Christmas and really enjoyed it. The room was very clean and large. The bed was very comfortable and the view from my top floor room was fantastic. The location was great -easy walking distance to most places. The staff were professional and always helpful but not intrusive. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: apiali
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in Boston for almost a week and even though it was so cold -for us- the hotel made the difference. The king bed was like really KING size bed, the room big, with lot of space. We were on the 23rd floor and the view was beautiful. The security was excelent, even though I was like 8 thousand miles from home, I felt so good when I was going back to my hotel. Really quiet, perfect location, like one block away from the Boston Common-right across the hotel there are all these places to eat-. If I were to go back to Boston I would defenitely go to that hotel again. I have no pictures, but when I wen I'd seen pictures from the guestrooms, and I thought I was going to be disappointed...and... The rooms are way better that the pictures. Alicia

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Price and Location was ok”
Reviews.Author: iamdesiree
Reviews.Content: I booked our flights and our hotel stay through the Radisson website and saved almost $400, compared through booking through the airline website. The room was fine, not fancy and we had a nice view of the Back Bay area. Very close to Boston Common, the exterior of the TV show Cheers and Beacon Hill. My only qualm was that it was a hike to the Faneuil Marketplace, waterfront and North End, where we spent most of our time. Thankfully, we had beautiful weather (low 70s and sunny) everyday that we were there and we didn't mind walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: northdown
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time at this hotel at the end of December 2006 for four nights - we were travelling with our kids (aged 2 and 4) and we would highly recommend this hotel for families especially those with young children. The rooms were huge with an excellent view - we took advantage of a previous review and asked for a room on the upper floors. The room was very clean, especially the bathroom, and was serviced daily to a high standard. Its central location close to two T subway stations (Arlington and Boylston) meant that we could easily get around the city. Its a short walk to Downtown Crossing as well as to the shopping mall at Copley Square. The Boston Trolley tour also collects from the Hotel which is another plus and Boston Common, with space and a great playground, is a five minute walk away. There is also a food court across the road including a Starbucks which is handy for a snack and plenty of restaurants. The staff were very helpful and made us all feel very welcome especially in the Theatre Cafe at breakfast where crayons were provided for the kids! We also took advantage of room service for the kids meals in the evening. Service was prompt and food good. We didn't use the pool but it looked fine although the changing rooms were small. One minor concern was that the balcony doors could not be locked - a concern with inquisitive children! Overall I would recommend this hotel highly, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “A cautionary tale”
Reviews.Author: Bermudashorts19
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for three nights during our first visit to Boston. We booked through expedia for convenience and the hotel portion of the vacation price meant our rate was $192 a night. Firstly the practical things everybody wants to know. We thought the room was of generous proportions, the furnishing were in good condition and housekeeping did a good job. We found the sleep number bed very uncomfortable though, it was as if it has been adjusted too many time and was full of lumps and bumps. We also had an extemely small bathroom, I could easily touch opposite walls simultaneously and it made for a very small bath. That said, it was a nice bathroom and I didn't dislike it. I didn't really like the public areas of the hotel, the reception was gloomy and the lifts were slow and nasty looking. However this is probably not a big deal as obviously we spent little time here. So why have I rated this terrible? This is service related and stems from the fact that I booked through Expedia. It seems that Radisson have a poor opinion of such guests and if you book through them you have to expect to be treated as a lower class of guest and a very low priority. When we booked our hotel, two months in advance I asked for a king room and certainly I assumed this was what I was booking. When we got to our room we found it was a twin but the Radisson staff pointed out that in the small print this was only a request and not guaranteed, indeed I found this was the case. But I did order two months in advance so I asked if this could be accommodated anyway and I also advised that this was our wedding anniversary. What followed was the most unbelievable outburst you can imagine. I was essentially told that I had booked via expeida so was a low priority guest and could not expect to be treated like other guests who had booked with them directly. I was told this by three members of staff independently and none of whom made any effort to explain the situation in any terms other than to make me feel like I was a parasite, the type that wants something for nothing and then has the cheek to complain! The third person even told me to call expedia and get them to find me another hotel if i didn't like it. Considering I had been nothing but polite and diplomatic, althought certainly assertive, this was an extraordinarily rude and unhelpful suggestion. Further I was told they always "have this problem" with people who have booked with Expedia or Hotels.com to boot. Well what problem exactly? That people who have paid $192 a night, which actually is NOT a cheap rate, would like to get the room they ordered. If they always refuse it then I am sure they always have this problem, but it is of their making and not the guests. So note to Radisson. This is the 21st century, get used to internet bookings and if you don't like guests who book through the internet then the answer is very simple, don't take them. And see the result in your annual Profit & Loss Account. But please don't accept guests and then treat them like unwanted guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonView
Reviews.Content: This was a sightseeing trip because I had never been to Boston. I was very happy with the location of this hotel. It is only a block from the Boston Common, Public Garden, and the "T" subway train stations. Do not rent a car. Take the public transportation. You can easily get to the rest of the sightseeing places by both the trains and just walking. The restaurant Legal Seafoods is right across from this hotel. The food at the hotel is also good. The hotel itself is an older building on the outside, but has very modern rooms on the inside. I was on the 19th floor; the carpet seemed new, the room was always cleaned, and it had a great view. There's a fitness room that's small but serves its purpose. But the pool needs to be renovated - it had peeling paint. The bed was very comfortable, with sleep-number system, fluffy comforter, and good pillows (there's an old review about thin pillows here on the web, but I found the pillows to be perfect, and I am very picky). The concierage staff was just so-so, did not seem very interested or helpful and one guy directed us to a restaurant that we never found and may not exist. The other complaint is the noisy plumbing - the toilets sound like jet engines and I could hear other rooms' plumbing throughout the night (although I am a light sleeper). But earplugs helped. Another sightseeing tip: Go to the top of the Prudential Center, the skyview with audio tape tour is great. There's a lot of guided tours and you should do at least one to get the full flavor of the history especially the Freedom Trail and North End. I really enjoyed my stay here. General Note: Most of the East Coast establishments do NOT supply toilet seat covers ! !

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CNorm
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight just a month ago with a friend and our 2 teenage daughters. Came to Boston for a weekend of shopping (which is great, by the way). Very much enjoyed this comfortable and attractive hotel. Friendly front desk staff and concierge. The rooms are tastefully decorated (and obviously recently renovated) and have sleep number beds....very comfy. Nice bright bathroom, too. Used the small gym, which was ok, but served the purpose. Daughters used the indoor pool, which was convenient. Excellent location, within easy walk to many Boston attractions (Copley Square, Newbury St. shopping, theater district, restaurants). Weekend rate not bad for a big city hotel (at $246, was cheaper than most). Highly recommend and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel Boston-Great location”
Reviews.Author: BostonRae
Reviews.Content: Having spent a weekend in NYC 3 months ago at a much pricier hotel and a small room, I was pleasantly surprised with my room at the Radisson. I arrived at 11:00, 4 hours before check-in. As the hotel had been booked the nite before, I was unable to get a room early. I was able to leave my bags with the bellman and returned at 1:30 and was given a room. No hassles. I was on the top (Room 2420) floor and had a magnificent view of the city from my private balcony. Having gone to the other end of the hotel and looking at the view from that end, it didn't compare the view I had. The room was quite large by hotel standards. The Sleep Number bed was a big plus. Great pillows for sleeping. The bathroom was quite small but well appointed. My room, bathroom and the hotel in general were quite clean. No odors in the elevators. The concierge was quite helpful with making a reservation at the Boston Aquarium for a Whale Watch Tour and with other questions I had about the city. My only complaint was that I was right next to the elevator bank so it was a little loud at times but not overwhelming. The rooms were not cleaned until after 1:00, but always with fresh toiletries-unlike my NYC hotel. Fresh bed linens were on request. I thought the location was great, just a block from the Boston Commons and Public Gardens. But then everything is in walking distance in Boston. Traveller Tip: While flagging a cab to return to the airport, a van pulled up and it cost me $14.50. It was the last stop before the airport. On my arrival I went with a private car and it cost me $35.00 and I was told a taxi would be $25-$30. Unfortunately I didn't get the name of the company, but forgo a taxi and use one of these shuttle vans. I'm sure the hotel can be of service. I will definitely stay here on my next trip requesting a room a few doors down from the one I had to avoid the elevator noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the View and Attention from Staff”
Reviews.Author: novice_explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel and enjoyed every one of them. We requested an upper floor room away from the elevators. They accommodated us by putting us on the 22nd floor at the very end of the hall, as far away from the elevators as you can get. The room was quite large and all furnishings were very comfortable. The balcony outside our sliding glass doors afforded us a spectacular view of the area. We found we liked it better than the views we discovered from the 52nd floor of the Prudential Tower. A full-size closet to hang our clothes, a full length mirror, beds with adjustable firmness settings, an above-average bathroom, and a balcony made this a great place to stay. Even with all that, the thing that made our stay the most enjoyable was the bell staff. Immediately upon our arrival our bags were loaded up and delivered to our room. In my experience, usually you have to wait a bit for someone to be summoned to assist you. That was not the case here. At our departure, the bellhop quickly hailed us a cab and loaded our luggage even as he was busy assisting a group of about 20 with transportation. Any time we needed service from any department it was met with promptness, courtesy, and a smile. The location was also excellent as we were able to walk to shopping, eating, and tourist spots. It was also a pick up/ drop off point for the trolley, which is a great way to see the area, especially on a slightly rainy day. The only downsides were somewhat slow service in the Theatre Cafe restaurant and some noise from nearby room's plumbing and what we think was a storage closet next to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: lkbarber
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Radisson Hotel Boston. We followed the advise of other trip advisors and asked for a renovated room on a high floor. Our room was on the 24th floor and was very nice. It looked like it had been recently renovated. The view at night was fantastic. The staff was very helpful with suggestions on where to eat, etc. Also, the hotel is located one block from the Boston Common and the start of the Freedom Trail. When we booked our room, I paid for the rate that included the parking and the hot breakfast buffet. The hot breakfast buffet was very good and had a lot of selections. We parked our car when we arrived and never used it the whole time we were there. We either walked, rode the trolley, or caught a taxi. The trolley stops at the front door of the hotel which is another plus. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great View at Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSquire
Reviews.Content: Despite looking like a "car-park" from the outside this hotel was actually excellent. The staff were really friendly, and the room spacious with good facilities - particular praise for the bed which was excellent. The view from rooms high up is amazing. Location is good - 1 block from Boston Common and easy to walk to China Town, Financial District and the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good”
Reviews.Author: 2UKTravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked a basic room and it was good and spacey and the bathroom was good. Bed was excellent as you can adjust the hardness/softness on both sides! Breakfast was fine but pricey. We took into account other reviews on TripAdvisor and asked for a quiet room away from the elevators and got one, and it was quiet. Situation is good for theatres and not too far to walk to the T. Only downside was that a cleaner left our door unlocked after cleaning the room and the staff behind the desk were not that concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend 2006”
Reviews.Author: RJGutierrez
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on Friday, September 1st. Unfortunately for me, Saturday was not available. The hotel was great. It was located in the theater district within walking distance of just about every thing in Boston - so we never used our car. We booked through the hotel website as advised by someone in one of the reviews here on TripAdvisor and received the hotel, parking, and breakfast package. This turned out to be a better deal than I expected as the food and staff serving breakfast were professional and the food excellent. We were on the 23rd floor and our hotel room overlooked the Boston area and the Prudential tower. The concierge was able to get us a 20% discount on our dinner cruise tickets on the Odyssey. The $160 price for two for a cruise on Bostons Harbor along with a 4 course gourmet meal and dancing were great! I would recommend this hotel to all and will only stay at this hotel on future trips. From the staff to service and the clean, spacious, and elegant rooms.. this hotel gets 5 stars from me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooms + beds - you will not leave anymore!”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for three nights with our three adolescent children. We all thouroughly enjoyed the very modern, spacious and relaxing rooms - and above all the number one bed, which are simply fabulous. From the outside the hotel is awful and we were quite shocked when we first arrived. Our impression of the lobby wasn't any better. But we were fully satisfied with the room on 17th and 23rd floor with great view + balcony. We would definitely stay there again. Breakfast for four (to pay for one child at the reasonable rate of about $ 7.--).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lbouchard33
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston and we were a bit nervous about driving in the city as everything you read tells you not to drive in Boston. This hotel was not far off the highway and we booked the package that included parking and breakfast. We parked our car and didn't worry about it until we left the next day. We were told that we could leave the car in the garage up to 6 pm on check out day and had to bring the ticket to the hotel lobby to have it validated before we left. We ended up leaving our car parked there until 8pm and the ticket was validated without question and we didn't have to pay additional parking fees. The hotel is in an excellent location. We happend to be going to the Charles Play House to see the Blue Man Group (loved the show) and it was less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We walked to Quincy Market and the Prudential Center from the hotel and neither took more than 30 minutes. The Prudential was a bit closer than Quincy.... but the walk to Quincy was beautiful as you pass through the Boston Commons and so many beautiful buildings. The hotel room was very clean and the sleep number beds were comfortable. The bed linens are a very nice quality and they feel crisp and clean. We thought the room was a bit on the small side and the bathroom was small as well....but we didn't spend much time in the room, so it was fine. The concierge was very helpful and booked our tickets on the duck tour. I'm glad we paid the $2.50 fee to book ahead as you can only buy the tickets from the Prudential building the day of the tour. We saw signs early on in the afternoon saying the next available tour was for 6:30 that evening. We will most certainly return to the Radisson for future trips to Boston and would highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and Most comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: laka
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this hotel and we enjoyed the Radison Hotel a great deal. My family of 4 including 2 teenagers ,were impressed with the hotel and the wonderful comfort number beds. These were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on and the bed linen was very nice too. Everything was clean and the staff was helpful. We would stay at this hotel again if in Boston. The location was good and the parking garage (included in the room package) was very convient. So we were able to walk or take the tour trolly and didn't have to use the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & room”
Reviews.Author: TripAdisorMember
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for two nights recently, and I was very happy with the Radisson Hotel Boston. The most important things for us in this search was location and parking. Having never been to Boston, and hearing lots of stories about the traffic, we wanted to be in the thick of things and able to walk the city. The Radisson is in heart of the theater district, which is also pretty central to the entire city. It's location was great, for everything we did. We weren't more than a 10-15 minute walk from all the major food and touristy things. But the thing to really make it great was that we didn't have to worry about our car and parking too much. We found the hotel, and parked, and that was it! The room rate that I got included the parking fee - which can run you around $20 bucks a day at a public/private garage, or even on the street (but good luck finding that one). We got a rate of $199 a night off of their website, Internet rate deals, the package included the parking. Great deal - for Boston prices and parking. I did a lot of searching, and you can get a better deal if you go to a place that doesn't include parking, and is a little bit more out of the way - maybe 165 or so....Having a toddler and wanting to not worry about the parking situation - the extra money was well worth it to me.
