The room we stayed in was newly renovated, seemed brand new to me. Fresh , clean , brand new fixtures in the bathroom. The room had 2 of those new Select Comfort beds which was a nice bonus. The sheets were soft and comfortable, cotton and not that weird polyester bed spread that most hotels have as a standard. Down comforter to boot, and a balcony that looked out into the city. The pool and gym were adequate, we got some decent time in during the dinner time hour when most people were out. The only thing that was a little difficult was that they have a set of hotel elevators, and separate parking garage elevators. We couldn't figure out if they connected or not - the problem was there were a few stairs to manuever up/down with our luggage, stroller, and toddler...so it was a little bit inconvenient, but definitely not any kind of show stopper. We had a great time in Boston, and would definitely stay at the Radisson again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: reba404
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reading reviews and looking at prices in the Boston area. The Radisson was reasonably priced for the city--it's an incredibly expensive place to stay--and in a great location. It has good reviews on this site as well. It did not disappoint. The room is nicely sized and the bed is comfortable. It had a balcony and provided an excellent view. I requested a high floor and away from the elevator and my requests were honored. It is a quiet, clean and well kept hotel. There are several restaurants within a block and there's a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts half a block away. The T subway is a block away as well. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Lindak1221
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable and equipped with a sleep number bed and hi-speed internet. We had a great view from our 23rd floor balcony. We stayed here 3 nights and were happy with the nearby restaurants. The pool and exercise area were less than expected but we were so busy being tourists that we didn't have time for them anyway. Lots of outdoor sunning area on the roof. Parking here is less expensive than in neighboring parking lots. We were quite happy at the Radisson and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: TheWishnik
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson in Boston on Stuart St. one night in March. Kinda expected it to be a typical chain hotel, but it was actually very clean and elegant. The front desk staff was extremely friendly & helpful. Stayed in a good-sized room with a balcony that offered a decent view of the city. Located right in the theater district and near the Boston Common and also near a lot of fantastic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Radison rules”
Reviews.Author: mwa55
Reviews.Content: Boston is a great, repeat, great town! We walked, rode the trolley, used the T and had a wonderful time. The Radison was great- good staff, nice comfortable room- very clean; beds were comfy (Sleep # beds are good we have one at home) Ate at Legal seafood across the street and then at PF Chaings nearby. Ate breakfast at hotel one morning- $8.95 for eggs, muffin, bacon and coffee! Also got Dunkin Donuts down the street one AM. If you like Dunkin there are over 100 in the city. Overall can't say a bad thing stay here and you will be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aong
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the hotel looks a bit shabby. It is sandwiched between 2 wings of a car park. Ignore this. Inside the hotel is what you would expect from a Radisson Hotel. The staff were couteous and helpful when we needed them. The room was excellent and very easily accomodated 2 adults and a teenager. The Location is what makes this hotel. It is beside Boston Common, on the edge of the Theatre District and China Town and just a short walk from Newbury Street. The only downside was the pool. It is very poor and felt undermaintained. But then we did not go for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, WONDERFUL LOCATION, FANTASTIC VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: ANGMACLEAN
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel after travelling for over 12 hours from Scotland. We were greeted by very friendly staff who were very welcoming. The reception staff even had time to talk to my two young children and tell them how to go about getting free ice cream from the hotel, this was a big hit on arrival, instantly we had 2 happy children. We were given a wonderful room with amazing views of the Charles River and the city of Boston. The beds in the room were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, were just what we needed after a long trip. We used the hotel,s garage which cost $25 per night and had free valet parking (which we did not use), we managed to park our own car and find it again with no problems at all . There are two restaurants for breakfast one of which is more casual, continental breakfast which we used and were happy with. The only complaint I could find about this hotel was that the pool was slightly cool but still enjoyable. We stayed here for our scheduled 2 nights then moved on to continue our itinery. Unfortunately one of our next hotels was sodreadful that we decided to return to the Royal Sonesta and enjoyed another 2 nights here. Would recommend this hotel and would return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Boston .”
Reviews.Author: dkeith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year (on my own ) and came back for another 6 nights this year (with my spouse). Definitely my hotel of choice in Boston . The room was very spacious - we benefited from getting the room that tucks in behind the elevator and this results in large room . This gives great space and we had no noise issues whatsoever. It would seem the bathroom did not benefit from the same facelift as the room. While the bathroom was still OK, it could use extra shelf space and finishes could be updated. Contact with the staff was minimal but bell captains were about the best I've seen -very helpful but not intrusive. One nice feature was the general activity in the lobby, always a few people around but almost always quiet enough so that it felt relaxing and never rushed as so many large hotels feel. Security staff were around but again never intrusive and card access was required to sleeping floors after 11pm (nice feature). The sleep number bed and the linen were very nice indeed as were the robes. What is really great is the location for a reasonable (for downtown Boston) price. This is the best location (in my view)in Boston -about 2 minutes from Boston Common and a reasonable walk to Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Quincy Market. Also the Boylston subway stop(Green line) is a 4-5 minute walk -a good way to/from airport. Good range of restaurants in the area from Bennigans to upscale Bonfire. If you want to stay in something a tad fancier then the Park Plaza and the 4 Seasons are a stone's throw away. We walked by many other hotels noted in these reviews but weighing all aspects , we had no second guesses and would return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jkknoonan
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Boston Radisson recently as part of a conference i was attending. As part of this yearly conference, i have had some extraordinarily poor experiences in chain hotels and often cringe at the thought of what awaits. From the moment i called to make my reservations, i had the feeling that this was going to be a better experience. The reservation person was warm, friendly, conversational and seemed to be genuinely iterested in my reservation and experience in Boston. Check in was smooth as silk, and even a promised in-room refrigerator was there with out having to make another call. And the beds... I don't think i have ever slept so well in a hotel. They are sleep number beds as advertised on TV. They were heavenly! The staff was top notch. Every employee spoke to us as we waited for elevators or passed by. A nod and good morning with a genuine smile but how refreshing!! The bell captains grabed doors and assisted with steps without even a look - all with a smile and wave. As i said, we planned a conference for this hotel and the event coordinating staff were exceptionally helpful and proactive. The meal in the banquet room was the best i've ever had in a banquet setting and served quickly and professionally. As i was leaving the banquet room, struggling with a load of papers and books, one of the staff approached and offered to take it to my room. I wrote down my room number and he started to walk off without even waiting for a tip! (Of course, i chased him down and rewarded his thoughtfulness.) If i HAD to say anything derogatory, it would be that the bathroom didn't have enough shelf space. Also, having such a great experience is going to make it very difficult for other hotels to please me in the future!!! Without hesitation, i would recommend this hotel for a convenient, pleasant stay in a Great American City!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the heels of some very disappointing lodging during a road trip in the northeast, this was a very pleasant experience. This is precisely what one should be able to expect from a metropolitan hotel affiliated with a leading brand name. The location is great, the restaurants nearby are numerous and the facility is very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, 2 children - 11&9) and I stayed at the Radisson from June 18 through June 22 - 4 nights. We had a room on the 15th floor facing West which was a view of the Prudential Tower and John Hancock building. If staying at this hotel request a high floor (above 14) with a West view. The balcony was very nice and the children liked to go out and watch over the pool area and also read. Overall the best thing about this hotel is the location. We were able to walk to the Boston Commons, Chinatown, the T and we actually walked to Quincy Market & Faneuil Hall one day. The walk to Quincy Market took about 15-20 minutes, but it was a very leisurely pace down Stuart to Tremont, then one block over to Washington. Washington is a major shopping area with the renowned Filene's Basement. From Washington, take a right on Court/State Street and you can see Quincy Market. The other great thing about this hotel is the pool. There are not many hotels in Boston that have a pool and although this one is not "outside" the rooftop deck area provide plenty of light in the pool area. We used the pool every afternoon for about 2 hours in between morning tours and dinner plans. During our stay we went on the Duck Tour, which was entertaining, however I won't do this again. The last time we were in Boston we did the trolley tour which was much better because you were able to get off at various locations and then reboard. If your Con'duck'tor on the duck tour is not entertaining, then the ride is not that much fun. The kids were really bored after the initial "splash" down into the water. We also toured Fenway Park. This is a must do even if you are not a baseball fan. This was probably the best bang for the buck - $12/adult. You get to sit in the green monster seats and in the press box. One evening for dinner we went to the North Shore (Italian area). We took the T to the Haymarket station and then we got lost! The concierge did not mention how to get to the area once you got off the T. So we started out in the wrong direction, stopped somebody on the street and then found our way over to Hanover street. What a choice of restaurants. There are so many it is really difficult to choose. There was one place called Giacomo's (sp?) that we stopped at because there were a lot of people standing outside. When we asked how long the wait, the one guy told us that he lived around the corner and that this was the best place on the block. He said they tell everyone 20 minutes, but even if it is 40 minutes, it is worth the wait. Unfortunately for us, it was already 7:40 and the kiddos were hungry so we couldn't wait. If you go, please place a review to let us know if you liked it! Back to the room- the room was a decent size for a family of 4. We weren't in the room that much so it never got too small. The bathroom was adequate. The counter was really low, I'm 5'7" and It only came up mid-thigh. I felt like I was really bending to wash my face. Also, the counter surface was very old. There was a hair dryer and a small coffee maker, but we made a Dunkin Donuts run every morning for coffee - there is DD across the street (and it seems like one on every corner in Boston - they have the BEST coffee). What we found is that if you leave $5 on your first day for the housekeeper you get pretty good service for the week. We did leave more on our last day, but I think it always helps to leave a little something in the beginning of the stay. Hope this was helpful. Enjoy your trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room But Terrible Noise from Elevator”
Reviews.Author: grace123
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Radisson Boston two years before and had just a happy memory. So I decided on Radisson without hesitation. I stayed for 2 nights this time. I stayed at 5 hotels during my trip in USA and it was the 3rd hotel. On arrival, the female staff greeted me brightly. 'Welcome back' She was smiling, which made me pleased. I don't understand why some of the hotel staffs are so stingy with smile. This time the room with one king bed was more spacious than the previous room with two queen beds, but the bathroom was too small, which embarrassed me. Maybe its peculiar floor plan was due to the location next to the elevator. Anyway it was bearable because we got more room instead. The bigger problem was NOISE!!! It prevented us from sleeping till midnight. At first we thought the noise was from the A/C, so turned it off. After a process of trial and error, we realized that the elevator was mailnly responsible for the noise. I always ask for a quiet room when booking a hotel room. 'a quiet room with a good view on the high floor' Did I miss 'quiet'?? Or Did the king bed cause the trouble? The biggest problem was the unfriendly attitude of the staff, which is unimaginable in high level hotels in Korea, my country. When I checked out, the staff looked so indifferent. I had experienced the same two years before when check-out. However I had understand to an extent because of my early check-out time. The door man was unkind at first and helped us carry our bags into the taxi later. I had sent an e-mail about my mileage accumulation soon after coming back from my trip 2 years ago. I had got no reply. They are not attentive at all. Actually I got help from the lady who was at reservation desk. I asked her where to get off on subway to reach my destination and she answered kindly. I wanted to watch a famous musical in the evening, but being too tired to get out of the hotel room, gave it up at last. Pros: neat & tidy(room, linens, pillows, bathroom) , good view, internet, ...... enough room, location( near Boston Common and T-station), newspaper Cons: attitude of the staff, noise from the elevator, noise from the A/C, ...... balcony's dirt

Reviews.Title: “Great location , bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: traceyf
Reviews.Content: this is a a hotel with a great location. rooms are spaciuos and have great facilities. It is a bit pricey if you book direct with the hotel but if you book via a booking agent such a octopus and expedia its good value. We booked the first 3 nights through the internet and the last night direct with the hotel and the price difference was considerable. however they have a nice bar/restuarant/lobby area and a great outdoor area at the bar so its great to sit on the terrace of an evening with a glass of wine and take in Boston. I would definatley recommend this hotel, but take my advice and book through an agent!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, below average staff.”
Reviews.Author: Beta7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends (all 22-24 years old). Although we are a very respectful group, the staff treated us like 10 year olds. When I returned home, I wrote a letter complaining about the staff and they did give us a hefty credit to our accounts. We all appreciated their willingness to correct their mistake. The rooms were great! Very clean and comfortable. Every room has a great view with a balcony. We had a great time despite the staff. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Radisson Boston!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my semiannual trip to the Radisson Boston and once again I had a great stay. As usual, the staff was friendly, accommodating, and efficient. The location of the hotel is great, close to tons of restaurants and a quick walk to everything Boston has to offer. They must have remolded some of the bathrooms (mine was brand new) and replaced the beds (I got one of those Sleep Number Beds) since my last visit. The bathroom was great and the lines on the bed were a nice upgrade. As other reviewers have stated, the furniture and wallpaper is getting a bit tired and itâ€™s time to replace themâ€¦hopefully, they will do this soon. Either way, Iâ€™ll be backâ€¦this hotel canâ€™t be beat!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a college trip with my two sons. The Radisson was wonderful. The room was very nice, extremly clean and very comfortable. The bathrooms were brand new and lovely. The hotel was very well located and the staff was very efficient. This hotel was very well priced. We all had breakfast and were able to park our car with our room which was priced at $209. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel and I would stay again and again! I'm very picky about hotels and have stayed at some of the best. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your car!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was satisfactory, but valet parking was included with my room, and my car was obviously rifled through (glove compartment, ashtray). Beware when valet parking at this hotel. The hotel was not at all helpful when I complained. They don't seem to care who they employ.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pepoling
Reviews.Content: Number one factor for a hotel for me is location, which for the Radisson was excellent. Just 2 blocks to a T stop, right near Boston Common & theater district. We paid a very reasonable price for a huge room (double room = 2 queen size beds) that we used for 4 people with plenty of space. The bathroom was spotless and fair sized. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast at the cafe (not cheap, but good). This hotel was an excellent value for its location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whilst staying at the Radisson we were pleased until we were woken at 8am by drilling in our roof. Apparently the hotel is undergoing renovations until May 2006, but they are still keeping most of the hotel open. This may result in you having to put up with tremendous noise during your stay. This is a nice hotel, but avoid until they have finished renovations because they will put you right under the floors they are working on!

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: lilyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last minute for one night at the end of our honeymoon last year. It's reall not much to look at from the outside, but we got a room on the 23rd floor with spectacular views of the John Hancock and Prudential towers! the balcony is small and concretey, but we spent about an hour out there watching the sun go down over the city. the bed was *huge* and the bathroom was newly renovated. only downside was that no breakfast was included for the price...

Reviews.Title: “terrible room next to elevator”
Reviews.Author: lifes2short
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean, has large rooms and the remodelled rooms are quite nice. JUST DON'T ACCEPT ONE NEXT TO THE ELEVATOR. We stayed in room 2320 and it should be against the law to rent this room. Loud, vibrating rumblin noises ALL NIGHT go right through the walls. NO SLEEP FOR US. Yes, the obvious solution would be to request another room, but we did not realize we had the noise until we got in after 10 PM and settled down to bed....who wanted to move then? I am still in my room writing this and plan to refuse to pay for the room....I'll see what happens :(

Reviews.Title: “Awful service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I stayed at the Radisson over spring break, we were treated very poorly. There was a bag of merchandise taken from my room and never recovered. The front desk and security were not kind and not accomodating. They never followed up on the incident and called me a liar when I tried to follow up with them. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Loved the concierge!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Nov. 11-13th and this hotel is fabulous. The rooms are spacious and clean with outrageous beds and bedding. The bathrooms are newly renovated and very mod. The locations is central to everything and the hotel staff was more than helpful and friendly. We got a room that backed up to the elevator and it sounded like a rollercoaster, and when I called for a new room they moved us across the hall and over one room within minutes. We were moved in less than 10 minutes and with no hassle what-so-ever! The most wonderful part of our stay was the CONCIERGE, JOHN HALLETT! He recommended ALL of our restaurants, shows and tours and never once steered us wrong. He chose everything according to our likes and dislikes and he was right on the money! He was attentive, interested and most importantly he became like a friend to my husband and I! Make sure you ask for John if you stay, he will send you to all the right places! Frank and Leslee Ent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson on Stuart Street in Boston in November 2005. The room was beautiful and I am never comfortable in hotel rooms. The bathroom was very modern and clean. The bed was amazing - with the softest sheets and a down comforter with duvet. When we checked out the bellhop gave us great directions (they were typed up and we were able to take them with us) and a map of the area that was helpful. Overall a great great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: YosM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Radisson with my parents. Everything was great. Big clean room, great friendly service. We had no problems except that we woke up couple of times at night due to loud noise coming from next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: fsufan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. The room was large, had a balcony, and was very clean. Location was good...T stop was a few blocks away as was Boston Common. Was able to walk to Faneuil Hall and to Newberry Street (about a fifteen minute walk to each). Agree with another reviewer that the bathroom needs updating. Our shower had hardly any water pressure. Several restaurants are near by...Legal Seafood, Fleming's, Maggiano's, Smith and Wollensky. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with good view”
Reviews.Author: tripprf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a single room on the 18th floor and had a beautiful view of the west side of the city. The hotel is very close to the Boston theater district, Boston Commons, and the Public Gardens. The room was good size, very clean, and quiet. There are some good restaurants around the hotel, including two small pubs up Tremont street and a McCormick and Scmicks across the street. We booked and prepaid for our room through Orbitz for $179.00 and the front desk staff made a big deal about having to take a credit card deposit in case of damages since the room was already paid for (what that was about, I have no idea). Aside from the somewhat snippy front desk person, the overall experience was a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..Large rooms..Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston 3 nights at what was to be the beginning of a 10 day trip to New England. The ONLY things not great about the hotel was the bathroom which was dated. The room was big, for a Boston Hotel and clean. Easy check in....helpful staff...within walking distance of EVERYTHING. Local Seafoods is directly across the street....a whole food court is one block east. The main car rental venue is across the street as well. Boston Commons is two blocks away. We walked to the waterfront and back easily. The pick up site for Trolley tours is directly in front. The night of our last stay, we walked to a great restaurant (Laurel Grill) and on the way home I tripped and cut my knee...requiring an emergency room visit and 10 stitches. The staff at the hotel were MOST helpful...got us a wheelchair...told the cabbie where to go...helped us back to the room when we returned....and gave us a VERY late check out the next day since our flight home (RATS) was at 6PM and I wasn't feeling great. We would certainly stay here again, and would gladly recommend this to all our friends. Best of all, we had gotten a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fit for a king”
Reviews.Author: hazelhazel
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 13-year old for three days in mid-August. The reviews seemed up and down for this place; we got the "up" experience. Actually enjoyed the location, near the Boston Commons, and not too far to walk to other attractions. Other than arriving early morning and not being able to check in until 3 (at 2:30 they said, "It's not 3 yet." Ughh), everything else was great. The rooms were huge, the beds perfect, nicely furnished, a great bathroom with all the amenities, a daily morning paper, and balconies in every room! Ours overlooked the John Hancock Tower and old rooftops throughout the city. Wonderful. One big reason we stayed there (believe it or not) was that they had a swimming pool. When it's hot and sometimes humid, this certainly comes in handy, and it did). An indoor pool, with some workout facilities. Can't beat that to break up a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean great hotel with professional staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights aug. 9 and 10. It is an excellent hotel. Very quiet, we didn't here people above us or walking in the hallways. Also, did not hear traffic outside. It is in a great location, close to public gardens and right across the street from Legal Seafoods which is always a treat! The staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Location,Clean Room!!”
Reviews.Author: Quinn96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had 3 rooms for our family. We had the 14th and 12th floors. Rooms were very fresh smelling and clean. Spotless...I had read negative reviews a day or two before our stay but was pleasantly surprised by friendly staff, excellent location and easy access to everything!!! I have a 14 month old child and was comfortable with him on the floor the carpet was brand new, crib was very nice too. Port a crib, not a pack and play. The breakfast staff didn't speak English and our to go order got a little mixed up but the blueberry pancakes were fresh (berries) and delicious!!! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would most certainly stay again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here: 3 july 2005 - 5 july 2005 The hotel is easy to find coming from the highway, and the city center is easy to reach by foot or taxi. The hotel is a large concrete block, but it's about the inside, which is great. Checking in only took minutes, while the car got parked in the garage next door. ($26/24hrs). The room was large and well equipped, the beds were large and we had a nice balcony viewing Boston's skyline from the 21st floor. Everything was clean and working fine. There also was a nice pool and a fitness area which were free to use, the vending machines were cheap which you wouldn't expect from a hotel like this. For $100 a night (priceline) this was a great deal. The place is really worth more money. A great way to experience Independance Day. I would really stay here again, so should you!

Reviews.Title: “good Location. costly Parking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July. The location was good as indicated by other reviewers. The drainage in bathroom was an irritating problem. I was put up in 21st floor. It would not work. That negates all other positive aspects of the hotel. Be informed about 28$ overnight parking charge. This hotel is located next to Arlington subway station. Close to attractions. While checking out, I tried to use the TV service and it will not work. Its ok as you can go to the front lobby. It is good for a day or two stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: JMS7-8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a tour with my youth symphony, which included a stay at the Boston Radisson. There were some early problems, such as a somewhat uncooperative front desk staff and a consistent drainage problem in bathrooms above the 14th floor (one room that reported a drainage problem ended up with black scum covering the better part of their bathroom after the engineering crew 'blew out the pipes.' They had to clean it up themselves!) Actually, the bathrooms left something to be desired overall (chipped tile, countertops that pooled water instead of draining it, and so forth.) However, my group faced a very serious dilemma the morning we were scheduled to leave. Two of the four elevators for the hotel (which has 24 floors) were out of commission. I had students trapped on the 16th floor, unable to access an elevator for over an hour. When I phoned the front desk to ask them about the situation, their initial reply was "We've dedicated two of our elevators to a group of 90 who are checking out..." Since we WERE the group of 90, I knew this was a fabrication! Things really turned ugly when some of the students decided to take the stairs, only to find that the stairwells were locked-down on the 9th floor. If there had been a fire, I shudder to think of what would have happened. When this was brought to the attention of the Radisson, their (weak) reply was... "Well, if there was a fire the doors would automatically unlock..." which, frankly, no one believed given the variety of mechanical failures we observed during our stay. Needless to say, I would never stay at this hotel again, and sincerely hope that other groups and tour providers will heed this warning ---

Reviews.Title: “Great Room! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great room! Newly rennovated, very large, 2-Queen size beds with plenty of room for 2 portable cribs. Great Location! Walking distance to just about everything, Publics Gardens (Swan Boats), Boston Commons, Fannueil Hall, Quincy Market, Duck Tours. Good price, although parking was extra. Friendly staff that was helpful in suggesting kid-friendly activities and making reservations. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business, and I was happy with my choice. The doors and hallway carpets are a bit dated, but the rooms are nicely furnished, and it was very nice to have a balcony and have access to fresh outside air, as others have mentioned. The fitness center has a couple of treadmills, bikes, and free weights, with two TVs, but it is located in an enclosed room next to the pool, and it gets VERY hot and humid in there. Also, there is no drinking water available in the pool/fitness center area. Hotel staff were cordial and helpful. Location was terrific, too, with nice views of the city, and it's nice to have theater as an entertainment option. Do yourself a favor and sample some of the terrific independent restaurants in the neighborhood - no need to visit chains such as Bennigan's, Legal Seafood, and Maggiano's when there are better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Beantown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May for one night on May 7 and it was a good night. We were supposed to go to the Sox game but it was rained out so we went to the doubleheader game the next day. It was raining and windy all day yet we still were able to walk around Boston and enjoyed it very much. The beds and room were beautiful and the view of the park, FleetCenter (or Derek Jeter Center), and the whole Financial District. I will come back next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a junior suite, and we had unbelievable views of Boston Common, the State House and the Boston skyline. We spent a good deal of time on the balcony (all rooms have balconies), taking in the lights and the spectacle of late-night revellers mingling with the theater crowds into the early morning hours. It wasn't a problem for us because we're up late anyway, but the endless cacophony of car horns and sirens might be problematic for light sleepers. Location is ubeatable here. Very close to the Common, Beacon Hill and Copley Place, with Chinatown (the best late-night dining option in the city) a mere three blocks away. You can just park your car in the garage ($17/ night) and leave it for the weekend-- a nice option, because driving in Boston is a nightmare. The bed in our suite was luxurious, with nice plump pillows and a new mattress. The bathroom was on the small side, but no big deal. Desk staff and concierges were friendly and quick with suggestions. Decent pool. So-so lobby. Room decor uninspired but unobtrusive. For under $200-- particularly because we were upgraded to a suite-- we felt we got a very good deal for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal...Great Room...Nice View”
Reviews.Author: jayetee
Reviews.Content: My sister and I brought my niece to Boston for her 16th birthday. We stayed at the Radisson and what a surprise when we saw the room. It was relatively spacious, comfortable, and presented a wonderful view overlooking the city. We got a great deal at $105 through an online service and we were not disappointed - we got a true bargain for the location and quality. We would stay here again without hesitation. If there is a downside, it is the somewhat antiquated bathroom. It was a "typical" for hotels bathroom. I have stayed at hotels with luxurious bathrooms; however, this would not be a deterrent since it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Hideous Exterior of the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: optom
Reviews.Content: This is an unspectacular hotel, but it is well located and the rooms are large -they all seem to have been refurbished recently. I paid $135 a night through quikbook and would certainly stay there again at that sort of price.

Reviews.Title: “everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Coxy
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights from the 10th March. Location good but not the best for the city attractions but this did not affect our trip. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Staff extremely courteous and helpful, room clean and sheets changed on a daily basis, furnishings were nice. Bathroom was looking a little 'tired' but the hotel is undergoing refurbishment at the moment (this did not affect our stay at all). Only complaint I have, (and it is a very, very minor one, and something we have encountered at other hotels), is the air con/heating system was very noisy when it cut in and it continually woke us up the first couple of nights of our stay until we got used to it. If the price was right we would stay here again as the hotel has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Theater District - Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Maybe2nite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in March of 2003 and it was a terrible experience from start to finish. When we arrived to our room there was a rotten egg smell in it. Every morning we were awakened by construction. The day we were leaving the valet pulled our vehicle up with a busted rear window. The hotel claimed no responsibility for the vehicle damage claiming it is a public garage where they park the hotel guests' cars. After asking for the staff's assistance to tape the window for us because we had a 6 hour drive home, they placed a garbage bag over the window with a piece of masking tape, it was a pathetic attempt. I would never stay at this hotel ever again. Terrible service, room and location.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY EXCELLENT.”
Reviews.Author: bazaa
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in hotels all over the USA. This is quite simply the best hotel ive EVER stayed in. The staff, location, rooms, room service - the entire package. Every hotel I stay in is rated against this one - "Yeah it was good, but not a good as the Radisson Boston". An absolute delight, can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A bit costly, but not bad overall”
Reviews.Author: geniph
Reviews.Content: The positives: the location is good, the views can be very nice (I had a view of Boston Common), my room had a nice balcony, which meant I could open the window. That's always a plus to me, as I don't like to use air-conditioning in most hotels; it's usually full of mold and aggravates my allergies. The room decor leaves a lot to be desired. The rooms are dark and rather dingy. The beds are adequate and the rooms adequately equipped. They have above-average toiletries. The coffee provided isn't particularly good and the coffeemaker is itsy-bitsy. The soundproofing's not too bad, but you do hear a bit too much of people passing in the hallways and doors slamming, which I hate. They accommodated my request for a high floor, quiet room (I request that in every hotel). The coffee shop is above average. The service varies wildly depending on who you get. I'd requested early check-in because I was flying in sleepless on a red-eye, and this was not accommodated; in fact, I couldn't check in until almost 4 p.m. Some of the desk clerks can be quite brusque. The bell captain, on the other hand, bent over backward to try to help out, storing my luggage for me, etc. Because the hotel was packed to the gills the week I was there, the service was more rudimentary than perhaps it would normally be. I wasn't able to get bellhop or concierge assistance during my stay; they were just too busy. Security was very good. High-speed internet access is available, but costly ($10 per day), and don't try to get help with the hookup. I fixed the initial problem with my hookup myself, but I've been a server administrator for 20 years. I don't know that a regular user would have been able to get connected without help. I waited on the tech support line for about 20 minutes while I was trying to fix the problem myself, and did finally resolve the issue while I was on hold. I never got an actual person on the line before I fixed it. If I'd been a normal user, that would have been pretty frustrating, I think. Hotel staff knows nothing about how to do the hookup; it's a third party company that does the support. Room service is disappointing; very expensive and the food is not particularly good. It also took a long time to get the food. Overall, for the price, a little disappointing, but not bad. By the way, don't judge the hotel by its outside appearance; it looks like a prison block from the outside, but it's nicer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: m0nec1a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Boston in mid January. It is in walking distance of theatres (live and cinema) a comedy club, great restaurants and the subway (called the "T"). The rooms are very spacious, the beds are comfortable, and the maid service is top notch. Ask for a room away from the elevator because its quite loud. Its best to get a room facing the Hancock building - the view will be awesome. Their restaurant, called the Theatre Cafe, has great food, but it is a little pricey. Breakfast will be about $15.00 for one person. The workout room faces the swimming pool. All are enclosed in glass so you see a great view of the city, but it also means that if you're swimming, the folks in the gym get a view of your rear. The only minuses I can think of is that the business center only has two computer terminals, and its about 10 dollars for 15 minutes to use the Internet. There's also no fridge, microwave or VCR in the rooms. If you're traveling to Boston, there's no need to rent a car. Just take the "T" everywhere. You can take shuttle #33 at Ground Transportation at Logan to the "T" subway. The Arlington or Boylston stop are closest to the Radisson. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Swoon0
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here on New years eve, Check in was courteous and efficient, bell boy was delightful, even taking a map of the city with him to our room and showing us what and where everything was happening on first night. We had a bit of a party happening above us at around 4 a.m. when I called the desk they were apologetic and the noise stopped within 5 minutes as she said she would send up security - it happened as they said it would so thumbs up. Didn't check out the facilites there at all but our room was very tastefully decorated with two queen beds in it (even though we only booked a king room !!), with a balcony with a view of the John Hancock building etc,. It's in a great location too, 5 mins walk from Boston Common. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: CT-Travler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 3 times in the past four years. Used to stay at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Towers but when the rates when up found the Radisson online and it is right around the corner from the Boston Park Plaza. GREAT LOCATION: Close to the theatre district, Boston Common, Newberry Street, and the Long Wharf area. The rooms are big and are fairly priced for a Boston hotel. Only compaints are that the service is a little slow during busy times and during one of my stays there were three or four tiny ants on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “100% Satisfaction Guaranteed??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having spent a night in the Radisson I made the mistake of using the hotel phone-after 11 minutes on an international call I was horrified to be greeted with a bill for $58-on querying this extortionate charge with the duty manager (after several efforts) I finally was told to review the phone call charge was explained in full on the reverse of the "100% Satisfaction Guaranteed%" leaflet, I finally found said leaflet and there it was on the reverse of the 100% Satisfaction Guaranteed%" how ironic- when I still queried how even with a $5 dollar connection charge and 50% excess charge, a call could total $58 I was told that it was not the duty managers problem and to ask for the rooms director the next morning, I did and was not even granted the dignity of a response from him/her just told that a $17 discount would be given, i mentioned my total disastifaction and went away angry and upset. I find this sly and ignorant behaviour from a world class hotel both sad and aloof and feel that that such behaviour can only result in these type of reviews been written.

Reviews.Title: “Not highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kccarlson
Reviews.Content: This appears to be an older hotel (i.e., 30-40 years old) that has received only superficial renovation. Staff were fairly pleasant, but we had to prod them several times to bring our luggage up to the room. Bathroom facilities and pool area would not be out of place in a Motel 6. For the price, breakfast should be included and the rooms should be in much better condition. On the positive side, it is convenient to much of Boston, particularly if you want to be able to walk - just a few minutes' walk from Boston Common. All in all - not highly recommended. My first time at a Radisson, and it didn't leave a positive impression. Would rather recommend the Airport Hilton, even though it is not as close to downtown - cheaper, better rooms, breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....great location”
Reviews.Author: patravelor
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel but expensive (between $225 & $300) plus parking. Location is everything about this hotel. I have stayed at the Crosstown Hampton Inn which is actually nicer and cheaper but the location isn't convenient. I would stay at the Radisson again if I needed to stay in this location. Many good restaurants and theaters within walking distance - plus Boston Commons!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient more than Charming”
Reviews.Author: Woganfan
Reviews.Content: One of the good things of staying here is that you cannot see the building itself. Pretty or inviting it ain't! But rooms are large and well looked after and the views terrific. Only downside is a noisy in-room air conditioning unit.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are massive, swimming pool a bit small...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, we stayed in a best western in New york and the difference is unbelievable. While the best western room was tiny, in the Radisson, the room was massive with lovely nightime views over Boston, all the rooms have good views i think cos all the hotel rooms are above the 8th or 10th floor, the lower floors are for parking. Lovely big comfortable beds in the rooms and right in the centre of Boston. By the way, I recommend Bennigans across the road for great food and drinks too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: London-Phil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson with my girlfriend for four nights in August 2004 and found most of the comments within TripAdvisor to be correct. The room we were initially given although very nice, was next to the lifts which were just too noisy. We were moved almost immedately, so full marks for that! The location was OK but it should be mentioned, there have been problems recently within the Theatre District where specifically, tourists have been targetted leaving theatre's or walking alone back to hotels. I think it's wise just to be aware that this problem exists here as it does in every large city. Back to the review. A couple of negatives. No one seemed to shower before using the pool even after working out in the attached gym, very un-hygenic. The charges to use the Hotel's internet facility are obcene, $9.00 for 15 minutes. And you may be staying in a large branded hotel chain in a major US city, but that does not give you the right to ask for a drink from the bar once closed (it was 00:30), regardless whether the TWO reception staff are busy chatting about boyfriends or not...Can you believe that? I've stayed in many Radissons around the world and never before been refused a drink as a guest, maybe I've just been lucky! Overall, I would still recomend this hotel but I would proberbly stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: menemsha23
Reviews.Content: I got my hotel on Hotwire and was shocked about how nice it was. My room was huge, and it's in a great location, especially for the 4th of July. It was very clean and the view was awesome. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value, helpful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visit Boston regularly and have been staying at the Tremont Hotel. This time the rate at the Radisson was similar so I decided to give the Radisson a try. Also an older property, but in pretty good shape...better than the Tremont. When I checked in they offered an upgrade to a small suite but warned me it was near an elevator...decided on a "business" room instead. Happy with the room and location...Good restaurants are nearby...Legal Seafood across the street, PF Changs a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gingerwanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel may look drab from the outside but the rooms with balconies are spacious and comfortable. Staff are good and kids enjoyed the pool. Hotel is metres away from the common and shopping areas. Get rid of your hire car here you won't need it. Will go again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSunlover
Reviews.Content: Our family (with 3 kids ages 8, 6 & 4) recently stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The room was spacious with updated decor and comfortable queen beds. The concierge was helpful in recommending a restaurant (Legal Seafoods, right around the corner was excellent!). The kids loved the pool and enjoyed the breakfast buffet (included with our package). I found the location great and close to everything. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: shewolfe
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on this centrally located hotel. Room was clean and smoke free. Had to call twice to get a crib delivered. When it came, my son cried. I couldn't blame him, it looked like it had last been used in a 19th century orphanage. Requested warm milk from room service and got cold. But the location is great, just a few blocks to the common. Lots of eating choices nearby as well. I wouldn't spend several nights here but it was fine for a mid-trip overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Restal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying in the Radisson Boston on a businesss trip. Got an excellent rate on Expedia and got good value. The bedrooms were huge - practically the same size as the whole of my Edinburgh Apartment! The beds were really comfy and despite some noise on the Saturday when the Sox were playing the hotel was quiet. The swimming pool is on the 9th floor with a sun terrace and looks to be very popular with families. There is also a terrace for the restaurant so we could eat breakfast outside in the sun. Small gripes are the slightly tired decor and the noisy a/c but as not used to air conditioning in the UK this may have been OK. The area is not the most picturesque although it is safe and central with some good restaurants on the doorstep ie Legal seafoods and a short walk to Boston Common. I think that this hotel is on a par with any of the UK Thistle chain that I have stayed in and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, location, & room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family was given an early check-in with no problems. Rooms were extreemly clean and comfortable. Excellent location: Public Gardens, Commons, and many wondeful restaurants within a block. Old Town Trolley stops at hotel. We will stay here next time we are in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ozchick64
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was OK. A bit tired but very reasonably priced. There was some renovation going on in the Theater cafe but we went a few blocks away for breakfast. The gym is pretty small, with 2 treadmills only so you have to get in early, as there are a lot of business people using the hotel. It is only a 5 minute walk to the common and the same to chinatown. Would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Redisson needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel definetely needs a makeover. The rooms are really old and furniture too (it still feels like 80ies). Bathrooms should be updated completelly. If you are looking for cheap and basic accomodations - this may work for you, but otherwise you will be disappointed as we were. No question that location is great. We found that Seaport Hotel is only $30 more expensive but in great new condition.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: cjurban
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Boston on June 25th for one night. The room was immaculate, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Anything you wanted, they would get for you. Don't believe the reviews about dirty rooms and bad staff. I would stay here again in a heart beat. We came into town to see Blue Man. A must see, especially if you have kids. Plus the hotel in only steps away from the playhouse. After we had dessert at Finale. Excellent staff and food. Try the Chocolate Bliss, it was a bit much, but you might as well go all out if you are only going to eat there once.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 200 Stuart St, Boston, MA 02116
